Title: the global , regional , and national burden of cancer , 1990-2023 , with forecast to 2050 : a systematic analysis for the global burden of disease study 2023 .
Abstract: cancer be a lead cause of death globally . accurate cancer burden information be crucial for policy planning , but many country do not have up-to-date cancer surveillance data . to inform global cancer-control effort , we use the global burden of disease , injury , and risk factor study ( gbd ) 2023 framework to generate and analyse estimate of cancer burden for 47 cancer type or grouping by age , sex , and 204 country and territory from 1990 to 2023 , cancer burden attributable to select risk factor from 1990 to 2023 , and forecast cancer burden up to 2050. cancer estimation in gbd 2023 use data from population-based cancer registration system , vital registration system , and verbal autopsy . cancer mortality be estimate use ensemble model , with incidence inform by mortality estimate and mortality-to-incidence ratio ( mirs ) . prevalence estimate be generate from model survival estimate , then multiply by disability weight to estimate year live with disability ( ylds ) . year of life lose ( ylls ) be estimate by multiply age-specific cancer death by the gbd standard life expectancy at the age of death . disability-adjusted life-years ( dalys ) be calculate a the sum of ylls and ylds . we use the gbd 2023 comparative risk assessment framework to estimate cancer burden attributable to 44 behavioural , environmental and occupational , and metabolic risk factor . to forecast cancer burden from 2024 to 2050 , we use the gbd 2023 forecasting framework , which include forecast of relevant risk factor exposure and use socio-demographic index a a covariate for forecast the proportion of each cancer not affect by these risk factor . progress towards the un sustainable development goal ( sdg ) target 3.4 aim to reduce non-communicable disease mortality by a third between 2015 and 2030 be estimate for cancer . in 2023 , exclude non-melanoma skin cancer , there be 18·5 million ( 95 % uncertainty interval 16·4 to 20·7 ) incident case of cancer and 10·4 million ( 9·65 to 10·9 ) death , contribute to 271 million ( 255 to 285 ) dalys globally . of these , 57·9 % ( 56·1 to 59·8 ) of incident case and 65·8 % ( 64·3 to 67·6 ) of cancer death occur in low-income to upper-middle-income country base on world bank income group classification . cancer be the second leading cause of death globally in 2023 after cardiovascular disease . there be 4·33 million ( 3·85 to 4·78 ) risk-attributable cancer death globally in 2023 , comprise 41·7 % ( 37·8 to 45·4 ) of all cancer death . risk-attributable cancer death increase by 72·3 % ( 57·1 to 86·8 ) from 1990 to 2023 , whereas overall global cancer death increase by 74·3 % ( 62·2 to 86·2 ) over the same period . the reference forecast ( the most likely future ) estimate that in 2050 there will be 30·5 million ( 22·9 to 38·9 ) case and 18·6 million ( 15·6 to 21·5 ) death from cancer globally , 60·7 % ( 41·9 to 80·6 ) and 74·5 % ( 50·1 to 104·2 ) increase from 2024 , respectively . these forecasted increase in death be great in low-income and middle-income country ( 90·6 % [ 61·0 to 127·0 ] ) compare with high-income country ( 42·8 % [ 28·3 to 58·6 ] ) . most of these increase be likely due to demographic change , a age-standardised death rate be forecast to change by -5·6 % ( -12·8 to 4·6 ) between 2024 and 2050 globally . between 2015 and 2030 , the probability of die due to cancer between the age of 30 year and 70 year be forecast to have a relative decrease of 6·5 % ( 3·2 to 10·3 ) . cancer be a major contributor to global disease burden , with increase number of case and death forecast up to 2050 and a disproportionate growth in burden in country with scarce resource . the decline in age-standardised mortality rate from cancer be encourage but insufficient to meet the sdg target set for 2030. effectively and sustainably address cancer burden globally will require comprehensive national and international effort that consider health system and context in the development and implementation of cancer-control strategy across the continuum of prevention , diagnosis , and treatment . gate foundation , st jude child 's research hospital , and st baldrick 's foundation .

Title: a novel mutation in cd83 result in the development of a unique population of cd4+ t cell .
Authors: García-Martínez LF, Appleby MW, Staehling-Hampton K, Andrews DM, Chen Y, McEuen M, Tang P, Rhinehart RL, Proll S, Paeper B, Brunkow ME, Grandea AG 3rd, Howard ED, Walker DE, Charmley P, Jonas M, Shaw S, Latham JA, Ramsdell F
Abstract: use a mouse mutagenesis screen , we have identify cd83 a be critical for the development of cd4 ( + ) t cell and for their function postactivation . cd11c ( + ) dendritic cell develop and function normally in mouse with a mutate cd83 gene but cd4 ( + ) t cell development be substantially reduce . additionally , we now show that those cd4 ( + ) cell that develop in a cd83 mutant animal fail to respond normally follow allogeneic stimulation . this be at least in part due to an altered cytokine expression pattern characterize by an increased production of il-4 and il-10 and diminished il-2 production . thus , in addition to it role in selection of cd4 ( + ) t cell , absence of cd83 result in the generation of cell with an altered activation and cytokine profile .

Title: autoimmune response to c9orf72 protein in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis .
Authors: Michaelis T, Lindestam Arlehamn CS, Johansson E, Frazier A, Berry JD, Cudkowicz M, Goyal NA, Fournier C, Snyder A, Kwan JY, Crook J, Phillips EJ, Mallal SA, Ravits J, Marder KS, Sidney J, Sulzer D, Sette A
Abstract: amyotrophic lateral sclerosis ( al ) be a neurodegenerative disease characterize by a progressive loss of motor neuron . neuroinflammation be apparent in affected tissue , include increase t cell infiltration and activation of microglia , particularly in the spinal cord ( 1,2 ) . autoimmune response be think to have a key role in al pathology , and it be hypothesize that t cell contribute to the rapid loss of neuron during disease progression ( 3,4 ) . however , until now there have be no reported target for such an autoimmune response . here we show that al be associate with recognition of the c9orf72 antigen , and we map the specific epitope that be recognize . we show that these response be mediate by cd4 ( + ) t cell that preferentially release il-5 and il-10 , and that il-10-mediated t cell response be significantly great in donor who have a longer predicted survival time . our result reinforce the previous hypothesis that neuroinflammation have an important role in al disease progression , possibly because of a disrupted balance of inflammatory and counter-inflammatory t cell response ( 4 ) . these finding highlight the potential of therapeutic strategy aim at enhance regulatory t cell ( 5 ) , and identify a key target for antigen-specific t cell response that could enable precision therapeutic in al .

Title: in vivo chimeric antigen receptor ( car ) -t cell therapy .
Authors: Bot A, Scharenberg A, Friedman K, Guey L, Hofmeister R, Andorko JI, Klichinsky M, Neumann F, Shah JV, Swayer AJ, Trudeau K, Weissman D, Stephan MT, Buchholz CJ, June CH
Abstract: chimeric antigen receptor ( car ) -t cell therapy have transform the outcome of patient with haematological malignancy , yet it use be limit by labour-intensive manufacturing , constrain production capacity and variable clinical performance . in vivo car-t cell engineering , in which car-t cell be generate directly inside the patient 's body , seek to overcome these challenge by eliminate the need for ex vivo cell processing and complex logistics , as well a improve clinical performance . recent advance in virology , rna medicine and nanotechnology have catalyse a radical overhaul of this approach , which use targeted delivery system such a lentiviral vector and lipid nanoparticles to introduce car-encoding genetic material into endogenous t cell . early clinical study have show efficient transduction , sustain car expression and initial sign of antitumour activity , establish proof of concept . this review explore the underlie technology - include rna deliver by lipid nanoparticles and engineered viral vector - and discuss how they be be adapt to develop more broadly applicable , scalable , safe and effective car-t cell therapy . by remove the need for ex vivo manipulation and chemotherapeutic conditioning , this strategy could enable the wide application of car-t cell therapies not just to blood cancer but to autoimmune disease for which ex vivo car-t cell therapy have show strong promise , such a systemic lupus erythematosus .

Title: effect of acute sleep deprivation on sport performance in athlete : a comprehensive systematic review and meta-analysis .
Authors: Gong M, Sun M, Sun Y, Jin L, Li S
Abstract: use meta-analysis to comprehensively and quantitatively evaluate the impact of acute sleep deprivation on different sport performance of athlete , this study aim to provide scientific guidance for coach in optimize and adjust training and competition arrangement . establish literature inclusion and exclusion criterion , we conduct search in both chinese and english database . use stata 14.0 , we analyze 75 indicator from 27 included literature , focus on three aspect : the impact of acute sleep deprivation on overall athletic performance , the impact on sport performance across various athletic ability , and the disparity in athletic performance between morning and afternoon follow acute sleep deprivation . the effect size of acute sleep deprivation on overall athletic performance be -0.56 ( p < 0.05 ) . sub-analyses reveal effect size of -0.23 ( p < 0.05 ) for whole night sleep deprivation , -1.17 ( p < 0.05 ) for partial sleep deprivation at the end of the night , and -0.25 ( p > 0.05 ) for partial sleep deprivation in the beginning of the night . the effect size of acute sleep deprivation on high intensity intermittent exercise , skill control , speed , aerobic endurance , and explosive power indicator be -1.57 , -1.06 , -0.67 , -0.54 , and -0.39 respectively ( p < 0.05 ) . the effect size of acute sleep deprivation on the overall athletic performance in the morning and afternoon be -0.30 , and -1.11 , respectively ( p < 0.05 ) . acute sleep deprivation significantly impair the overall athletic performance of athlete , with a more pronounced negative impact observe with partial sleep deprivation at the end of the night . various type of exercise performance be adversely affect by acute sleep deprivation , with magnitude of impact rank high intensity intermittent , skill control , speed , aerobic endurance , and explosive power . follow acute sleep deprivation , athlete ' overall sport performance in the afternoon be inferior to that in the morning .

Title: selection of dna bind site by regulatory protein . ii . the bind specificity of cyclic amp receptor protein to recognition site .
Authors: Berg OG, von Hippel PH
Abstract: the statistic of base-pair usage within know recognition site for a particular dna-binding protein can be use to estimate the relative protein bind affinity to these site , as well a to site contain any other combination of base-pairs . a have be describe elsewhere , the connection between base-pair statistic and bind free energy be make by an equal probability selection assumption ; i.e . that all base-pair sequence that provide appropriate binding strength be equally likely to have be choose a recognition site in the course of evolution . this be analogous to a statistical-mechanical system where all configuration with the same energy be equally likely to occur . in this communication , we apply the statistical-mechanical selection theory to analyze the base-pair statistic of the know recognition sequence for the cyclic amp receptor protein ( crp ) . the theoretical prediction be find to be in reasonable agreement with bind data for those sequence for which experimental binding information be available , thus lend support to the basic assumption of the selection theory . on the basis of this agreement , we can predict the affinity for crp binding to any base-pair sequence , albeit with a large statistical uncertainty . when the know recognition site for crp be rank accord to predict binding affinity , we find that the ranking be consistent with the hypothesis that the level of function of these site parallel their fractional saturation with crp-camp under in-vivo condition . when apply to the entire genome , the theory predict the existence of a large number of randomly occur `` pseudosites '' with strong binding affinity for crp . it appear that most crp molecule be engage in non-productive binding at non-specific or pseudospecific site under in-vivo condition . in this sense , the specificity of the crp bind site be very low . relative specificity requirement for polymerase , repressor and activator be compare in light of the result of this and the first paper in this series .

Title: a systematic review and meta-analysis of the efficacy and safety of pharmacological treatment for obesity in adult .
Authors: McGowan B, Ciudin A, Baker JL, Busetto L, Dicker D, Frühbeck G, Goossens GH, Monami M, Sbraccia P, Martinez-Tellez B, Woodward E, Yumuk V
Abstract: this systematic review and network meta-analysis evaluate the efficacy and safety of obesity management medication ( omms ) in term of reduce body weight and impact on obesity-related complication . here a medline and embase search be perform up to 31 january 2025 for randomize controlled trial compare omms versus placebo/active comparators in adult . primary endpoint be percentage of total body weight loss ( tbwl % ) at the end of the study . secondary endpoint be tbwl % at 1 , 2 and ≥3 year , lipid profile , blood pressure , hemoglobin a1c , fast plasma glucose , mental health , serious adverse event , quality of life , cardiovascular morbidity and mortality , remission of obesity-related complication and all-cause mortality . fifty-six clinical trial be identified-orlistat ( 22 ) , semaglutide ( 14 ) , liraglutide ( 11 ) , tirzepatide ( 6 ) , naltrexone/bupropion ( 5 ) and phentermine/topiramate ( 2 ) -enrolling 60,307 patient ( 32,598 omm and 27,709 placebo ) . all omms show a significantly great tbwl % versus placebo ( p < 0.0001 ) , more than 10 % for semaglutide and tirzepatide . both tirzepatide and semaglutide show normoglycemia restoration , remission of type 2 diabetes and reduction in hospitalization due to heart failure . semaglutide be effective in reduce major adverse cardiovascular event and reduce pain in knee osteoarthritis . tirzepatide be effective in remission of obstructive sleep apnea syndrome and metabolic dysfunction-associated steatohepatitis . these result support the need to individualize the selection of omms .

Title: hsa-mir-155-5p expression in primary breast tissue may have the potential for prediction of breast cancer brain recurrence : result from the multi-institutional exploratory cohort study .
Authors: Koyama Y, Muguruma M, Horimoto Y, Narui K, Yamada A, Yamada K, Yamamoto S, Orihara S, Kaise H, Kogure A, Yoshioka Y, Ochiya T, Ishikawa T
Abstract: despite the known incidence of brain metastasis in breast cancer , no useful biomarker have be clinically establish for breast cancer brain metastasis ( bcbm ) . in the present study , we aim to examine the expression of micrornas ( mirnas ) relate to bcbm in formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded ( ffpe ) tissue to identify their usefulness a predictive biomarkers of breast cancer brain recurrence ( bcbr ) . pair of primary breast and metastatic site tissue sample be collect from 38 patient who experience the first recurrence of metastasis to a single distant organ ( brain/lungs/liver/bones = 11/12/9/6 patient ) between january 2007 and december 2021 at five institution in japan . we evaluate the expression of 15 mirnas in ffpe specimen of untreated breast and metastatic site from the same patient use quantitative polymerase chain reaction . analysis of the select 15 mirnas reveal that hsa-mir-155-5p exhibit significant bcbr-specific overexpression in untreated primary breast tissue ( p < 0.001 ) . two other mirnas , hsa-mir-150-5p and hsa-mir-20b-5p , exhibited moderate ( ρ = 0.587 ) and weak ( ρ = 0.350 ) positive correlation with hsa-mir-155-5p , respectively . the bcbr prediction model demonstrate a high discrimination ability for hsa-mir-155-5p ( auc = 0.960 ) . the localization of hsa-mir-155-5p in primary breast cancer tissue by in situ hybridization confirm that hsa-mir-155-5p be uniformly stain in the breast cancer cell . hsa-mir-155-5p expression in untreated primary breast tissue may be a valuable biomarker for predict bcbr . a personalized escalation strategy be expect to be helpful in conquer brain metastasis .

Title: muscle-derived mir-126 regulates tdp-43 axonal local synthesis and nmj integrity in al model .
Authors: Ionescu A, Ankol L, Ganapathy Subramaniam A, Altman T, Magen I, Cohen Y, Danino Y, Gradus-Pery T, Niv Y, Bar Avi O, Geller D, Ibraheem A, Cheng R, Steinberg N, Alfahel L, Duc P, Ergul-Ulger Z, Arslan D, Tan E, Rage F, Riva N, Quattrini A, Bekircan-Kurt CE, Israelson A, Dori A, Hornstein E, Perlson E
Abstract: amyotrophic lateral sclerosis ( al ) be characterize by neuromuscular junction ( nmj ) disruption and neurodegeneration . recent finding highlight a pivotal role for tar dna-binding protein 43 ( tdp-43 ) in form axonal pathological condensate and facilitate nmj disruption through inhibition of local protein synthesis . however , the mechanism that drive local tdp-43 accumulation remain unknown . here we identify that the tdp-43 axonal accumulation in peripheral nerve of sod1 patient and mice stem from it aberrant local synthesis . this be a non-cell-autonomous process drive by muscle-derived mir-126a-5p extracellular vesicle ( ev ) . inhibit muscle secretion of mir-126a-5p prompt presynaptic tdp-43 synthesis and accumulation , which disrupt axonal translation and cause nmj degeneration . introduce mir-126 to sod1 ( g93a ) mouse , primary co-cultures and human induce pluripotent stem cell ( ipsc ) -derived co-cultures with al mutation exhibit neuroprotective effect and delay motor decline . these finding identify a transcellular communication axis between muscle and motor neuron that regulate axonal local synthesis and nmj maintenance , offer insight into al onset and progression .

Title: a 52-kb deletion in the sost-meox1 intergenic region on 17q12-q21 be associate with van buchem disease in the dutch population .
Authors: Staehling-Hampton K, Proll S, Paeper BW, Zhao L, Charmley P, Brown A, Gardner JC, Galas D, Schatzman RC, Beighton P, Papapoulos S, Hamersma H, Brunkow ME
Abstract: van buchem disease be an autosomal recessive sclerosing bone dysplasia characterize by skeletal hyperostosis , overgrowth of the mandible , and a liability to entrapment of the seventh and eighth cranial nerve . the genetic determinant map to chromosome 17q12-q21 . we refine the critical interval to the < 1-mb region between d17s2250 and d17s2253 in 15 affected individual , all of whom share a common disease haplotype . furthermore , we report here the identification of a 52-kb deletion locate within the interval and encompass d17s1789 that be 100 % concordant with the disorder . although the deletion itself do not appear to disrupt the cod region of any know or novel gene ( s ) , the close flanking gene be meox1 on the proximal side , and sost on the distal side of the deletion . meox1 be know to be important for the development of the axial skeleton , whereas the sost gene be the determinant of sclerosteosis , a disorder that share many feature with van buchem disease , thus raise the possibility that van buchem disease result from dysregulation of the expression of one or both of these gene .

Title: joint effect of triglyceride glucose index and it obesity-related derivative with estimate glucose disposal rate on cardiometabolic multimorbidity in middle-aged and old chinese adult : a nationwide cohort study .
Authors: Ruan X, Ling Y, Chen J, Xiang Y, Ruan H, Zhang W, Jing L, Gao X, He Y, Lu X, Chang T, Xu J, Chen J
Abstract: the triglyceride-glucose ( tyg ) index , tyg-body mass index ( tyg-bmi ) , tyg-waist circumference ( tyg-wc ) , tyg-waist-to-height ratio ( tyg-whtr ) , and estimate glucose disposal rate ( egdr ) serve a surrogate marker of insulin resistance ( ir ) and be associate with cardiometabolic disease ( cmds ) . however , the joint effect of tyg-related index and egdr on cardiometabolic multimorbidity ( cmm ) risk remain unclear . this study aim to assess both separate and combined effect of tyg-related index and egdr on cmm . the data of this study derive from the china health and retirement longitudinal study ( charls ) . tyg-related index and egdr be dichotomize at their median level for participant categorization . univariate and multivariate cox regression and restrict cubic spline ( rcs ) analyze effect of tyg-related index and egdr on cmm , while receiver operate characteristic ( roc ) curve , net reclassification improvement ( nri ) and integrated discrimination improvement ( idi ) assess their predictive performance . meanwhile , the mutual mediating effect and interaction effect be far assess . this study include 5,854 participant ( male : 47.5 % , median age : 57.0 year ) . compare to low tyg-related index plus high egdr , high tyg-related index plus low egdr have elevate cmm risk : tyg ( hr 3.59 , 95 % ci 2.28-5.65 ) , tyg-bmi ( hr 3.40 , 95 % ci 2.30-5.02 ) , tyg-wc ( hr 3.85 , 95 % ci 2.58-5.75 ) , and tyg-whtr ( hr 3.62 , 95 % ci 2.43-5.39 ) . furthermore , the addition of tyg-related index combine with egdr to the basic model significantly improve cmm risk prediction : tyg ( auc 0.713 , nri 0.363 , idi 0.008 , all p < 0.05 ) ; tyg-bmi ( auc 0.729 , nri 0.479 , idi 0.011 , all p < 0.05 ) ; tyg-wc ( auc 0.716 , nri 0.419 , idi 0.010 , all p < 0.05 ) ; and tyg-whtr ( auc 0.717 , nri 0.379 , idi 0.010 , all p < 0.05 ) . moreover , the mediation analysis demonstrate that egdr significantly mediate all tyg-related index ' association with cmm , with only obesity-related tyg index mediate the association between egdr and cmm . notably , no significant additive or multiplicative interaction be observe between any tyg-related index and egdr for cmm risk . high tyg-related index and low egdr be independently and jointly associate with high cmm risk . joint application of tyg-related index and egdr could improve early identification and prevention of cmm .

Title: proteotoxic stress response drive t cell exhaustion and immune evasion .
Authors: Wang Y, Ma A, Song NJ, Shannon AE, Amankwah YS, Chen X, Wu W, Wang Z, Saadey AA, Yousif A, Ghosh G, Mandula JK, Velegraki M, Xiao T, Wen H, Huang SC, Wang R, Beusch CM, Dawood AS, Gordon DE, Abdel-Hakeem MS, Ghoneim HE, Xin G, Searle BC, Li Z
Abstract: chronic infection and cancer cause t cell dysfunction know a exhaustion . this cell state be cause by persistent antigen exposure , suboptimal co-stimulation and a plethora of hostile factor that dampen protective immunity and limit the efficacy of immunotherapy ( 1-4 ) . the mechanism that underlie t cell exhaustion remain poorly understood . here we analyse the proteome of cd8 ( + ) exhaust t ( t ( ex ) ) cell across multiple state of exhaustion in the context of both chronic viral infection and cancer . we show that there be a non-stochastic pathway-specific discordance between mrna and protein dynamic between t effector ( t ( eff ) ) and t ( ex ) cell . we identify a distinct proteotoxic stress response ( psr ) in t ( ex ) cell , which we term t ( ex ) -psr . contrary to canonical stress response that induce a reduction in protein synthesis ( 5,6 ) , t ( ex ) -psr involve an increase in global translation activity and an upregulation of specialized chaperone protein . t ( ex ) -psr be further characterize by the accumulation of protein aggregate and stress granule and an increase in autophagy-dominant protein catabolism . we establish that disruption of proteostasis alone can convert t ( eff ) cell to t ( ex ) cell , and we link t ( ex ) -psr mechanistically to persistent akt signalling . finally , disruption of t ( ex ) -psr-associated chaperone in cd8 ( + ) t cell improve cancer immunotherapy in preclinical model . moreover , a high t ( ex ) -psr in t cell from patient with cancer confers poor response to clinical immunotherapy . collectively , our finding indicate that t ( ex ) -psr be a hallmark and a mechanistic driver of t cell exhaustion , which raise the possibility of target proteostasis pathway a an approach for cancer immunotherapy .

Title: sotatercept for pulmonary arterial hypertension within the first year after diagnosis .
Authors: McLaughlin VV, Hoeper MM, Badesch DB, Ghofrani HA, Gibbs JSR, Gomberg-Maitland M, Preston IR, Souza R, Waxman AB, Kopeć G, Meyer G, Olsson KM, Fu W, Shi Y, Miller B, Kim SS, Mackenzie HS, Brambatti M, Patel MJ, Koglin J, Cornell AG, Humbert M
Abstract: sotatercept , an activin-signaling inhibitor , reduce morbidity and mortality among patient with long-standing pulmonary arterial hypertension . it effect in patient with pulmonary arterial hypertension within the first year after diagnosis be unclear . in this phase 3 trial , we enrol adult patient with world health organization functional class ii or iii pulmonary arterial hypertension who have receive the diagnosis less than 1 year earlier , have an intermediate or high risk of death , and be receive double or triple background therapy . patient be randomly assign to receive add-on therapy with subcutaneous sotatercept ( start dose , 0.3 mg per kilogram of body weight ; escalate to target dose , 0.7 mg per kilogram ) or placebo every 21 day . the primary end point be clinical worsening , a composite of death from any cause , unplanned hospitalization last at least 24 hour for worsen of pulmonary arterial hypertension , atrial septostomy , lung transplantation , or deterioration in performance in exercise test due to pulmonary arterial hypertension , assess in a time-to-first-event analysis . the trial be stop early owe to loss of clinical equipoise after the reporting of positive result from previous sotatercept trial . a total of 320 patient be include ( 160 each in the sotatercept and placebo group ) . the median duration of follow-up be 13.2 month . at least one primary end-point event occur in 17 patient ( 10.6 % ) in the sotatercept group and in 59 patient ( 36.9 % ) in the placebo group ( hazard ratio , 0.24 ; 95 % confidence interval , 0.14 to 0.41 ; p < 0.001 ) . deterioration in performance in exercise test due to pulmonary arterial hypertension occur in 8 patient ( 5.0 % ) in the sotatercept group and in 46 patient ( 28.8 % ) in the placebo group ; unplanned hospitalization for worsen of pulmonary arterial hypertension occur in 3 patient ( 1.9 % ) and 14 patient ( 8.8 % ) , respectively ; and death from any cause occur in 7 patient ( 4.4 % ) and 6 patient ( 3.8 % ) . no case of atrial septostomy or lung transplantation occur . the most common adverse event with sotatercept be epistaxis ( 31.9 % ) and telangiectasia ( 26.2 % ) . among adult with pulmonary arterial hypertension who have receive the diagnosis less than 1 year earlier , the addition of sotatercept to background therapy result in a low risk of clinical worsening than placebo . ( fund by merck sharp and dohme , a subsidiary of merck [ rahway , nj ] ; hyperion clinicaltrials.gov number , nct04811092 . ) .
Journal: The New England journal of medicine

Title: the amount of scurfin protein determine peripheral t cell number and responsiveness .
Authors: Khattri R, Kasprowicz D, Cox T, Mortrud M, Appleby MW, Brunkow ME, Ziegler SF, Ramsdell F
Abstract: in the absence of the recently identify putative transcription factor scurfin , mouse develop a lymphoproliferative disorder result in death by 3 wk of age from a pathology that resemble tgf-beta or ctla-4 knockout mouse . in this report , we characterize mouse that overexpress the scurfin protein and demonstrate that these animal have a dramatically depress immune system . mouse transgenic for the foxp3 gene ( which encode the scurfin protein ) have few t cell than their littermate control , and those t cell that remain have poor proliferative and cytolytic response and make little il-2 after stimulation through the tcr . although thymic development appear normal in these mouse , peripheral lymphoid organ , particularly lymph node , be relatively acellular . in a separate transgenic line , force expression of the gene specifically in the thymus can alter thymic development ; however , this do not appear to affect peripheral t cell and be unable to prevent disease in mouse lack a functional foxp3 gene , indicate that the scurfin protein act on peripheral t cell . the data indicate a critical role for the foxp3 gene product in the function of the immune system , with both the number and functionality of peripheral t cell under the aegis of the scurfin protein .

Title: multi-omic characterization of the effect of ocrelizumab in patient with relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis .
Authors: Kornilov SA, Price ND, Gelinas R, Acosta J, Brunkow ME, Gervasi-Follmar T, Winger RC, Aldershoff D, Lausted C, Troisch P, Smith B, Heath JR, Repovic P, Cohan S, Magis AT
Abstract: the study examine change in the plasma proteome , metabolome , and lipidome of n = 14 patient with relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis ( rrms ) initiate treatment with ocrelizumab , assay at baseline , 6 month , and 12 month . analysis of > 4000 circulate biomarkers identify depletion of b-cell associated protein a the early effect observe follow ocrelizumab ( ocr ) initiation , accompany by the reduction in plasma abundance of cytokine and cytotoxic protein , marker of neuronaxonal damage , and biologically active lipid include ceramides and lysophospholipids , at 6 month . b-cell depletion be accompany by decrease in b-cell receptor and cytokine signaling but a pronounced increase in circulate plasma b-cell activate factor ( baff ) . this be follow by an upregulation of a number of signal and metabolic pathway at 12 month . patient with high baseline brain mri lesion load demonstrate both high level of cytotoxic and structural protein in plasma at baseline and more pronounced biomarker change trajectory over time . digital cytometry identify a putative increase in myeloid cell and a pro-inflammatory subset of t-cells . therapeutic effect of ocrelizumab extend beyond cd20-mediated b-cell lysis and implicate metabolic reprogramming , juxtapose the early normalization of immune activation , cytokine signaling and metabolite and lipid turnover in periphery with change in the dynamic of immune cell activation or composition . we identify baff increase follow cd20 depletion a a tentative compensatory mechanism that contribute to the reconstitution of targeted b-cells , necessitate further research .

Title: intercellular communication in the brain through a dendritic nanotubular network .
Authors: Chang M, Krüssel S, Parajuli LK, Kim J, Lee D, Merodio A, Kwon J, Okabe S, Kwon HB
Abstract: intercellular nanotubular network mediate material exchange , but their existence in neuron remains to be explore in detail . we identify long , thin dendritic filopodia form direct dendrite-dendrite nanotube ( dnts ) in mammalian cortex . super-resolution microscopy in dissociated neuron reveal dnts ' actin-rich composition and dynamic , enable long-range calcium ion ( ca ( 2+ ) ) propagation . imaging and machine learning-based analysis validate in situ dnts a anatomically distinct from synaptic spine . dnts actively transport small molecule and human amyloid-β ( aβ ) ; dnt density increase before plaque formation in the medial prefrontal cortex of app/ps1 mouse ( app , aβ precursor protein ; ps1 , presenilin-1 ) , suggest that the dendrite-dnt network might play a role in alzheimer 's disease pathology . computational model of dnt-mediated aβ propagation recapitulate early amyloidosis , predict selective intracellular accumulation . these finding uncover a nanotubular connectivity layer in the brain , extend neuronal communication beyond classical synapsis .

Title: unveil the molecular and immunological driver of antibody-drug conjugate in cancer treatment .
Authors: Zippelius A, Tolaney SM, Tarantino P, Balthasar JP, Thurber GM
Abstract: after decade of investment , antibody-drug conjugate ( adcs ) be finally demonstrate their potential , mark by a grow number of clinical approval , application in early line of treatment and integration into drug combination , include immunotherapy . this progress have spur investment in develop new adcs and expand the use of approved adcs in clinical practice . the design of adcs be complex , involve multiple molecular component that interact with both tumour and host tissue microenvironments . in this review , we explore the molecular and immunological factor influence adc efficacy and toxicity . we describe how the molecular component of adcs determine their systemic , tissue and cellular distribution , which ultimately dictate therapeutic efficacy . these interaction also determine the toxicity profile and set limitation on maximum dosing . finally , we discuss the impact of adc treatment on immune cell , emphasize the distinct but interconnected role of immunogenic cell death , activation of immune cell such a dendritic cell and antibody-fc interaction . these mechanism be crucial for increase efficacy beyond the direct cytotoxic effect of the payload . by provide insight into the intricate interaction of adcs , this review aim to inform the rational design of combination therapy and guide the development of the next generation of clinically effective adcs .

Title: localize glutamine leakage drive the spatial structure of root microbial colonization .
Authors: Tsai HH, Tang Y, Jiang L, Xu X, Dénervaud Tendon V, Pang J, Jia Y, Wippel K, Vacheron J, Keel C, Andersen TG, Geldner N, Zhou F
Abstract: plant root release exudate to encourage microbiome assembly , which influence the function and stress resilience of plant . how specific exudate drive spatial colonization pattern remain largely unknown . in this study , we demonstrate that endodermal casparian strips-forming the root 's extracellular diffusion barrier-restrict nutrient leakage into the rhizosphere , coincide with and control spatial colonization pattern of rhizobacteria . we find that vasculature-derived glutamine leakage be a major bacterial chemoattractant and enhancer of proliferation , define a previously unknown pathway for root exudate formation . bacteria defective in amino acid chemoperception display reduce attraction toward leakage site , and root with casparian strip defect display bacterial overproliferation , dependent on bacterial capacity for amino acid metabolization . associate chronic immune stimulation suggest that endodermal nutrient restriction be crucial for regulate microbial colonization and assembly , limit excessive proliferation that could compromise plant health .

Title: monoclonal antibody protect against pandrug-resistant klebsiella pneumoniae .
Authors: Roscioli E, Zucconi Galli Fonseca V, Bosch SS, Paciello I, Maccari G, Cardinali G, Batani G, Stazzoni S, Tiseo G, Giordano C, Yuwei S, Capoccia L, Cardamone D, Ridelfi M, Troisi M, Manganaro N, Mugnaini C, De Santi C, Ciabattini A, Cerofolini L, Fragai M, Licastro D, Wyres K, Dortet L, Barnini S, Nicolau DP, Menichetti F, Falcone M, Abdelraouf K, Sala C, Kabanova A, Rappuoli R
Abstract: the 'silent pandemic ' cause by antimicrobial resistance require innovative therapeutic approach . human monoclonal antibody ( mabs ) , which be among the most transformative and safe drug in oncology ( 1 ) and autoimmunity ( 2 ) , be rarely use for infectious disease and not yet use for antimicrobial resistance ( 3 ) . here we apply an antigen-agnostic strategy to isolate extremely potent human mabs against klebsiella pneumoniae sequence type 147 ( st147 ) , a hypervirulent and pandrug-resistant lineage that be spread globally . isolated mabs target the kl64 capsule and the o-antigen . however , although mabs displayed bactericidal activity in the picomolar range in vitro , only the capsule-specific mabs be protective against fulminant bloodstream infection by st147 and two geographically and genetically distant carbapenem-resistant kl64-bearing k. pneumoniae . protection observe in vivo correlate with in vitro bacterial uptake by macrophage and enchain bacterial growth . our study thus describe a mab that protect against pandrug-resistant k. pneumoniae and provide a strategy to isolate mabs and identify mabs that confer protection against bacteria with antimicrobial resistance .

Title: astrocyte-mediated central amygdala microcircuit gate comorbid anxiety symptom in chronic pain .
Authors: Zan GY, Yao SY, Deng YZ, Jiang YH, Ye RF, Chen Y, Long JD, Cheng YJ, Chai JR, Xu C, Zhao M, Liu ZQ, Liu JG, Wang YJ
Abstract: comorbid anxiety symptom be prominent affective component of chronic pain , yet the central mechanism underlie these symptom remain elusive . the central amygdala ( cea ) regulate nociceptive processing and associate anxiety in chronic pain . however , the specific microcircuit and cell type within the cea that regulate pain-related anxiety have not be fully elucidate . in this study , we discover a microcircuit in the cea wherein dynorphinergic neuron of the lateral subdivision of the central amygdala ( cel ) project to the medial subdivision ( cem ) , activation of which gate anxiogenic effect associate with chronic pain . dynorphin-mediated activation of cem astroglial kappa opioid receptor ( kor ) , dependent upon corticotropin-releasing factor ( crf ) receptor 2 signaling , enhance cem neuron excitability by promote n-methyl-d-aspartate receptor ( nmdar ) activation , likely via release gliotransmitter d-serine . behaviorally , kor-mediated bidirectional communication between cea peptidergic neuron and astrocytes modulate the anxiogenic effect of chronic pain . our finding reveal a neuroglial microcircuit underlie pain-associated anxiety and suggest potential target for therapeutic intervention .

Title: polygenic and developmental profile of autism differ by age at diagnosis .
Authors: Zhang X, Grove J, Gu Y, Buus CK, Nielsen LK, Neufeld SAS, Koko M, Malawsky DS, Wade EM, Verhoef E, Gui A, Hegemann L, Geschwind DH, Wray NR, Havdahl A, Ronald A, St Pourcain B, Robinson EB, Bourgeron T, Baron-Cohen S, Børglum AD, Martin HC, Warrier V
Abstract: although autism have historically be conceptualize a a condition that emerge in early childhood ( 1,2 ) , many autistic people be diagnose later in life ( 3-5 ) . it be unknown whether earlier- and later-diagnosed autism have different developmental trajectory and genetic profile . use longitudinal data from four independent birth cohort , we demonstrate that two different socioemotional and behavioural trajectory be associate with age at diagnosis . in independent cohort of autistic individual , common genetic variant account for approximately 11 % of the variance in age at autism diagnosis , similar to the contribution of individual sociodemographic and clinical factor , which typically explain less than 15 % of this variance . we further demonstrate that the polygenic architecture of autism can be break down into two modestly genetically correlate ( r ( g ) = 0.38 , s.e . = 0.07 ) autism polygenic factor . one of these factor be associate with early autism diagnosis and low social and communication ability in early childhood , but be only moderately genetically correlate with attention deficit-hyperactivity disorder ( adhd ) and mental-health condition . conversely , the second factor be associate with late autism diagnosis and increase socioemotional and behavioural difficulty in adolescence , and have moderate to high positive genetic correlation with adhd and mental-health condition . these finding indicate that earlier- and later-diagnosed autism have different developmental trajectory and genetic profile . our finding have important implication for how we conceptualize autism and provide a model to explain some of the diversity find in autism .

Title: regulator of cd8 ( + ) t cell exhaustion .
Authors: Sun Q, Dong C
Abstract: t cell exhaustion be an adaptive and distinct cell fate that emerge in response to persistent antigen stimulation , primarily in chronic infection and cancer . it be characterize by a progressive loss of effector function and sustained expression of multiple inhibitory receptor . progression to t cell exhaustion be drive by persistent antigen stimulation through the t cell receptor and be modulate by signal from co-stimulatory and inhibitory molecule as well a by microenvironmental factor such a cytokine , metabolite and neuronal factor . these extrinsic cellular factor reshape the t cell transcriptome , epigenome and metabolism towards a state of exhaustion through critical intrinsic cell regulator . in this review , we summarize our current understanding of the regulator involve in t cell exhaustion , highlight their role in direct the fate and functionality of distinct exhaust t cell subset and how they may be harness for the development of improved immunotherapy against cancer and chronic infection .

Title: enzyme-converted o kidney allow abo-incompatible transplantation without hyperacute rejection in a human decedent model .
Authors: Zeng J, Ma M, Tao Z, Rao Z, Wu C, Yin S, Jiang X, Chen G, Wang Z, Huang D, Zhu M, Liu L, Huo W, Yang H, Guo H, Chen G, Li F, Zheng C, Huang D, Rahfeld P, Kizhakkedathu JN, Withers SG, Lu X, Zhang K, Lin T, Song T
Abstract: abo-incompatible kidney transplantation be widely use to meet the escalate need for organ . current recipient-centric desensitization protocol involve antibody depletion through plasmapheresis increase the risk of infection , perioperative bleeding event and cost . here we present a donor-centric desensitization protocol , convert type-a kidney into enzyme-converted o kidney during hypothermic perfusion to remove the a antigen from the kidney . an ex vivo model result in no antibody-mediated injury . encourage by this , an enzyme-converted o kidney be transplant into a type-o brain-dead recipient with a high titre of anti-a antibody , and no hyperacute rejection be observe . the graft be well tolerate with no evidence of antibody-mediated rejection for 2 day . antibody-mediated lesion and complement deposition be find start 3 day post-transplant , coincide with a-antigen regeneration , and later high banff score , suggest an immune-mediated response . single-cell sequencing confirm the elevated expression of accommodation-related gene , suggest the potential for longer-term tolerance . this study provide a donor-centric organ engineering strategy and have the potential to broaden the reach of abo-incompatible kidney transplantation , improve the fairness of and access to organ allocation .

Title: dietary cysteine enhance intestinal stemness via cd8 ( + ) t cell-derived il-22 .
Authors: Chi F, Zhang Q, Shay JES, Han S, Ten Hoeve J, Yuan Y, Yang Z, Shin H, Block S, Solanki S, Shah YM, Vander Heiden MG, Agudo J, Yilmaz ÖH
Abstract: a fundamental question in physiology be understand how tissues adapt and alter their cellular composition in response to dietary cue ( 1-8 ) . the mammalian small intestine be maintain by rapidly renew lgr5 ( + ) intestinal stem cell ( iscs ) that respond to macronutrient change such a fast regimen and obesogenic diet , yet how specific amino acid control isc function during homeostasis and injury remains unclear . here we demonstrate that dietary cysteine , a semi-essential amino acid , enhance isc-mediated intestinal regeneration follow injury . cysteine contribute to coenzyme a ( coa ) biosynthesis in intestinal epithelial cell , which promote expansion of intraepithelial cd8αβ ( + ) t cell and their production of interleukin-22 ( il-22 ) . this enhance il-22 signal directly augments isc reparative capacity after injury . the mechanistic involvement of the pathway in drive the effect of cysteine be demonstrate by several finding : coa supplementation recapitulate cysteine effect , epithelial-specific loss of the cystine transporter slc7a11 block the response , and mouse with cd8αβ ( + ) t cell lack il-22 or a depletion of cd8αβ ( + ) t cell fail to show enhanced regeneration despite cysteine treatment . these finding highlight how coupled cysteine metabolism between iscs and cd8 ( + ) t cell augment intestinal stemness , provide a dietary approach that exploit isc and immune cell crosstalk for ameliorate intestinal damage .

Title: obesity , diabetes , and inflammation : pathophysiology and clinical implication .
Authors: Donath MY, Drucker DJ
Abstract: obesity and it related disorder , include type 2 diabetes and liver , kidney , and cardiovascular disease , be now recognize a chronic inflammatory condition . here , we review the mechanism underlie inflammation in these setting and how they may contribute to pathology . nutrient excess trigger immune activation through pattern recognition receptor and the nlrp3 inflammasome , lead to interleukin ( il ) -1β production and downstream cytokine cascade . initially adaptive , this inflammation promote tissue remodel and metabolic compensation , but chronic activation contributes to insulin resistance , β cell dysfunction , and end-organ damage . we discuss the current therapeutic option , with a focus on glucagon-like peptide-1 ( glp-1 ) receptor agonist , which , alone or combine with additional bioactive moiety , exert notable anti-inflammatory effect . some effect of glp-1 medicine be independent of glucose control or weight loss , and they be attribute to direct signal via the immune glp-1 receptor ( glp-1r ) and , indirectly , via central nervous system circuit . understand these mechanism may unlock far therapeutic potential in chronic inflammatory disease .

Title: a comprehensive genetic catalog of human double-strand break repair .
Authors: de Alba EL, Salguero I, Giménez-Llorente D, Montes-Torres J, Fernández-Sanromán Á, Casajús-Pelegay E, Terrón-Bautista J, Barroso-González J, Bernal JA, Macintyre G, Fernández-Leiro R, Losada A, Cortés-Ledesma F
Abstract: the analysis of dna sequence outcome provide molecular insight into double-strand break ( dsb ) repair mechanism . use parallel in-pool profiling of cas9-induced insertion and deletion ( indels ) within a genome-wide knockout library , we present a comprehensive catalog that assess the influence of nearly every human gene on dsb repair outcomes . this repairome resource uncovers uncharacterized mechanism , pathway , and factor involve in dsb repair , include oppose role for xlf and paxx , a molecular explanation for cas9-induced multinucleotide insertion , hltf function in cas9-induced dsb repair , the involvement of the saga complex in microhomology-mediated end joining , and an indel mutational signature link to vhl loss , renal carcinoma , and hypoxia . these result exemplify the potential of repairome to drive future discovery in dsb repair , crispr-cas gene editing and the etiology of cancer mutational signature .

Title: epithelial-mesenchymal transition .
Authors: Zhang CX, Huang RY, Sheng G, Thiery JP
Abstract: epithelial-mesenchymal transition ( emt ) be a fundamental mechanism involve in the morphogenesis of metazoan . through this evolutionarily conserve multi-stage process , cell acquire quasi-epithelial to multiple intermediate morphology with epithelial and mesenchymal attribute , rarely reach a complete mesenchymal phenotype . complex evolutionary-conserved morphogenetic movement in gastrulation be describe extensively , a they exemplify the extent of epithelial cell plasticity in the animal kingdom . nonetheless , a single-gene knockout can modify the mode of gastrulation while achieve the same body plan . numerous interconnected mechanism drive different degree of emt , include surface receptor signal , metabolism , and epigenetics . emt be reactivate in adult tissue during repair and disease , particularly in cancer initiation , progression to metastasis , and refractoriness to treatment . emt also contribute to dormancy and drug tolerance , lead to minimal residual disease at the origin of recurrence . multiple emt state coexist in tumor , create a dynamic ecosystem for generate an inflammatory microenvironment , stemness , invasion , and metastasis . this review provide an in-depth description of these aspect along with recent controversy and offer new opportunity to far explore the multiple function of emt . examine the potential attribute of emt in tissue repair , fibrosis , and cancer progression can provide new opportunity for therapeutic intervention .

Title: notch3 destabilize regulatory t cell to drive autoimmune neuroinflammation in multiple sclerosis .
Authors: Benamar M, Contini P, Schmitz-Abe K, Lanzetta O, Getachew F, Bachelin C, Leyva Castillo JM, Wang M, Oktelik FB, Perrot O, Batamack Y, Arbag SN, Stephen-Victor E, Harb H, Agrawal PB, Louapre C, Ivaldi F, Uccelli A, Inglese M, Angelini C, Zujovic V, De Palma R, Chatila TA
Abstract: the immune regulatory defect that promote neuroinflammation in multiple sclerosis ( m ) remain unclear . we show that a specific regulatory t ( treg ) cell subpopulation express notch3 be increase in individual with m and in mouse with experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis ( eae ) . notch3 ( + ) treg cell be induce by the gut microbiota via toll-like receptor ( tlr ) -dependent mechanism . they then translocate to the central nervous system ( cns ) in eae where they promote disease severity . notch3 interacted with delta-like ligand 1 ( dll1 ) on microglia to subvert treg cell into t helper 17 ( th17 ) cell . notch3 deletion in treg cell prevent eae onset by stabilize treg cell and by simultaneously promote the expansion of a tissue-resident treg cell population that express neuropeptide y receptor 1 ( npy1r ) and which suppress pathogenic ifn-γ ( + ) and gm-csf ( + ) t cell . our study thus identify altered treg cell population dynamic a a fundamental pathogenic mechanism in autoimmune neuroinflammation .

Title: relook into the risk factor of proximal junctional kyphosis in early onset scoliosis patient : do the location of upper instrument vertebra in relation to the sagittal apex matter ?
Authors: Yang B, Xu L, Zhou Q, Qian Z, Wang B, Zhu Z, Qiu Y, Sun X
Abstract: grow rod surgery be the mainstay of treatment for early-onset scoliosis ( eos ) while proximal junctional kyphosis ( pjk ) be one of the most commonly report postoperative complication . we seek to investigate the impact of the location of upper instrument vertebra ( uiv ) in relation to the sagittal apex on proximal junctional kyphosis in eos after traditional grow rod ( grs ) treatment . a total of 102 eos patient who receive traditional grow rod treatment with a follow-up of at least 2 year between 2009 and 2020 be retrospectively review . radiographic measurement be perform before and after the index surgery and at the late follow-up . we investigate the coronal cobb angle and spinopelvic parameter of the whole spine . the location of the uiv , apex , low instrument vertebra ( liv ) , inflection vertebra ( iv ) , the number and distance of uiv-apex , liv-apex and iv-apex be also record . risk factor for pjk be analyze by logistic regression analysis . pjk be observe in 21 patient ( 20.6 % ) during the follow-up period . the pjk group show a young age at the index surgery ( 5.9 vs. 7.1 year , p = 0.042 ) , more lengthening procedure time ( 5.0 vs. 4.0 , p = 0.032 ) , large preoperative coronal cobb angle ( 82.0 vs. 75.6° , p = 0.038 ) , high correction rate ( 51.2 % vs. 44.4 % , p = 0.047 ) and large postoperative proximal junctional angle ( pja ) ( 13.9 vs. 5.5° , p < 0.001 ) than the non-pjk group . the ratio of the number and distance from uiv-apex to iv-apex also differ significantly between the two group . the logistic regression reveal that age at the index surgery ≤ 7 year , the ratio of the number from uiv- apex to iv- apex ≤ 0.6 and the ratio of the distance from uiv- apex to iv- apex ≤ 0.6 be independent risk factor for postoperative pjk . besides young age , a close location of uiv relative to the sagittal apex be identify to be an independent risk factor of postoperative pjk . selection of uiv at a relatively farther location away from the sagittal apex might help prevent occurrence of pjk .

Title: familiarity and genetic literacy among medical student in indonesia .
Authors: Swandayani YM, Cayami FK, Winarni TI, Utari A
Abstract: there be a lack of genetic knowledge among health care professional especially in some develop country such a indonesia . base on our experience , genetic disorder receive less attention in medical education and professional . this study aim to determine the familiarity and literacy of genetics among medical student in indonesia . a total of 1003 indonesian medical ( pre-clinical and clinical ) student complete the rapid estimate of adult literacy in genetics ( real-g ) questionnaire with a total score of seven for familiarity and eight for genetic literacy . the mann-whitney u test be use to compare the familiarity and genetic literacy score between pre-clinical and clinical student . the average score of familiarity and genetic literacy be 5.63 ± 0.96 and 6.37 ± 0.83 , respectively . genetic familiarity be high ( p = 0.043 ) among clinical student than pre-clinical student , while there be no significant difference in genetic literacy ( p = 0.362 ) between pre-clinical and clinical student . genetic familiarity do not impact the level of genetic literacy . however , medical student ' genetic literacy be influence by demographic characteristic , such a age , sex , university type , genetic learning experience , university accreditation , and university location . in general , indonesian medical student have relatively good familiarity and literacy in genetics although further study be necessary to accurately measure the genetic familiarity and literacy in medical student and general public .

Title: the pp2a-b55α phosphatase be a master regulator of mitochondrial degradation and biogenesis .
Authors: Cianfanelli V, Nanni M, Corrà S, Mauri S, Sumpton D, Lilla S, De Cegli R, Bordi M, Milletti G, Ferraina C, Hall A, Petraroia M, Clausi V, Giorda E, Scarsella M, Barbiera A, Cadeddu G, Colasanti M, Persichini T, Maeda K, Maya-Mendoza A, Bartek J, Di Malta C, Locatelli F, Zanivan S, Ismail S, Ziviani E, Cecconi F
Abstract: mitochondrial homeostasis relies on a tight balance between mitochondrial biogenesis and degradation . although mitophagy be one of the main pathway involve in the clearance of damage or old mitochondrion , it coordination with mitochondrial biogenesis be poorly characterize . here , by unbiased approach include last-generation liquid chromatography couple to mass spectrometry and transcriptomics , we identify the protein phosphatase pp2a-b55α/ppp2r2a a a parkin-dependent regulator of mitochondrial number . upon mitochondrial damage , pp2a-b55α determines the amplitude of mitophagy induction and execution by regulate both early and late mitophagy event . a few minute after the insult , ulk1 be release from the inhibitory regulation of pp2a-b55α , whereas 2 to 4 hour later , pp2a-b55α promote the nuclear translocation of tfeb , the master regulator of autophagy and lysosome gene , to support mitophagy execution . moreover , pp2a-b55α control a transcriptional program of mitochondrial biogenesis by stabilize the parkin substrate and pgc-1α inhibitor paris . pp2a-b55α target rescue neurodegenerative phenotype in a fly model of parkinson 's disease , thus suggest potential therapeutic application .

Title: mtch2 modulates cpt1 activity to regulate lipid metabolism of adipocytes .
Authors: Wu C, Wang T, Ghosh A, Long F, Sharma AK, Dahlby T, Noé F, Severi I, Colleluori G, Cinti S, Giordano A, Ding L, Khandelwal R, Kostidis S, Giera M, Balazova L, Gardeux V, Abu-Nawwas L, Deplancke B, Chourasia S, Kleiner S, Hamilton BS, Alcántara JMA, Ruiz JR, Blüher M, Pekcec A, Balaz M, Gross A, Neubauer H, Wolfrum C
Abstract: metabolic disorder , include obesity and metabolic-associated steatohepatitis , arise from a chronic energy surplus . thus , enhance energy dissipation through increase respiration hold significant therapeutic potential for metabolic disorder . through a comprehensive analysis of human and murine adipose tissue , along with a functional screen , we identify mitochondrial carrier homolog 2 , a mitochondrial outer membrane protein , a a pivotal regulator of mitochondrial metabolism . intriguingly , it expression in adipose tissue be a strong determinant of obesity in human . adipocyte-specific ablation of mitochondrial carrier homolog 2 improve mitochondrial function and whole-body energy expenditure , independent of uncouple protein 1. furthermore , mitochondrial carrier homolog 2 regulate mitochondrial influx of free fatty acid by modulate the sensitivity of carnitine palmitoyltransferase 1 to malonyl-coa through direct physical interaction , lead to enhance energy expenditure in adipocytes/adipose tissue . here we show mitochondrial carrier homolog 2 function a a negative regulator of energy metabolism in adipocytes and represent a potential target for treat obesity and related metabolic disorder .

Title: the tumour microenvironment in pancreatic cancer - new clinical challenge , but more opportunity .
Authors: Kung HC, Zheng KW, Zimmerman JW, Zheng L
Abstract: patient with advanced-stage pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma ( pdac ) predominantly receive chemotherapy , and despite initial response in some patient , most will have disease progression and often dismal outcome . this lack of clinical effectiveness partly reflect not only cancer cell-intrinsic factor but also the presence of a tumour microenvironment ( tme ) that preclude access of both systemic therapy and circulate immune cell to the primary tumour , as well a support the growth of pdac cell . combine with improved preclinical model of pdac , advance in single-cell spatial multi-omics and machine learning-based model have provide novel method of untangle the complexity of the tme . in this review , we focus on the desmoplastic stroma and both the intratumoural and intertumoural heterogeneity of pdac , with an emphasis on cancer-associated fibroblast and their surrounding immune cell niche . we describe new approach in convert the immunologically 'cold ' pdac tme into a 'hot ' tme by prim t cell activation , overcome t cell exhaustion and unravelling myeloid cell-mediated immunosuppression . furthermore , we explore integrated target involve the tme , such a point of convergence among tumour , stromal and immune cell metabolism as well a oncogenic kras signal . finally , build on our experience with failed clinical trial in the past , we consider how this evolve comprehensive understanding of the tme will ensure future success in develop more effective therapy for patient with pdac .

Title: anti-cytokine biologics for asthma in adult .
Authors: Israel E, Wechsler ME, Jackson DJ, Moore WC
Abstract: an estimate 3-10 % of patient with asthma be unable to reach full control with currently available inhaled therapy . in a large proportion of these patient , asthma can be drive in whole or in part by type 2 ( t2 ) inflammation , which be usually initiate by an immunological response to stimulation at mucosal surface . the introduction of monoclonal antibody , which target t2 inflammatory process , provide important option for this population . in the past decade , five anticytokine biologics ( acbs ) that block specific t2 inflammatory cytokine have be introduce . three biologics , mepolizumab , reslizumab , and benralizumab , inhibit the il-5 or il-5 receptor pathway ; dupilumab block il-4 and il-13 through it activity on the il-4 receptor-alpha ; and tezepelumab prevents activation of the thymic stromal lymphopoietin cytokine production cascade . these drug reduce exacerbation and improve lung function and patient-reported asthma quality of life in individual with a history of asthma exacerbation and evidence of t2 inflammation . some also allow oral corticosteroid reduction or elimination in patient dependent on these therapy for asthma control . the effect of acbs varies by the degree of t2 inflammation , which be most easily assess by blood eosinophil count and exhale nitric oxide . the use of acbs guide by these biomarkers and phenotypic characteristic of patient with severe asthma allow a personalised medicine approach that increase the likelihood of improvement .

Title: reprogramming cellular senescence and age clock for advanced cancer immunotherapy .
Authors: Yang H, Liu D, Qiu L, Wang R, Zhang C, Yu D, Zhong Q, Yuki N, Song Z, Zhu T, Ju H, Hong W, Zhu J
Abstract: cellular senescence have gradually be recognize a a key process , which not only inhibit the occurrence of early tumor but also promote advanced malignant progression through secretory and immunomodulatory function . initially , cellular senescence manifest a irreversible cell cycle arrest , but now it encompass a broad phenotype regulate by the p53-p21cip1 and p16ink4a-rb pathway . although secretory phenotype relate to age can recruit immune effector to clear new tumor cell , persistent senescent cell population often trigger chronic inflammation , promote immune escape and fibrosis . in this review , we first discuss the molecular underpinnings of cellular senescence , highlight it induction pathway and diverse physiological or pathological role . we then examine the composition of the tumor microenvironment , where senescent cell accumulate and secrete pro-inflammatory cytokine , reshape immune surveillance and extracellular matrix architecture . against this backdrop , we explore how age clock refine our understanding of individual susceptibility to malignancy by distinguish biological from chronological age . we also present current therapeutic prospect , include senolytic agent target senescent stromal cell that promote tumor growth , and the utilization of age clock metric to tailor immunotherapy more effectively for old patient . finally , we consider the major challenge face clinical translation , from standardize multi-omics data pipeline to clarify the ethical implication of measure biological age . by bridge senescence biology with geroscience and cutting-edge oncology , we posit that age clock may catalyze a transformation in cancer care , enable more personalized , effective , and age-conscious treatment strategy .

Title: disruption of fnip1 reveals a metabolic checkpoint control b lymphocyte development .
Authors: Park H, Staehling K, Tsang M, Appleby MW, Brunkow ME, Margineantu D, Hockenbery DM, Habib T, Liggitt HD, Carlson G, Iritani BM
Abstract: the coordination of nutrient and energy availability with cell growth and division be essential for proper immune cell development and function . by use a chemical mutagenesis strategy in mouse , we identify a pedigree that have a complete block in b cell development at the pre-b cell stage result from a deletion in the fnip1 gene . enforced expression of an immunoglobulin transgene fail to rescue b cell development . whereas essential pre-b cell signal molecule be activate normally in fnip1-null pre-b cell , the metabolic regulator ampk and mtor be dysregulated , result in excessive cell growth and enhanced sensitivity to apoptosis in response to metabolic stress ( pre-b cell receptor crosslinking , oncogene activation ) . these result indicate that folliculin-interacting protein 1 ( fnip1 ) be vital for b cell development and metabolic homeostasis and reveal a metabolic checkpoint that may ensure that pre-b cell have sufficient metabolic capacity to support division , while limit lymphomagenesis cause by deregulated growth .

Title: novel approach to the stratified management of knee osteoarthritis .
Authors: Fuggle NR, Chapurlat R, Laslop A, Al-Daghri N, Alokail M, Thiyagarajan JA, Balkowiec-Iskra E, Berenbaum F, Bemden AB, Borg JJ, Bruyère O, Burlet N, Cavalier E, Rosa MM, Conaghan PG, Cooper C, Dennison EM, Englund M, Im GI, Haugen IK, Hiligsmann M, Kurth A, Lane N, Lories R, Marlovits S, Matijevic R, Mobasheri A, Ormarsdóttir S, Yerro MCP, Radermecker RP, Rannou F, Sepodes B, Silverman S, Torre C, Veronese N, Rizzoli R, Reginster JY, Harvey NC
Abstract: knee osteoarthritis be a highly prevalent whole-joint disease that be associate with substantial morbidity . if step change be to be make in the management of knee osteoarthritis , novel patient stratification approach be need to identify the most effective treatment for individual patient . numerous method for stratify patient with knee osteoarthritis can be employ ; clinical presentation , include co-morbidity and pain phenotype , can influence treatment decision , and there be a rich history of image biomarker use , both from conventional radiograph and , since it development , via mri , in identify patient at risk of disease progression , and the latter facilitate the detection of synovitis . the development of novel biochemical biomarkers and the rapid growth of '-omics ' technology provide fresh opportunity to deploy these advance in the stratification of patient with knee osteoarthritis . the health economic landscape in this area be develop , and scoping work have highlight the need for further study .

Title: brain tumor induce widespread disruption of calvarial bone and alteration of skull marrow immune landscape .
Authors: Dubey A, Yamashita E, Stangeland B, Abbas I, Fooksman D, Harris RA, Palmer GM, Koba WR, Zhang J, Himes BT, Lu OR, Ho WS, Kuiper RV, Huffman D, Wu Z, Uchida Y, Ishii M, Welch RL, Fiedler AF, Reynolds D, Hosainey SAM, Dobrenis K, Ye Q, Fisher K, Killian N, Stanley ER, Eskandar E, Behnan J
Abstract: the skull marrow niche have recently be identify a a reservoir that supply the brain with monocyte and neutrophil in the context of disease and injury , but it role in brain cancer remain unknown . here we show that glioblastoma , the most malignant type of brain tumor , induce calvarial bone abnormality in murine model and patient with glioblastoma , alter osteoclast activity and increase the number of skull channel in mouse . single-cell rna sequence reveal glioblastoma-mediated alteration in the immune landscape of skull marrow and femoral bone marrow , include expansion of neutrophil and deterioration of various b cell subset . in vivo inhibition of bone resorption reduce bone abnormality , but promote tumor progression in mesenchymal subtype tumor . this also abolish the survival benefit of the checkpoint inhibitor anti-pd-l1 , by reduce activate t cell and increase inflammatory neutrophil number . together , these data provide insight into how brain tumor affect skull bone and the immune environment .

Title: dpp-4 inhibitor alleviate gut-brain axis pathology in parkinson 's disease .
Authors: Jeong SH, Kim YJ, Shin JY, Oh KW, Lee JW, Lee PH
Abstract: dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitor ( dpp-4is ) have be report to exhibit therapeutic effect in parkinson 's disease ( pd ) , increase their potential for drug repurposing . one aspect of pd pathogenesis be think to be associate with the gut-brain axis , where α-synuclein from the gut be transmit to the brain via the vagus nerve ( vn ) . we explore whether sitagliptin , a dpp-4i , exhibit a protective effect in a low-dose rotenone-treated gut-brain axis-associated pd model . to explore the effect of sitagliptin , we use the oral rotenone-treated mouse model , which show spreading of pathological α-synuclein from the intestine in a stereotypic manner via the vn into the midbrain with motor deficit . sitagliptin mitigate rotenone-induced gut inflammation and toll-like receptor 2 ( tlr2 ) expression , reduce α-synuclein accumulation in the gut , vn and brain and lessen neuronal loss in the medulla and midbrain with recovery of motor performance . in addition , sitagliptin suppress inflammation in response to a tlr2 agonist and rotenone in macrophage , enteric glial cell and enteroendocrine cell line in vitro . in secretin tumour cell 1 , an enteroendocrine cell line , sitagliptin also decrease rotenone-induced endogenous α-synuclein level . the beneficial effect of sitagliptin be maintain even under glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor blockade . notably , sitagliptin significantly alter the gut microbiome , shift towards a profile that may counteract pd pathology . these finding demonstrate that sitagliptin alleviate α-synuclein deposition in the gut and brain through modulation of tlr2-mediated inflammation and alter the gut microbiome composition towards a more favourable profile , which indicate that dpp-4is can offer a novel therapeutic avenue for manage pd .

Title: eomesodermin ( + ) cd4 ( + ) t cell be critical for curative immunotherapy outcome .
Authors: Zhang P, Haeseleer F, Waltner OG, Gartlan KH, Bhise SS, Minnie SA, Adams RC, Yeh AC, Ensbey KS, Legg SRW, Sekiguchi T, Atilla E, Nemychenkov NS, Nelson EL, Joshi T, Liang EC, Hirayama AV, Abe K, Koyama M, Clouston AD, Gauthier J, Furlan SN, Hill GR
Abstract: interleukin 10 ( il-10 ) -producing cd4 ( + ) type-1 regulatory t cell ( tr1 ) promote immune tolerance during chronic infection , autoimmunity , and transplantation . however , specific eomesodermin ( eomes ) -dependent stage of tr1 differentiation and function remain unclear . use preclinical model of bone marrow transplantation ( bmt ) , we demonstrate a tr1 differentiation trajectory in vivo from eomes ( + ) il-10 ( - ) to eomes ( + ) il-10 ( + ) subsets with the acquisition of cytokine , cytolytic , and exhaustion feature . the eomes ( + ) cd4 ( + ) fraction represent the dominant cytotoxic subset after bmt , mediate graft-versus-leukemia effect while limit inflammation . in cd19-targeted chimeric antigen receptor ( car ) t cell immunotherapy , eomes drive the same cd4 ( + ) tr1 phenotype that control cytolysis , while mitigate immune toxicity and promote persistence . in individual with high-grade b cell lymphoma that have long-term disease control after receive commercial cd19-targeted car t cell , eomes ( + ) tr1 cell represent a stable population comprise 40 % -80 % of the cd4 ( + ) car t cell population . hence , eomes control both regulatory and cytotoxic program in cd4 ( + ) t cell , essential for curative immunotherapy outcome .

Title: a generative artificial intelligence approach for the discovery of antimicrobial peptide against multidrug-resistant bacteria .
Authors: Wang Y, Zhao L, Li Z, Xi Y, Pan Y, Zhao G, Zhang L
Abstract: the discovery of novel antimicrobial peptide ( amp ) against clinical superbug be urgently need to address the ongoing antibiotic resistance crisis . amp be promise candidate due to their broad-spectrum activity , rapid bactericidal mechanism and reduced likelihood of induce resistance compare with conventional antibiotic . here , a pre-trained protein large language model ( llm ) , proteogpt , be establish and far develop into multiple specialized subllms to assemble a sequential pipeline . this pipeline enable rapid screen across hundred of million of peptide sequence , ensure potent antimicrobial activity and minimize cytotoxic risk . through transfer learning , we endow the llm with different domain-specific knowledge to achieve high-throughput mining and generation of amp within a unified methodological framework . notably , both mine and generate amp exhibit reduced susceptibility to resistance development in icu-derived carbapenem-resistant acinetobacter baumannii ( crab ) and methicillin-resistant staphylococcus aureus ( mrsa ) in vitro . the amp also show comparable or superior therapeutic efficacy in in vivo thigh infection mouse model compare with clinical antibiotic , without cause organ damage and disrupt gut microbiota . the mechanism of action of these amp involve disruption of the cytoplasmic membrane and membrane depolarization . overall , this study present a generative artificial intelligence approach for the discovery of novel antimicrobial against multidrug-resistant bacteria , enable efficient and extensive exploration of amp space .

Title: poor sleep health be associate with old brain age : the role of systemic inflammation .
Authors: Miao Y, Wang J, Li X, Guo J, Ekblom MM, Sindi S, Zhang Q, Dove A
Abstract: poor-quality sleep have be link to increase dementia risk . we investigate the relationship between healthy sleep pattern and old brain age , and the extent to which this be mediate by systemic inflammation . the study include 27,500 adult from the uk biobank ( mean age 54.7 y , 54.0 % female ) . the presence of five self-reported healthy sleep characteristic ( early chronotype , 7-8 h daily sleep , no insomnia , no snoring , no excessive daytime sleepiness ) be sum into a healthy sleep score ( 0-5 pt ) and use to define three sleep pattern : healthy ( ≥4 pt ) , intermediate ( 2-3 pt ) , and poor ( ≤1 pt ) . low-grade inflammation be estimate use the infla-score , a composite index of inflammatory biomarkers . after a mean follow-up of 8.9 y , brain age be estimate use a machine learn model base on 1079 brain mri phenotype and use to calculate brain age gap ( bag ; i.e. , brain age minus chronological age ) . data be analyse use linear regression and generalised structural equation model . at baseline , 898 ( 3.3 % ) participant have poor sleep , 15,283 ( 55.6 % ) have intermediate sleep , and 11,319 ( 41.2 % ) have healthy sleep . compare to healthy sleep , intermediate ( β = 0.25 [ 0.11 , 0.40 ] , p = 0.010 ) and poor ( β = 0.46 [ 0.05 , 0.87 ] , p < 0.001 ) sleep be associate with significantly high bag . in mediation analysis , infla-score mediate 6.81 % and 10.42 % of the association between intermediate and poor sleep and high bag . poor sleep health may accelerate brain ageing . this may be drive by high level of systemic inflammation . alzheimerfonden ; demensfonden ; loo and han osterman foundation for medical research ; the knowledge foundation ; swedish research council .

Title: international expert consensus on the management of acute aortic type b intramural haematoma and penetrate ulcer .
Authors: Squizzato F, D'Oria M, Antonello M, Trimarchi S, Mani K, Holden A, Kölbel T, Haulon S, Verhoeven E, Böckler D, Resch T, Azizzadeh A, Lombardi J, Piazza M
Abstract: the aim of this study be to achieve an international expert consensus on manage acute type b penetrate aortic ulcer ( paus ) and intramural haematoma ( imhs ) . a modified delphi consensus process be employ to develop recommendation for the management of acute type b pau and imh . survey be send to international expert practice in high volume aortic centre worldwide . statement be vote on use a four point likert scale in a three round delphi process . statement achieve grade a ( full agreement 75 % ) or b ( overall agreement 80 % , full disagreement < 5 % ) be include a expert recommendation . consistency of response be measure use cohen 's κ and the intraclass correlation coefficient . eighty three expert be include in the final analysis : 25 statement achieve a consensus , 18 ( 72 % ) receive a grade b strength and 7 ( 28 % ) a grade a strength . most statement ( 97 % ) have a high consistency classify a grade i or ii . the expert panel agree on the indication for thoracic endovascular aortic repair ( tevar ) for complicate imh/pau , define by rupture or refractory pain/hypertension . uncomplicated imh/pau should be manage conservatively and follow up with serial compute tomography image during the acute phase . high risk uncomplicated imhs be identify by increased haematoma thickness , new onset or increased size of ulcer like projection , or transition to aortic dissection ; high risk uncomplicated paus be define by new associate haematoma , pau width/depth increase , or total aortic diameter increase . uncomplicated high risk imh/paus may be consider for tevar . in perform tevar , a proximal sealing length > 20 mm in a site free from haematoma should be achieve , eventually extend in zone 2 , with a 0 - 10 % oversize . patency of the left subclavian artery should be maintain . an agreement among international expert be achieve on assessment , management , and follow up of acute type b imhs and paus , address area of inconsistency or knowledge gap in exist guideline .
