Title: genetic modification of the ajcc classification of papillary thyroid cancer : an international , multicentre , retrospective cohort study .
Authors: Xing M, Lin S, Mathur A, Li Y, Bendlova B, Kuklikova V, Melo M, Jesus TT, Soares P, Colombo C, Fugazzola L, Mitsutake N, Matsuse M, Sako A, Estrada-Florez AP, Carvajal-Carmona LG, Bohórquez ME, Mian C, Vianello F, O'Neill CJ, Clifton-Bligh R, Czarniecka A, Jarzab B, Jung CK, Brahma B, Ladenson PW, Park YJ
Abstract: the four-stage american joint committee on cancer ( ajcc ) staging system have be use for almost 50 year for assess the risk of multiple cancer ; the ajcc classification for papillary thyroid cancer be solely base on clinical parameter , and despite updated edition it accuracy remain suboptimal . we aim to evaluate whether the performance of the ajcc system could be improve by integrate tumour genetic status of braf and tert gene . this retrospective multicentre cohort study use patient medical record from 15 medical centre across ten country for patient ( of all age ) with papillary thyroid cancer who have be surgically treat with total thyroidectomy or hemithyroidectomy with or without neck dissection , follow by postoperative radioiodine ablation and appropriate thyroid-stimulating hormone level target . test for braf ( v600e ) and tert promotor ( tertp ) mutation be perform on genomic dna isolate from surgical or cytological specimen of primary papillary thyroid cancer tumour at each centre . data from all medical centre be pool for aggregated analysis of the relationship between the genetic status and papillary thyroid cancer-specific mortality for each of the four classical stage of the 7th and 8th edition of the ajcc system ( ajcc7e and ajcc8e ) . the primary endpoint be papillary thyroid cancer-specific mortality , characterise by mortality rate per 1000 person-years . use patient who be treat for papillary thyroid cancer between january 1979 , to july 2023 at the 15 centre , our cohort comprise of 4746 patient ( 3612 [ 76·1 % ] female and 1134 [ 23·9 % ] male ) , with median age of 48 year ( iqr 37-59 ; 89 [ 1·9 % ] patient age ≤18 year ) . for the 4400 patient with available ethnicity data , the majority be asian ( 2140 [ 48·6 % ] ) and 2096 ( 47·6 % ) be white . for ajcc7e , compare with the original stage , the genetic duet of braf ( v600e ) and tertp mutation be associate with increased mortality in all stage versus the corresponding original stage , although the hr for stage i do not reach statistical significance . those with wildtype braf ( v600e ) and tertp have flat survival curve for stage i-iii with ajcc7e and stag i-ii of ajcc8e . patient with dual mutation have reduction in survival across all stage for the ajcc7e ( stage i hr 5·96 [ 95 % ci 0·73-48·66 ] ; p=0·10 ; stage ii 5·94 [ 95 % ci 1·42-24·91 ] ; p=0·015 ; stage iii 4·04 [ 95 % ci 1·87-8·70 ] ; p=0·00037 ; and stage iv 1·79 [ 95 % ci 1·15-2·76 ] ; p=0·0092 ) . tertp mutation alone be also significantly associate with a significant increase in mortality for stage iv ( 3·57 [ 2·01-6·37 ] ; p < 0·0001 ) . for ajcc8e , we observe a similar pattern of increase mortality when both mutation be present compare to mortality in the original staging , with significant difference in hr for stage i and ii ( stage i adjust hr 10·30 [ 95 % ci 3·43-30·93 ] , p < 0·0001 ; stage ii hr 3·95 [ 95 % ci 1·92-8·15 ] ; p=0·00020 ) . stage iii also show increased mortality with dual mutation , but the increase be not statistically significant ( hr 1·77 [ 0·95-3·31 ] ; p=0·072 ) . in contrast to ajcc7e , the dual mutation do not increase mortality compare with the original stage iv ( hr 0·95 [ 0·47-1·92 ] , p=0·89 ) , but the tertp mutation do significantly increase mortality in stage iv papillary thyroid cancer ( hr 2·75 [ 1·36-5·58 ] , p=0·0049 ) . integrate the genetic status of braf and tertp into the ajcc system change the original risk stage of the ajcc system and significantly improve the accuracy of it mortality risk classification for papillary thyroid cancer . national institute on age , the auburn community cancer endow chair in basic research , the heart , breast , and brain health equity research program , national institute of health , and the american association for cancer research fellowship 21-40-69-estr ( usa ) ; ministry of health ( czech republic ) ; prémio francisco augusto da fonseca dia e maria josé melena da fonseca para jovens investigadores ( portugal ) ; italian ministry of health-ricerca corrente ( italy ) ; jsps kakenhi ( japan ) ; minciencias , l'oreal-unesco-icetex-colciencias , universidad del tolima ( colombia ) ; strategmed2/267398/4/ncbr/2015 , the national centre for research and development ( poland ) ; risbin iptekdok 2014 , ministry of health ( indonesia ) ; and the information and communication technology and future planning of the basic science research program via the national research foundation of korea ( nrf ) fund by the ministry of science ( korea ) .

Title: association between metabolic score for insulin resistance and future stroke risk in patient with cardiovascular-kidney-metabolic syndrome stage 0-3 : a longitudinal analysis base on charls .
Authors: Wu H, Zhou Y, Lai X, Ma B, Ding L, Zhu X, Chen Z, Liu Z
Abstract: metabolic disorder , cardiovascular disease , and chronic kidney disease be closely interrelate , and the proposal of cardiovascular-kidney-metabolic ( ckm ) syndrome concept have receive extensive attention.the disease burden of ckm be heavy , with stroke be a significant contributor , and ckm staging be bidirectional.a large body of evidence have demonstrate that insulin resistance be closely associate with disease such a stroke , obesity and chronic kidney disease . while the metabolic score for insulin resistance ( mets-ir ) serve a an important indicator for evaluate insulin resistance , the relationship between mets-ir and stroke incidence remains unclear in the population define by ckm syndrome stage 0-3. in this study , data on individual with ckm syndrome stage 0-3 without stroke at baseline be collect from china health and retirement longitudinal study ( charls ) .self-reported stroke be use a the primary outcome , with mets-ir at baseline a the exposure factor . logistic regression be perform to analyze the effect of mets-ir on the incidence of stroke among participant with ckm , and restrict cubic spline ( rcs ) regression be utilize to explore the potential nonlinear relationship between them . to evaluate the predictive value of mets-ir for stroke risk in individual with ckm syndrome stage 0-3 , we apply receiver operating characteristic ( roc ) analysis . a total of 5009 participant be include in this study , with a mean age of 60.48 ± 8.81 year . over a 5-year follow-up , 339 participant in this study develop incident stroke . participant be stratify into mets-ir quartile ( q1-q4 ) . in the fully adjust model , compare with q1 ( the low quartile ) , the odds ratio ( or ) for q3 be 1.88 ( 95 % 1.25-2.81 ; p = 0.002 ) , and the or for q4 be 1.72 ( 95 % 1.08-2.76 ; p = 0.02 ) . rcs analysis reveal a nonlinear relationship between mets-ir and stroke risk among participant with ckm syndrome stage 0-3 ( p-overall < 0.05 ; p-nonlinearity < 0.05 ) . roc analysis show an area under the curve ( auc ) of 0.726 ( 95 % 0.699-0.752 ) , with an optimal mets-ir cutoff value of 29.58. in individual with ckm syndrome stage 0-3 , elevate mets-ir level may be associate with an increase stroke risk . furthermore , mets-ir demonstrates moderate predictive value for stroke risk in this population . monitor mets-ir may therefore aid in their early identification .

Title: change in accelerated aging and risk of cardiovascular disease and mortality : three cohort study .
Authors: Zhang JJ, Yu HC, Geng TT, Chen SH, Wang YX, Guo H, Zhang XM, He MA, Gao JL, Liu G, Liao YF, Wu SL, Pan A
Abstract: accelerate aging be a dynamic process , yet few study examine the association of change in accelerated age with cardiovascular disease ( cvd ) and mortality . this study aim to evaluate this association in three prospective cohort from china and the uk . data be draw from the kailuan cohort ( n = 107,830 ) , the dongfeng-tongji ( dftj ) cohort ( n = 14,032 ) , and the uk biobank ( n = 316,087 ) . accelerate aging be assess by phenoage and klemera-doubal method ( kdm ) age , measure at baseline ( kailuan cohort : 2006-2009 ; dftj cohort : 2008-2010 ; uk biobank : 2006-2010 ) and the first follow-up ( kailuan cohort : 2010-2013 ; dftj cohort : 2013 ; uk biobank : 2012-2013 ) . change in accelerated age be classify a persistent accelerate age , recovery from accelerate aging , delay accelerate age , and stable non-accelerated aging . cox proportional hazard model be use to estimate hazard ratio ( hr ) and 95 % confidence interval ( ci ) . meta-analysis be perform to summarize estimate across three cohort . median follow-up period be 10.3-15.9 year across three cohort . when define accelerate age by phenoage , baseline accelerate age be significantly associate with increased risk of cvd ( pooled 1.41 , 95 % 1.25 , 1.60 ) and mortality ( pooled 1.47 , 95 % 1.33 , 1.63 ) . compare to participant with persistent accelerated aging , participant recover from accelerate age ( pooled hr of 0.76 , 95 % 0.72 , 0.81 ; pool hr of mortality : 0.84 , 95 % 0.78 , 0.89 ) , delay accelerate age ( pooled hr of 0.75 , 95 % 0.70 , 0.79 ; pool hr of mortality : 0.77 , 95 % 0.72 , 0.83 ) or maintain non-accelerated aging ( pooled hr of 0.59 , 95 % 0.48 , 0.71 ; pool hr of mortality : 0.58 , 95 % 0.55 , 0.62 ) exhibit decreased risk of both cvd and mortality . when define accelerate age by kdm age , the result remain consistent with those of phenoage . accelerate aging be a significant risk factor for cvd and mortality . recover from or delay accelerated aging , or maintain non-accelerated aging , be associate with reduced risk of cvd and mortality .

Title: engineer geminivirus replicons enable rapid in planta direct evolution .
Authors: Zhu H, Qin X, Wei L, Jiang D, Zhang Q, Wang W, Liang R, Zhang R, Zhang K, Liu G, Zhao KT, Chen K, Qiu JL, Gao C
Abstract: direct evolution can rapidly generate genetic variant with new and enhanced property , yet efficient platform for perform such evolution directly in plant cell have be lack . we develop geminivirus replicon-assisted in planta direct evolution ( grape ) , a system that link gene function to geminivirus roll circle replication ( rcr ) to enable high-throughput selection for desired activity . grape support the screening of up to 10 ( 5 ) variant on a single nicotiana benthamiana leaf within four day . use grape , we evolve the immune receptor nrc3 to resist inhibition by the nematode effector sprysec15 and broaden the recognition spectrum of the rice immune receptor pikm-1 to recognize all six allele of the fungal effector avr-pik . grape provide a rapid , scalable , and generalizable platform for directed evolution of diverse gene in plant cellular context .

Title: effect of repurposed simvastatin on disability progression in secondary progressive multiple sclerosis ( ms-stat2 ) : a phase 3 , randomise , double-blind , placebo-controlled trial .
Authors: Chataway J, Williams T, Blackstone J, John N, Braisher M, De Angelis F, Bianchi A, Calvi A, Doshi A, Apap Mangion S, Wade C, Bordea E, Merry R, Barton G, Lyle D, Jarman E, Mahad D, Shehu A, Arun T, McDonnell G, Geraldes R, Craner M, Hillier C, Ganesalingam J, Fisniku L, Hobart J, Spilker C, Robertson NP, Kalra S, Pluchino S, Harikrishnan S, Mattoscio M, Harrower T, Young C, Lee M, Chhetri SK, Ahmed F, Rog D, Silber E, Gallagher P, Duddy M, Straukiene A, Nicholas R, Rice C, Tebbs S, Hawton A, Hunter R, Giovannoni G, Ciccarelli O, Beveridge J, Nixon S, Thompson AJ, Greenwood J, Pearson OR, Evangelou N, Sharrack B, Galea I, Gray E, Pavitt S, Chandran S, Ford HL, Frost C, Nicholas JM
Abstract: despite the success of immune modulation in the treatment of relapse multiple sclerosis , disability progression be a major problem drive by multiple mechanism . comorbidities ( eg , vascular risk ) and age be think to augment these neurodegenerative pathology . in the phase 2b ms-stat trial of simvastatin ( 80 mg ) versus placebo in secondary progressive multiple sclerosis ( spms ) , the adjust difference in brain atrophy rate between group be -0·254 % per year : a 43 % reduction . in this phase 3 ms-stat2 trial , we aim to assess the efficacy of simvastatin versus placebo in slow the progression of disability in spms . this phase 3 , randomise , double-blind , parallel group , placebo-controlled clinical trial be conduct at 31 neuroscience centre and district general hospital in the uk . participant age 18-65 year with a diagnosis of spms and an expand disability status scale ( edss ) of between 4·0 and 6·5 be eligible and randomly assign ( 1:1 ) to oral simvastatin ( 80 mg ) or match placebo for up to 4·5 year , base on a minimisation algorithm within an independent and secure online randomisation service . all participant , site investigator , and the trial coordinate team be mask to treatment allocation . the primary outcome be time to 6-month eds confirm disability progression ( an increase of at least 1 point if edss score at baseline visit be less than 6·0 or an increase of 0·5 point if edss score at baseline visit be 6·0 or more ) assess in all randomly assign participant ( intention-to-treat analysis ) without imputation . this study be register with clinicaltrials.gov ( nct03387670 ) and be on the isrctn registry ( isrctn82598726 ) . the study be complete . between may 10 , 2018 , and july 26 , 2024 , 1079 patient be screen for eligibility and 964 participant be randomly assign , with 482 ( 50 % ) in the placebo group and 482 ( 50 % ) in the simvastatin group . of all 964 participant , 704 ( 73 % ) be female and 260 ( 27 % ) be male , with a mean age of 54 year ( sd 7 ) . 173 ( 36 % ) of 482 participant in the placebo group and 192 ( 40 % ) of 482 participant in the simvastatin group have 6-month confirm disability progression ( adjust hazard ratio 1·13 [ 95 % ci 0·91 to 1·39 ] , p=0·26 ) . although no emergent safety issue be see , there be one serious adverse reaction ( rhabdomyolysis ) in the simvastatin group . 12 ( 2 % ) of 482 participant in the placebo group and five ( 1 % ) of 482 participant in the simvastatin group have a cardiovascular serious adverse event . the ms-stat2 trial do not show a treatment effect of simvastatin in slow disability progression in spms . simvastatin use in multiple sclerosis should be confine to exist vascular indication . national institute for health and care research health technology assessment programme , uk multiple sclerosis society , and the u national multiple sclerosis society .

Title: induction of experimental cell division to generate cell with reduced chromosome ploidy .
Authors: Marti Gutierrez N, Mikhalchenko A, Shishimorova M, Frana D, Van Dyken C, Li Y, Ma H, Koski A, Liang D, Lee SG, Eyberg D, Safaei Z, Kang E, Lee Y, O'Leary T, Lee D, Krieg S, Wu D, Rubin E, Amato P, Mitalipov S
Abstract: somatic cell nuclear transfer ( scnt ) enable the direct reprogramming of somatic cell into functional oocyte , albeit with a diploid genome . to address ploidy reduction , we investigate an experimental reductive cell division process , term mitomeiosis , wherein non-replicated ( 2n2c ) somatic genome be prematurely force to divide follow transplantation into the metaphase cytoplasm of enucleated human oocyte . however , despite fertilization with sperm , scnt oocyte remain arrest at the metaphase stage , indicate activation failure . artificial activation use a selective cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor successfully bypass this arrest , induce the segregation of somatic chromosome into a zygotic pronucleus and a polar body . comprehensive chromosome trace via sequence reveal that homologous chromosome segregation occur randomly and without crossover recombination . nonetheless , an average of 23 somatic chromosome be retain within the zygote , demonstrate the feasibility of experimentally halve the diploid chromosome set . fertilized human scnt oocyte progress through normal embryonic cell division , ultimately develop into embryo with integrated somatic and sperm-derived chromosome . while our study demonstrate the potential of mitomeiosis for in vitro gametogenesis , at this stage it remain just a proof of concept and further research be require to ensure efficacy and safety before future clinical application .

Title: long-term overall survival with dual ctla-4 and pd-l1 or pd-1 blockade and biomarker-based subgroup analysis in patient with advanced non-small-cell lung cancer : a systematic review and reconstruct individual patient data meta-analysis .
Authors: Di Federico A, Stumpo S, Mantuano F, De Giglio A, Lo Bianco F, Pecci F, Alessi JV, Wang X, Sperandi F, Melotti B, Gelsomino F, Skoulidis F, Garassino MC, Peters S, Awad MM, Ardizzoni A, Ricciuti B
Abstract: immune checkpoint inhibitor target pd-l1 or pd-1 a monotherapy or combine with ctla-4 inhibitor or chemotherapy ( or both ) be the standard of care for patient with advanced non-small-cell lung cancer ( nsclc ) . however , it remain unclear which patient benefit from the addition of ctla-4 inhibitor . we aim to evaluate whether dual checkpoint blockade with ctla-4 and pd-l1 or pd-1 inhibitor provide similar efficacy to pd-l1 or pd-1 inhibitor monotherapy , or whether these strategy produce distinct outcome across nsclc subpopulation . we conduct a search of pubmed , medline , and embase for randomised phase 3 trial publish from database inception to nov 21 , 2024 , that investigate pd-l1 or pd-1 inhibitor , with or without ctla-4 inhibitor , in patient with advanced nsclc . we focus on study report kaplan-meier survival data at 5 year or biomarker analysis base on pd-l1 , kras , and stk11 mutational status . individual patient data be extract from kaplan-meier curve with webplotdigitizer version 5 and reconstruct with the ipdfromkm method . the primary endpoint of the study be 5-year overall survival in the overall population and in subpopulation base on pd-l1 tumour proportion score ( tps ) , tumour histology , and mutational status ( mutant v wild-type ) of kras and stk11 . this study be register with prospero , crd420251081707 . the initial search yield 1026 result , and six randomise clinical trial meet the eligibility criterion and be include . among the 2881 patient eligible for analysis ( 838 [ 29·1 % ] female and 2043 [ 70·9 % ] male ) , 1282 receive dual ctla-4 and pd-l1 or pd-1 blockade and 1599 receive single pd-l1 or pd-1 blockade . patient treat with dual ctla-4 and pd-l1 or pd-1 blockade have similar median overall survival compare with those treat with single pd-l1 or pd-1 inhibition ( 16·1 month [ 95 % ci 15·0-17·8 ] v 16·9 month [ 15·5-18·3 ] ; hr 0·95 [ 95 % ci 0·87-1·03 ] , p=0·19 ) . median overall survival be significantly longer with dual ctla-4 and pd-l1 or pd-1 blockade among patient with pd-l1 tps less than 1 % versus those treat with single pd-l1 or pd-1 inhibition ( 15·5 month [ 95 % ci 13·6-18·5 ] v 14·5 month [ 13·4-15·9 ] ; hr 0·85 [ 95 % ci 0·74-0·98 ] , p=0·021 ) , with 5-year overall survival rate of 16·6 % ( 95 % ci 13·4-20·6 ) versus 9·3 % ( 7·0-12·3 ) , respectively . median overall survival in patient with tumour harbour stk11 mutation be also significantly longer with dual ctla-4 and pd-l1 or pd-1 blockade compare with single pd-l1 or pd-1 inhibition ( 13·9 month [ 95 % ci 9·8-20·8 ] v 7·8 month [ 6·4-12·9 ] ; hr 0·67 [ 95 % ci 0·49-0·91 ] , p=0·012 ) . however , no significant difference in overall survival be find between treatment group by tumour histology ( squamous v non-squamous nsclc ) or by kras mutational status . compare with single pd-l1 or pd-1 inhibition , dual immune checkpoint blockade with ctla-4 and pd-l1 or pd-1 inhibitor be associate with improved overall survival in patient with advanced nsclc and pd-l1 tps less than 1 % and in those with stk11 mutation , but not in the overall population . prospective validation of these result in clinical trial be warrant . nextgenerationue .

Title: neoadjuvant treatment of ibi310 plus sintilimab in locally advanced msi-h/dmmr colon cancer : a randomized phase 1b study .
Authors: Wang F, Chen G, Qiu M, Ma J, Mo X, Liu H, Li Y, Ding P, Wan X, Hu Y, Huang X, Jiang W, Wu X, Luo J, Zhou Y, Li L, Sun Y, Wang Q, Wang N, Jiang W, Yuan W, Li L, Liu L, Yuan X, Wang G, Song Z, Liu H, Ge J, Wang Y, Zhao P, Li T, You J, Tang J, Du X, Lin J, Zhang R, Fu Z, Xu J, Zhong H, Kang L, Deng Y, Lu X, Guo Q, Zhou H, Xu RH
Abstract: although neoadjuvant immunotherapy show promising efficacy in locally advanced microsatellite instability-high or mismatch repair-deficient ( msi-h/dmmr ) colon cancer , whether dual immune checkpoint inhibition provide additional benefit over anti-pd-1 monotherapy remain unclear . this randomized phase 1b trial ( nct05890742 ) evaluate a neoadjuvant regimen of ibi310 ( anti-cytotoxic t lymphocyte-associated antigen 4 [ ctla-4 ] ) plus sintilimab ( n = 52 ) versus sintilimab monotherapy ( n = 49 ) . surgery be perform in 51 and 45 patient , respectively . the primary endpoint , pathological complete response ( pcr ) rate , be significantly high in the combination compare to the monotherapy arm within the modify intent-to-treat ( mitt ) population ( 78.4 % versus 46.7 % , p = 0.0015 ) , with consistent result in the intent-to-treat ( itt ) population ( 76.9 % versus 42.9 % ) . safety in both arm be comparable and manageable without new safety signal . after a median follow-up of 21.4 month , no disease recurrences occur . one death occur in each arm due to postoperative complication and adverse event . these finding demonstrate the added benefit of neoadjuvant ibi310 plus sintilimab over sintilimab monotherapy for locally advanced msi-h/dmmr colon cancer .

Title: dupilumab versus omalizumab in patient with chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyp and coexist asthma ( everest ) : a multicentre , randomise , double-blind , head-to-head phase 4 trial .
Authors: De Corso E, Canonica GW, Heffler E, Springer M, Grzegorzek T, Viana M, Horváth Z, Mullol J, Gevaert P, Michel J, Peters AT, Wagenmann M, Zaghloul S, Zhang M, Corbett M, Nash S, Angello JT, Radwan A, Deniz Y, Martin A, Hellings PW
Abstract: chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyp ( crswnp ) be predominantly drive by type 2 inflammation . the biologics dupilumab and omalizumab , which target driver and mediator of type 2 inflammation ( interleukin [ il ] -4/il-13 signal and immunoglobulin e [ ige ] , respectively ) , be efficacious in treat crswnp but direct comparison be few . in everest ( evaluate treatment response of dupilumab versus omalizumab ) , the first head-to-head trial in respiratory biologics , we aim to compare the efficacy and safety of dupilumab and omalizumab in patient with severe crswnp who have mild , moderate , or severe asthma . everest be an international , randomise , double-blind , phase 4 trial , conduct at 100 hospital or clinical centre in 17 country . site be select with otolaryngology , pneumologist , allergist , and immunologist practice ; need to have previously conduct double-blind study ; and be require have nasal endoscopy and electrocardiogram machine . eligible patient age 18 year or old with severe uncontrolled crswnp ( with a nasal polyp score of 5 or more [ and ≥2 for each nostril ] ) , symptom of nasal congestion and loss of smell for at least 8 week before screening , and physician-diagnosed asthma . patient be randomly assign ( 1:1 ) to subcutaneous dupilumab 300 mg every 2 week or omalizumab weight-tiered and ige-tiered dosing every 2 week or 4 week for 24 week , with background mometasone furoate nasal spray . patient and investigator be mask to the study drug . primary endpoint be change from baseline in endoscopic nasal polyp score and university of pennsylvania smell identification test ( upsit ) at 24 week . efficacy be assess in the intention-to-treat population and safety be assess in patient who receive at least one dose of study medication . the trial be register at clinicaltrials.gov , nct04998604 . between sept 27 , 2021 , and dec 27 , 2024 , 819 individual be screen for study inclusion , 459 be exclude ( most common screen failure be : 167 do not meet nasal polyp score ≥5 or do not have ongoing symptom of nasal congestion and loss of smell , 114 do not meet pre-bronchodilator fev ( 1 ) ≤85 % predict normal , and 99 do not meet eligibility a per omalizumab drug-dosing ) , and 360 participant be randomly assign ( 181 assign to the dupilumab group and 179 assign to the omalizumab group ) . of the 360 participant , 198 ( 55 % ) participant be male , 162 ( 45 % ) be female , and the mean age of the total population sample be 52 year ( sd 13·1 ) . improvement be significantly great with dupilumab than omalizumab for all primary and secondary efficacy endpoint at week 24. least square mean difference in change from baseline dupilumab over omalizumab be : nasal polyp score -1·60 ( 95 % ci -1·96 to -1·25 ; p < 0·0001 ) and upsit 8·0 ( 6·3 to 9·7 ; p < 0·0001 ) . 115 ( 64 % ) of 179 participant in the dupilumab group and 116 ( 67 % ) of 173 participant in the omalizumab group report treatment-emergent adverse event , the most common of which be nasopharyngitis , accidental overdose , headache , upper respiratory tract infection , and cough . there be no death in the study . dupilumab be superior to omalizumab in patient with severe crswnp and coexist asthma . these finding support the efficacy of dupilumab in patient with type 2 respiratory disease versus an active biologic comparator , the know safety profile of dupilumab and omalizumab , and could enable good treatment target for patient with crswnp and asthma in clinical practice . sanofi and regeneron pharmaceutical .

Title: impact of glp-1 receptor agonist on stroke , subarachnoid hemorrhage , and intracerebral hemorrhage : a propensity-matched multi-institutional cohort study .
Authors: Costa M, O'Leary S, Price AM, Young CC, Srinivasan VM, Kan P
Abstract: the author evaluate whether glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor agonist ( glp-1-ras ) improve outcome in patient with aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage ( asah ) , spontaneous intracerebral hemorrhage ( sich ) , and acute ischemic stroke ( ai ) and reduce the overall incidence of these event . this retrospective study leverage trinetx data ( 2014-2024 ) to identify patient with asah , sich , or ai . individual receive exenatide , lixisenatide , semaglutide , dulaglutide , liraglutide , or tirzepatide within 8 week of diagnosis be propensity match to control . outcome ( e.g. , mortality , rebleeding/recurrence , seizure , hydrocephalus ) be assess at 6 and 12 month ; the incidence rate of stroke type be examine at 1 and 2 year . for asah patient , glp-1-ra use at 6 month reduce rebleeding ( or 0.73 , p = 0.003 ) and mortality ( or 0.41 , p < 0.001 ) and at 1 year lower cognitive deficit ( or 0.63 , p = 0.034 ) and mortality ( or 0.39 , p < 0.001 ) . in sich patient , glp-1-ras decrease hydrocephalus ( or 0.37 , p = 0.005 ) and seizures ( or 0.56 , p = 0.007 ) at 6 month , with persistent benefit at 1 year ( hydrocephalus , or 0.38 , p = 0.007 ; seizure , or 0.63 , p = 0.018 ) , alongside low mortality ( or 0.45-0.40 , both p < 0.001 ) and rebleeding ( or 0.70-0.69 , both p < 0.001 ) rate . in ais patient , mortality fell at 6 month ( or 0.27 , p < 0.001 ) and 1 year ( or 0.44 , p < 0.001 ) , with reduce recurrence ( or 0.60 , p < 0.001 ) and low hydrocephalus ( or 0.32 , p < 0.001 ) and seizure ( or 0.43 , p < 0.001 ) rate at 6 month . at 1 year , glp-1-ra user have low incidence rate of sah ( or 0.64 , p = 0.001 ) , ich ( or 0.62 , p < 0.001 ) , and ai ( or 0.82 , p = 0.003 ) , which be sustain at 2 year ( or 0.77-0.87 , all p < 0.05 ) . adverse event be similar . glp-1-ras be associate with improved survival and few complication across stroke subtypes , plus reduced hemorrhagic and ischemic stroke incidence . prospective trial be warrant to confirm these observation .

Title: basic mechanism of itch and advance in clinical management .
Authors: Coscarella G, Edwards E, Yosipovitch G
Abstract: chronic pruritus require comprehensive assessment and management due to it profound impact on quality of life . the etiology of pruritus be diverse , encompass dermatologic , neuropathic , systemic , psychogenic , and mixed cause . pruritogens activate c and aδ fiber through histaminergic and non-histaminergic pathway . increase evidence highlight the role of th2 cytokine , particularly interleukin ( il ) -4 , il-13 , and il-31 , which directly stimulate sensory neuron and perpetuate the itch-scratch cycle . itch perception arises from dynamic interaction between the immune system and the peripheral and central nervous system . signal transmit by sensory fiber be process in the dorsal horn and relay to thalamic and cortical center , reinforce chronicity . diagnostic evaluation begin with detailed history and examination , complement by laboratory test such a complete blood count , kidney , liver , glucose , and thyroid function test to uncover systemic or neurologic contributor . for dermatologic condition , topical immunomodulators-including corticosteroid , calcineurin inhibitor , and pde4 inhibitors- be first-line option for localized itch . extensive itch may require systemic immunosuppressant or phototherapy . biologic agent target il-4/il-13 and il-31 pathway have revolutionize treatment for atopic dermatitis and prurigo nodularis , while jak-stat inhibitor also offer significant antipruritic effect in atopic dermatitis and beyond . neuropathic itch may respond to topical anesthetic : menthol , pramoxine , capsaicin , or compound ketamine-amitriptyline-lidocaine formulation , as well a systemic gabapentinoids and antidepressant . systemic or intractable pruritus may benefit from kappa opioid receptor agonist . new drug target the mast cell such a btk inhibitor , c-kit inhibitor , and mrgprx2 antagonist have robust anti-pruritic effect in mast cell-mediated disease . supportive measure , include psychosocial intervention , remain integral to long-term management .
Journal: Annals of allergy, asthma & immunology : official publication of the American

Title: microglial glycolytic reprogramming in alzheimer 's disease : association with impaired phagocytic function and alter vascular proximity .
Authors: Lu N, Jin Z, Liu N, Zhu C, Wei H, Xu Q
Abstract: alzheimer 's disease ( ad ) be characterize by chronic neuroinflammation alongside amyloid-beta plaque and phosphorylated tau ( p-tau ) tangle accumulation . microglia , a resident immune cell , undergo glycolytic reprogramming that may exacerbate inflammation and impede toxic protein clearance . specifically , the glycolytic enzyme pyruvate kinase m2 ( pkm2 ) drive proinflammatory microglial phenotype link to neurodegeneration . this study investigate how pkm2-mediated microglial glycolytic reprogramming and inflammatory response alongside aβ/p-tau clearance in human ad brain . hippocampal-entorhinal cortex ( hp-ec ) tissue from 8 ad patient and 8 match control underwent multiplex immunohistochemistry and high-resolution spatial analysis . pkm2 ( + ) iba1 ( + ) microglia density significantly increase in ad versus control ( p < 0.001 ) , predominantly display a disease-associated microglial ( ham-like ) phenotype ( abca7 ( + ) ) with concurrent lipid-droplet accumulation ( plin3 ( + ) ; ldam phenotype ) . spatially , glycolytic pkm2 ( + ) iba1 ( + ) microglia accumulate near aβ plaque , p-tau tangle , and cerebral vasculature . notably , their distribution around plaques/tau show anomalous increase density with distance ( p < 0.001 ) , suggest impaired chemotaxis . perivascular localization lack clear chemotactic gradient . functionally , overall phagocytic activity ( cd68 ( + ) ) decrease significantly in ad ( p = 0.001 ) , primarily attribute to pkm2- subset , whereas pkm2 ( + ) iba1 ( + ) microglia exhibit pronounced phagocytic exhaustion ( plin2 ( + ) ; p < 0.001 ) , consistent around both aβ and p-tau lesion ( all p < 0.001 ) . our study establish that microglial glycolytic reprogramming via pkm2 promote a proinflammatory ham-like phenotype , phagocytic exhaustion , and peri-pathological accumulation with aggregate and cerebral vessel . target glycolytic pathway represent a viable therapeutic strategy for alleviate microglial dysfunction and neuroinflammation in ad .

Title: hsa_circ_0038737 promote parpi resistance in castration-resistant prostate cancer via igf2bp3-mediated dnph1 mrna stabilization .
Authors: Wang Z, Ge Q, Anwaier A, Liu S, Tian X, Zhang Z, Feng T, Hong Z, Ye D, Xu W, Qin X
Abstract: resistance to poly ( adp-ribose ) polymerase inhibitor ( parpi ) pose a major challenge to therapeutic efficacy in castration-resistant prostate cancer ( crpc ) . although circular rna ( circrnas ) have emerge a critical regulator in cancer biology , their involvement in parpi resistance remain largely uncharacterized . this study aim to elucidate the molecular mechanism by which hsa_circ_0038737 modulate parpi resistance in crpc through post-transcriptional regulatory pathway . we employ a comprehensive set of in vitro and in vivo approach , include qrt-pcr , rna sequencing , rna-protein pull-down , rna immunoprecipitation , functional assay , and xenograft/organoid model , to investigate the biological function and mechanistic role of hsa_circ_0038737 in crpc progression and therapeutic response . we identify hsa_circ_0038737 a a nuclear-enriched circrna significantly upregulated in crpc , with expression level correlate with poor prognosis and aggressive clinical feature . mechanistically , hsa_circ_0038737 interacts with rna-binding protein ( rbp ) igf2bp3 , enhance the stability of dnph1 mrna , a nucleotide sanitizer critical for dna repair . the circrna-rbp-mrna regulatory axis promotes parpi resistance by facilitate dna damage repair capacity . moreover , we reveal that reverse-complementary alu element mediate circrna biogenesis , with hnrnpdl facilitate this process . pharmacologic inhibition of dnph1 effectively restore parpi sensitivity both in vitro and in vivo . our finding reveal a novel hsa_circ_0038737/igf2bp3/dnph1 axis drive parpi resistance in crpc , offer promise potential biomarkers and therapeutic target to overcome resistance and improve treatment outcome in advanced prostate cancer .

Title: longitudinal association of a polygenic risk score for plasma t-tau with incident alzheimer dementia and mild cognitive impairment .
Authors: Mourtzi N, Charisis S, Ntanasi E, Hatzimanolis A, Ramirez A, Sampatakakis SN, Yannakoulia M, Kosmidis MH, Dardiotis E, Hadjigeorgiou G, Sakka P, Mamalaki E, Papandreou C, Georgakis MK, Scarmeas N
Abstract: elevated level of total tau ( t-tau ) be a key biomarker of neurodegeneration , often see in alzheimer disease ( ad ) . identify individual at increase risk of ad use minimally invasive biomarkers can enable early intervention . we develop a polygenic risk score ( pr ) for plasma t-tau and examine it association with the risk for develop clinical endophenotypes of ad pathology . this longitudinal cohort study use data from the hellenic longitudinal investigation of age and diet ( heliad ) study , involve individual age 65 year or old , free of ad , or amnestic mild cognitive impairment ( amci-an ad prodrome ) at baseline . our primary exposure be prstau , a pr base on common genetic variant link to plasma tau level . the primary outcome be amci or ad incidence . we assess the association between prstau level and amci/ad risk use cox regression model adjust for age , sex , education , apoe ε4 allele carriership , and population structure . we seek replication in a sample of uk biobank ( ukb ) participant age 60 year or old without prevalent dementia . in the heliad sample , among 618 cognitively healthy participant ( mean age 73.37 year , 58.4 % female ) , follow for 2.92 ± 0.80 year , 73 develop ad/amci . a 1 sd increase in prstau be link to a 29 % high ad/amci risk ( hazard ratio [ hr ] 1.290 , 95 % ci 1.006-1.654 ) . stratify analysis reveal great effect estimate in woman ( hr 1.451 , 95 % ci 1.023-2.058 ) and young participant ( hr 1.866 , 95 % ci 1.175-2.962 ) , whereas result in men and old participant do not reach statistical significance . in the ukb sample ( n = 142,637 , mean age 64.2 year , 52 % female ) , 2,737 participant develop ad over 12.9 ± 2.4 year of follow-up . high prstau be also link to increase ad risk ( hr 1.046 , 95 % ci 1.007-1.086 ) . these result support the potential utility of pr for plasma t-tau in predict ad/amci incidence . the relationship between genetic predisposition for elevated plasma t-tau level and ad pathology might be influence by sex and age , suggest that these factor should be consider in ad genetic risk modeling . pr could serve a an early indicator of genetic propensity for tau pathology , enhance exist ad diagnostic and risk stratification algorithm .

Title: anti-inflammatory therapy for atherosclerotic stroke prevention .
Authors: Georgakis MK, Melton P, Živković L, Kopczak A, Katsanos AH
Abstract: ischemic stroke cause by atherosclerosis be associate with the high risk of recurrence among stroke etiology , highlight a residual risk that current secondary prevention strategy fail to address . multiple line of research implicate inflammation in the pathogenesis of atherosclerosis , include recent large cardiovascular outcome trial demonstrate that anti-inflammatory therapy can lower residual vascular risk in patient with coronary artery disease . notably , low-dose colchicine , a long-used anti-inflammatory drug , have receive approval for cardiovascular risk reduction in patient with atherosclerosis . however , translation of anti-inflammatory treatment to patient with ischemic stroke have be challenge , with the first colchicine trial show neutral or conflict result . in this study , we review the preclinical , genetic , and epidemiologic literature link inflammation to atherosclerotic stroke ; examine key finding of cardiovascular outcome trial for stroke prevention ; and summarize complete and ongoing stroke-specific trial . we discuss the etiologic heterogeneity of ischemic stroke that may obscure anti-inflammatory treatment effect , highlight the need for precision medicine approach target patient with establish atherosclerosis and vascular inflammation . finally , we provide an overview of the emerge anti-inflammatory therapeutic that be under development for atheroprotection and outline a translational roadmap to accelerate clinical impact in stroke prevention .

Title: unravel the multifactorial pathophysiology of polycystic ovary syndrome : exploring lifestyle , prenatal influence , neuroendocrine dysfunction , and post-translational modification .
Authors: Senthilkumar H, Chauhan SC, Arumugam M
Abstract: polycystic ovary syndrome ( pcos ) be a complex , multifactorial metabolic and endocrine disorder in reproductive-age woman . this review discuss the interlinked role of lifestyle , metabolic dysregulation , insulin resistance , neuroendocrine impairment , genetic predisposition , and post-translational modification ( ptms ) in pcos pathogenesis . lifestyle component , especially those lead to obesity and insulin resistance , worsen the hyperandrogenism , ovulatory dysfunction , and inflammation . dietary treatment such a , dash diet and caloric restriction , particularly along with metformin , have be prove to improve metabolic and reproductive parameter . environmental toxin , such a endocrine-disrupting chemical ( edcs ) and advanced glycation end-products ( age ) , further compromise ovarian function and hormone regulation . oxidative stress and insulin resistance , drive by mitochondrial malfunction and chronic inflammation , create a self-perpetuating vicious cycle that compromise oocyte quality and worsen metabolic imbalance . neuroendocrine disruption , characterize by increased gnrh and lh pulsatility , be initiate by dysregulated kisspeptin , dynorphin , and neurokinin b signal in kndy neuron , modify gabaergic input , and increase amh and androgen . ptms such a phosphorylation , methylation , acetylation , and ubiquitination also play essential role in granulosa cell function , ar signaling , insulin sensitivity , and oocyte maturation . current and novel treatment option vary from lifestyle modification and pharmacological intervention ( e.g. , metformin , glp-1 receptor agonist , myoinositol , vitamin d , and statin ) to regenerative measure like mesenchymal stem cell and fecal microbiota transplantation . new therapy focus on ptms and neuroendocrine regulator remain the future hope . multidisciplinary individualized management be critical for successful pcos therapy and avert long-term complication .

Title: efficacy and safety of variable-dose metformin a adjunctive therapy to insulin in adolescent with type 1 diabetes mellitus : a systematic review and network meta-analysis .
Authors: Li C, Qiao L, Li T
Abstract: adolescent type 1 diabetes ( t1d ) be complicate by insulin resistance , dyslipidemia , and heighten cardiovascular risk . a adjunctive metformin therapy lack optimize dosing , we conduct a network meta-analysis ( nma ) to rigorously assess the dose-dependent efficacy and safety of metformin combine with insulin in this population . totally 764 adolescent ( age 10-19 year ) meet inclusion criterion be involve . we assess five metformin regimen : 1.0 g/day , 1.7 g/day , 2.0 g/day , weight-based ( ≤ 60 kg:1.0 g/day ; ≥60 kg:2.0 g/day ) , and multi-tiered weight-based ( < 50 kg:1.0 g ; 50-75 kg:1.5 g ; ≥75 kg:2.0 g ) . outcome include hba1c , bmi/bmi-z , insulin dose , lipid profile , and adverse event . a bayesian nma be perform use r 4.4.1 , with effect size report a mean difference ( md ) or relative risk ( rr ) with 95 % confidence interval ( ci ) . surface under the cumulative ranking curve ( sucra ) value ranked intervention . consequently , metformin 2.0 g/day significantly reduce bmi ( md=-0.6 kg/m² , 95 % -0.68 , -0.52 ) and ldl-c ( md=-12.78 mg/dl , 95 % -21.17 , -0.49 ) versus placebo . dos of 1.0 g/day , 2.0 g/day , and the 60 kg weight-based regimen significantly reduce daily insulin requirement . metformin 2.0 g/day and the 50 kg weight-based regimen reduce total cholesterol . no regimen significantly lower hba1c or triglyceride versus placebo . all dos demonstrate safety profile comparable to placebo regard gastrointestinal event , hypoglycemia , diabetic ketoacidosis ( dka ) , and transaminase elevation ( rrs not significant ) . to sum up , adjunctive metformin at 2.0 g/day offer significant benefit in weight management , insulin dose reduction , and lipid improvement ( ldl-c , total cholesterol ) for adolescent with t1d , with a favorable safety profile across all dos , which will represent a viable therapeutic option .

Title: gcn1 couple gcn2 to ribosomal state to initiate amino acid response pathway signaling .
Authors: Zhou C, Zhang M, Murray J, Paulo J, Gygi S, Shao S, Whitman M, Keller T
Abstract: during nutrient deprivation , activation of the protein kinase gcn2 regulate cell survival and metabolic homeostasis . in addition to amino acid stress , gcn2 be activate by a variety of cellular stress . gcn2 activation have be link to it association with uncharged trna , specific ribosomal protein , and condition of translational arrest , but their relative contribution to activation be unclear . here , we use in vitro translation to reconstitute gcn2 activation by amino acid stress and compare collide ribosome population induce by diverse translational stressor . initiation of gcn2 signaling require the di-ribosome sensor gcn1 , which recruit gcn2 to ribosomes in a collision-dependent manner , where gcn2 become activate by key ribosomal interaction and stably associate with collided ribosome . our finding define the molecular requirement and dynamic of gcn2 activation .

Title: treg-microglia partnership in the injured spinal cord preserve treg cell function and regulate microglial cholesterol metabolism .
Authors: Qin T, Jiang T, Zhou Z, Wu M, Zhang Y, Yang Z, Zheng Z, Yi J, Wang X, Luo M, Gao P, Liu J, Huang Y, Liu H, Li Q, Zhou W, Zhang S, Guo X, He B, Wang Y, Fan J, Zhao S, Chen J, Yin G
Abstract: the spatiotemporal dynamic and specific role of regulatory t ( treg ) cell in spinal cord injury ( sci ) remain unclear . use single-cell rna sequencing , flow cytometry , and immunofluorescence , we find that thymus-derived treg cell infiltrate the injured spinal cord via peripheral blood around 3 day post-sci . treg cell depletion worsen sci and impaired long-term recovery . transcriptomic profiling reveal strong anti-inflammatory function of treg cell and the potential to regulate cholesterol metabolism in neighbor microglia . further single-cell rna sequencing uncover the clonality of sci-associated treg cell . major histocompatibility complex class ii ( mhc ii ) expression on microglia , not macrophage , be crucial for sustain treg cell number and neuroprotective function , with myelin-phagocytosing microglia-activated treg cell show significant neuroprotective effect . treg cell mitigate microglial inflammation via ctla-4 and upregulated the atp-binding cassette transporter g1 ( abcg1 ) receptor in microglia , help to manage myelin load and reduce lipid droplet formation . our finding offer mechanistic insight into sci-associated treg cell and lay the groundwork for future treg-based therapy in sci treatment .

Title: solid tumour car-t cell engineer with fusion protein target pd-l1 for localized il-12 delivery .
Authors: Murad JP, Christian L, Rosa R, Ren Y, Buckley AJ, Lee EHJ, Lopez LS, Park AK, Yang J, Yamaguchi Y, Trac C, Adkins LN, Chang WC, Martinez C, June CH, Forman SJ, Ishihara J, Lee JK, Stern LA, Priceman SJ
Abstract: chimeric antigen receptor ( car ) -t cell efficacy in solid tumour be limited due in part to the immunosuppressive tumour microenvironment ( tme ) . to improve antitumour response , we hypothesize that enable car-t cell to secrete bifunctional fusion proteins consist of a cytokine modifier such a tgfβ ( trap ) , il-15 or il-12 , combine with an immune checkpoint inhibitor such a αpd-l1 , would provide tumour-localized immunomodulation to improve car-t cell functionality . here we engineer car-t cell to secrete tgfβ ( trap ) , il-15 or il-12 molecule fuse to αpd-l1 scfv and assess in vitro functionality and in vivo safety and efficacy in prostate and ovarian cancer model . car-t cell engineer with αpd-l1-il-12 be superior in safety and efficacy compare with car-t cell alone and those engineer with αpd-l1 fuse with tgfβ ( trap ) or il-15 . further , αpd-l1-il-12 engineer car-t cell improve t cell trafficking and tumour infiltration , and localize ifnγ production , tme modulation and antitumour response , with reduced systemic inflammation-associated toxicity . we believe our αpd-l1-il-12 engineering strategy present an opportunity to improve car-t cell clinical efficacy and safety across multiple solid tumour type .

Title: fibrinolytic therapy for thromboembolic disease : approve indication and future direction .
Authors: Rashedi S, Leyva H, Hamade N, Pfeferman MB, Ortega-Paz L, Sadeghipour P, Talasaz AH, O'Donoghue ML, Jimenez D, Monrea M, Anderson CD, Elkind MSV, Lang IM, Weitz JI, Goldhaber SZ, De Caterina R, Konstantinides SV, Piazza G, Krumholz HM, Braunwald E, Bikdeli B
Abstract: fibrinolytic therapy play a pivotal role in the management of thromboembolic disease by promote plasmin-mediated fibrin degradation and vessel recanalization , which frequently come at the cost of increase risk of hemorrhagic event , include intracranial bleeding . since the discovery of streptokinase in 1933 , several additional fibrinolytic agent have be develop . two plasminogen activators-urokinase and tissue plasminogen activator ( tpa ) -were identify in human sample . through recombinant dna technology , tpa be clone and modify to produce alteplase . subsequent effort to prolong it plasma half-life lead to the development of mutant derivative such a tenecteplase and reteplase . although fibrinolytic therapy in patient with st-segment elevation myocardial infarction be currently restrict to those who can not undergo primary percutaneous coronary intervention within 120 minute of presentation , it have be a mainstay treatment for acute ischemic stroke and pulmonary embolism ( pe ) with hemodynamic compromise . catheter-directed fibrinolysis have be evaluate in patient with intermediate-risk pe , deep vein thrombosis , acute limb ischemia , and after endovascular thrombectomy for ischemic stroke . fibrinolytic agent have also be use in other clinically important indication , such a central venous access device thrombosis , mechanical prosthetic valve thrombosis , leave ventricular assist device thrombosis , central retinal artery occlusion , cerebral venous sinus thrombosis , and leave ventricular thrombus . this paper provide a comprehensive overview of the current application , approve indication , evolve role , and future direction of fibrinolytic agent in thromboembolic disease .
Journal: Journal of the American College of Cardiology

Title: sclerostin : how human mutation have help reveal a new target for the treatment of osteoporosis .
