Abstract: in the 1990s there be a tremendous mood of optimism among pharmaceutical scientist that identification of disease-associated variation in the human genome would result in a surge of new drug target ( the 'gene-to-drug ' mantra ) . to date the expected deluge of new drug have not arrive . however , a small number of drug arise directly from the study of rare human disorder show mendelian inheritance be now enter late stage clinical trial . here we describe the advantage of this approach and discuss the background and early clinical trial finding with antibody direct at a target identify in this way .

Title: platelet activation play a pro-inflammatory role in myasthenia gravis .
Authors: Wen Q, Zhang S, Wang Y, Liu H, Wang J, Su S, Xie N, Lu Y, Di L, Xu M, Wang M, Chen H, Wang S, Zhu W, Wen X, Han J, Wan D, Zhao S, Lu W, Tao Z, Duo J, Huang Y, Chai G, Duan R, Li X, Hao J, Da Y
Abstract: myasthenia gravis ( mg ) be an autoimmune disorder that disrupt neuromuscular junction function through autoantibody . platelet be emerge a key player in the pathogenesis of mg , bridge innate and adaptive immunity . we analyze platelet transcriptome signature and their interaction with the immune system in achr+ immunotherapy-naïve mg ( nmg ) patient use bulk and single-cell rna sequence on peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) . nmg patient exhibit upregulation of gene relate to activation , inflammation , and cytoskeletal regulation . increase platelet count , activation , alter morphology , enhance cd62p expression , and elevate plasma cd40l level be observe in pbmcs , which diminish with minimal clinical status ( mm ) . functionally , platelet show heighten interaction with leukocyte , form aggregate that correlate with disease severity . these feature return to baseline after intravenous immunoglobulin or prolonged immunosuppressive therapy . this study underscore platelet activation 's critical role in mg and support platelet-targeted therapy .

Title: a human-specific regulatory mechanism reveal in a pre-implantation model .
Authors: Fueyo R, Wang S, Crocker OJ, Swigut T, Nakauchi H, Wysocka J
Abstract: stem cell-based human embryo model offer a unique opportunity for functional study of the human-specific feature of development . here we genetically and epigenetically manipulate human blastoids , a 3d embryo model of the blastocyst ( 1 ) , to investigate the functional effect of hervk ltr5hs , a hominoid-specific endogenous retrovirus , on pre-implantation development . we uncover a pervasive cis-regulatory contribution of ltr5hs element to the hominoid-specific diversification of the epiblast transcriptome in blastoids . many of the ltr5hs genomic insertion in the human genome be unique to our own specie . we show that at least one such human-specific ltr5hs element be essential for the blastoid-forming potential via enhance expression of the primate-specific znf729 gene , encode a krab zinc-finger protein . znf729 bind to gc-rich sequence , abundant at gene promoter associate with basic cellular function , such a cell proliferation and metabolism . despite mediate recruitment of trim28 , at many of these promoter znf729 act a a transcriptional activator . together , our result illustrate how recently emerge transposable element and gene can confer developmentally essential function in human .

Title: program cell death in triple-negative breast cancer .
Authors: Liu Y, He J, Chen J, Chen T, Li W, Yang Z, Zeng F
Abstract: triple-negative breast cancer ( tnbc ) be a particularly aggressive and therapeutically challenge subtype of breast cancer , define by the lack of estrogen receptor , progesterone receptor , and human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 expression . this absence of actionable molecular target contribute to it resistance to conventional treatment . this review provide an overview of the mechanistic function , interrelated process , and therapeutic implication of several program cell death ( pcd ) pathways-including apoptosis , pyroptosis , necroptosis , autophagy , and ferroptosis-in the context of tnbc pathogenesis and treatment . a conceptual framework be propose for leverage these interconnect cell death pathway a a basis for novel target intervention . give the complex interplay among various pcd form characterize by share feature such a inflammation , mitochondrial dysfunction , and overlap molecular mediator , this integrate network offer promise opportunity for combinatorial therapeutic strategy . modulation of one cell death pathway may influence others , potentially amplify therapeutic efficacy . furthermore , these pcd pathway be highly relevant to immunotherapy outcome , offer a foundation for synergistic treatment modality . this review provide an in-depth analysis of the crosstalk between immune-based therapy and pcd , along with a comprehensive discussion of derive therapeutic approach . however , tumor diversity , resistance mechanism , and discrepancy between preclinical model and human physiology pose major challenge in apply these finding clinically . the overarch goal be to present innovative insight and strategy to enhance the clinical management of tnbc and ultimately improve patient outcome .

Title: sequencing-free whole-genome spatial transcriptomics at single-molecule resolution .
Authors: Cheng Y, Dang S, Zhang Y, Chen Y, Yu R, Liu M, Jin S, Han A, Katz S, Wang S
Abstract: recent breakthrough in spatial transcriptomics technology have enhance our understanding of diverse cellular identity , spatial organization , and function . yet exist spatial transcriptomics tool be still limit in either transcriptomic coverage or spatial resolution , hinder unbiased , hypothesis-free transcriptomic analysis at high spatial resolution . here , we develop reverse-padlock amplicon-encoding fluorescence in situ hybridization ( raefish ) , an image-based spatial transcriptomics method with whole-genome coverage and single-molecule resolution in intact tissue . we demonstrate the spatial profiling of transcript from 23,000 human or 22,000 mouse gene in single cell and tissue section . our analysis reveal transcript-specific subcellular localization , cell-type-specific and cell-type-invariant zonation-dependent transcriptomes , and gene program underlie preferential cell-cell interaction . finally , we further develop our technology for the direct spatial readout of guide rna ( grnas ) in an image-based , high-content crispr screen . overall , these development offer a broadly applicable technology that enable high-coverage , high-resolution spatial profiling of both long and short , native and engineered rna in many biomedical context .

Title: a needed nomenclature for nucleosomes .
Authors: Keogh MC, Almouzni G, Andrews AJ, Armache KJ, Arrowsmith CH, Baek SH, Bedford MT, Bernstein E, Côté J, David Y, Denu JM, Fierz B, Garcia BA, Glass KC, Gozani O, Helin K, Henikoff S, Jensen ON, Josefowicz SZ, Kelleher NL, Kutateladze TG, Lindner HH, Lu C, Luger K, Mallick P, Musselman CA, Muir TW, Paša-Tolić L, Schneider R, Shi X, Shi Y, Sidoli S, Smith LM, Tyler JK, Wolberger C, Workman JL, Strahl BD, Young NL
Abstract: histone post-translational modification ( ptms ) be crucial to eukaryotic genome regulation , with a range of report function and mechanism of action . though often study individually , it have long be recognize that the modification function by combinatorial synergy or antagonism . interplay may involve ptms on the same histone , within the same nucleosome ( contain a histone octamer ) , or between nucleosomes in higher-order chromatin . give this , the field must distinguish ever great complexity , and the context in which it be study , with brevity and precision . the proteoform be introduce to define individual form of a protein by sequence and ptms , follow by the nucleoform to describe the particular gathering of histone within an individual nucleosome . there be now a need to define specific form of these entity in prose while provide space for experimental nuance . to this end , we introduce a nomenclature that can express discrete ptms , proteoforms , nucleoforms , or situation where define ptms exist in an uncertain context . though specifically design for the chromatin field , adaption of the framework could be use to describe-and thus dissect-how proteoforms be configure in functionally distinct complex across biology .

Title: a paneukaryotic genomic analysis of the small gtpase rabl2 underscore the significance of recurrent gene loss in eukaryote evolution .
Authors: Eliáš M, Klimeš V, Derelle R, Petrželková R, Tachezy J
Abstract: the cilium ( flagellum ) be a complex cellular structure inherit from the last eukaryotic common ancestor ( leca ) . a large number of ciliary protein have be characterize in a few model organism , but their evolutionary history often remain unexplored . one such protein be the small gtpase rabl2 , recently implicate in the assembly of the sperm tail in mammal . use the wealth of currently available genome and transcriptome sequence , include data from our on-going sequencing project , we systematically analyze the phylogenetic distribution and evolutionary history of rabl2 orthologs . our dense taxonomic sampling reveal the presence of rabl2 gene in nearly all major eukaryotic lineage , include small `` obscure '' taxon such a breviates , ancyromonads , malawimonads , jakobids , picozoans , or palpitomonads . the phyletic pattern of rabl2 gene indicate that it be present already in the leca . however , some organism lack rabl2 a a result of secondary loss and our present sampling predicts well over 30 such independent event during the eukaryote evolution . the distribution of rabl2 gene correlate with the presence/absence of cilium : not a single well-established cilium-lacking specie have retain a rabl2 ortholog . however , several ciliated taxon , most notably nematode , some arthropod and platyhelminth , diplomonads , and ciliated subgroup of apicomplexans and embryophytes , lack rabl2 as well , suggest some simplification in their cilium-associated function . on the other hand , several algae currently unknown to form cilium , e.g. , the `` prasinophytes '' of the genus prasinoderma or the ochrophytes pelagococcus subviridis and pinguiococcus pyrenoidosus , turn out to encode not only rabl2 , but also homologs of some hallmark ciliary protein , suggest the existence of a cryptic flagellated stage in their life cycle . we additionally obtain insight into the evolution of the rabl2 gene architecture , which seem to have ancestrally consist of eight exon subsequently modify not only by lineage-specific intron loss and gain , but also by recurrent loss of the terminal exon encode a poorly conserve c-terminal extension . our comparative analysis support the notion that rabl2 be an ancestral component of the eukaryotic cilium and underscore the still underappreciated magnitude of recurrent gene loss , or reductive evolution in general , in the history of eukaryotic genome and cell .

Title: spatiotemporal-adaptive nanotherapeutics promote post-injury regeneration in age through metabolic modulation .
Authors: Liang K, Zhao L, Zhang S, Zheng L, Zhang Z, Wang S, Chen J, Xu W, Wang W, Yang H, Song C, Qiu P, Zhao C, Fang W, Zhu J, Fan S, Liu Z, Tang R, Zhao Y, Fang X
Abstract: in the elderly population , dysregulated cellular behaviour during the heal process impact tissue regeneration after injury . early in the regeneration process , pro-inflammatory macrophage contribute to immune imbalance , while in late stage , senescent stem cell reduce regenerative capacity . here we demonstrate that nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide ( nad ( + ) ) can reprogramme both type of dysfunctional cell . we develop a spatiotemporal-adaptive nanotherapeutic system for the delivery of nad ( + ) into select cell during different phase of tissue repair . by replenish intracellular nad ( + ) pool , this system reshape the multicellular regeneration niche , by metabolically rewire pro-inflammatory macrophage towards a pro-repair phenotype during the early phase , and enhance the differentiation capacity of senescent stem cell at late stage . this strategy effectively restore impaired bone regeneration in osteoporotic mouse and accelerate skin wound healing . our work present a spatiotemporal-adaptive nanomedicine platform that bridge cell metabolism , nanomedicine and regeneration therapy .

Title: systemic increase of ampa receptor associate with cognitive impairment of long covid .
Authors: Fujimoto Y, Abe H, Eiro T, Tsugawa S, Tanaka M, Hatano M, Nakajima W, Ichijo S, Arisawa T, Takada Y, Kimura K, Sano A, Hirahata K, Sasaki N, Kimura Y, Takahashi T
Abstract: long covid primarily present with persistent cognitive impairment ( cog-lc ) , impose a substantial and lasting global burden . even after the pandemic , there remain a critical global need for diagnostic and therapeutic strategy target cog-lc . nevertheless , the underlying neural mechanism remain poorly understood . give the central role of synapsis in brain function , investigation of synaptic molecular change may provide vital insight into cog-lc pathophysiology . in this study , we use [ ( 11 ) c ] k-2 pet to characterize the density of ampa receptor ( ampars ) on the post-synaptic cell surface , which be crucial synaptic component in brain signalling . statistical parametrical mapping be use to spatially normalize and apply independent t-test for a voxel-based comparison . we select patient with cog-lc ( n = 30 ) base on repeatable battery for the assessment of neuropsychological status assess persistent cognitive impairment and healthy control ( n = 80 ) with no diagnosed neuropsychiatric disorder . the primary objective be to compare [ ( 11 ) c ] k-2 standardize uptake value ratio with white matter ( suvr ( wm ) ) a a reference region between patient with cog-lc and healthy control , and to define the regional extent of difference . the secondary objective be to examine association between [ ( 11 ) c ] k-2 suvr ( wm ) and plasma concentration of cytokine or chemokines . a an exploratory objective , we test whether [ ( 11 ) c ] k-2 pet data could distinguish cog-lc from healthy control use a partial least square base classification algorithm . a voxel-based comparison ( p < 0.05 , t > 1.66 , one-tailed , false discovery rate control ) and a volume of interest analysis ( p < 0.05 , bonferroni multiple comparison ) demonstrate that increase index of ampar density in large part of the brain of patient with cog-lc compare with that in healthy control . a voxel-based correlation analysis also show the brain region where [ ( 11 ) c ] k-2 suvr ( wm ) correlate positively with plasma tnfsf12 and negatively with plasma ccl2 concentration . a partial least square model train on the index of ampar density data demonstrate high diagnostic accuracy , achieve 100 % sensitivity and 91.2 % specificity . [ ( 11 ) c ] k-2 pet signal represent the index of ampar density on the post-synaptic neural cell surface , not on the glial cell surface . a systemic increase in synaptic ampars across the brain may drive abnormal information processing in cog-lc and , through excessive excitatory signalling , pose a risk of excitotoxic neuronal damage . we derive the hypothesis that [ ( 11 ) c ] k-2 pet would be helpful in establish a diagnostic framework for cog-lc and that antagonist for cell surface ampars , such a perampanel , would be a potential therapeutic target . these hypothesis should be investigate in future large-scale clinical study .

Title: the immunology of brain tumor .
Authors: Bunse L, Bunse T, Kilian M, Quintana FJ, Platten M
Abstract: brain tumor represent a unique challenge for cancer immunotherapy because of their location in an immune privilege site . however , the brain tumor immune microenvironment be dictate more by tumor type than the location within the brain per se . this feature be reflect by the high immunogenicity and response to immunotherapy of metastatic brain tumor compare with primary brain tumor . immunotherapy for brain tumor aim at inducing and boost tumor t cell response use vaccine , immune checkpoint inhibitor , or adoptive t cell therapy . a fundamental challenge in the field be how such brain tumor-targeting t cell gain access to brain tumor and maintain their function despite a hostile immunosuppressive microenvironment . here , we review current knowledge of the cellular and molecular determinant of the antigenicity of brain tumor and the immunosuppressive brain tumor microenvironment . expand and exploit this knowledge will provide the key for effective combinatorial therapy .

Title: association between sarcopenic obesity and risk of fall : a population-based cohort study among middle-aged and old adult use the charls .
Authors: Yu C, Meng Z, Wang X, Xiao J
Abstract: although previous research have establish a strong link between sarcopenia and fall risk in middle-aged and old adult , the effect of sarcopenic obesity and possible sarcopenic obesity on fall risk remain underexplored in large-scale study . this longitudinal analysis aim to examine these association use nationally representative cohort data . we analyze data from the china health and retirement longitudinal study ( charls ) , include 9,996 participant age 45 and old with available body composition measurement . participant be categorize into four group base on asian work group for sarcopenia ( awgs ) criterion and median waist circumference ( wc ) : ( 1 ) normal wc without sarcopenia ( control group ) , ( 2 ) normal wc with sarcopenia , ( 3 ) obesity without sarcopenia , and ( 4 ) obesity with sarcopenia . cox proportional hazard model be use to estimate adjust hazard ratio ( hr ) , 95 % confidence interval ( ci ) , and p-values , with the control group a the reference . the model be sequentially adjust for demographic ( age , sex , residence ) , socioeconomic ( education ) , and behavioral ( smoking , alcohol ) variable . compare to participant with normal wc and no sarcopenia ( reference group ) , those with sarcopenic obesity have a significantly high risk of fall ( hr = 1.25 ; 95 % 1.00-1.56 ; p = 0.048 ) , even after adjust for demographic , socioeconomic , and behavioral factor . similarly , possible sarcopenic obesity be link to a modest but statistically significant increase in fall risk ( hr = 1.12 ; 95 % 1.02-1.24 ; p = 0.021 ) . subgroup analyse reveal that the fourth quartile show a trend toward high fall risk across all subgroup , especially among individual age ≥ 60 year and male . however , in most subgroup , the 95 % ci cross 1 , suggest limited statistical significance in some stratum . both sarcopenic obesity and possible sarcopenic obesity be associate with an elevated risk of fall . middle-aged and old adult should adopt preventive strategy , such a maintain regular physical activity , to preserve muscle mass and reduce the risk of fall .

Title: safety and efficacy of a dexamethasone-sparing regimen with daratumumab and lenalidomide in patient with frailty and newly diagnose multiple myeloma ( ifm2017-03 ) : a phase 3 , open-label , multicentre , randomise , control trial .
Authors: Manier S, Lambert J, Hulin C, Macro M, Laribi K, Araujo C, Pica GM, Touzeau C, Godmer P, Slama B, Karlin L, Orsini Piocelle F, Dib M, Sanhes L, Morel P, El Yamani A, Tiab M, Tabrizi R, Richez V, Garderet L, Royer B, Bareau B, Mariette C, Fleck E, Robu D, Calmettes C, Rigaudeau S, Demarquette H, Frenzel L, Decaux O, Mohty M, Arnulf B, Bigot N, Perrot A, Corre J, Mary JY, Avet-Loiseau H, Moreau P, Leleu X, Facon T
Abstract: patient with frailty and newly diagnose multiple myeloma have worse outcome due to high rate of adverse event ( aes ) and treatment discontinuation . this study evaluate a dexamethasone-sparing regimen of daratumumab plus lenalidomide versus lenalidomide plus dexamethasone in frail patient with newly diagnose multiple myeloma . in this prospective , randomised , open-label trial , conduct at 61 active intergroup francophone of myeloma centre , patient age 65 year or old with newly diagnose multiple myeloma and an eastern cooperative oncology group proxy frailty score of 2 or more be randomly assign 2:1 to receive daratumumab ( 1800 mg subcutaneously ) plus oral lenalidomide ( 25 mg daily for 21 day of a 28 day cycle ) and dexamethasone ( 20mg weekly ) for two cycle ( dexamethasone-sparing group ) or lenalidomide ( 25 mg daily ) and oral dexamethasone ( 20 mg weekly ; control group ) , with stratification by international staging system , age , and centre . the primary endpoint be progression-free survival . efficacy be assess in the intention-to-treat population and safety be assess in all patient expose to at least one dose of randomised intervention . this trial be register with clinicaltrials.gov , nct03993912 , and be complete . from oct 18 , 2019 to july 20 , 2021 , 335 patient be screen , of whom 295 patient be randomly assign ( 200 to lenalidomide plus daratumumab , 95 to lenalidomide plus dexamethasone ) . the median age be 81 year ( iqr 77-84 ) , with 180 ( 61 % ) age old than 80 year , and 151 ( 51 % ) patient be female and 144 ( 49 % ) be male . median follow-up be 46·3 month ( iqr 46·0-52·7 ) . median progression-free survival be 53·4 month ( 95 % ci 35·3-not reach ) in the dexamethasone-sparing group versus 22·5 month ( 16·5-39·0 ) in the control group ( hazard ratio [ hr ] 0·51 , 95 % ci 0·37-0·70 , p < 0·0001 ) . the most common grade 3-5 aes be neutropenia ( 110 [ 55 % ] of 200 patient in the dexamethasone-sparing group vs 23 [ 24 % ] of 95 patient in the control group ) , and infection ( 38 [ 19 % ] v 20 [ 21 % ] ) . serious adverse event occur in 126 patient ( 63 % ) in the dexamethasone-sparing group and 66 patient ( 69 % ) in the control group . aes lead to death occur in 23 patient ( 12 % ) in the dexamethasone-sparing group and 12 patient ( 13 % ) in the control group , with 4 ( 2 % ) and 2 ( 2 % ) grade 5 treatment-emergent adverse event , respectively . in the ifm2017-03 trial , use of lenalidomide plus daratumumab , with dexamethasone limit to the first 2 treatment cycle , reduce the risk of progression or death compare with lenalidomide plus dexamethasone , with no additional safety concern . lenalidomide plus daratumumab could therefore be consider a a treatment option for old patient with frailty and newly diagnose multiple myeloma . the study be fund by johnson & johnson .

Title: target histone h2b acetylate enhanceosomes via p300/cbp degradation in prostate cancer .
Authors: Luo J, Chen Z, Qiao Y, Tien JC, Young E, Mannan R, Mahapatra S, Bhattacharyya R, Xiao L, He T, Eyunni S, Zhang Y, Zheng Y, Su F, Cao X, Wang R, Cheng Y, Seri R, George J, Shahine M, Miner SJ, Rees MG, Ronan MM, Roth JA, Vaishampayan U, Wang M, Wang S, Parolia A, Chinnaiyan AM
Abstract: prostate cancer be drive by oncogenic transcription factor enhanceosomes comprise chromatin and epigenetic regulator . the lysine acetyltransferases p300 and creb-binding protein ( cbp ) be key cofactor that activate enhancer through histone acetylation . here we identify p300/cbp-mediated multisite histone h2b n-terminal acetylation ( h2bntac ) a a defining feature of oncogenic enhanceosomes in androgen receptor ( ar ) -positive prostate cancer . p300/cbp be essential for ar and ets transcription factor erg transcriptional activity , and their dual degradation eliminate h2bntac and histone h3 lysine 27 acetylation at hyperactive enhancer , lead to strong suppression of oncogenic transcription than target either paralog or bromodomain alone . cytotoxicity profile across > 900 cell line reveal that tumor with high h2bntac , include ar-positive prostate cancer , be selectively dependent on p300/cbp . in preclinical model , systemic p300/cbp degradation inhibit tumor growth , synergized with ar antagonist and show no evident toxicity . these finding position h2bntac a an epigenetic marker of enhancer addiction and establish dual p300/cbp degradation a a promising therapeutic strategy for enhancer-driven cancer .

Title: etrasimod a induction and maintenance treatment for patient with moderately to severely active ulcerative colitis in east asia ( enlight uc ) : a randomised , double-blind , placebo-controlled , multicentre , phase 3 study .
Authors: Wu K, Zheng C, Cao Q, Ding Y, Gao X, Zhong J, Chiu CT, Zhang H, Wang X, Wang B, Liang J, Liu X, Zhou Y, Xu B, Kim TO, Shen X, Chen D, Chen W, Liu Y, Shen J, Liu F, Ding X, Zhan Q, Chou JW, Zeng S, Lin Y, Ying L, Chen X
Abstract: etrasimod be an oral , once-daily sphingosine 1-phosphate ( s1p ) receptor modulator for the treatment of active ulcerative colitis . in the randomised , placebo-controlled , double-blind phase 3 enlight uc study , also know a the es101002 study , we aim to evaluate the efficacy and safety of etrasimod in patient with moderately to severely active ulcerative colitis in east asia . use a central interactive web response system , in the 12-week induction period , adult ( age 18-75 year , inclusive ) with moderately to severely active ulcerative colitis ( modify mayo score [ mm ] 4-9 with an endoscopic subscore ≥2 and a rectal bleeding subscore ≥1 ) and an inadequate response , loss of response , or intolerance to at least one ulcerative colitis treatment be randomly assign ( 2:1 ) to once-daily oral etrasimod 2 mg or placebo . patient and study staff be mask to treatment assignment . patient be enrol from 52 hospital across china , taiwan , and souh korea . randomisation be stratify by previous treatment status and baseline disease activity . patient who have an mms clinical response at induction period week 12 be re-randomly assign ( 1:1 ) to once-daily oral etrasimod 2 mg or placebo for the 40-week maintenance period . randomisation be stratify by induction period treatment , previous exposure to biologicals or jak inhibitor , and concomitant use of oral corticosteroid at induction period baseline . the primary efficacy outcome be mms clinical remission ( stool frequency subscore=0 [ or stool frequency subscore=1 with a ≥1 point decrease from induction period baseline ] , rectal bleeding subscore=0 , and endoscopic subscore ≤1 [ exclude friability ] ) , assess in the induction and maintenance period separately ( at induction period week 12 and maintenance period week 40 ) . the primary efficacy analysis use the full analysis set ( fa ) , which include all patient who be randomly assign and receive at least one dose of study treatment for the induction period , and all re-randomly assigned patient who show clinical response at induction period week 12 and receive at least one dose of study treatment for the maintenance period . the safety analyse for each treatment period use the safety analysis set ( saf ) , which include all patient who receive any amount of study drug in the corresponding treatment period . enlight uc be register with clinicaltrials.gov ( nct04176588 ) and the study be complete . 606 patient be screen between sept 25 , 2019 , and april 27 , 2023 , and 340 be randomly assign for the induction period and treat ( 228 patient [ 88 female and 140 male ] assign to etrasimod and 112 patient [ 44 female and 68 male ] assign to placebo ) . 157 patient who show clinical response in the induction period be re-randomly assigned and treat in the maintenance period ( 77 patient [ 35 female and 42 male ] assign to etrasimod and 80 patient [ 32 female and 48 male ] assign to placebo ) . a significantly great proportion of patient treat with etrasimod than those treat with placebo , show clinical remission at induction week 12 ( 57 [ 25·0 % ] of 228 patient vs six [ 5·4 % ] of 112 patient ; adjust difference 20·4 % ; 95 % ci 13·4 % -27·4 % ; p < 0·0001 ) and maintenance period week 40 ( 37 [ 48·1 % ] of 77 patient vs 10 [ 12·5 % ] of 80 patient ; adjust difference 35·9 % ; 95 % ci 22·5 % -49·2 % ; p < 0·0001 ) . in the induction period , the most frequently report treatment-emergent adverse event ( teae ) be increase alt ( 22 [ 10 % ] in the etrasimod group vs one [ 1 % ] in the placebo group ) . in the maintenance period , the most frequently report teae be upper respiratory tract infection ( 14 [ 18 % ] in the etrasimod group vs 14 [ 17 % ] in the placebo group ) . across the induction and maintenance period , most teaes be mild to moderate in severity . five ( 2 % ) of 228 patient treat with etrasimod and four ( 4 % ) of 112 patient treat with placebo discontinue study treatment due to teaes during the induction period , and one ( 1 % ) of 77 patient treat with etrasimod and one ( 1 % ) of 81 patient treat with placebo discontinue study treatment due to teaes during the maintenance period . no grade 4 or high teae , malignancy , or death be report . etrasimod be effective and well tolerate a an oral induction and maintenance treatment in patient with moderately to severely active ulcerative colitis in east asia . everest medicine . for the chinese translation of the abstract see supplementary material section .

Title: measurement of organ-specific and acute-phase blood protein level in early lyme disease .
Authors: Zhou Y, Qin S, Sun M, Tang L, Yan X, Kim TK, Caballero J, Glusman G, Brunkow ME, Soloski MJ, Rebman AW, Scavarda C, Cooper D, Omenn GS, Moritz RL, Wormser GP, Price ND, Aucott JN, Hood L
Abstract: lyme disease result from infection of human with the spirochete borrelia burgdorferi . the first and most common clinical manifestation be the circular , inflamed skin lesion refer to a erythema migrans ; later manifestation result from infection of other body site . laboratory diagnosis of lyme disease can be challenge in patient with erythema migrans because of the time delay in the development of specific diagnostic antibody against borrelia . reliable blood biomarkers for the early diagnosis of lyme disease in patient with erythema migrans be need . here , we perform select reaction monitoring , a targeted mass spectrometry-based approach , to measure select protein that ( 1 ) be know to be predominantly express in one organ ( i.e. , organ-specific blood protein ) and whose blood concentration may change a a result of lyme disease , or ( 2 ) be involve in acute immune response . in a longitudinal cohort of 40 lyme disease patient and 20 healthy control , we identify 10 protein with significantly alter serum level in patient at the time of diagnosis , and we also develop a 10-protein panel identify through multivariate analysis . in an independent cohort of patient with erythema migrans , six of these protein , apoa4 , c9 , crp , cst6 , pglyrp2 , and s100a9 , be confirm to show significantly alter serum level in patient at time of presentation . nine of the 10 protein from the multivariate panel be also verify in the second cohort . these protein , primarily innate immune response protein or protein specific to liver , skin , or white blood cell , may serve a candidate blood biomarkers require further validation to aid in the laboratory diagnosis of early lyme disease .

Title: mechanism underlie induction of hyperglycemia in rat by single administration of olanzapine .
Authors: Nagata M, Nakajima M, Ishiwata Y, Takahashi Y, Takahashi H, Negishi K, Yasuhara M
Abstract: acute administration of olanzapine rapidly elevate blood glucose level . however , the mechanism underlie the rapid development of hyperglycemia with the administration of olanzapine remain unclear . the aim of the present study be to clarify the mechanism underlie olanzapine-induced acute hyperglycemia . male wistar rat receive an intravenous infusion of saline ( control ) or olanzapine 2.5 , 5 , or 10 mg/kg . blood sample be obtain periodically after olanzapine infusion to determine serum concentration of glucose , olanzapine , and several endogenous substance . in a separate experiment , rat receive an intravenous injection of propranolol ( 2 mg/kg ) 30 min before infusion of olanzapine ( 10 mg/kg ) . the intravenous infusion of olanzapine induce dose-dependent increase in the serum concentration of glucose , epinephrine , and insulin . pretreatment with propranolol suppress olanzapine-induced elevation in the serum concentration of glucose , but do not affect the serum concentration of olanzapine or olanzapine-induced increase in the serum concentration of epinephrine . although the serum concentration of corticosterone increase after administration of olanzapine , no significant difference be observe among the olanzapine dose group . furthermore , administration of olanzapine do not affect the serum concentration of glucagon or histamine . we develop a pharmacokinetic-pharmacodynamic model assume that the olanzapine-induced secretion of epinephrine lead to elevate serum glucose concentration . this model appear to satisfactorily characterize olanzapine-induced hyperglycemia . in conclusion , a single intravenous dose of olanzapine dose-dependently increase the serum concentration of glucose in rat , and epinephrine play a role in olanzapine-induced acute hyperglycemia .

Title: first-line immunotherapy with or without chemotherapy versus braf plus mek inhibitor in braf ( v600e ) -mutated metastatic non-small-cell lung cancer ( front-braf ) : a multicentre , retrospective cohort study .
Authors: Di Federico A, Wang K, Chen MF, Barsouk AA, Pagliaro A, Chen LN, Ogliari FR, Stockhammer P, Thawani R, Raslan S, Gariazzo E, Fusco F, Hambelton GM, Citarella F, Meyer D, Aldea M, De Giglio A, Alessi JV, Pecci F, Gelsomino F, Corassa M, Vokes NI, Wang X, de Biase D, Abu Rous F, Areesawangkit P, Elghawy O, Cortellini A, Metro G, Ferrara R, Awad MM, Pabani A, Murray JC, Cappuzzo F, Garassino MC, Dagogo-Jack I, Riely G, Grant M, Herzberg BO, Ardizzoni A, Planchard D, Johnson BE, Langer CJ, Offin M, Negrao MV, Ricciuti B
Abstract: patient with braf ( v600e ) ( ie , val600glu ) -mutated non-small-cell lung cancer ( nsclc ) can be treat with braf and mitogen-activated protein kinase ( mek ) inhibitor , or with immune checkpoint inhibitor ( icis ) with or without chemotherapy . we aim to investigate which initial systemic treatment should be prioritise in this population . in this retrospective cohort study conduct across 17 centre in the usa , italy , france , and brazil , clinicopathological data be collect from participant age 18 year and old with stage iv , treatment-naive , metastatic braf ( v600e ) -mutated nsclc and with an eastern cooperative oncology group performance status of 0-3 , who start first-line treatment with icis with or without chemotherapy ( pd-1 or pd-l1 inhibitor with or without platinum-based chemotherapy ) or braf and mek inhibitor ( dabrafenib and trametinib or encorafenib and binimetinib ) between jan 2 , 2015 , and july 11 , 2024. the primary endpoint be overall survival with first-line icis with or without chemotherapy versus with braf and mek inhibitor . 284 participant be identify for this study , of whom 88 ( 31 % ) receive icis with or without chemotherapy and 196 ( 69 % ) receive braf and mek inhibitor . the median age of participant be 68 year ( iqr 61-74 ) , and 148 ( 52 % ) participant be female and 136 ( 48 % ) male . participant in the icis with or without chemotherapy group have a high history of smoking ( 73 [ 83 % ] v 118 [ 60 % ] ; p=0·0002 ) and a high pd-l1 expression ( ≥50 % in 58 [ 66 % ] v 76 [ 39 % ] , 1-49 % in 16 [ 18 % ] v 67 [ 34 % ] , and < 1 % in eight [ 9 % ] v 31 [ 16 % ] ; p=0·0003 ) than those in the braf and mek inhibitor group . at a median follow-up time of 45·0 month ( 95 % ci 39·0-55·7 ) , icis with or without chemotherapy be associate with improved median overall survival compare with braf and mek inhibitor ( 40·9 month [ 95 % ci 33·3-not reach ] v 25·2 month [ 19·9-31·1 ] ; hazard ratio [ hr ] 0·69 [ 0·49-0·98 ] , p=0·039 ) . in subgroup analysis , icis with or without chemotherapy , compare with braf and mek inhibitor , be associate with long median overall survival in participant with a history of smoking ( hr 0·60 [ 0·40-0·90 ] , p=0·013 ) , with a pd-l1 tumour proportion score of ≥1 % or high ( hr 0·66 [ 0·45-0·98 ] , p=0·039 ) , age 70 year or old ( hr 0·54 [ 0·31-0·94 ] , p=0·029 ) , with tp53 co-mutations ( hr 0·46 [ 0·27-0·79 ] , p=0·0048 ) , and without brain metastasis ( hr 0·66 [ 0·45-0·99 ] , p=0·045 ) . with braf and mek inhibitor , frequency of adverse event of any grade and of grade 3 and high be similar whether administer a first-line therapy or a second-line therapy follow icis with or without chemotherapy . first-line icis with or without chemotherapy be associate with improved overall survival compare with braf and mek inhibitor in participant with metastatic braf ( v600e ) -mutated nsclc , particularly among specific subpopulation . these finding , although suggest potential clinical relevance , remain exploratory and require confirmation from prospective study . nextgenerationeu .

Title: microbiome-metabolome interplay in pancreatic cancer progression : insight from multi-omics analysis .
Authors: Luo D, Chen Q, Li Y, Yang J, Tao Y, Ji L, Gong X
Abstract: recent study suggest that intratumoral microbiome and alter metabolic network play crucial role in pancreatic cancer ( pc ) progression . however , the precise interplay between microbial community and tumor metabolism in pc remain poorly understood . this study aim to investigate the impact of the intratumoral microbiome , the metabolic landscape , and their interaction on pc development . 16 rdna sequencing and untargeted metabolomic profiling be perform on 47 paired pancreatic cancer and adjacent normal tissue to analyze their intratumoral microbiome and metabolic landscape . bioinformatics tool be use to conduct differential microbiome abundance analysis and pathway enrichment . a correlation analysis be perform to identify key microbiota-metabolite interaction . 16 rdna sequence reveal significant difference in the abundance and diversity ( α-diversity and β-diversity ) of the intratumoral microbiome in pc . the predominant specie in pancreatic cancer be pseudomonas . enrichment analysis show that amino acid metabolic pathway , include arginine and proline metabolism , arginine biosynthesis , be significantly enrich in pc . untargeted metabolomics identify 298 metabolite that be significantly alter in pc ( fold change > 1.5 , p-value < 0.05 ) . these include amino acid metabolite such a lys-leu , pro-leu , arg-leu , lys-val , his-lys , and others . functional enrichment analysis highlight several metabolic pathway that play important role in pancreatic cancer , include glycine , serine , and threonine metabolism , amino acid biosynthesis , metabolic pathway and cysteine and methionine metabolism . correlation analysis between microbiome and metabolic data reveal significant association between pseudomonas and several metabolite , include alpha-ketoisovaleric acid , 16-hydroxyhexadecanoic acid , myristic acid , nonanoic acid ( the spearman correlation coefficient r , 0.5 ≤|r|≤ 1 and p-value < 0.05 ) . this study suggest a relationship between the microbiome and metabolism in pancreatic cancer . we observe that pseudomonas contributes to alter amino acid metabolism , but whether this interaction be causal and the mechanism underlie it remain unclear . further experimental validation be require before consider microbiome-targeted metabolic intervention a viable therapeutic strategy .

Title: taurochenodeoxycholic acid alleviate obesity-induced endothelial dysfunction .
Authors: Lu H, Wu Z, Wan M, Xiong S, Huang X, Liu T, Jiang X, He L, Ma C, Cui H, Yue X, Li J, Qin X, Wang Y, Zhang C, Yang J, Liu S, Zhang W
Abstract: obesity be a global health challenge significantly increase cardiovascular disease ( cvd ) burden . effective prevention and treatment necessitate target early pathological change , particularly obesity-induced endothelial dysfunction ( ed ) . this study aim to characterize ed heterogeneity in non-hypertensive obese ( nho ) individual , investigate the association of serum metabolite with obesity-induced ed , and identify potentially predictive and therapeutic metabolite . utilize wire myograph , this study assess ed of ex vivo arteriole from omental adipose tissue of 213 nho patient , categorize into metabolically healthy obesity ( mho ) and metabolically unhealthy obesity ( muo ) . target metabolomic profiling identify association between serum metabolite and ed . obesity-induced ed in nho patient lack correlation with many traditional cardiovascular risk factor . the mho and muo individual exhibit similar ed and metabolomic profile characteristic . serum metabolomics identify bile acid ( ba ) , particularly chenodeoxycholic acid ( cdca ) , a negatively correlate with ed in nho patient . taurochenodeoxycholic acid ( tcdca ) , a taurine-conjugated derivative of cdca , protect against obesity-induced ed and hypertension . mechanistically , endothelial farnesoid x receptor ( fxr ) deletion aggravate obesity-induced ed and hypertension , negate the beneficial effect of bariatric surgery or tcdca treatment . the tcdca-fxr activation in endothelial cell upregulated atf4 transcription , which be suppress by phb1 , thereby enhance serine and one-carbon metabolism . this study suggest cdca a a promising biomarker for identification of obesity-induced ed . taurochenodeoxycholic acid demonstrate significant therapeutic potential for alleviate various form of obesity-induced ed . this effect be mediate by the endothelial tcdca-fxr-phb1-atf4 axis , which upregulates serine and one-carbon metabolism , thereby offer a novel strategy to delay the onset of hypertension and other cvds .

Title: current status and solution for ai ethic in ophthalmology : a bibliometric analysis .
Authors: Chen X, Yang Y, Yun D, Wang R, Lin Y, Luo M, Zhang W, Yu-Wai-Man P, Burton M, Liang L, Lin H
Abstract: ophthalmology , an early adopter of medical artificial intelligence ( ai ) , have make significant advancement , but ethical discussion limit . this bibliometric analysis review 498 publication from web of science and scopus ( 2000-2023 ) to explore the evolution , status , thematic trend , data modality and their ethical focus , and solution in ophthalmic ai ethic . ophthalmology rank second in medical ai ethic , with major contributor from the united state ( u ) , china , the united kingdom ( uk ) , singapore and india . ethical concern focus on privacy , fairness , and transparency . ethical priority differ by modality with fundus imaging ( 59.4 % ) and optical coherence tomography ( oct ) ( 30.9 % ) a the most common . most study ( 78.3 % ) address ethic in diagnostic algorithm development , while only 11.5 % directly target ethical concern , though this focus be increase . this study highlight the need for ai technology and guideline to address ethical challenge in ophthalmology , offer a future direction for research and innovation in medical ai governance .

Title: current status and solution for ai ethic in ophthalmology : a bibliometric analysis .
Authors: Chen X, Yang Y, Yun D, Wang R, Lin Y, Luo M, Zhang W, Yu-Wai-Man P, Burton M, Liang L, Lin H
Abstract: ophthalmology , an early adopter of medical artificial intelligence ( ai ) , have make significant advancement , but ethical discussion limit . this bibliometric analysis review 498 publication from web of science and scopus ( 2000-2023 ) to explore the evolution , status , thematic trend , data modality and their ethical focus , and solution in ophthalmic ai ethic . ophthalmology rank second in medical ai ethic , with major contributor from the united state ( u ) , china , the united kingdom ( uk ) , singapore and india . ethical concern focus on privacy , fairness , and transparency . ethical priority differ by modality with fundus imaging ( 59.4 % ) and optical coherence tomography ( oct ) ( 30.9 % ) a the most common . most study ( 78.3 % ) address ethic in diagnostic algorithm development , while only 11.5 % directly target ethical concern , though this focus be increase . this study highlight the need for ai technology and guideline to address ethical challenge in ophthalmology , offer a future direction for research and innovation in medical ai governance .

Title: park7-driven igf2bp3-k76 lactylation mediates ferroptosis and haic resistance in hepatocellular carcinoma .
Authors: Zhu Z, Xia X, Lu Y, Li D, He X, Zhang B, Xiong G, Zhang W, Liang H, Zhu H
Abstract: oxaliplatin/5-fluorouracil ( oxa/5-fu ) -based hepatic artery infusion chemotherapy ( haic ) represent a promising strategy against advanced hepatocellular carcinoma ( hcc ) , yet acquire resistance frequently impede it efficacy . here , we identify lactylation of igf2bp3 at lysine 76 ( igf2bp3-k76lac ) a a key driver of haic resistance . igf2bp3-k76lac overexpression enhances chemoresistance in vitro and in vivo . mechanistically , lactylation at igf2bp3 k76 strengthen it affinity for m6a-modified fsp1 mrna , upregulating fsp1 and confer ferroptosis resistance . blocking of igf2bp3-k76lac bolster oxa/5-fu-induced ferroptosis , disrupts antioxidant defense , and curbs tumor growth . moreover , park7 function a a lactyltransferase to facilitate igf2bp3-k76lac via increase the binding of lactate at igf2bp3-k76 site . finally , block antibody target igf2bp3-k76lac be show to work synergistically with oxa/5-fu to restore chemosensitivity . take together , our finding reveal a critical role for the park7-igf2bp3-k76lac-fsp1 axis in haic resistance , highlight igf2bp3-k76lac a a potential therapeutic target in hcc .

Title: association of social isolation and loneliness with incident cancer in a population-based cohort study .
Authors: Liu X, Chen P, Wang J, Li Z, Zhu Y, Yang J, Wang L, He S, Sun X, Li J, Yang H
Abstract: social isolation and loneliness pose significant public health challenge globally . this study aim to examine the association of social isolation , loneliness and their combined effect with incident cancer . this study utilize data from the uk biobank ( ukb ) , which be a population-based prospective cohort . social isolation and loneliness be assess through self-reported questionnaire . cancer case be identify by link to cancer registry . a total of 430,376 participant be include , during a mean follow-up of 14.32 year , 45,131 participant be diagnose with cancer . compare to participant in least isolated group , those in most isolated group have significantly high risk of cancer of lip , oral cavity and pharynx ( hr 1.32 , 95 % ci 1.11-1.58 ) , cancer of digestive organ ( hr 1.10 , 95 % ci 1.03-1.16 ) , cancer of respiratory and intrathoracic organ ( hr 1.17 , 95 % ci 1.07-1.28 ) , breast cancer ( hr 1.11 , 95 % ci 1.04-1.18 ) , cancer of female genital organ ( hr 1.23 , 95 % ci 1.09-1.38 ) , and cancer of urinary tract ( hr 1.31 , 95 % ci 1.17-1.46 ) . however , the most isolated group have low risk of cancer of mesothelial and soft tissue ( hr 0.80 , 95 % ci 0.64-0.99 ) , prostate cancer ( hr 0.88 , 95 % ci 0.83-0.94 ) . individual with loneliness have a significantly increase risk of cancer of urinary tract ( hr 1.19 , 95 % ci 1.01-1.40 ) , but a reduced risk of cancer of skin ( hr 0.76 , 95 % ci 0.61-0.93 ) . social isolation and loneliness be independently associate with incident cancer , with implication for early effective cancer prevention .

Title: a miniature crispr-cas10 enzyme confers immunity by inhibitory signalling .
Authors: Doherty EE, Adler BA, Yoon PH, Hsieh K, Loi K, Armbruster EG, Lahiri A, Bolling CS, Wilcox XE, Akkati A, Iavarone AT, Pogliano J, Doudna JA
Abstract: microbial and viral co-evolution have create immunity mechanism involve oligonucleotide signal that share mechanistic feature with human antiviral system ( 1 ) . in these pathway , include cyclic oligonucleotide-based antiphage signal system ( cbasss ) and type iii crispr system in bacteria and cyclic gmp-amp synthase-stimulator of interferon gene ( cgas-sting ) in human , oligonucleotide synthesis occur upon detection of virus or foreign genetic material in the cell , trigger the antiviral response ( 2-4 ) . here , in an unexpected inversion of this process , we show that the crispr-related enzyme mcpol synthesize cyclic oligonucleotides constitutively a part of an active mechanism that repress a toxic effector . cell-based experiment demonstrate that the absence or loss of mcpol-produced cyclic oligonucleotides trigger cell death , prevent the spread of virus that attempt immune evasion by deplete host cyclic nucleotide . structural and mechanistic investigation reveal mcpol to be a di-adenylate cyclase whose product , c-di-amp , prevents toxic oligomerization of the effector protein 2tmβ . analysis of cell by fluorescence microscopy show that lack of mcpol allow 2tmβ-mediated cell death due to inner membrane collapse . these finding unveil a powerful defence strategy against virus-mediated immune suppression , expand our understanding of the role of oligonucleotides in immunity .

Title: paracetamol ( acetaminophen ) use during pregnancy and autism risk : evidence do not support causal association .
Authors: Louwen F, Deuster E, McAuliffe FM, Jacobsson B, Geary M, Fleischman S, Kihara AB
Abstract: recent political statement link paracetamol ( acetaminophen ) use during pregnancy to autism spectrum disorder have create concern among patient and healthcare provider worldwide . this editorial critically examine the scientific evidence , highlight that the large and most methodologically rigorous population-based study employ sibling control analyse demonstrate no causal association between prenatal paracetamol exposure and neurodevelopmental disorder . while some observational study have suggest potential weak association , these finding likely reflect confound by indication and familial genetic factor rather than actual causal relationship . the most robust evidence come from a swedish population-based study of 2.48 million child , which find no increase risk when control for familial confounding . major international medical organization include acog , rcog , and figo , and regulatory agency include the european medicine agency continue to recommend paracetamol a the safe analgesic option during pregnancy when clinically indicate . the established risk of untreated pain and fever during pregnancy significantly outweigh theoretical concern base on methodologically limited study . healthcare provider should continue evidence-based counseling while avoid unnecessary anxiety about this essential medication in obstetric practice .
Journal: International journal of gynaecology and obstetrics: the official organ of the

Title: creative experience and brain clock .
Authors: Coronel-Oliveros C, Migeot J, Lehue F, Amoruso L, Kowalczyk-Grębska N, Jakubowska N, Mandke KN, Seabra JP, Orio P, Campbell D, Gonzalez-Gomez R, Prado P, Cuadros J, Tagliazucchi E, Cruzat J, Legaz A, Medel V, Hernandez H, Fittipaldi S, Altschuler F, Moguilner S, Baez S, Santamaria-Garcia H, González-Hernández A, Bonilla-Santos J, Güntekin B, Babiloni C, Abasolo D, Di Caterina G, Yener GG, Escudero J, Ochoa-Gómez JF, Soto-Añari M, Bruno MA, Valdes-Sosa PA, Anghinah R, Gonzalez-Montealegre RA, Clark RA, García AM, Kaltwasser L, Schürmann M, Meier JM, Brzezicka A, Whelan R, Lawlor B, Robertson IH, Bailey C, Melloni L, Sajnani N, Ibanez A
Abstract: creative experience may enhance brain health , yet metric and mechanism remain elusive . we characterize brain health use brain clock , which capture deviation from chronological age ( i.e. , accelerate or delay brain age ) . we combine m/eeg functional connectivity ( n = 1,240 ) with machine learn support vector machine , whole-brain modeling , and neurosynth metanalyses . from this framework , we reanalyzed previously publish datasets of expert and match non-expert participant in dance , music , visual art , and video game , along with a pre/post-learning study ( n = 232 ) . we find delay brain age across all domain and scalable effect ( expertise > learning ) . the high the level of expertise and performance , the great the delay in brain age . age-vulnerable brain hub show increased connectivity link to creativity , particularly in area relate to expertise and creative experience . neurosynth analysis and computational modeling reveal plasticity-driven increase in brain efficiency and biophysical coupling , in creativity-specific delayed brain age . finding indicate a domain‑independent link between creativity and brain health .

Title: use of ai in identification of sexually transmit infection and anogenital dermatosis : a systematic review and meta-analysis .
Authors: Soe NN, Kusnandar II, Latt PM, Fairley CK, Chow EPF, Maatouk I, Johnson CC, Shah P, Peters RPH, Subissi L, Zhang L, Ong JJ
Abstract: artificial intelligence ( ai ) excels in dermatology . however , it application to sexually transmitted infection ( stis ) remain unclear . to assess the performance of ai algorithm and their application in detect stis and anogenital dermatosis from clinical image in sexual health . six database ( ieee xplore , embase , scopus , medline , web of science , and cinahl ) be search for study publish from january 1 , 2010 , to april 12 , 2024 , use 3 main concept : artificial intelligence , diagnosis , and sexually transmitted infection . study that use ai to identify anogenital skin condition from clinical image be include . study that use non-ai approach or nonanogenital condition , as well a review and study lack performance metric , be exclude . follow the preferred reporting item for systematic review and meta-analyses ( prisma ) guideline , 2 reviewer independently assess full-text article and extract data use a standardized spreadsheet . another 2 reviewer resolve any disagreement . a modified quality assessment of diagnostic accuracy study ( quadas-2 ) critical appraisal tool and the checklist for evaluation of image-based ai report in dermatology ( clear derm ) be use for quality assessment . pool sensitivity and specificity of ai application for detect anogenital skin condition . a bivariate random-effects meta-analysis be conduct for condition with more than 3 study . of 5381 study screen and 258 full text select , 140 meet the inclusion criterion . most study report on mpox ( 110 [ 78.6 % ] ) , while other anogenital condition , include genital herpes ( 7 [ 5.0 % ] ) , genital wart ( 8 [ 5.7 % ] ) , scabies ( 8 [ 5.7 % ] ) , and molluscum contagiosum ( 6 [ 4.3 % ] ) , receive less attention . meta-analyses show high performance of ai for identification of mpox ( pooled sensitivity : 0.96 [ 95 % ci , 0.93-0.97 ] ; pool specificity : 0.98 [ 95 % ci , 0.97-0.99 ] ) , herpes simplex ( sensitivity : 0.91 [ 95 % ci , 0.71-0.98 ] ; specificity : 0.97 [ 95 % ci , 0.94-0.98 ] ) , genital wart ( sensitivity : 0.87 [ 95 % ci , 0.67-0.96 ] ; specificity : 0.98 [ 95 % ci , 0.95-0.99 ] ) , psoriasis ( sensitivity : 0.90 [ 95 % ci , 0.78-0.95 ] ; specificity : 0.98 [ 95 % ci , 0.96-0.99 ] ) , and scabies ( sensitivity : 0.89 [ 95 % ci , 0.84-0.93 ] ; specificity : 0.98 [ 95 % ci , 0.95-0.99 ] ) . study quality be variable , and the assessment identify high risk of bias across the population selection ( 76.1 % ) , reference standard ( 76.1 % ) , and index test ( 20.0 % ) . most study rely on open-source datasets ( 121 [ 86.4 % ] ) ; only 17 ( 12.1 % ) use external validation . all but 1 study ( 0.7 % ) remain at the proof-of-concept stage , and model be not publicly available for external evaluation . the finding suggest that ai show promise in identify stis and anogenital dermatosis but that significant research gap exist . future work should prioritize understudied stis and differential condition while improve data quality , conduct external validation , and validate finding in clinical setting .

Title: parp1 auto-modification promotes faithful okazaki fragment processing and limit replication fork speed .
Authors: Elsborg JD, Munk SHN, Adelantado-Rubio A, Pék R, Fábian Z, Imburchia V, Zentout S, Hendriks IA, Buch-Larsen SC, Smith R, Bartek J, Duxin JP, Huet S, Maya-Mendoza A, Nielsen ML
Abstract: poly ( adp-ribose ) polymerase ( parp ) inhibitor have prove their efficacy for treat tumor defective in homologous recombination via synthetic lethality . in response to dna break , parp1 be the primary adp-ribosylation writer , modify itself ( auto-modification ) and other protein to facilitate repair . however , enzymatic inhibition block both process , make it difficult to dissect their distinct functional role . use proteomics and site-directed mutagenesis , we identify a parp1 mutant deficient in auto-modification , yet it retain catalytic activity . this separation-of-function mutant reveal that parp1 auto-modification slows dna replication fork progression but be dispensable for repair factor recruitment . instead , auto-modification promote the timely release of parp1 at dna break site and prevent the formation of replication stress . simultaneous inhibition of fen1 and loss of parp1 auto-modification give rise to synthetic lethality , implicate auto-modification in okazaki fragment processing . our result demonstrate that trapping of parp at dna break impede repair factor accessibility , constitute an important dimension of parp-inhibitor-driven cytotoxicity .

Title: murine hypothalamic destruction with vascular cell apoptosis subsequent to combine administration of human papilloma virus vaccine and pertussis toxin .
Authors: Aratani S, Fujita H, Kuroiwa Y, Usui C, Yokota S, Nakamura I, Nishioka K, Nakajima T
Abstract: vaccination be the most powerful way to prevent human being from contract infectious disease include virus . in the case of the human papillomavirus ( hpv ) vaccine , an unexpectedly novel disease entity , hpv vaccination associate neuro-immunopathetic syndrome ( han ) , have be report and remain to be carefully verify . to elucidate the mechanism of han , we apply a strategy similar to the active experimental autoimmune encephalitis ( eae ) model - one of the most popular animal model use to induce maximum immunological change in the central nervous system . surprisingly , mouse vaccinate with pertussis toxin show neurological phenotype that include low responsiveness of the tail reflex and locomotive mobility . pathological analysis reveal the damage to the hypothalamus and circumventricular region around the third ventricle , and these region contain apoptotic vascular endothelial cell . these data suggest that hpv-vaccinated donners that be susceptible to the hpv vaccine might develop han under certain environmental factor . these result will give u the new insight into the murine pathological model of han and help u to find a way to treat of patient suffer from han .

Title: the definition of cure in colon cancer : a pooled analysis of 15 randomized clinical trial .
Authors: Pastorino A, Liu H, Pederson L, Martelli V, Iveson T, de Gramont A, Alberts SR, George TJ, Yothers G, Harkin A, Labianca R, Taieb J, Schmoll HJ, Twelves C, Wolmark N, Saltz LB, Souglakos I, Goldberg RM, Kerr R, Lonardi S, Yoshino T, Puccini A, André T, Shi Q, Sobrero A
Abstract: the definition of cure in stage ii to iii colon cancer ( cc ) remain unclear due to limitation in conventional end point , which include death and second primary tumor a event . these can complicate communication with patient regard long-term outcome . to distinguish relapse from compete health-related event to classify long-term outcome year after surgery and explore when the incidence of true relapse of the initial cc approach 0 % to define cure in this disease . design , set , this pooled analysis of individual patient-level data from 15 phase 3 randomized clinical trial assess time to cc-related relapse use kaplan-meier and aalen-johansen method , with death and second primary tumor treat a compete risk . cox regression model evaluate prognostic association , stratify by sex , stage , and tumor . patient with stage ii to iii cc who undergo adjuvant chemotherapy be include . all patient have undergone radical surgery for cc and receive adjuvant chemotherapy with a median follow-up of at least 6 year . the adjuvant colon cancer endpoint ( accent ) and the international duration evaluation of adjuvant chemotherapy ( idea ) databases included adjuvant study conduct between 1996 and 2015. data be analyze from february 2022 to june 2025. adjuvant chemotherapy regimen vary across trial , include fluoropyrimidines alone or in combination with oxaliplatin or biologic agent . the primary outcome be time to cc-related recurrence . the predefined threshold for cure be a recurrence risk below 0.5 % . of 35 213 include patient , 19 346 ( 54.9 % ) be male , and the mean ( sd ) age be 60.2 ( 10.8 ) year . the incidence rate of recurrence peak at 6.4 % ( 1993 of 31 373 ) between month 6 and month 12 and decrease continuously until year 10 of follow-up never exceed 0.5 % . recurrence rate appear to increase again after year 10 and peak at 2.0 % during year 12.5 to year 13 , a pattern observe exclusively in the mosaic trial . competing-event analysis reveal that death and second primary tumor inflate the apparent recurrence rate , especially for old patient . the overall cumulative incidence of relapse with death a compete risk be low among female patient ( hazard ratio , 0.58 ; 95 % ci , 0.45-0.76 ; p < .001 ) . in this pooled analysis of phase 3 randomized clinical trial , a recurrence rate less than 0.5 % occur after 6 year from surgery , support a practical definition of cure . recognize this milestone may improve patient communication , guide follow-up duration , and reduce unnecessary long-term surveillance .

Title: zdhhc11-mediated palmitoylation alleviate chondrocyte senescence and serve a a therapeutic target for osteoarthritis .
Authors: Wang K, He W, Gong Z, Gao J, Gao T, Pan N, Wu D, Yang Y, Li Z, Zhao X, Ji M, Shen S
Abstract: osteoarthritis ( oa ) be a whole-joint disorder that interfere with the quality of life in old individual . here we report that zdhhc11 be highly express in articular chondrocytes but be downregulated in the degenerated cartilage of aged mouse and patient with oa . zdhhc11 prevents chondrocyte senescence and promote cartilage anabolism , culminate in an improved oa phenotype . the deletion of zdhhc11 in mouse ( zdhhc11 ( fl/fl ) ) exacerbate oa progression in a destabilized medial meniscus model . specifically , we identify zdhhc11 a a key palmitoyltransferase whose depletion lead to a gnb2-dependent e3 ubiquitin ligase-mediated proteasomal degradation of apod . mechanistically , zdhhc11-mediated palmitoylation alleviate oa progression by deactivate the gata4-p65 signaling pathway . we also propose an original lipid nanoparticle-based platform for zdhhc11 mrna delivery to rejuvenate impaired cartilage by specifically target chondrocytes in vivo . collectively , zdhhc11-dependent palmitoylation be essential for ameliorate oa , and the targeted delivery of zdhhc11 may serve a a promising strategy for future oa treatment .

Title: assessment of meat content and foreign object detection in cattle meatball use ultrasonography , radiography , and electrical impedance tomography imaging .
Authors: Ulum MF, Maryani, Rahminiwati M, Choridah L, Setyawan NH, Ain K, Mukhaiyar U, Pamungkas FA, Jakaria, Garnadi AD
Abstract: meat content and physically hazardous contaminant in the internal section of meatball can not be detect by the naked eye or surface detector . this study be aim at analyze the meat content of cattle meatball and detect foreign object use ultrasonography ( usg ) , digital radiography ( dr ) , and electrical impedance tomography ( eit ) . meatball be produce use four different meat formulation ( 0 % , 25 % , 50 % , and 75 % meat ) and three treatment ( no preservative ( control ) , borax , and formalin preservative ) . cast iron and plastic bead be use a model of foreign object embed in the sample . the echogenicity , opacity , and resistivity value of each sample be evaluate and compare across group . the result show that the shelf life of the control meatballs be short than that of meatball with preservative . the echogenicity and opacity value for the different meat formulation be hypoechoic in usg and grey in dr. usg be able to distinguish between control and preservative-treated meatball but could not differentiate meat content and detect foreign object . conversely , dr effectively assessed meat content and detect iron-based foreign object , while eit show high resistivity value for iron and plastic bead compare to the meatball body .

Title: track clonal evolution during treatment in ovarian cancer use cell-free dna .
Authors: Williams MJ, Vázquez-García I, Tam G, Wu M, Varice N, Havasov E, Shi H, Al-Rawi DH, Satas G, Lees HJ, Lee JJ, Myers MA, Zatzman M, Rusk N, Ali E, Shah RH, Berger MF, Mohibullah N, Lakhman Y, Chi DS, Abu-Rustum NR, Aghajanian C, McPherson A, Zamarin D, Loomis B, Weigelt B, Friedman CF, Shah SP
Abstract: emergence of drug resistance be the main cause of therapeutic failure in patient with high-grade serous ovarian cancer ( hgsoc ) ( 1 ) . to study drug resistance in patient , we develop cloneseq-sv , which combine single-cell whole-genome sequencing ( 2 ) with targeted deep sequencing of clone-specific genomic structural variant in time-series cell-free dna . cloneseq-sv exploit tumour clone-specific structural variant a highly sensitive endogenous cell-free dna marker , enable the relative abundance measurement and evolutionary analysis of co-existing clonal population over the therapeutic time course . here , use this approach , we study 18 patient with hgsoc over a multi-year period from diagnosis to recurrence and show that drug resistance typically arise from selective expansion of a single or small subset of clone present at diagnosis . drug-resistant clone frequently show interpretable and distinctive genomic feature , include chromothripsis , whole-genome doubling , and high-level amplification of oncogene such a ccne1 , rab25 , myc and notch3 . phenotypic analysis of match single-cell rna sequence data ( 3 ) indicate pre-existing and clone-specific transcriptional state such a upregulation of epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition and vegf pathway , link to drug resistance . in one notable case , clone-specific erbb2 amplification affect the efficacy of a secondary targeted therapy with a positive patient outcome . together , our finding indicate that drug-resistant state in hgsoc pre-exist at diagnosis , lead to positive selection and reduced clonal complexity at relapse . we suggest these finding motivate investigation of evolution-informed adaptive treatment regimen to ablate drug resistance in future hgsoc study .

Title: report approval for transcranial electrical stimulation ( rate ) : expert recommendation base on a delphi consensus study .
Authors: Nejati V, Vaziri Z, Antal A, Antonenko D, Behroozmand R, Bestmann S, Brunelin J, Brunoni AR, Carvalho S, Davis NJ, Enticott PG, Fallgatter AJ, Ferrucci R, Fitzgerald PB, Hamada M, Hamilton RH, Hoy KE, Jaberzadeh S, Jamil A, Cohen Kadosh R, Krekelberg B, Laureys S, Romero Lauro LJ, Loo CK, Martin D, Martinotti G, Mondino M, Oliviero A, Pellicciari MC, Plewnia C, Pobric G, De Raedt R, Razza LB, Rocchi L, Salehinejad MA, Khorrami AS, Schecklmann M, Siebner HR, Taylor SF, Vanderhasselt MA, Vanneste S, Vicario CM, Woods AJ, Ziemann U, Nitsche MA
Abstract: transcranial electrical stimulation ( te ) have gain substantial momentum a a research and therapeutic tool ; however , it suffer from challenge relate to reproducibility and quality assessment due to the absence of standardized reporting practice . here we aim to develop a comprehensive and consensus-based checklist for conduct and report te study to enhance the quality of research and report . in this consensus statement , we use a delphi approach conduct across three round and involve 38 expert to identify crucial element require to report in tes study . this consensus-driven approach include the evaluation of the interquartile deviation ( > 1.00 ) , the percentage of positive response ( above 60 % ) and mean importance rating ( < 3 ) , hence ensure the creation of a robust and well-balanced checklist . these metric be utilize to assess both the consensus reach and importance rating for each item . consensus be reach , lead to the retention of 66 out of the initial 70 item . these item be categorize into five group : participant ( 12 item ) , stimulation device ( 9 item ) , electrodes ( 12 item ) , current ( 12 item ) and procedure ( 25 item ) . we then distil a short version of the checklist , which include the 26 item deem essential . the report approval for transcranial electrical stimulation ( rate ) checklist be relevant to those carry out and assess te study , a it provide a structured framework for researcher to consider and report . for reviewer , it can serve a a tool to assess completeness , comprehensiveness and transparency of report . in addition , the rate checklist aim to promote a deep understanding of te and facilitates comparison between study within the field . overall , the rate checklist provide a shared reference point that may improve research quality , foster harmonization in reporting and , ultimately , enhance the interpretability and reproducibility of finding in both research and clinical context .

Title: p23 act a a negative regulator of ferroptosis in nsclc by block gpx4 degradation via chaperone-mediated autophagy .
Authors: Chen J, Peng Y, Zhou M, Che Y, Zhao S, He C, Zhang W, Tian X, Zhang W, Liu Z, Zhou M, Liang G, Huo X, Wang Y, Yu Z, Ma X
Abstract: ferroptosis have be identify a a tumor-inhibiting event in a variety of cancer ; however , it molecular basis in non-small cell lung cancer ( nsclc ) have not be completely elucidate . notably , glutathione peroxidase 4 ( gpx4 ) play a crucial role in ferroptosis . our previous research reveal that prostaglandin e synthase 3 ( p23 ) , a potential transcription factor , play a crucial role in promote cancer progression and metastasis through succinylation . our study reveal a previously unknown antiferroptotic function of p23 . mechanistically , p23 stabilizes gpx4 by competitively bind heat shock cognate 71 kda protein ( hsc70 ) to suppress chaperone-mediated autophagy ( cma ) activity , which subsequently inhibit ferroptosis and accelerate tumor growth . notably , impair p23 succinylation disrupt it interaction with hsc70 , restore cma-mediated gpx4 degradation . collectively , our finding suggest that target p23-regulated cma pathways represent a potentially viable strategy to modulate ferroptosis in nsclc .

Title: epigenetic regulation of chromosomal instability by ezh2 methyltransferase .
Authors: Bai Y, Agustinus AS, Yomtoubian S, Meydan C, McNally DR, Yoffe L, Hubisz MJ, Tranquille M, Pramod S, Hong C, Plasilova ML, Kapoor AR, Singh A, Withers H, Dow LE, Laughney AM, Bhinder B, Elemento O, Melnick AM, Bakhoum SF, Mittal V
Abstract: chromosomal instability ( cin ) and epigenetic reprogramming be central driver of breast cancer progression , yet the mechanism connect them remain elusive . we uncover a direct role of ezh2 histone methyltransferase in promote cin in triple-negative breast cancer ( tnbc ) . across breast cancer , ezh2 expression correlate with copy number alteration , and it catalytic activity be associate with increased cin in metastasis-initiating cell . pharmacological ezh2 inhibition suppress cin , reveal an unexpected vulnerability . integrate chromatin and transcriptome profiling identify tankyrase ( tnks ) , a poly ( adp-ribose ) polymerase , a a direct transcriptional target of ezh2 . mechanistically , ezh2-mediated tnks suppression disrupts cpap ( centrosomal p4.1-associated protein ) , drive centrosome overduplication , multipolar mitosis and exacerbate cin . in vivo , cin suppression be a critical mechanism underlie the anti-metastatic effect of ezh2 inhibition . these finding delineate a previously unrecognized epigenetic mechanism govern cin and establish ezh2 inhibitor a the first therapeutic agent capable of directly suppress cin , underscore the need for trial with metastasis-focused endpoint .

Title: human endogenous retrovirus ervk3-1 characterize a metabolically active and immunosuppressive subtype of liver cancer .
Authors: Wen X, Weng S, Chen M, Lin D, Xue W, Zeng D, Shen J
Abstract: human endogenous retrovirus ( hervs ) , particularly the herv-k family , be increasingly recognize for their role in cancer biology , yet the function of ervk3-1 ( hervk_3p21.31 ) in liver hepatocellular carcinoma ( lihc ) remain largely unexplored . we analyze transcriptomic data from the tcga-lihc cohort to identify differentially express gene ( degs ) between high and low ervk3-1 expression group , follow by functional enrichment analysis ( go , kegg , gsea ) , protein-protein interaction ( ppi ) network construction , and hub gene identification . the immunological relevance of ervk3-1 be assess through tip immune cycle analysis , single-cell rna sequence datasets , and correlation with immune checkpoint expression . immunotherapy responsiveness be evaluate use tide and tcia database . high ervk3-1 expression be associate with enrichment in metabolic and oxidative stress-related pathway , while low expression correlate with cell cycle and dna replication . ppi analysis reveal mitosis-related hub gene ( e.g. , ccnb1 , cdk1 ) . ervk3-1 expression promote early immune cell recruitment but be inversely correlate with late stage of the cancer immunity cycle , include immune infiltration and t-cell killing . single-cell data show high ervk3-1 expression in immunosuppressive subset , alongside positive association with inhibitory immune checkpoint ( e.g. , pd-1 , ctla-4 , tim-3 ) . high ervk3-1 expression also correlate with great immune evasion and reduced immunotherapy responsiveness . ervk3-1 play a multifaceted role in lihc progression , contribute to metabolic reprogramming , immune suppression , and resistance to immunotherapy . these finding highlight ervk3-1 a a potential prognostic biomarker and therapeutic target in liver cancer .

Title: assess pathological response to neoadjuvant therapy in renal cell carcinoma : a systematic review and guideline for sample and report standard from the international neoadjuvant kidney cancer consortium .
Authors: Blackmur JP, van der Mijn JCK, Warren AY, Browning L, Burgers F, Hirsch MS, Kapur P, Mehra R, Rao P, Signoretti S, Bex A, Stewart GD, van Montfoort ML, Jones JO
Abstract: pathological response be a surrogate marker of efficacy of neoadjuvant therapy in various tumour type , but there be no consensus on report pathological response for renal cell carcinoma . we aim to assess the status of pathological response reporting in renal cell carcinoma and develop a recommendation on tissue preparation and response reporting for neoadjuvant treatment . we conduct a systematic review of publication on the pubmed and web of science database to identify manuscript report response to pre-surgical therapy in renal cell carcinoma . 119 eligible paper be identify . only five ( 4 % ) study include detail of how pathological response have be assess . qualitative statement on residual tumour be common ( 55 [ 46 % ] study ) , but only eight ( 7 % ) study use a quantitative assessment of pathological response . guideline for tissue preparation and pathological response reporting be review at an international workshop hold at the netherlands cancer institute in october , 2024 , and far develop through expert discussion . to assess neoadjuvant pathological response , nephrectomy specimen should be sample with the use of a standardised baseline approach with consideration for more extensive sampling . microscopic assessment should quantify the residual viable tumour in 10 % interval and great linear extent . clinical detail , include the neoadjuvant therapy receive , should accompany the pathological assessment . in this systematic review , we describe a standardised method for assessment and report pathological response , initially intend for use in clinical trial or research setting . these guideline will help investigator to assess whether the degree of pathological response be link to survival outcome and will inform future standard reporting practice .

Title: spatial transcriptomic profiling of metastatic renal cell carcinoma identify chemokine-driven macrophage and cd8+ t-cell interaction predictive of immunotherapy response .
Authors: Kalogirou C, Krebs M, Kunz AS, Hahn O, Kübler H, Schwinger M, Hartmann A, Schmieder A, Eckstein M
Abstract: metastatic renal cell carcinoma ( mrcc ) still lack tissue-based biomarkers that predict benefit from first-line immune checkpoint inhibitor ( ici ) regimens . high-resolution spatial transcriptomics can dissect the tumor microenvironment ( tme ) and reveal prognostic niche invisible to bulk assay , offer a path toward precision immunotherapy . formalin-fixed , paraffin-embedded sample from 12 therapy-naïve patient with mrcc treat with ici-based combination be profile with 10x genomics visium and nanostring cosmx . six patient contribute matched metastatic lesion . cell-type deconvolution use robust cell type decomposition with a public single-cell rna-seq reference . clinical outcome ( mean follow-up 16.75 month ) be correlate with spatial feature . validation employ phase 2/3 javelin renal 101 as well a checkmate 010/025 transcriptomic data . spatial transcriptomics uncover pronounced divergence between primary tumor and metastasis in cellular composition and microarchitectural organization . canonical rcc molecular subtypes display marked intrapatient and interpatient spatial heterogeneity , underscoring limitation of bulk classification . five recurrent immune niche emerge across sample . one niche-rich in macrophage and cd8 ( + ) t cell and define by chemokine signaling-was closely associate with objective response in metastatic lesion yet absent or infrequent in matched primary . a gene signature reflect this niche stratify responder within the immuno-oncology ( io ) -treated arm of javelin 101 and checkmate 010/025 trial . on the other hand , signature derive from angiogenic tumor cell-rich niche define responder within the comparator arm ( tyrosine kinase inhibitor/everolimus ) in these trial . metastasis-specific immune niche , rather than primary-tumor characteristic , appear decisive for ici efficacy in mrcc . spatial transcriptomic profiling can identify these clinically relevant microenvironments and generate transferable gene signature , support biomarker-driven patient selection and trial design . integrate spatial tme analysis into future study may accelerate personalized immunotherapy strategy for mrcc .

Title: optimize car t cell therapy for solid tumour : a clinical perspective .
Authors: Li J, Liu C, Zhang P, Shen L, Qi C
