Abstract: chimeric antigen receptor ( car ) t cell therapy be revolutionize the management of haematological malignancy but face particular hurdle in the treatment of solid tumour . in this review , we discuss important advance in refining car t cell therapy to provide practical clinical insight to address these challenge . we describe key strategy , include target antigen selection to enhance efficacy while minimize on-target , off-tumour toxicity ; early apheresis , rapid manufacturing and frontline application to preserve t cell fitness and ensure timely treatment ; lymphodepletion to augment car t cell expansion ; locoregional delivery to maximize local therapeutic concentration and reduce systemic toxicity ; and repeat infusion to prolong therapeutic effect . furthermore , we discuss advanced response evaluation frameworks that will be essential for accurate assessment of the efficacy of car t cell therapy , and we highlight the need for robust toxicity management approach to mitigate severe adverse event . by systematically address these multifaceted challenge , this review provide a comprehensive guide for the optimization of car t cell therapy for solid tumour to enhance both efficacy and safety .

Title: genomically match therapy in advanced solid tumor : the randomized phase 2 rome trial .
Authors: Marchetti P, Curigliano G, Biffoni M, Lonardi S, Scagnoli S, Fornaro L, Guarneri V, De Giorgi U, Ascierto PA, Blandino G, D'Amati G, Aglietta M, Cremolini C, Conte P, Crimini E, Ceracchi M, Pisegna S, Verkhovskaia S, Bordonaro R, Bracarda S, Butturini G, Del Mastro L, DeCensi A, Fabbri A, Fenocchio E, Gori S, Metro G, Pessino A, Pozzessere D, Puglisi F, Tamberi S, Zambelli A, Marino D, Capoluongo E, Cappuzzo F, Cerbelli B, Giannini G, Malapelle U, Mazzuca F, Nuti M, Pruneri G, Simmaco M, Strigari L, Tonini G, Martini N, Botticelli A
Abstract: despite recent advancement demonstrate the potential of tumor-agnostic biomarkers to guide effective therapy , randomize evidence support the clinical superiority of precision oncology approach compare to standard therapy remain limited . the rome trial be a multicenter , randomize , open-label phase 2 study compare tailor treatment ( tt ) to standard of care ( soc ) in patient with advanced solid tumor progress after one or two line of therapy . comprehensive genomic profiling on tissue and blood be perform to identify actionable alteration . overall response rate ( orr ) be the primary endpoint , and progression-free survival ( pfs ) , overall survival ( o ) , time to treatment failure ( ttf ) , time to next treatment ( ttnt ) and safety be the secondary endpoint . between november 2020 and august 2023 , 1,794 patient be screen , 897 be evaluate by the molecular tumor board ( mtb ) and 400 be randomize to tt or soc . tt achieve a significantly high orr ( 17.5 % versus 10 % ; p = 0.0294 ) and improve median pfs ( 3.5 month versus 2.8 month ; hazard ratio = 0.66 ( 0.53-0.82 ) , p = 0.0002 ) . tt also show superior 12-month pfs rate ( 22.0 % versus 8.3 % ) . median o be similar , with a 52 % crossover rate . grade 3/4 adverse event be also similar ( 40 % tt versus 52 % soc ) . these result highlight the potential of tt to improve outcome for patient with diverse actionable genomic alteration . these result also provide relevant evidence support a tumor-agnostic precision oncology strategy and highlight the potential of tt , guide by genomic profiling and mtb recommendation , to significantly improve outcome for patient with diverse actionable genomic alteration . clinicaltrials.gov identifier : nct04591431 .

Title: cost-utility analysis of accelerate and standard strategy for renal replacement therapy initiation .
Authors: Round J, Akpinar I, Yan C, Patel N, van Katwyk S, Montgomery C, Wald R, Bagshaw SM
Abstract: little be know about the long-term cost and outcomes related to strategy for timing of initiation of kidney replacement therapy ( krt ) in critically ill patient with severe acute kidney injury ( aki ) . to estimate the cost-utility and cost-effectiveness of accelerated krt initiation compare with standard krt initiation in critically ill patient with aki . design , set , in this economic evaluation , a state-transition model be develop use data from the standard v accelerate initiation of renal replacement therapy in aki ( starrt-aki ) trial , a multicenter , multinational randomize clinical trial of critically ill patient with severe aki conduct between october 2015 and september 2019. trial data be link to administrative health database in alberta , canada , to estimate cost and long-term clinical outcome . the model include 4 health state : no chronic kidney disease , severe chronic kidney disease , krt dependent , and dead . cost be report in 2024 canadian dollar . data be analyze from february 2022 to november 2024. initiation of krt . the primary outcome for the economic evaluation be cost per quality-adjusted life-year ( qaly ) gain . the qaly be a combined measure of patient quality of life and length of life . expect cost , qalys , incremental cost-effectiveness ratio ( icer ) , and incremental net monetary benefit ( inmb ) be estimate on the basis of 5000 monte carlo simulation . a total of 146 patient from the starrt-aki trial be include in the analysis , with 73 patient ( mean [ sd ] age , 59.67 [ 14.5 ] year ; 52 men [ 71.3 % ] ) randomize to receive accelerated initiation and 73 patient ( mean [ sd ] age , 61.88 [ 12.9 ] year ; 48 men [ 65.8 % ] ) randomize to receive standard initiation . standard initiation be more costly per patient than accelerate initiation ( mean [ sd ] , $ 251 370 [ $ 155 801 ] vs $ 231 518 [ $ 183 302 ] ) but generate more qalys ( mean [ sd ] 7.49 [ 2.03 ] qalys v 6.64 [ 1.76 ] qalys ) . the icer of standard initiation compare with accelerated initiation be $ 23 208 , with an inmb of $ 22 648 ( 95 % credible interval , $ 15 980- $ 29 316 ) when assume a willingness to pay per qaly of $ 50 000. the finding of this economic evaluation suggest that standard krt initiation may be cost-effective in a canadian setting , but this finding be sensitive to postdischarge cost trajectory and regional variation in krt dependence .

Title: genome-wide analysis of brain age identify 59 associate locus and unveils relationship with mental and physical health .
Authors: Jawinski P, Forstbach H, Kirsten H, Beyer F, Villringer A, Witte AV, Scholz M, Ripke S, Markett S
Abstract: neuroimaging and machine learning be advance research into the mechanism of biological age . in this field , 'brain age gap ' have emerge a a promising magnetic resonance imaging-based biomarker that quantify the deviation between an individual 's biological and chronological age of the brain . here we conduct an in-depth genomic analysis of the brain age gap and it relationship with over 1,000 health trait . genome-wide analysis in up to 56,348 individual unveil a heritability of 23-29 % attributable to common genetic variant and highlight 59 associate locus ( 39 novel ) . the lead locus encompasses mapt , encode the tau protein central to alzheimer 's disease . genetic correlation reveal relationship with mental health , physical health , lifestyle and socioeconomic trait , include depressed mood , diabetes , alcohol intake and income . mendelian randomization indicate a causal role of high blood pressure and type 2 diabetes in accelerated brain aging . our study highlight key gene and pathway relate to neurogenesis , immune-system-related process and small gtpase binding , lay the foundation for further mechanistic exploration .

Title: stratify lung adenocarcinoma risk with multi-ancestry polygenic risk score in east asian never-smokers .
Authors: Blechter B, Wang X, Dai J, Karsonaki C, Shi J, Shiraishi K, Choi J, Matsuo K, Chen TY, Hung RJ, Chen K, Shu XO, Kim YT, Choudhury PP, Williams J, Landi MT, Lin D, Zheng W, Yin Z, Zhou B, Wang J, Seow WJ, Song L, Chang IS, Hu W, Chien LH, Cai Q, Hong YC, Kim HN, Wu YL, Wong MP, Richardson BD, Li S, Zhang T, Breeze C, Wang Z, Bassig BA, Kim JH, Albanes D, Wong Sm JY, Shin MH, Chung LP, Yang Y, Zheng H, Dai H, Yatabe Y, Zhang XC, Kim YC, Caporaso NE, Chang J, Ho JCM, Daigo Y, Momozawa Y, Kamatani Y, Kobayashi M, Okubo K, Honda T, Hosgood HD, Kunitoh H, Watanabe SI, Miyagi Y, Matsumoto S, Horinouchi H, Tsuboi M, Hamamoto R, Goto K, Takahashi A, Goto A, Minamiya Y, Hara M, Nishida Y, Takeuchi K, Wakai K, Matsuda K, Murakami Y, Shimizu K, Suzuki H, Saito M, Ohtaki Y, Tanaka K, Wu T, Wei F, Machiela MJ, Kim YH, Oh IJ, Lee VHF, Chang GC, Chen KY, Su WC, Chen YM, Seow A, Park JY, Kweon SS, Gao YT, Liu J, Schwartz AG, Houlston R, Gorlov IP, Wu X, Yang P, Lam S, Tardon A, Chen C, Bojesen SE, Johansson M, Risch A, Bickeböller H, Ji BT, Wichmann HE, Christiani DC, Rennert G, Arnold SM, Brennan P, McKay J, Field JK, Davies MPA, Shete SS, Le Marchand L, Liu G, Andrew AS, Kiemeney LA, Zienolddiny-Narui S, Grankvist K, Cox A, Taylor F, Yuan JM, Lazarus P, Schabath MB, Aldrich MC, Jeon HS, Jiang SS, Chen CH, Hsiao CF, Hu Z, Burdett L, Yeager M, Hutchinson A, Hicks B, Liu J, Berndt SI, Wu W, Wang J, Li Y, Choi JE, Park KH, Sung SW, Kang CH, Wang WC, Xu J, Guan P, Tan W, Yu CJ, Yang G, Sihoe ADL, Choi YY, Park IK, Hung HH, Vermeulen RCH, Cheng I, Wu J, Tsai FY, Chan JKC, Li J, Lin HC, Liu J, Song B, Sawada N, Yamaji T, Wyatt K, Ma H, Zhu M, Wang Y, Qi T, Li X, Ren Y, Chao A, Iwasaki M, Zhu J, Wu G, Chen CY, ScD CC, Yang PC, Stevens VL, Fraumeni JF Jr, Lin K, Walters RG, Chen Z, Chatterjee N, Gorlova OY, Amos CI, Shen H, Hsiung CA, Chanock SJ, Rothman N, Kohno T, Lan Q, Zhang H
Abstract: lung adenocarcinoma ( luad ) in never-smokers be a major public health burden , especially among east asian woman . polygenic risk score ( prss ) be promise for risk stratification but be primarily develop in european-ancestry population . we aim to develop and validate single- and multi-ancestry prss for east asian never-smokers to improve luad risk prediction . prss be develop use genome-wide association study summary statistic from east asian ( 8,002 case ; 20,782 control ) and european ( 2,058 case ; 5,575 control ) population . single-ancestry model include prs-25 , prs-ct , and ldpred2 ; multi-ancestry model include ldpred2+prs-eur128 , prs-csx , and ct-sleb . performance be evaluate in independent east asian data from the female lung cancer consortium ( flcca ) and externally validate in the nanjing lung cancer cohort ( njlcc ) . we assess predictive accuracy via auc , with 10-year and ( age 30-80 ) absolute risk estimate . the best multi-ancestry pr , use east asian and european data via ct-sleb ( clump and thresholding , super learning , empirical bayes ) , outperform the best east asian-only pr ( ldpred2 ; auc = 0.629 , 95 % 0.618,0.641 ) , achieve an auc of 0.640 ( 95 % ci : 0.629,0.653 ) and odds ratio of 1.71 ( 95 % ci : 1.61,1.82 ) per sd increase . njlcc validation confirm robust performance ( auc =0.649 , 95 % 0.623 , 0.676 ) . the top 20 % pr group have a 3.92-fold high luad risk than the bottom 20 % . far , the top 5 % pr group reach a 6.69 % lifetime absolute risk . notably , this group reach the average population 10-year luad risk at age 50 ( 0.42 % ) by age 41 , nine year earlier . multi-ancestry pr approach enhance luad risk stratification in east asian never-smokers , with consistent external validation , suggest future clinical utility .
Journal: Journal of the National Cancer Institute

Title: predictive factor for early super response to bimekizumab in 341 patient with psoriasis-a 24-week short-term multicenter real-life experience .
Authors: Çetinarslan T, Mergen MA, Türel Ermertcan A, Bülbül Başkan E, Yazıcı S, An İ, Gürel G, Adışen E, Demirbaş A, Dursun R, Aslancan B, Topkarcı Z, Esen M, Türkoğlu Z, Canat D, Kandiş S, Kılıç A, Ertam Sağduyu İ, Yazıcı EI, Gökyayla E, Demirel Öğüt N, Karstarlı Bakay ÖS, Temiz SA, Erdemir VA, Hapa FA, Aydin Ö, Hızlı P, Solak B, Bütüner M, Aytekin S, Albayrak H, Daye M, Türsen Ü, Sarıbaş Yıldırım AN, Cengiz Özyurt B
Abstract: purpose/the efficacy of bimekizumab be show in moderate to severe plaque psoriasis . the aim of this study be to investigate the early super responder ( esr ) profile ( at week 4 ) to bimekizumab . we perform a multicenter retrospective study in 20 dermatology outpatient clinic in turkey . adult patient with moderate-to-severe psoriasis who be under bimekizumab for at least 12 week be enrol . a total of 341 adult patient be include . 136 have nail psoriasis ( 39.9 % ) , 148 have psoriatic arthritis ( psa ) ( 43.4 % ) , 223 ( 65.4 % ) have at least one difficult-to-treat area involvement , 155 ( 45.5 % ) be bio-naïve , 110 ( 32.5 % ) have ≥ 2 biologics history . at week 4 , pasi75 be achieve in 144 patient ( 49.8 % ) , pasi90 be achieve in 88 patient ( 30.4 % ) , pasi100 be achieve in 51 patient ( 17.6 % ) . family history ( p = 0.041 ) , palmoplantar involvement ( p = 0.008 ) , psa ( p = 0.097 ) , and bio-experienced status ( p = 0.060 ) be associate with low odds of be an esr , whereas each 1-point increase in baseline pasi be associate with significantly low odds of esr ( p < 0.001 ) . gender , age , disease duration , history of conventional systemic treatment , and presence of any comorbidity be not significantly associate with the likelihood of be an esr ( all p > 0.05 ) . bimekizumab be the effective treatment in both bio-naïve and bio-experienced patient ; however , it may have a more rapid onset of action in bionaive patient . further study be need on the long-term efficacy and safety data of bimekizumab .

Title: a systematic review and meta-analysis of the treatment modality available for child afflict from cystic fibrosis .
Authors: Alruwaili TAM, Alanazi MF, Alruwaili BF, Fayed HK, Elsaeed M, Alnazi TD, Aljared A, Alanazi AMW, Alanazi AM, Alsharari SD, Alshammari A, Saad K
Abstract: this study aim to evaluate the efficacy of different treatment modality in child with cystic fibrosis ( cf ) and determine the superiority of specific treatment modality . a comprehensive literature search be conduct use different search string across multiple database , include pubmed , cochrane library , embase , wos , scopus , cinahl , psycinfo , and google scholar , up to october 2024. randomized control trial ( rcts ) , case-control study and cohort study be include . the triple therapy indicate a significant reduction in cf-related complication , with an or of 0.29 and an rr of 0.54 , accompany by low heterogeneity ( i² = 0 % for both ) . physiotherapy and pulmonary exercise also yield a beneficial effect , with an or of 0.24 and an rr of 0.49 , without heterogeneity . in contrast , nutritional intervention reveal non-significant outcome ( or = 6.91 and rr = 2.63 ) , suggest the need to re-evaluate these strategy . ivacaftor alone do not achieve statistical significance ( or = 0.34 and rr = 0.58 ) , and the confidence interval be broad , indicate uncertainty in the effect estimate . azithromycin exhibit a positive effect on cf management , with an or of 2.37 and an rr of 1.54. the overall pool or across all treatment be 0.71 , with an rr not compute due to substantial heterogeneity ( i²=93 % ) . the study underscore the effectiveness of certain treatment , such a triple therapy and physiotherapy exercise , for cf while highlight the considerable variability in treatment outcome . notably , nutritional intervention need to be carefully reassess . the finding emphasize integrate physiotherapy and targeted pharmacological intervention into standard cf management tailor to individual need .

Title: very high prevalence of nonoptimally control traditional risk factor at the onset of cardiovascular disease .
Authors: Lee H, Huang X, Khan SS, Son D, Lee HH, Kim EJ, Lloyd-Jones DM, Kim HC, Greenland P
Abstract: recent study suggest that coronary heart disease ( chd ) may frequently occur in the absence of traditional cardiovascular disease ( cvd ) risk factor . however , it be unclear whether this could reflect missed clinical diagnosis or subthreshold nonoptimal risk factor exposure precede chd , and whether similar pattern be observe for heart failure ( hf ) or stroke . the purpose of this study be to determine the antecedent occurrence of nonoptimal level of 4 traditional risk factor ( blood pressure [ bp ] , cholesterol , glucose , and tobacco smoking ) before first chd , hf , or stroke . we analyze 2 population-based prospective cohort : knhis ( korean national health insurance service ) ( n = 9,341,100 ; baseline age ≥20 year ; follow-up , 2009-2022 ) and mesa ( multi-ethnic study of atherosclerosis ) ( n = 6,803 ; baseline age 45-84 year ; follow-up , 2000-2019 ) . among individual who develop incident chd , hf , or stroke during follow-up , we determine the prevalence of ≥1 traditional risk factor above optimal level-systolic bp ≥120 mm hg or diastolic bp ≥80 mm hg or bp-lowering treatment ; total cholesterol ≥200 mg/dl or lipid-lowering treatment ; fast glucose ≥100 mg/dl or diagnosis of diabetes or glucose-lowering treatment ; or past or current smoking-at any visit before cvd . analysis be base on 601,025 and 1,188 cvd event in knhis and mesa , respectively . prevalence of ≥1 nonoptimal risk factor be high ( 99.7 % and 99.6 % ) before chd , with similar pattern before hf ( 99.4 % and 99.5 % ) and stroke ( 99.3 % and 99.5 % ) in both knhis and mesa , respectively . prevalence of ≥1 risk factor before cvd be consistently high ( > 99 % ) across age group in both men and woman , with the low proportion observe for hf and stroke ( > 95 % ) when occur at age < 60 year in woman . prevalence of ≥2 risk factor be also common ( 93.2 % to 97.2 % ) before cvd event . in this binational study of 2 prospective cohort , the presence of nonoptimal level of ≥1 traditional risk factor be nearly universal before cvd . these result not only challenge claim that chd event frequently occur without antecedent major risk factor but also demonstrate that other cvd event , include hf or stroke , rarely occur in the absence of nonoptimal traditional risk factor , highlight the importance of primordial prevention effort .
Journal: Journal of the American College of Cardiology

Title: bacterial rna promotes proteostasis through inter-tissue communication in c. elegans .
Authors: Kyriakakis E, Medde C, Ritz D, Fucile G, Schmidt A, Spang A
Abstract: life expectancy have be increase over the last decade , which be not match by an increase in healthspan . besides genetic composition , environmental and nutritional factor influence both health- and lifespan . diet be think to be a major factor for healthy ageing . here , we show that dietary rna specie improve proteostasis in c. elegans . inherent bacterial-derived double strand rna reduces protein aggregation in a c. elegans muscle proteostasis model . this beneficial effect depend on low level of systemic selective autophagy , the rnai machinery in the germline , even when the rna be deliver through ingestion in the intestine and the integrity of muscle cell . our data suggest a requirement of inter-organ communication between the intestine , the germline and muscle . our result demonstrate that bacterial-derived rna elicit a systemic response in c. elegans , which protect the animal from protein aggregation during ageing , which might extend healthspan .

Title: decipher the carcinogenic role of benzo [ a ] pyrene in glioblastoma : insight from network toxicology , single-cell transcriptomics , and mendelian randomization .
Authors: Yi L, Wang W, Sun Z, Chen Y, Xiong Z, Ma L, Ye W, Li X
Abstract: benzo [ a ] pyrene ( bap ) be a known environmental carcinogen link to multiple tumor , but it role in glioblastoma ( gbm ) remain poorly understood . this study aim to explore bap 's tumorigenic mechanism in gbm through an integrated approach combine network toxicology , single-cell transcriptomics , mendelian randomization , and bibliometric analysis . bap target gene be predict use chembl , sea , and pharmmapper , and gbm-related gene be retrieve from genecards , omim , and ttd . overlap gene be use to construct a protein-protein interaction network in cytoscape . molecular docking and molecular dynamic simulation be perform to assess bap-target interaction . single-cell rna-seq data ( gse131928 ) be analyze to profile gene expression in gbm subpopulation . mendelian randomization assess causal relationship between core gene and gbm risk , and finding be validate in vitro . bibliometric analysis track research trend on these gene . 31 overlap gene be identify . tp53 be highly express in mes-like and ac-like malignant cell as well a cd8⁺ tex cell . mr reveal a significant inverse association between tp53 expression and gbm risk ( or = 0.13 , 95 % 0.04-0.47 , p = 0.002 ) . dock and simulation show strong bap-tp53 binding , confirm by in vitro experiment . bibliometrics indicate that tp53 research in gbm have shift from basic mechanism to clinical translation . bap may drive gbm by target tp53 , offer insight for gbm prevention and therapy .

Title: mosunetuzumab plus polatuzumab vedotin in transplant-ineligible refractory/relapsed large b-cell lymphoma : primary result of the phase 3 sunmo trial .
Authors: Budde LE, Zhang H, Kim WS, Maruyama D, Rego EM, Norasetthada L, Hong H, Ozcan M, Jeon YW, Cordeiro de Farias DL, Fogliatto LM, Pavlovsky A, Goto H, Olszewski AJ, Shah N, Hu B, Yin S, Wu H, To I, Ead WS, Ashby J, Janousek M, Pham S, Wang J, Kwan A, Batlevi CL, Wei MC, Westin J
Abstract: prognosis for patient with refractory/relapsed large b-cell lymphoma ( lbcl ) consider ineligible for curative-intent therapy be poor . the combination of mosunetuzumab , a t-cell-engaging bispecific antibody , and polatuzumab vedotin , an antibody-drug conjugate , ( mosun-pola ) , represent a novel fixed-duration outpatient therapy . in the phase 3 sunmo trial , patient with refractory/relapsed lbcl who be ineligible for autologous stem cell transplant be randomize ( 2:1 ) to receive mosun-pola or rituximab , gemcitabine , and oxaliplatin ( r-gemox ) . dual primary endpoint be centrally-assessed overall response rate and progression-free survival . overall survival be a key secondary endpoint . a total of 208 patient be randomize to receive mosun-pola ( n=138 ) or r-gemox ( n=70 ) . at a median follow-up of 23.2 month , the primary analysis of sunmo demonstrate that the median progression-free survival be significantly longer with mosun-pola than with r-gemox ( 11.5 month [ 95 % confidence interval ( ci ) , 5.6-18 ] v 3.8 month [ 95 % ci , 2.9-4.1 ] ; hazard ratio for progression or death , 0.41 [ 95 % ci , 0.3-0.6 ] ; p < 0.0001 ) . overall response rate be significantly great with mosun-pola versus r-gemox ( 70 % vs 40 % ; p < 0.0001 ) , with a complete response rate of 51 % and 24 % , respectively . in the mosun-pola group , the rate of grade ≥2 cytokine release syndrome and usage of tocilizumab occur in less than 5 % of patient , and patient-reported outcome be improve compare with r-gemox . mosun-pola demonstrate superior efficacy verus r-gemox , with significant improvement in both overall response rate and progression-free survival , and infrequent cytokine release syndrome event with a manageable safety profile . ( fund by f. hoffmann-la roche ltd ; clinicaltrials.gov , nct05171647 ) .
Journal: Journal of clinical oncology : official journal of the American Society of

Title: anesthesia issue in central nervous system disorder .
Authors: Mandal PK, Saharan S, Penna O, Fodale V
Abstract: every year , million of people affect by disorder of the central nervous system ( cns ) undergo various diagnostic , therapeutic and surgical procedure require administration of anesthetic agent . anesthetic exert their anesthetic , amnesic and analgesic effect by act on multiple neuronal membrane protein in the cns . while some of the causal anesthetic target have be identify , a large number of anesthetic target remain unknown . the consequent longterm effect of anesthetic agent on expression of these various molecular target have be implicate in mediate potentially long-lasting adverse effect . recent work suggest that the effect of general anesthetic may not be entirely reversible , with animal study demonstrate persistent change in cns protein expression post recovery from anesthesia . age-associated or disease-induced alteration in the cns can profoundly alter multiple aspect of brain structure , biochemistry , and function . such maladaptive change in the brain can render it increasingly vulnerable to the effect of various anesthetic . the selection of appropriate anesthesia drug and protocol be mandatory , especially in individual with pre-existing cns disorder , so a to maximize anesthesia efficiency , avoid occurrence of adverse event , and ensure patient safety . this review aim to summarize and consider the effect and potential risk of commonly use anesthetic agent in patient with compromised cns function . we provide a comprehensive review of the establish as well a the implicated effect of anesthetic agent on the elderly as well a on the pathology and progression of common neurological condition .

Title: multiscale proteomic modeling reveals protein network drive alzheimer 's disease pathogenesis .
Authors: Wang E, Yu K, Cao J, Wang M, Katsel P, Song WM, Wang Z, Li Y, Wang X, Wang Q, Xu P, Yu G, Zhu L, Geng J, Habibi P, Qian L, Tuck T, Li A, Tcw J, Roussos P, Brennand KJ, Haroutunian V, Johnson ECB, Seyfried NT, Levey AI, Bennett DA, Peng J, Cai D, Zhang B
Abstract: the molecular mechanism underlie the pathogenesis of alzheimer 's disease ( ad ) , the most common form of dementia , remain poorly understood . proteomics offer a crucial approach to elucidate ad pathogenesis , a alteration in protein expression be more directly link to phenotypic outcome than change at the genetic or transcriptomic level . in this study , we develop multiscale proteomic network model for ad by integrate large-scale match proteomic and genetic data from brain region vulnerable to the disease . these model reveal detailed protein interaction structure and identify putative key driver protein ( kdps ) involve in ad progression . notably , the network analysis uncovers an ad-associated subnetwork that capture glia-neuron interaction . ahnak , a top kdp in this glia-neuron network , be experimentally validate in human induce pluripotent stem cell ( ipsc ) -based model of ad . this systematic identification of dysregulated protein regulatory network and kdps lay down a foundation for develop innovative therapeutic strategy for ad .

Title: disease relapse , all-cause mortality , and adverse event associate with long-acting injectable antipsychotic versus oral antipsychotic in old people with schizophrenia in hong kong : a population-based within-subject analysis .
Authors: Wei Y, Yan VKC, Castle DJ, Huang C, Deng EK, Leung SM, Yiu HHE, Lee KJ, Lui SSY, Ng VWS, Hayes JF, Lai FTT, Wang H, Yan EWC, Chan EW
Abstract: old individual ( age ≥65 year ) with schizophrenia be at increased risk of treatment non-adherence due to cognitive decline and complex polypharmacy . use of long-acting injectable ( lai ) antipsychotic in this population have not be systematically investigate . we aim to compare risk of disease relapse , all-cause mortality , and adverse event associate with lai versus oral antipsychotic among old people with schizophrenia . in this population-based within-subject analysis , we use territory-wide electronic health record from the clinical database analysis and report system of the hong kong hospital authority . individual diagnose with schizophrenia ( icd-9-cm code 295 ) in inpatient , outpatient , or emergency department setting between jan 1 , 1993 , and dec 31 , 2023 , be identify , and people age 65 year and old who be prescribe lai or oral antipsychotic between jan 1 , 2004 , and dec 31 , 2023 , be consider for inclusion . individual with incomplete demographic information be exclude . the primary outcome be disease relapse , define a hospital admission for schizophrenia . the secondary outcome comprise all-cause mortality and adverse event , include cardiovascular hospital admission , extrapyramidal symptom , acute liver injury , and acute kidney injury , which be identify use icd-9-cm code or laboratory test . a self-controlled case series study use poisson regression be conduct to compare the risk of disease relapse and adverse event between the treatment period of lai and oral antipsychotic . an individual-stratified cox regression be perform for all-cause mortality . time-varying confounders , include age , season , class of antipsychotic , covid-19 stringency index , and concomitant treatment with antidepressant , benzodiazepine or z-drugs , mood stabiliser , and antiparkinsonian drug , be adjust for . people with lived experience of schizophrenia be not involve in the design or conduct of the study . of 24 985 old individual with schizophrenia , 4696 ( 18·8 % ) be prescribe lai or oral antipsychotic . 10 655 ( 42·6 % ) of 24 985 individual be male and 14 330 ( 57·4 % ) be female . data on ethnicity be not available . compare with oral antipsychotic , lai antipsychotic be associate with statistically significantly low risk of hospital admission for schizophrenia ( incidence rate ratio [ irr ] 0·71 [ 95 % ci 0·64-0·78 ] , p < 0·0001 ) and all-cause mortality ( hazard ratio [ hr ] 0·23 [ 95 % ci 0·12-0·44 ] , p < 0·0001 ) . no statistically significant difference be find in cardiovascular hospital admission , acute liver injury , and acute kidney injury . lai antipsychotic be associate with increased risk of extrapyramidal symptom ( irr 2·17 [ 1·24-3·80 ] , p=0·0068 ) , but only with first-generation ( 2·86 [ 1·41-5·84 ] , p=0·0038 ) not second-generation lai antipsychotic . in old individual with schizophrenia , lai antipsychotic be associate with low risk of disease relapse and mortality , without increase risk of adverse event , than oral antipsychotic , except for elevated risk of extrapyramidal symptom specifically relate to first-generation lai antipsychotic . overall , lai antipsychotic , especially second-generation medication , could be more broadly consider for long-term use among this population , particularly at an early stage of disease . national natural science foundation of china .

Title: decode alzheimer 's disease at the cellular level reveals promise combination therapy .
Authors: Coleman K, Tatonetti NP
Abstract: alzheimer 's disease ( ad ) have long resist effective treatment due to it pathological heterogeneity and cell-type-specific regulatory change . in this issue of cell , li et al . leverage single-cell rna sequencing and drug repurposing to propose a promising combination therapy , validate through real-world evidence and mouse model , that target multiple ad-relevant cell type .

Title: microtubule architecture connect amot stability to yap/taz mechanotransduction and hippo signalling .
Authors: Vanni G, Citron A, Suli A, Contessotto P, Caire R, Gandin A, Mantovan G, Zanconato F, Brusatin G, Di Palma M, Peirano E, Pozzer LS, Albanese C Jr, Steiner RA, Cordenonsi M, Panciera T, Piccolo S
Abstract: cellular mechanotransduction be a key informational system , yet it mechanism remain elusive . here we unveil the role of microtubule in mechanosignalling , operate downstream of subnuclear f-actin and nuclear envelope mechanic . upon mechanical activation , microtubule reorganize from a perinuclear cage into a radial array nucleate by centrosome . this structural rearrangement trigger degradation of amot protein , which we identify a key mechanical rheostat that sequester yap/taz in the cytoplasm . amot be stable in mechano-off but degrade in mechano-on cell state , where microtubule allow amot rapid transport to the pericentrosomal proteasome in complex with dynein/dynactin . this process ensure swift control of yap/taz function in response to change in cell mechanic , with experimental loss of amot protein render cell insensitive to mechanical modulation . ras/rtk oncogene promote yap/taz-dependent tumorigenesis by corrupt this amot-centred mechanical checkpoint . notably , the hippo pathway fine-tunes mechanotransduction : lats kinase phosphorylate amot , shield it from degradation , thereby indirectly restrain yap/taz . thus , amot protein stability serve a a hub link cytoskeletal reorganization and hippo signalling to yap/taz mechanosignalling .

Title: nlrp3 inflammasome and hearing loss : from mechanism to therapy .
Authors: Murillo-Cuesta S, Seoane E, Cervantes B, Zubeldia JM, Varela-Nieto I
Abstract: the nlrp3 inflammasome , a key component of the innate immune system , have emerge a a central mediator of inflammation-driven sensorineural hearing loss ( snhl ) . this review synthesize current evidence on it involvement across a wide spectrum of auditory pathology , include genetic syndrome such a cap and autosomal dominant deafness ( dfna ) 34 , as well a noise-induced , age-related , drug-induced , and viral hearing loss . dysregulated activation of nlrp3 in the cochlea lead to the release of proinflammatory cytokine ( il-1b and il-18 ) and pyroptotic cell death , contribute to irreversible cochlear damage . experimental study have demonstrate that pharmacological inhibition of nlrp3 via agent such a mcc950 , oridonin and tranylcypromine can preserve auditory function . gain-of-function mutation in the nlrp3 gene be frequently associate with both syndromic and nonsyndromic hearing loss , and animal model express these mutation replicate cochlear inflammation and hearing deficit , validate their pathogenic role . clinically , il-1b signal blocker such a anakinra and canakinumab have show efficacy in caps patient , stabilize or improve hear outcome . emerge selective nlrp3 inhibitor , include dapansutrilo and mcc950 , be progress through early-phase clinical trial . additionally , natural compound such a piceatannol and oridonin have demonstrate otoprotective effect in preclinical model of noise- and drug-induced hearing loss . collectively , these finding position the nlrp3 inflammasome a a promising therapeutic target for snhl . future translational research should focus on validate nlrp3-targeting compound in human trial , identify biomarkers for early diagnosis , and explore combination therapy that integrate anti-inflammatory , antioxidant , and regenerative strategy . target nlrp3 may ultimately redefine treatment paradigm for prevent or halt progressive hearing loss .

Title: influence of pokémon go on physical activity : study and implication .
Authors: Althoff T, White RW, Horvitz E
Abstract: physical activity help people maintain a healthy weight and reduce the risk for several chronic disease . although this knowledge be widely recognize , adult and child in many country around the world do not get recommended amount of physical activity . although many intervention be find to be ineffective at increase physical activity or reach inactive population , there have be anecdotal report of increased physical activity due to novel mobile game that embed game play in the physical world . the most recent and salient example of such a game be pokémon go , which have reportedly reach ten of million of user in the united state and worldwide . the objective of this study be to quantify the impact of pokémon go on physical activity . we study the effect of pokémon go on physical activity through a combination of signal from large-scale corpus of wearable sensor data and search engine log for 32,000 microsoft band user over a period of 3 month . pokémon go player be identify through search engine query and physical activity be measure through accelerometer . we find that pokémon go lead to significant increase in physical activity over a period of 30 day , with particularly engage user ( ie , those make multiple search query for detail about game usage ) increase their activity by 1473 step a day on average , a more than 25 % increase compare with their prior activity level ( p < .001 ) . in the short time span of the study , we estimate that pokémon go have add a total of 144 billion step to u physical activity . furthermore , pokémon go have be able to increase physical activity across men and woman of all age , weight status , and prior activity level show this form of game lead to increase in physical activity with significant implication for public health . in particular , we find that pokémon go be able to reach low activity population , whereas all 4 lead mobile health apps study in this work largely draw from an already very active population . mobile apps combine game play with physical activity lead to substantial short-term activity increase and , in contrast to many exist intervention and mobile health apps , have the potential to reach activity-poor population . future study be need to investigate potential long-term effect of these application .

Title: sensory neuron drive pancreatic cancer progression through glutamatergic neuron-cancer pseudo-synapses .
Authors: Ren L, Liu C, Çifcibaşı K, Ballmann M, Rammes G, Mota Reyes C, Tokalov S, Klingl A, Grünert J, Goyal K, Neckel PH, Mattheus U, Schoeps B, Yıldızhan SE, Sezerman OU, Cevik NC, Sever EA, Karakas D, Safak O, Steiger K, Muckenhuber A, Görgülü K, Chen Z, Zhang J, Ye L, Maula Ali MI, Tiwari VK, Romanyuk N, Giesert F, Saur D, Rad R, Schmid RM, Algül H, Krüger A, Friess H, Ceyhan GO, Istvanffy R, Demir IE
Abstract: cancer thrive on neuronal input . here , we demonstrate the presence of pseudo-synaptic connection between sensory nerve ending and cancer cell in an extracerebral cancer , i.e. , pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma ( pdac ) . these synaptic site exhibit a selective enrichment of the glutamatergic n-methyl-d-aspartate receptor ( nmda ) receptor subunit nmdar2d ( grin2d ) on the cancer cell , which turn pdac cell responsive to neuron-derived glutamate and promotes tumor growth and spread . intriguingly , neuron transform a subset of co-cultured pdac cell into calcium-responsive cell via grin2d-type glutamate receptor at the neuron-cancer pseudo-synapses . we find that the expression of this subunit be due to the increase glutamate availability provide by sensory innervation in a neurotrophic feedforward loop . moreover , interference with the glutamate-grin2d signaling at these neuron-cancer pseudo-synapses markedly improve survival in vivo . this discovery of peripheral cancer-neuron pseudo-synapses may provide an opportunity for cancer-neuroscience-instructed oncological therapy .

Title: durvalumab , carboplatin , and etoposide in patient who be treatment-naive with extensive-stage small-cell lung cancer and poor performance status ( nej045a ) : a single-arm phase 2 trial .
Authors: Asao T, Saida Y, Watanabe S, Kisohara A, Kishi K, Morita R, Nakagawa T, Tsukita Y, Furuya N, Miyawaki T, Ishikawa N, Yamada T, Tanaka T, Morita S, Kikuchi T, Maemondo M, Kobayashi K
Abstract: treat patient with extensive-stage small-cell lung cancer ( sclc ) with poor performance status pose considerable challenge . we aim to evaluate the combination of an immune checkpoint inhibitor with platinum-based therapy in this population . this open-label , single-arm phase 2 nej045a trial enrol untreated patient with extensive-stage sclc with performance status 2 or 3. participant receive four cycle of durvalumab , carboplatin , and etoposide , follow by durvalumab maintenance . a dose adjustment strategy be use , with initial reduction in carboplatin-etoposide dosage , subsequently adjust base on adverse event , allow for potential escalation . the primary endpoint be tolerability , assess by the proportion of patient complete induction therapy . a key secondary endpoint be 1-year survival rate . this trial be register at the japan registry of clinical trial ( jrcts031200319 ) and have be complete . between april 8 , 2021 , and oct 3 , 2023 , 57 patient ( performance status 2 n=43 and performance status 3 n=14 ) be enrol with a median age of 73·5 year ( iqr 69·0-77·5 ) , 44 ( 79 % ) of 56 be male . 26 ( 67 % ; 80 % ci 55·2-76·7 ; p < 0·0001 ) of 39 patient with performance status 2 and five ( 50 % ; 26·7-73·3 ; p=0·0088 ) of ten with performance status 3 complete induction therapy , exceed the pre-specified threshold . grade 3 or high adverse event occur in 52 ( 93 % ) of 56 patient , and 12 ( 21 % ) of 56 discontinued due to adverse event . the 1-year survival rate be 43·4 % ( 80 % ci 34·1-53·1 ) overall ( p < 0·0001 ) , 50·0 % ( 39·1-60·9 ) in performance status 2 ( p < 0·0001 ) , and 18·2 % ( 5·0-41·5 ) in performance status 3. durvalumab , carboplatin , and etoposide show tolerability and promise efficacy a a first-line treatment for patient with untreated extensive-stage sclc with poor performance status , support the integration of immune checkpoint inhibitor in this therapeutically challenging population . astrazeneca kk .

Title: immunometabolic reprogramming of macrophage by gut microbiota-derived cadaverine control colon inflammation .
Authors: de Oliveira Formiga R, Li Q, Zhao Y, Campos Ribeiro MA, Guarino-Vignon P, Fatouh R, Dubois L, Creusot L, Puchois V, Amouyal S, Alonso Salgueiro I, Bredon M, Chollet L, Ledent T, Scandola C, Auger JP, Danne C, Krönke G, Tkacz E, Emond P, Chevreux G, Pham HP, Pontoizeau C, Lamaziere A, Argüello RJ, Rolhion N, Michel ML, Wai T, Sokol H
Abstract: cadaverine be a polyamine produce by the gut microbiota with link to health and disease , notably inflammatory bowel disease ( ibd ) . here , we show that cadaverine shape monocyte-macrophage immunometabolism in a context- and concentration-dependent fashion to impact macrophage functionality . at baseline , cadaverine be take up via l-lysine transporter and activate the thioredoxin system , while during inflammation , cadaverine signal through aconitate decarboxylase 1 ( acod1 ) -itaconate . both pathway induce activation of transcription factor , nuclear factor erythroid 2-related factor 2 ( nrf2 ) , which support mitochondrial respiration and promote immunoregulatory macrophage polarization . conversely , under high concentration , cadaverine act via histamine 4 receptor , lead to glycolysis-driven inflammation and pro-inflammatory function in macrophage . likewise , cadaverine exhibit paradoxical effect in experimental colitis , either protective or detrimental , evoke opposite fate on macrophage depend on level dictate by enterobacteriaceae . in ibd patient , elevate cadaverine correlate with high flare risk . our finding implicate cadaverine a a microbiota-derived metabolite manipulating macrophage energy metabolism with consequence in intestinal inflammation and implication for ibd pathogenesis .

Title: neutrophil-to-albumin ratio : a novel predictor of osteoporosis in rheumatoid arthritis .
Authors: Zhang Y, He Z, Li K, Wu Q, Wang S, Liu M, Liu Q, Xu Q, Kong X, Lin C
Abstract: osteoporosis ( op ) frequently coexist with rheumatoid arthritis ( ra ) , but validate predictor of early risk be not extensively study . this study seek to examine the relationship between the neutrophil percentage-to-albumin ratio ( npar ) and the likelihood of develop ra-related op ( ra-op ) . after investigate the relationship between the npar and ra-op in the clinical retrospective study , we far validate this association use data from the national health and nutrition examination survey ( nhanes ) database ( 2005-2020 cycle ) . this retrospective study enrol 718 ra patient from the rheumatology department of the first affiliated hospital of guangzhou university of chinese medicine between january 2020 and december 2024. patient be categorize into low-npar ( < 1.7598 ) and high-npar ( ≥1.7598 ) group base on the median npar . extracted clinical data encompass demographic characteristic , comorbidities , serological marker , and other laboratory parameter . preliminary univariate and multivariate logistic regression analysis assess potential association between npar and ra-op , multi-model adjust logistic regression be subsequently apply to evaluate the independent association , subgroup analysis examine consistency across demographic and clinical stratum , receiver operating characteristic ( roc ) curve analysis assess npar 's diagnostic performance , and then restrict cubic spline ( rcs ) visualize potential non-linear relationship . finally use the identical statistical framework , we validate finding within the nhanes cohort . the high-npar group exhibit significantly high op incidence than the low-npar group ( 39.0 % vs. 26.5 % ; p < 0.001 ) . after full adjustment ( model 4 ) , npar remain independently associate with increased ra-op risk a a categorical variable ( high vs. low adjust or = 1.70 ( 95 % 1.01~2.88 ) ; p = 0.049 ) . subgroup analyse demonstrate no significant interaction effect ( p-interaction > 0.05 ) except for disease duration . the roc curve show an area under the curve ( auc ) of 0.58 ( 95 % 0.53~0.63 ) and npar cut-off of 1.886. the covariate-adjusted rcs indicate a linear dose-response relationship ( p overall=0.033 ; p nonlinearity=0.168 ) . nhanes cohort analysis independently validate both the npar-ra-op association and it linear characteristic . npar , serve a a novel composite biomarker integrate neutrophil-mediated inflammation and nutritional status ( via albumin ) , independently predict op risk in ra . it derivation from routine clinical parameter render npar a readily deployable , cost-effective tool for op risk stratification in clinical practice .

Title: targeted clearance of extracellular tau use aptamer-armed monocyte alleviate neuroinflammation in mouse with alzheimer 's disease .
Authors: Zhuo Y, Lu Y, Zhu Y, Wen N, Zou G, Lu H, Pei X, Zhang Y, Zhang Q, Wang X, Zhang W, Zhang Q, Wang Z, Xie S, Li CQ, Tan W, Qiu L
Abstract: extracellular tau determine the progression of alzheimer 's disease , yet therapeutic strategy target it be hinder by poor brain delivery and limited clearance . here we develop a tau-clearing cell therapy base on monocyte functionalized with a high-affinity tau-specific aptamer . the aptamer be covalently conjugate to the surface of monocyte ( derive from bone marrow leucocyte and culture under monocyte-inducing condition ) via bioorthogonal chemistry without affect their viability or function . upon intravenous administration in mice express mutant and disease-relevant human tau , the engineered monocyte actively cross the blood-brain barrier and accumulate in tau-rich brain region such a the hippocampus and striatum . they efficiently phagocytosed extracellular tau , lead to a significant reduction in tau burden . a a result , glial activation be suppress , neuroinflammation be alleviate , and neuronal and mitochondrial integrity be preserve . long-term treatment improved memory and spatial learning , without induce toxicity or behavioural side effect . these result demonstrate that aptamer-guided monocyte can achieve target delivery , effective clearance and sustained neuroprotection , offer a promising strategy for therapeutic intervention in alzheimer 's disease .

Title: reason for discontinuation of obesity pharmacotherapy with semaglutide or tirzepatide in clinical practice .
Authors: Gasoyan H, Butsch WS, Casacchia NJ, Schulte R, Criswell V, Fox J, Renner H, Le P, Alpert J, Rothberg MB
Abstract: this study aim to characterize the reason for treatment discontinuation with injectable semaglutide or tirzepatide for obesity in regular clinical practice . this cross-sectional study use electronic health record data between january 2022 and december 2024 from a single integrate health system in ohio and florida . the primary reason for treatment discontinuation be examine in a randomly select sample of adult with overweight or obesity and without type 2 diabetes who initiate injectable semaglutide or tirzepatide and discontinue treatment within the first year . we randomly select 288 patient ; 145 receive semaglutide and 143 tirzepatide . overall , 137 patient ( 47.6 % ) discontinue their medication due to cost or insurance-related issue , 42 ( 14.6 % ) due to inability to tolerate the side effect , 34 ( 11.8 % ) a they be unable to fill the medication due to shortage , 7 ( 2.4 % ) a they switch to a compounded medication , and 5 ( 1.7 % ) due to unsatisfactory weight loss ; 31 ( 10.8 % ) discontinue for other reason , and for 32 ( 11.1 % ) patient the discontinuation reason be not specify in the electronic health record . high cost or insurance-related issue be the most common reason for treatment discontinuation with semaglutide or tirzepatide for obesity . our finding highlight the need for policy to address cost and could inform discussion between healthcare provider and patient concern cost and side effect .

Title: ultraprocessed food consumption , inflammatory index level , and risk of suicide attempt : finding from a prospective cohort study .
Authors: Wu Y, Sun M, Yuan Y, Zhang S, Zhu L, Lou Z, Shi Y, Li J, Sun Z, Yang L, Li L, Shen Y
Abstract: suicide attempt ( sa ) be a major public health issue , with many case be preventable . however , the impact of dietary pattern remain inadequately study . currently , the rise consumption of ultraprocessed food ( upfs ) have be link to various health issue , include mental health disorder that may increase risk of sa . this study aim to investigate the association between upf consumption and sa , and explore the mediating role of sa-related inflammatory index level . this study include 208,938 participant from the uk biobank cohort , recruit from 2006 to 2010. cox proportional hazard model be use to assess the association between the weight proportion of upf intake and incident sa . substitution analysis be conduct to evaluate risk of sa when replace upf with unprocessed or minimally process food ( unpfs ) . causal mediation analysis be far conduct to estimate the mediating effect of inflammatory index level in this association . over a median follow-up of 13.1 y , 545 sa event be identify . compare with participant in the low quintile of upf consumption , those in the high quintile have a 1.63 time high risk of develop sa [ hazard ratio ( hr ) : 1.63 , 95 % confidence interval ( ci ) : 1.23 , 2.15 ] . additionally , each sd increase in upf consumption be associate with a 20 % high risk of sa ( 1.20 , 95 % 1.11 , 1.29 ) . notably , replace 20 % of upf weight with unpf be link to a 23 % reduction in sa risk ( 0.77 , 95 % 0.69 , 0.85 ) . furthermore , in causal mediation analysis , inflammatory index level mediate 0.7 % -1.5 % of the association between upf consumption and sa . high upf consumption be associate with an increase risk of sa , partially mediate by inflammatory index level . replace upf with unpf significantly reduce sa incidence , highlight potential benefit of transition to a diet with high unpf consumption .
Journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition

Title: tmk-pin1 drive a short self-organizing circuit for auxin export and signal in arabidopsis .
Authors: Huang R, Wang J, Chang M, Tang W, Yu Y, Zhang Y, Peng Y, Wang Y, Guo Y, Lu T, Cao Y, Zhou Y, Zhang Q, Huang Y, Wu A, Ren L, Gallei M, Dong J, Chen H, He J, Wen M, Friml J, Sun L, Xiong Y, Yang Z, Xu T
Abstract: the versatile and pivotal role of the phytohormone auxin in regulate plant growth and development be typically link to it directional transport , rely on the polarize pin-formed ( pin ) auxin exporter at the plasma membrane ( pm ) . for decade , auxin have be propose to promote pin polarization , generate self-regulatory feedback mediate much of plant development , but mechanistic insight into this regulation be lack . here , we uncover an auxin-induced protein complex at the pm , contain auxin co-receptors transmembrane kinase ( tmks ) and pin1 auxin exporter , a the core machinery that underlie this feedback regulation . auxin promote pin1 phosphorylation by tmks , modulate pin1 polarization and transport activity . we also provide evidence that pin1-exported extracellular auxin be crucial for tmk activation and cell elongation , thus form the simple two-element self-regulatory feedback circuit . thus , these finding offer direct mechanistic insight into a potential self-organizing circuit for auxin signaling and transport to ensure proper plant development in arabidopsis .

Title: the dcc gene product in cellular differentiation and colorectal tumorigenesis .
Authors: Hedrick L, Cho KR, Fearon ER, Wu TC, Kinzler KW, Vogelstein B
Abstract: the analysis of human colorectal tumor have reveal frequent loss of heterozygosity ( loh ) of the long arm of chromosome 18. a novel gene , dcc ( delete in colorectal cancer ) , locate within the region of loh on chromosome 18q be identify and have be implicate a a tumor suppressor gene . we have now show that dcc encode a membrane-bound protein of the immunoglobulin-cam family , a demonstrate by cell-surface labeling , immunohistochemical analysis , and sequencing of cdna clone . the dcc protein be find in axon of the central and peripheral nervous system and in differentiate cell type of the intestine . colorectal tumor that lose their capacity to differentiate into mucus produce cell uniformly lack dcc expression and loss of a chromosome 18q allele be often accompany by loss of dcc expression in colon tumor . these result provide evidence that dcc encode a cell surface-localized protein and emphasize the inverse relationship between differentiation and tumorigenesis .

Title: a circrna promote esophageal squamous cell carcinoma progression by inhibit trim25-mediated degradation of igf2bp family member .
Authors: Tan S, Ming Y, Guo J, Liu W, Ma H, Liu Y, Xu Z, Gu-Ha AL, Dai L, Lin YD, Peng Y
Abstract: esophageal squamous cell carcinoma ( escc ) be a highly aggressive malignancy with poor prognosis and limited treatment option . while circular rna ( circrnas ) be frequently dysregulated in escc , their functional role and molecular mechanism in tumor progression remain largely unexplored . we characterize circrna use rt-pcr , sanger sequencing , and fluorescent in situ hybridization . gain- and loss-of-function study in vitro and in vivo be perform to assess circrna function . molecular interaction be investigate via rna pull-down assay couple with mass spectrometry , electrophoretic mobility shift assay , co-immunoprecipitation , and immunoblot analysis . clinical relevance be evaluate by rt-qpcr and immunohistochemistry in patient specimen . we identify circlnf , a novel circrna derive from the long non-coding rna firre gene , which be significantly upregulated in escc . functional assay demonstrate that circlnf promotes proliferative and migratory capacity in cultured cell and accelerate tumor progression and metastasis in animal model . mechanistically , circlnf directly interacts with igf2bp family protein through their `` cauc '' motif , protect them from trim25-mediated ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation . importantly , circlnf expression positively correlate with igf2bp1 protein level in escc patient tissue , underscore the clinical relevance of the circlnf-igf2bp axis in escc progression . our finding reveal an oncogenic role of circlnf in escc by inhibit trim25-mediated proteasomal degradation of igf2bp protein and highlight circlnf a a potential therapeutic target for escc .

Title: cross-ancestral gwas identifies 29 variant across head and neck cancer subsites .
Authors: Ebrahimi E, Sangphukieo A, Park HA, Gaborieau V, Ferreiro-Iglesias A, Diergaarde B, Ahrens W, Alemany L, Arantes LM, Betka J, Bratman SV, Canova C, Conlon MS, Conway DI, Cuello M, Curado MP, de Carvalho AC, de Oliviera JC, Gormley M, Hadji M, Hargreaves S, Healy CM, Holcatova I, Hung RJ, Kowalski LP, Lagiou P, Lagiou A, Liu G, Macfarlane GJ, Olshan AF, Perdomo S, Pinto LFR, Podesta JRV, Polesel J, Pring M, Rashidian H, Gama RR, Richiardi L, Robinson M, Rodriguez-Urrego PA, Santi SA, Saunders DP, Soares-Lima SC, Timpson N, Vilensky M, von Zeidler SV, Waterboer T, Zendehdel K, Znaor A, Brennan P, McKay J, Virani S, Dudding T
Abstract: head and neck squamous cell carcinoma ( hnscc ) include diverse cancer arise in the oral cavity , oropharynx , and larynx , with the main risk factor be environmental exposure such a tobacco , alcohol , and human papillomavirus ( hpv ) infection . the genetic factor contribute to susceptibility across different population and tumour subsites remain incompletely understood . here we show , through a genome-wide association and fine mapping study of over 19,000 hnscc case and 38,000 control from multiple ancestry , 18 genetic risk variant and 11 signal from fine mapping of the human leukocyte antigen ( hla ) region , all previously unreported . rs78378222 , a regulatory variant for tp53 be associate with a 40 % reduction in overall hnscc risk . we also identify gene-environment interaction , with brca2 and adh1b variant show effect modify by smoke and alcohol use . subsite-specific analysis of the hla region reveals distinct immune-related association across hpv-positive and hpv-negative tumour . these finding refine the genetic architecture of hnscc and highlight mechanism link inherited variation , immunity , and environmental exposure .

Title: evolution of mycobacterium tuberculosis transcription regulation be associate with increased transmission and drug resistance .
Authors: Culviner PH, Frey AM, Liu Q, Ha DTM, Thai PVK, Thu DDA, Quang NL, Calderon R, Lecca L, Caws M, Dunstan SJ, Murray MB, Thuong NTT, Fortune SM
Abstract: mycobacterium tuberculosis ( mtb ) have co-evolved with human for thousand of year and be characterize by variation in virulence , transmissibility , and disease phenotype . to identify bacterial contributor to phenotypic diversity , we develop new rna sequencing ( rna-seq ) and phylogenomic tool to capture hundred of mtb isolate transcriptomes , link transcriptional and genetic variation , and find association between variant and epidemiologic trait . across 274 mtb clinical isolates , we uncover unexpected diversity in virulence gene expression , which we link to know and unknown regulator . surprisingly , we find that many isolates harbor variant associate with decreased expression of esxa ( esat6 ) and esxb ( cfp10 ) , which be virulence effector , dominant t cell antigen , and immunodiagnostic target . across > 55,000 isolates , these variant associate with increased transmissibility , especially in drug-resistant mtb strain . our data suggest expression of mtb virulence gene be evolve in response to drug-linked pressure , raise concern about use of these target in immunodiagnostics and next-generation vaccine .

Title: the panoptes system use decoy cyclic nucleotide to defend against phage .
Authors: Sullivan AE, Nabhani A, Izrailevsky DS, Schinkel K, Hoffman CRK, Robbins LK, Nagy TA, Duncan ML, Ledvina HE, Erbse AH, Kibby EM, Tak U, Dinh DM, Ednacot EMQ, Nguyen CM, Burroughs AM, Aravind L, Whiteley AT, Morehouse BR
Abstract: bacteria combat phage infection use antiphage system and many system generate nucleotide-derived second messenger upon infection that activate effector protein to mediate immunity ( 1 ) . phage respond with counter-defences that deplete these second messenger , lead to an escalating arm race with the host . here we outline an antiphage system we call panoptes that indirectly detect phage infection when phage proteins antagonize the nucleotide-derived second-messenger pool . panoptes be a two-gene operon , optse , wherein opts be predict to synthesize a nucleotide-derived second messenger and opte be predict to bind that signal and drive effector-mediated defence . crystal structure show that opts be a minimal crispr polymerase ( mcpol ) domain , a version of the polymerase domain find in type iii crispr system ( cas10 ) . opts orthologues from two distinct panoptes system generate cyclic dinucleotide product , include 2',3'-cyclic diadenosine monophosphate ( 2',3'-c-di-amp ) , which we show be able to bind the soluble domain of the opte transmembrane effector . panoptes potently restrict phage replication , but phages that have loss-of-function mutation in anti-cyclic oligonucleotide-based antiphage signal system ( cbass ) protein 2 ( acb2 ) escape defence . these finding be unexpected because acb2 be a nucleotide 'sponge ' that antagonize second-messenger signalling . our data support the idea that cyclic nucleotide sequestration by acb2 release opte toxicity , thereby initiate inner membrane disruption , lead to phage defence . these data demonstrate a sophisticated immune strategy that bacteria use to guard their second-messenger pool and turn immune evasion against the virus .

Title: flt3-itd induces cmtm6 and enhances immune escape in acute myeloid leukemia .
Authors: Zwick M, Zinkel B, Spohr C, Rückert T, Halbach S, Shoumariyeh K, Scheid J, Baur AS, Braun LM, Angel M, Michaeli E, Todkar A, Nelde A, Märklin M, Holzmayer SJ, Dicks S, Boerries M, Duquesne S, Schlaak AE, Otto-Mora P, Bengsch B, Schiff M, Kissel S, Selle M, Follo M, Altmann H, Kunadt D, Illert AL, Walz JS, Walz G, Duyster J, Schetelig J, Brummer T, Zeiser R, Köhler N
Abstract: fms-like tyrosine kinase-3 internal tandem duplication ( flt3-itd ) mutation be frequent in acute myeloid leukemia ( aml ) and be associate with a high risk of relapse . cklf-like marvel transmembrane domain contain member 6 ( cmtm6 ) stabilize pd-l1 surface expression and modulates tumor immunity in solid cancer . in this study , we find a role for flt3-induced cmtm6 in hematological malignancy . flt3 drove cmtm6 and pd-l1 expression in aml cell , while flt3 inhibition reduce expression of cmtm6 and pd-l1 . in three distinct allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplantation mouse model , transplantation of cmtm6 deficient flt3-itd+ leukemia cell result in prolonged survival , reduce leukemia burden , enhance t cell effector function , and decreased expression of t cell exhaustion marker compare to cmtm6 proficient flt3-itd+ leukemia cell . furthermore , combination therapy with anti-pd-l1 and tandutinib significantly improve survival , suppress leukemia cell expansion , and augment the anti-leukemia t cell response in mice bear flt3-itd+ leukemia . mechanistically , protein-protein interaction of flt3 and cmtm6 within their transmembrane domain , which be not phosphorylation dependent , enhance cmtm6 stability in leukemia cell , while flt3-itd do not increase cmtm6 and pd-l1 expression at the rna level . furthermore , cmtm6 upregulation and protein interaction with flt3 be validate in primary leukemia cell from two independent cohort of patient with flt3-itd+ aml . collectively , these finding uncover flt3-mediated stabilization of cmtm6 in aml cell , which result in enhanced pd-l1 cell surface expression and leukemia immune escape .

Title: the gut‑skin axis : emerge insight in understand and treat skin disease through gut microbiome modulation ( review ) .
Authors: Zhao Y, Yu C, Zhang J, Yao Q, Zhu X, Zhou X
Abstract: emerge evidence indicate a significant association between the composition and functionality of the gut microbiome and various skin disorder , include psoriasis , atopic dermatitis , acne and several dermatological condition . the gut‑skin axis theory describe a complex bidirectional communication network between the gut and the skin , provide mechanistic insight into the pathogenesis of certain cutaneous disease . specifically , the gut microbiome influence skin health through the regulation of systemic immunity , inflammatory response and metabolic pathway . advance in high‑throughput sequencing and bioinformatics technology have substantially enhance the understanding of the role of the gut microbiome in skin pathology . clinical and preclinical study have demonstrate that restore gut microbial homeostasis via intervention such a faecal microbiota transplantation , probiotic and prebiotics can ameliorate symptom of skin disease . furthermore , personalize microbiome‑based therapy , next‑generation probiotic and dietary modification hold promise for refine gut‑skin interaction and advance precision medicine in dermatology . therapeutic strategy target the gut‑skin axis offer novel avenue for innovative dermatological treatment , with future breakthrough potentially involve microbial community engineering , postbiotics and artificial intelligence in microbiome‑related diagnostics . this narrative review summarize recent advance in gut‑skin axis research , explore it potential in the prevention and management of select dermatosis and discuss future trend and scientific development in the field .

Title: target specific kinase substrates rescue increase colitis severity induce by the crohn 's disease-linked lrrk2-n2081d variant .
Authors: Heaton GR, Li X, Li X, Zhou X, Zhang Y, Vu DT, Oeller M, Karayel O, Hoang QQ, Kars ME, Kamath N, Wang M, Tarassishin L, Mann M, Peter I, Yue Z
Abstract: lrrk2 contain a kinase domain where the n2081d crohn 's disease ( cd ) risk and the g2019s parkinson 's disease ( pd ) pathogenic variant be locate . it be not clear how the n2081d variant increase cd risk or how these adjacent mutation give rise to distinct disorder . to investigate the pathophysiology of the cd-linked lrrk2 n2081d variant , we generate a knock-in ( ki ) mouse model and compare it effect with those of the lrrk2-g2019s mutation . lrrk2n2081d ki mouse demonstrate heightened sensitivity to induce colitis , result in more severe intestinal damage than in lrrk2g2019s ki and wt mouse . analysis of colon tissue reveal distinct mutation-dependent lrrk2 rab substrate phosphorylation , with significantly elevate phosphorylated rab10 level in lrrk2n2081d mouse . in cell , we demonstrate that the n2081d mutation activates lrrk2 through a mechanism distinct from that of lrrk2-g2019s . we also find that proinflammatory stimulation enhances lrrk2 kinase activity , lead to mutation-dependent difference in rab phosphorylation and inflammatory response in dendritic cell ( dc ) . finally , we show that knockout of rab12 , but not pharmacological lrrk2 kinase inhibition , significantly reduce colitis severity in lrrk2n2081d mouse . our study characterize the pathogenic mechanism of lrrk2-linked cd , highlight structural and functional difference between disease-associated lrrk2 variant , and suggest rab protein a promising therapeutic target for modulate lrrk2 activity in cd treatment .

Title: discovery and artificial intelligence-guided mechanistic elucidation of a narrow-spectrum antibiotic .
Authors: Catacutan DB, Tran V, Arnold A, Alexander J, Corso G, Yousefi Y, Tu MM, McLellan S, Tertigas D, Magolan J, Surette MG, Brown ED, Coombes BK, Barzilay R, Stokes JM
Abstract: current clinical antibiotic be largely broad-spectrum agent that can alter the gut microbiome and promote colonization by enterobacteriaceae , which be often drug resistant . this include adherent-invasive escherichia coli ( aiec ) , particularly in patient with inflammatory bowel disease , in which dysbiosis create a niche for this pathogen to colonize . there be an urgent and unmet need for novel narrow-spectrum and microbiome-sparing antibiotic . here we screen 10,747 bioactive small molecule for antibacterial activity against aiec and discover enterololin , an antibacterial compound with targeted activity against enterobacteriaceae specie . enterololin could overcome intrinsic and acquire resistance mechanism in clinical isolates when combine with a subinhibitory concentration of spr741 , a polymyxin b analogue use here to increase outer membrane permeability in gram-negative bacteria . molecular substructure- and deep learning-guided mechanism-of-action investigation reveal that enterololin perturbs lipoprotein traffic through a mechanism involve the lolcde complex , laboratory-evolved resistant mutant predominantly map to lolc and lole , with an in vitro frequency of resistance of ~10 ( -8 ) to 10 ( -7 ) . enterololin show low mammalian cytotoxicity ( hek293 half-maximal inhibitory concentration ~100 µg ml ( -1 ) ) and suppress aiec infection in mouse model when administer in combination with spr741 , while largely preserve the overall microbiome composition . this study highlight the utility of deep learning method for predict molecular interaction and identify a promising enterobacteriaceae-specific antibacterial candidate for further development .

Title: efficacy and safety of immune checkpoint inhibitor for advanced squamous non-small cell lung cancer : a systematic review and network meta-analysis .
Authors: Liu N, Zhang B, He J, Li S
Abstract: significant efficacy heterogeneity exist between first- and second-line immunotherapy regimen for advanced squamous non-small cell lung cancer ( sqnsclc ) , but most regimen lack directly comparable clinical trial evidence , result in unclear prioritization . this analysis identify optimal treatment strategy by evaluate difference in efficacy across immune checkpoint inhibitor ( icis ) . we search through comprehensive database , include pubmed , embase , the cochrane library and the clinical trial database . traditional meta-analysis be do use stata 15.0 , while bayesian-framework network meta-analysis be implement with r 's gemtc package via markov chain monte carlo simulation . subgroup analysis be perform for different pd-l1 expression level , number of treatment , ethnic group , and smoke history . we include 25 randomize control trial . immune-related therapy can provide significant benefit relative to chemotherapy alone in advanced sqnsclc . compare with chemotherapy , except for ipilimumab+chemo [ hr = 0.92,95 % ( 0.59-1.40 ) ] , atezolizumab+chemo [ hr = 0.88 , 95 % ( 0.56-1.40 ) ] , and durvalumab+chemo [ hr = 0.84 , 95 % ( 0.52-1.40 ) ] , durvalumab+ tremelimumab+chemo [ hr = 0 . 88 , 95 % ( 0.54-1.40 ) ] , which significantly improve overall survival ( o ) . cemiplimab [ hr = 0.48 , 95 % ( 0.34-0.67 ) ] show the best os benefit . compare with chemotherapy , all immunotherapy significantly improve progression-free survival ( pfs ) except for ipilimumab+chemo [ hr = 0.87 , 95 % ( 0.75-1.00 ) ] . sugemalimab+chemo provide the best survival benefit [ hr = 0.34 , 95 % ( 0.24-0.48 ) ] . for pd-l1≥50 % tumor , penpulimab show excellent o and pfs ; for pd-l1 1-49 % tumor , pembrolizumab+chemo and camrelizumab+chemo achieve the best o and pfs , respectively ; for pd-l1≥1 % tumor , the tislelizumab+chemo and camrelizumab+chemo show the best o and pfs result , while for tumor with pd-l1 < 1 % , both nivolumab and serplulimab+chemo provide significant survival benefit . in asian patient , patient treat with pembrolizumab or pembrolizumab + chemotherapy have favorable o and pfs benefit . in non-asian patient , there be also favorable o and pfs benefit with cemiplimab . for former/current smoker , pembrolizumab+chemotherapy and camrelizumab+chemotherapy have significant o and pfs benefit , but most immunotherapy do not improve o and pfs in never smoker . camrelizumab+chemo [ or = 3.5 , 95 % ( 2.3-5.3 ) ] have the best overall response rate ( orr ) benefit . ipilimumab+chemo have the high incidence of adverse event ( aes ) [ or = 2.0 , 95 % ( 1.5-2.7 ) ] . http : //www.crd.york.ac.uk/prospero/ , identifier crd420251027447 .

Title: semaglutide and exercise function in obesity-related hfpef : insight from the step-hfpef program .
Authors: Borlaug BA, Kitzman DW, Patel S, Chinnakondepalli KM, Butler J, Davies MJ, Petrie MC, Shah SJ, Verma S, Núñez J, Einfeldt MN, Liisberg K, Salsali A, Kosiborod MN
Abstract: exercise function quantify by 6-minute walk distance ( 6mwd ) be severely impaired in patient with heart failure with preserved ejection fraction ( hfpef ) . this prespecified secondary analysis of pool data from the step-hfpef program ( research study to investigate how well semaglutide work in people live with heart failure and obesity ) examine factor associate with impaired exercise function at baseline , detailed effect of semaglutide on 6mwd , and on other key trial endpoint accord to baseline 6mwd in patient with hfpef . associate of 6mwd be assess at baseline , and effect of semaglutide on 6mwd be evaluate at early ( 20 week ) and final ( 52 week ) time point , across subgroup , and accord to the magnitude of weight loss achieve . effect of semaglutide on the dual primary ( change in kansas city cardiomyopathy questionnaire-clinical summary score [ kccq-css ] and body weight ) and secondary/exploratory endpoint be contrast by tertiles of baseline 6mwd . the author randomize 1,145 patient to semaglutide or placebo . compare with patient who have obesity-related hfpef and high 6mwd , those with low 6mwd be old and have low kccq-css , high body mass index and waist circumference , great systemic inflammation ( high c-reactive protein ) , and more severe congestion ( high n-terminal pro-b-type natriuretic peptide , more diuretic use ) . treatment with semaglutide increase 6mwd compare with placebo , an effect apparent at 20 week ( treatment difference 14.6 m [ 95 % 8.6-20.7 m ; p < 0.0001 ] ) that be maintain at 52 week ( treatment difference 17.1 m [ 95 % 9.2-25.0 m ; p < 0.0001 ] ) . increase in 6mwd with semaglutide ( vs placebo ) be similar across all relevant subgroup , with no significant interaction . treatment with semaglutide increase kccq-css and reduced body weight , reduce c-reactive protein , improve the hierarchical composite ( death , heart failure event , change in kccq-css and 6mwd ) , and reduce n-terminal pro-b-type natriuretic peptide across the spectrum of baseline 6mwd ( all p ( interaction ) = n ) . each 1-unit decrease in body mass index on treatment with semaglutide be associate with a 4.1 m ( 95 % 2.4-5.7 m ) increase in 6mwd ( p < 0.0001 ) . in patient with obesity-related hfpef , impaired 6mwd be most strongly associate with excess adiposity , congestion , and inflammation . semaglutide-mediated improvement in hf-related symptom , physical limitation , and exercise function be consistent across the spectrum of baseline 6mwd , observe as early a 20 week after the initiation of treatment , precede maximal weight loss . the effect be consistent across subgroup . there be strong correlation between great magnitude of weight loss and great improvement in 6mwd . ( research study to investigate how well semaglutide work in people live with heart failure and obesity [ step-hfpef ] , nct04788511 ; research study to look at how well semaglutide work in people live with heart failure , obesity and type 2 diabetes [ step-hfpef dm ] , nct04916470 ) .

Title: functional rna split drive the evolutionary emergence of type v crispr-cas system from transposon .
Authors: Jin S, Zhu Z, Li Y, Zhang S, Liu Y, Li D, Li Y, Luo Y, Cheng Z, Zhao KT, Gao Q, Yang G, Li H, Liang R, Zhang R, Qiu JL, Zhang YE, Liu JG, Gao C
Abstract: transposon-encoded tnpb nuclease give rise to type v crispr-cas12 effector through multiple independent domestication event . these system use different rna molecule a guide for dna targeting : transposon-derived right-end rna ( rernas or omega rna ) for tnpb and crispr rna for type v crispr-cas system . however , the molecular mechanism bridge transposon activity and crispr immunity remain unclear . we identify trancs ( transposon-crispr intermediate ) derive from distinct is605- or is607-tnpb lineage . trancs utilize both crispr rna and rernas to direct dna cleavage . the cryoelectron microscopy ( cryo-em ) structure of latranc from lawsonibacter sp . closely resemble that of the isdra2 tnpb complex ; however , unlike a single-molecule rerna , the latranc guide rna be functionally split into a tracrrna and crrna . an engineered rna split of isdra2 tnpb enable activity with a crispr array . these finding indicate that functional rna splitting be the primary molecular event drive the emergence of diverse type v crispr-cas system from transposon .

Title: [ a case of coexistent persistent trigeminal and hypoglossal artery manifest with neurovascular compression syndrome by hypertension ] .
Authors: Asayama K, Hayashi K, Kanai Y, Tahara N, Kato Y, Abe S, Mitaki S, Nagai A
Abstract: a 70-year-old woman visit our hospital with hypertension , diplopia , and right orbital pain . neurological examination reveal right ophthalmoplegia . ct angiography and mri identify a right persistent trigeminal artery ( pta ) , right persistent hypoglossal artery , and bovine aortic arch . the right internal carotid artery ( ica ) be displace laterally in the cavernous sinus due to the bifurcation of the pta . compression of the right oculomotor nerve , right trochlear nerve , and first division of the right trigeminal nerve by the elongated right ica be note and consider a potential cause of the ophthalmoplegia and orbital pain . symptom improve with normalization of blood pressure . during embryonic development , the right posterior communicate artery and bilateral vertebral artery be aplastic or hypoplastic , which suggest that these carotid-basilar anastomosis may have remain a supply route to provide sufficient blood flow to the posterior cerebral circulation . this be an extremely rare case of embryological implication manifest with neurovascular compression syndrome .
