Title: aspirin and healthy lifespan in old people : main outcome of the aspree-xt observational study .
Authors: Shah RC, Ryan J, Webb KL, Wolfe R, Chan A, Chong TT, Ernst ME, Espinoza SE, Flynn O, Lee SY, McNeil J, Nelson MR, Orchard SG, Reid CM, Sheets K, Stocks NP, Weerasinghe NS, Wilson ME, Woods RL, Murray AM
Abstract: in the aspirin in reduce event in the elderly ( aspree ) clinical trial , low-dose aspirin be not associate with survival free of dementia and persistent physical disability ( a measure of a healthy lifespan ) ; however , there be a small increased risk of death . give the long pre-clinical phase of many age condition , we aim to examine the legacy effect ( post-trial ) and the longer-term effect of aspirin versus placebo through extend follow-up in the aspree-xt observational study . between march 10 , 2010 , and dec 24 , 2014 , 19 114 community-dwelling people in australia and the usa , age predominantly 70 year and old , be randomly assign to low-dose aspirin or placebo for a median of 4·7 year a part of the aspree trial . post-trial observational follow-up continue for a median of 4·3 year ( iqr 4·1-4·6 ) . all component of the primary endpoint ( ie , incident dementia , persistent physical disability , and death ) be adjudicate by masked expert panel . analysis use cox proportional hazard model with intention-to-treat . 15 633 participant ( 8836 [ 56·5 % ] be woman , 6797 [ 43·5 % ] be men ; 981 [ 6·3 % ] be not white ) be eligible for and agree to observational follow-up . there be no effect of randomisation to aspirin ( 34·37 event per 1000 person-years ) versus placebo ( 33·68 per 1000 person-years ) on the primary endpoint ( hazard ratio [ hr ] 1·02 ; 95 % ci 0·94-1·11 ; p=0·63 ) in the aspree-xt period . similarly , over the period of both aspree and aspree-xt , no long-term effect of aspirin versus placebo be observe on the composite outcome of death , dementia , or persistent physical disability over almost a decade of follow-up ( hr 1·01 ; 95 % ci 0·95-1·08 ; p=0·65 ) , include no long-term effect on death ( 1·06 ; 0·99-1·14 ; p=0·10 ) . no effect of aspirin on incident major haemorrhagic event a compare with placebo be find in aspree-xt ; however , aspirin be associate with an increase hazard for incident major haemorrhagic event across both aspree and aspree-xt ( 1·24 ; 1·10-1·39 ) . low-dose aspirin do not appear to be effective in promote a healthy lifespan in initially healthy , community-dwelling old people . national institute on age and the national cancer institute ( usa ) .

Title: efferocytic remodelling of pancreatic islet macrophage by limited β-cell death .
Authors: Zakharov PN, Chowdhury CS, Peterson OJ, Barron B, Vomund AN, Gorvel L, Unanue ER, Klechevsky E, Wan X, Ravichandran KS
Abstract: the primary driver of type i diabetes be the autoimmune t cell that destroy insulin-producing β-cells within the islet of langerhans in the pancreas ( 1 ) . pancreatic islet macrophage have also be variably link to disease onset and progression . a macrophage-mediated removal of die cell through efferocytosis regulates tissue homeostasis and immune response ( 2 ) , here we investigate how efferocytosis by intra-islet macrophage influence the immune environment of pancreatic islet . use a series of complementary omics-based and functional approach , we identify a subset of anti-inflammatory intra-islet efferocytic macrophage ( e-mac ) within the pancreas of mouse and human . when limited β-cell apoptosis be induce in vivo in wild-type c57bl/6 mouse and diabetic-prone nod mouse , islet macrophage adopt this e-mac phenotype without an apparent increase in the total number of intra-islet macrophage . such limited β-cell apoptosis and increase in e-mac number lead to long-term suppression of autoimmune diabetes in nod mouse . this e-mac phenotype could also be recapitulate ex vivo by co-culturing macrophage with apoptotic β-cells . mechanistically , the e-mac-enriched population impart an anergic-like state on cd4 ( + ) t cell ex vivo and promoted accumulation of such anergic-like cd4 ( + ) t cell in vivo within the islet . analyse macrophage-t cell interaction within pancreatic islet use nichenet and target experimental validation , we identify the igf-1-igf1r axis a a contributor to the anergic-like t cell phenotype in the islet . collectively , these data advance a concept that efferocytosis-associated reprogramming of the islet macrophage and the subsequent influence on the adaptive immune response could be beneficial in modulate diabetic autoimmunity .

Title: oral iptacopan therapy in patient with c3 glomerulopathy : a randomised , double-blind , parallel group , multicentre , placebo-controlled , phase 3 study .
Authors: Kavanagh D, Bomback AS, Vivarelli M, Nester CM, Remuzzi G, Zhao MH, Wong EKS, Wang Y, Krishnan I, Schuhmann I, Trapani AJ, Webb NJA, Meier M, Israni RK, Smith RJH
Abstract: c3 glomerulopathy be an ultra-rare , severe form of glomerulonephritis cause by overactivation of the alternative complement pathway . we aim to assess efficacy and safety of iptacopan ( lnp023 ) , an oral , proximal complement inhibitor that target factor b to selectively inhibit the alternative pathway of the complement cascade . appear-c3g be a multicentre , randomise , double-blind , placebo-controlled , phase 3 study of iptacopan versus placebo ( both in addition to supportive care [ renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system ( raas ) inhibitor ] and immunosuppression ) . adult participant ( age 18-60 year ) with biopsy-confirmed c3 glomerulopathy be enrol from 35 hospital or medical centre in 18 country . inclusion criterion include reduced serum c3 concentration ( ie , < 77 mg/dl [ define a < 0·85 × low limit of the central laboratory normal range ] ) at screening , urine protein-creatinine ratio ( upcr ) of 1·0 g/g or high at day -75 and day -15 before randomisation , estimate glomerular filtration rate ( egfr ) of 30 ml/min per 1·73 m ( 2 ) or high at screening and day -15 , and vaccination against neisseria meningitidis and streptococcus pneumoniae . all eligible participant be randomise 1:1 via interactive response technology to either the iptacopan or the placebo group , stratify by treatment with corticosteroid , mycophenolic acid , or both ( yes or no ) . during the 6-month double-blind period , participant orally receive either iptacopan 200 mg twice daily or placebo ; this be follow by a 6-month open-label period in which all participant receive iptacopan 200 mg twice daily . the primary endpoint be relative reduction in proteinuria ( measure by log-transformed ratio to baseline in upcr sample from a 24-h urine collection ) at 6 month . the primary analysis be do in the full analysis set ( ie , all participant to whom study treatment be assign by randomisation ) ; all participant who receive at least one dose of study treatment be include in the safety analysis . this trial be register with clinicaltrials.gov ( nct04817618 ) and the adult cohort have be complete . between july 28 , 2021 , and feb 15 , 2023 , 132 participant be screen , of whom 58 do not complete the screening period and 74 ( 64 % male ; 69 % white ) be randomise 1:1 to receive either iptacopan ( n=38 ) or placebo ( n=36 ) . one participant in the placebo group discontinue treatment during the open-label period . the 24-h upcr percentage change relative to baseline at 6 month be -30·2 % ( 95 % ci -42·8 to -14·8 ) in the iptacopan group and 7·6 % ( -11·9 to 31·3 ) in the placebo group . in the iptacopan group , the geometric mean of 24-h upcr be 3·33 g/g ( 95 % ci 2·79 to 3·97 ) at baseline and 2·17 g/g ( 1·62 to 2·91 ) at 6 month ; in the placebo group , this be 2·58 g/g ( 2·18 to 3·05 ) at baseline and 2·80 g/g ( 2·37 to 3·30 ) at 6 month . the primary endpoint be meet with a relative reduction in 24-h upcr at 6 month for iptacopan versus placebo of 35·1 % ( 13·8 to 51·1 ; p=0·0014 ) . 30 ( 79 % ) of 38 participant in the iptacopan group have treatment-emergent adverse event , compare with 24 ( 67 % ) of 36 participant in the placebo group ; most of these be of mild or moderate severity . there be no death , no treatment discontinuation due to treatment-emergent adverse event , and no meningococcal infection . serious adverse event be report in three ( 8 % ) participant in the iptacopan group and one ( 3 % ) participant in the placebo group . iptacopan show a statistically significant , clinically meaningful proteinuria reduction in addition to raas inhibitor and immunosuppression at 6 month . iptacopan be well tolerate with an acceptable safety profile in patient with c3 glomerulopathy . novartis pharma .

Title: multiple sclerosis : molecular pathogenesis and therapeutic intervention .
Authors: Boutitah-Benyaich I, Eixarch H, Villacieros-Álvarez J, Hervera A, Cobo-Calvo Á, Montalban X, Espejo C
Abstract: multiple sclerosis be a chronic immune-mediated disorder of the central nervous system characterize by demyelination , axonal loss , and neuroinflammation , culminate in progressive neurological disability . despite significant advance in understand it immunopathogenesis , current immunotherapy remain limited in their ability to halt disease progression , make multiple sclerosis incurable and highlight the critical need for novel therapeutic strategy . antigen-specific immunotherapy represent a groundbreaking approach that aim to restore immune tolerance to myelin-derived antigen while preserve the protective function of the immune system . unlike broad immunosuppressive strategy , antigen-specific immunotherapy offer the potential for highly targeted modulation of pathogenic immune response , reduce off-target effect and enhance safety profile . over the last two decade , preclinical study and clinical trial have explore diverse antigen-specific immunotherapy modality , range from peptide-based vaccine to nanoparticle platform , each aim at achieve durable tolerance in multiple sclerosis . this review provide a comprehensive overview of multiple sclerosis , cover it etiology , clinical feature , pathogenesis , pathology , and current therapeutic approach . thus , it delve into the current state of antigen-specific immunotherapy research , critically examine it success and limitation while address the translational challenge that must be overcome to realize it therapeutic potential . by integrate insight from immunology , biotechnology , and translational medicine , we propose direction for advance antigen-specific approach in the quest for transformative multiple sclerosis therapy .

Title: single cell and spatial transcriptomics define a proinflammatory and profibrotic niche after kidney injury .
Authors: Li L, Liao J, Zhang Y, Yao Z, Huang J, Wu K, Li L, Peng Y, Zhu H, Hong X, Liu X, Zhou L, Hou FF, Fu H, Liu Y
Abstract: kidney fibrosis be the common outcome of chronic kidney disease ( ckd ) . it often instigate in the focal site by form the fibrogenic niche after injury . in this study , use single-cell rna sequencing ( scrna-seq ) and a spatial transcriptomic ( st ) approach , the cellular heterogeneity , spatial organization , and molecular interaction be delineate in the fibrotic kidney . through analysis of the scrna-seq and st data from normal and fibrotic kidney in mouse subject to unilateral ischemia-reperfusion injury , a tenascin c ( tnc ) -enriched , proinflammatory , and profibrotic microenvironment be identify that facilitated macrophage activation and promote renal inflammation and fibrosis . both tnc-enriched decellularized kidney tissue scaffold and exogenous tnc protein promote bone marrow-derived macrophage activation though toll-like receptor 4 ( tlr4 ) /nf-κb signal . either pharmacological inhibition of tlr4 signal or genetic knockout of it gene alleviate renal inflammation and fibrosis by inhibit macrophage activation in vivo . finally , chimeric mouse that receive bone marrow transplantation from tlr4-deficient donor be protect against kidney inflammation and fibrosis . these result suggest that tnc play a crucial role in orchestrate the formation of a proinflammatory and profibrotic niche that promote renal inflammation and fibrosis by activate macrophage via tlr4/nf-κb signaling . the finding underscore the complex interplay among fibroblast , extracellular microenvironment , and macrophage that drive kidney fibrosis .

Title: early implantation of a transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt ( tip ) in patient with liver cirrhosis and ascites ( etips ) : a multicentre , randomise control trial .
Authors: Bettinger D, Janoschke M, Jenkner C, Kaufmann M, van Gessel J, Otter HH, Schultheiss M, Thimme R
Abstract: portal hypertension be a major complication in patient with liver cirrhosis , lead to severe outcome such a variceal bleeding and ascites . transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt ( tip ) have emerge a an effective interventional treatment of recurrent ascites and variceal bleeding . however , up to 30 % of patient with recurrent ascites show tips refractory ascites , and prior data have show that the frequency of paracenteses before tip implantation predict ascites clearance indicate that tip implantation may be too late in some patient . especially , patient with grade 2 ascites and a meld score ≥ 15 , or grade 3 ascites irrespective of meld score at first decompensation with ascites face a high risk of further decompensation and mortality . therefore , these patient may benefit from early tip implantation in order to improve post-tips mortality . we hypothesise that early tip implantation in these select patient at the time of the first decompensation may improve transplantation-free survival compare to standard medical treatment ( smt ) . the etips study be a prospective , randomise , open , multicenter interventional , superiority trial . patient will be randomise 1:1 in the intervention group with tip implantation and in the smt group . the primary endpoint be transplantation-free survival . secondary endpoint include the time to ascites with need for paracentesis and quality of life assess six and 12 month after randomisation . expand the concept of early tip implantation to ascites management may offer significant survival benefit and may significantly change the treatment algorithm of patient with ascites . german registry for clinical study drks00034545 . register on 20/02/2025 . clinical trial nct06576934 . register on 04/12/2024 .

Title: acute surgery vs conservative treatment for traumatic acute subdural hematoma .
Authors: Van Essen TA, Yue JK, Barber J, Lingsma HF, Pisica D, den Boogert HF, van Dijck JT, Moojen WA, Hutchinson P, Markowitz AJ, Steyerberg EW, Okonkwo DO, Bodien YG, Valadka AB, Diaz-Arrastia R, Robertson CS, Foreman B, Wang VY, McCrea MA, Giacino JT, Yuh EL, de Ruiter GCW, Temkin NR, Maas AIR, Peul WC, Manley GT
Abstract: it be unclear whether perform surgery for most patient with an acute subdural hematoma ( asdh ) and traumatic brain injury ( tbi ) be superior to conservative treatment . to compare the effectiveness of a strategy prefer acute surgical asdh evacuation with one prefer initial conservative treatment . design , set , this comparative effectiveness study use data from february 1 , 2014 , to july 31 , 2018 , from the prospective observational transforming research and clinical knowledge in traumatic brain injury study , conduct at 18 level 1 trauma center in the u . the study include patient with nonpenetrating tbi present to the emergency department and admit within 24 hour after injury with asdh detect on acute head compute tomography scan . statistical analysis be perform from december 1 , 2022 , to december 20 , 2024. acute surgical hematoma evacuation vs initial conservative treatment , compare outcome between center accord to treatment preference , measure by the case mix-adjusted probability of undergo acute surgery ( vs conservative treatment ) per center . functional disability at 6 month be assess with the glasgow outcome scale-extended at 6 month , analyze with ordinal logistic regression adjust for prespecified confounders , quantify with a common odds ratio ( or ) . variation in center preference be quantify with a median or ( mor ) . of 2697 include patient , 711 ( mean [ sd ] age , 46.5 [ 19.4 ] year ; 539 men [ 76 % ] ) have an asdh , of whom 148 ( 21 % ) underwent acute cranial surgery and 563 ( 79 % ) underwent initial conservative treatment . the acute surgery cohort have low mean ( sd ) glasgow coma scale score ( 6.8 [ 4.4 ] v 11.4 [ 4.6 ] ) , more pupil abnormality ( both pupil unreacting : 43 of 133 [ 32 % ] vs 41 of 477 [ 9 % ] ) , and few isolate asdhs ( eg , more with concurrent intracranial lesion ; 92 of 133 [ 69 % ] vs 297 of 563 [ 53 % % ] ) compare with the conservative treatment cohort . in the surgical cohort , 129 of 148 patient ( 87 % ) underwent decompressive craniectomy ( dc ) , and 17 of 148 ( 11 % ) underwent craniotomy . in the conservative treatment cohort , 67 of 563 patient ( 12 % ) underwent delay cranial surgery ( dc or craniotomy ) . the proportion of patient undergo acute surgery range from 0 % to 86 % ( median , 17 % [ iqr , 5 % -27 % ] ) between center , with up to a 3-fold high probability of prognostically similar patient receive acute surgery in one center compare with another random center ( mor , 2.95 [ 95 % ci , 1.79-7.47 ] ; p = .06 ) . center preference for acute surgery over initial conservative treatment be not associate with a good outcome ( or , 1.05 [ 95 % ci , 0.88-1.26 ] per 22 % [ iqr , 5 % -27 % ] increase in acute surgery at a give trauma center ) . in this comparative effectiveness study , similar patient with traumatic asdh be treat differently due to center-specific treatment preference . outcome be similar in center prefer surgical evacuation and those preferring initial conservative treatment . this study suggest that , for a patient with asdh for whom a neurosurgeon experience clinical equipoise between acute surgery v ( initial ) conservative treatment , conservative treatment may be consider .

Title: regulatory role of igf2r in insulin secretion and adaptive β-cell proliferation .
Authors: Shirakawa J, De Jesus DF, Tsuno T, Basile G, Inoue R, Takatani T, Nishiyama A, Okawa ER, Tamura T, Terauchi Y, Kulkarni RN
Abstract: insulin-like growth factor-2 receptor ( igf2r ) , also know a cation-independent mannose-6-phosphate receptor , be localize in cytosolic vesicle and be unique in it ability to transport enzyme to the lysosome and to clear igf2 from the cell surface by act a a scavenger receptor . to evaluate the direct role of igf2r in β-cell biology , we undertake complementary in vitro knockdown and in vivo knockout approach . a β-cell line with a stable knockdown of igf2r ( igf2rkd ) exhibit decreased glucose-induced insulin secretion and enhance cell proliferation . tamoxifen-inducible β-cell-specific igf2r knockout mouse exhibit impaired glucose tolerance and blunt insulin secretion after high-fat-diet loading that be likely secondary to reduce β-cell mass due to attenuated proliferation . β-cells with igf2rkd have few autophagosomes after starvation and reduced expression of p62 , lc3b , and ulk1 . age mouse also have impair autophagy in βigf2r-deficient β-cells . reduce igf2r function and n6-methyladenosine ( m6a ) mrna methylation be observe in islet from both mouse and human type 2 diabetes . take together , these data point to igf2r a an important regulator of insulin secretion , cell proliferation , and autophagy in mammalian β-cells . the significance of insulin-like growth factor-2 receptor ( igf2r ) in β-cells remains unclear . to assess the physiological role of igf2r in β-cells , the effect of igf2r deficiency in vivo and in vitro be investigate . igf2r modulates insulin secretion , cell proliferation , and autophagy in β-cells . igf2r play a role in the regulation of β-cell biology .

Title: brd9-p53-e2f1 circuit orchestrates cell growth and dna damage repair in gastric cancer .
Authors: Zhou Q, Wang Q, Duan Y, Zhang C, Liu T, Liu H, Zhao M, Hu Z
Abstract: brd9 be involve in multiple physiological and pathological pathway , yet it functional role and molecular mechanism in gastric cancer ( gc ) remain largely unexplored . address this knowledge gap be critical give the persistent global mortality burden of gc and the limited efficacy of current therapeutic strategy . brd9 expression in gc patient be systematically analyze use immunohistochemical ( ihc ) assay and transcriptomic datasets . comprehensive functional validation , employ cellular and murine tumor model , elucidate brd9 's role in gc progression . molecular pathway underlie brd9-mediated gastric carcinogenesis be delineate through integrated approach , include rna sequencing , co-immunoprecipitation ( co-ip ) , subcellular fractionation , and luciferase reporter assay . brd9 be significantly overexpressed in gc and associate with poor patient prognosis . functionally , brd9 promote gc cell proliferation and enhance dna damage repair capacity . mechanistically , elevate brd9 expression inhibit p53 nuclear translocation via direct binding , subsequently activate the e2f transcription factor family . notably , we identify that e2f1 directly bind to and transactivated the brd9 promoter , establish a positive feedback loop that sustain brd9 expression . additionally , brd9 knockdown sensitized gc cell to cisplatin and oxaliplatin treatment . these finding highlight the critical role of brd9 in gc progression and it therapeutic potential . the brd9-p53-e2f1 axis act a a crucial regulator of gc cell proliferation and dna damage response . target brd9 pharmacologically could be a novel therapeutic approach to enhance chemotherapy efficacy and improve treatment outcome in gc patient .

Title: spatial multiomics of acute myocardial infarction reveals immune cell infiltration through the endocardium .
Authors: Wünnemann F, Sicklinger F, Bestak K, Nimo J, Thiemann T, Amrute JM, Nordbeck M, Hartmann N, Ibarra-Arellano MA, Tanevski J, Chazotte M, Heine C, Frey N, Lavine KJ, Coscia F, Saez-Rodriguez J, Leuschner F, Schapiro D
Abstract: myocardial infarction ( mi ) continue to be a leading cause of death worldwide . even though it be well establish that the complex interplay between different cell type determine the overall healing response after mi , the precise change in the tissue architecture be still poorly understood . in this study , we generate an integrative cellular map of the acute phase after murine mi use a combination of imaging-based transcriptomics ( molecular cartography ) and antibody-based highly multiplexed imaging ( sequential immunofluorescence ) . this enable u to evaluate cell type composition and change at subcellular resolution over time . we observe the recruitment of leukocyte to the infarcted heart through the endocardium and perform unbiased spatial proteomic analysis use deep visual proteomics ( dvp ) to investigate the underlying mechanism . dvp identify von willebrand factor ( vwf ) a an upregulated mediator of inflammation 24 hour after mi , and functional blocking of vwf reduce the infiltration of c-c chemokine receptor 2 ( ccr2 ) -positive monocyte and worsen cardiac function after mi .

Title: dual modulation of lipid and glucose metabolism by a nutraceutical combination in patient at cardiometabolic risk : result from a multicenter randomize control trial .
Authors: Pacella D, Lembo M, Trimarco V, Izzo A, Manzi MV, Jankauskas SS, Forzano I, Gallo P, Spinelli A, Morisco C, Cristiano S, Rozza PI, Esposito E, Rozza F, Esposito L, Bear SKB, Giugliano G, Santulli G
Abstract: recent evidence suggest that inhibit 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme a reductase ( hmgcr ) , a key enzyme in cholesterol biosynthesis , have beneficial effect on lipid metabolism and blood pressure ( bp ) , but detrimental consequence on glycemia . nutraceuticals ( nut ) contain both monacolin k ( mk ) and morus alba have be show to be more effective in lower lipid compare to nut formulation contain only mk . however , the effect of these nut on glucose homeostasis have not be fully determine . to evaluate the association between ldl-c-lowering therapy and glycemia in patient receive nut combination with or without morus alba , we analyze data from a prospective , randomize , active-treatment control trial ( nct02898805 ) , which enrol 359 patient to compare the effect of a nut combination contain mk alone ( formulation 1 , f1 ; n = 170 ) versus one containing mk and morus alba ( formulation 1 , f2 ; n = 189 ) . participant in the two treatment arm ( f1 vs. f2 ) be comparable in term of sex , age , metabolic parameter , and bp . after 3 month , both group experience significant reduction in ldl-c , fast plasma glucose , hba1c , and homa index . f2 treatment lead to a significantly great reduction in glycemic level compare to f1 treatment ( b = - 16 , p < 0.001 ) . notably , a divergent trend emerge over time : an inverse relationship between ldl-c and glycemic level be observe in the f1 group , while a significant direct association between ldl-c and glycemic level be detect in the f2 group ( b = 0.06 , p = 0.002 ) . take together , our finding indicate that the treatment with a nut combination contain morus alba simultaneously reduce plasma level of ldl-c and glucose .

Title: pathogenic variant reveal candidate gene for prostate cancer germline test for men of african ancestry .
Authors: Gheybi K, Soh PXY, Jiang J, Mbeki TMN, Louw M, Burns D, Mundra P, Kiriy D, Hasan MM, Jaratlerdsiri W, Lebelo MT, Campbell RA, Radzuma MB, Nenzhelele M, Obida M, Obida M, Ombuki WM, Oyaro MO, Patrick SM, Loda M, Wedge DC, Bristow RG, Brewer DS, Cooper CS, Reimand J, Cancel-Tassin G, Cussenot O, Hovens CM, Cocoran NM, Stricker PD, Schlomm T, Prins GS, Sørensen KD, Weischenfeldt J, Mutambirwa SBA, Ngugi PM, Thomas DM, Kote-Jarai Z, Eeles RA, Bornman MSR, Hayes VM
Abstract: prostate cancer ( pca ) germline test , while gain momentum , be ancestry restrictive and african exclusive . through whole genome sequencing for 217 african ancestral case ( 186 southern african , 31 pan representative ) , we identify 172 potentially pathogenic variant in 78 dna damage repair or pca relate gene . prevalence for report ( 13/217 , 5.99 % ) and cumulative predict ( 24/217 , 11.06 % ) variant of significance ( 11 gene ) fall below that report for non-africans . conversely , brca1 , hoxb13 , cdk12 , mlh1 , msh2 , and brip1 remain unimpacted . through pathogenic ranking base on variant frequency and functionality , clinical presentation and tumour-matched biallelic inactivation , top-ranked candidate include prex2 , pole , fat1 , brca2 , polq , lrp1b and atm . besides notable impact of dna polymerase , include polg , fanconi anaemia gene include fancd2 , fanca , fancg , ercc4 , fance and fanci , while dna mismatch repair gene msh3 and pms1 outrank know namesake msh6 and pms2 . this study provide insight into the spectrum of african-relevant potentially pathogenic pca variant , highlight much-needed gene candidate for ancestry-inclusive germline testing .

Title: the neural correlate of identity faking and concealment : an fmri study .
Authors: Ding XP, Du X, Lei D, Hu CS, Fu G, Chen G
Abstract: the neural basis of self and identity have receive extensive research . however , most of these exist study have focus on situation where the internal representation of the self be consistent with the external one . the present study use fmri methodology to examine the neural correlate of two different type of identity conflict : identity faking and concealment . participant be present with a sequence of name and ask to either conceal their own identity or fake another one . the result reveal that the right insular cortex and bilaterally inferior frontal gyrus be more active for identity concealment compare to the control condition , whereas identity fake elicit a significantly large percentage signal increase than the control condition in the right superior frontal gyrus , leave calcarine , and right caudate . these result suggest that different neural system associate with both identity processing and deception be involve in identity concealment and faking .

Title: development of cognitive , motor , metabolic , and mutant huntingtin aggregation in the zq175 mouse model of huntington 's disease .
Authors: McLean FH, Monteiro O, Lelos MJ, Ekkunagul T, Spicer RM, Rybnicek J, Lambert JJ, Langston RF
Abstract: huntington 's disease ( hd ) be an inherited neurodegenerative disease . in human , the clinical diagnosis be often dependent on the emergence of motor symptom . however , cognitive impairment and metabolic change can be early indicator . hd mouse model be a useful tool to understand disease progression , however , relatively few study have monitor the timeline for the emergence of cognitive index with motor and metabolic phenotype in parallel . in this study , cognitive , motor , and metabolic phenotype be investigate at different age in the zq175 knock-in mouse alongside immunohistochemical and long-term potentiation ( ltp ) study . we demonstrate that zq175 mouse develop impaired hippocampal ltp at 3-months and cognitive deficit in visuospatial attention be evident by 4-months . long-term and spatial memory impairment emerge by 12-months , alongside motor impairment . additionally , an anxiolytic-like phenotype emerge at 6-months . difference in body weight be also detect from 6-months onwards , primarily drive by a reduction in fat mass . additionally , reduce brain weight and the presence of huntingtin aggregate in the hippocampus , striatum and hypothalamus be observe at 12-months . these data support the zq175 mouse a a model of hd , which recapitulate many aspect of the disease progression in human and can be use to understand mechanism underlie the disease .

Title: integrated profiling of ipsc-derived motor neuron carry c9orf72 , fus , tardbp , or sod1 mutation .
Authors: Ma GM, Xia CC, Lyu BY, Liu J, Luo F, Guan MF, Wang JY, Sun L, Zhang L, Chen Y, Mao YW, Yu GQ, Wang WY
Abstract: here , we conduct temporal rna sequencing ( rna-seq ) profiling of human induce pluripotent stem cell ( hipscs ) and induced pluripotent stem cell ( ipsc ) -derived motor neuron ( imns ) carry c9orf72 , fus , tardbp , or sod1 mutation in both patient with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis ( al ) and healthy individual . we discover dysregulated gene expression and alternative splicing ( a ) throughout imn development and maturation , and imns with mutation in als-associated gene display enrichment of cytoskeletal defect and synaptic alteration from the premature stage to mature imns . our finding indicate that synaptic gene dysfunction be a common molecular hallmark of familial al , which may result in neuronal susceptibility and progressive motor neuron degeneration . analysis of upstream splice factor reveal that differentially express rna-binding protein ( rbps ) in imns from patient with al may cause abnormal a event . overall , our research provide a comprehensive and valuable resource for gain insight into the share mechanism of familial al pathogenesis during motor neuron development and maturation in imn model .

Title: assessment of the role of small airway dysfunction in relation to exacerbation risk in patient with well control asthma ( atlantis ) : an observational study .
Authors: Galant SP, Kuks PJM, Kole TM, Kraft M, Siddiqui S, Fabbri LM, Beghé B, Rabe KF, Papi A, Brightling CE, Singh D, Kocks JWH, Franzini L, Vonk JM, Kerstjens HAM, Heijink IH, Pouwels SD, Slebos DJ, van den Berge M
Abstract: recent survey suggest that asthma remain inadequately control in more than 50 % of adult with asthma despite guideline-based standard therapy . small airway be often under-recognised a major site of airway obstruction and inflammation . this might be relate to lack of assessment with current tool such a impulse oscillometry , and thus under-treatment might explain inadequate control . small airway dysfunction , which be common in adult with well control asthma , might represent an important biomarker of future risk of exacerbation . we aim to investigate whether small airway dysfunction be present in patient with well control asthma and , if so , whether it be a risk factor for future exacerbation in this population . the observational assessment of small airway involvement in asthma ( atlantis ) study include 773 extensively characterised patient with asthma age 18-65 year from 29 primary and specialty clinic in nine country from june 30 , 2014 , to march 3 , 2017. patient be require to be diagnose with asthma at least 6 month before inclusion base on evidence of airway hyper-responsiveness , bronchodilator reversibility , or peak expiratory flow variability . patient be require to have stable asthma , define a no asthma exacerbation and regular asthma treatment at a consistent dose for 8 week before baseline visit . the current analysis include patient with well control asthma , define a an asthma control questionnaire ( acq-6 ) score of less than 0·75 at baseline . small airway dysfunction be define , base on deviation from predict value of impulse oscillometry parameter , a a z score of more than 1·645 for r5-r20 ( resistance at 5 hz minus resistance at 20 hz ) and ax ( area of reactance ) and a z score of less than -1·645 for x5 ( reactance at 5 hz ) , with additional analysis explore severe small airway dysfunction ( z score of 3 or -3 ) . atlantis be register with clinicaltrials.gov , nct02123667 . of 773 patient , acq-6 assessment be available for 772 patient . among these patient , 384 ( 50 % ) be classify a have well control asthma , and small airway dysfunction be present in 108 ( 36 % [ 95 % ci 30-41 ] ) of 304 patient with impulse oscillometry data available for r5-r20 , 89 ( 34 % [ 28-42 ] ) of 261 patient with data for ax , and 79 ( 26 % [ 21-31 ] ) of 303 patient with data for x5 . in the multivariable analysis , we find that r5-r20-defined small airway dysfunction be associate with increased risk of future exacerbation , independent of age , sex , smoke status , global initiative for asthma step 4-5 , previous exacerbation , percentage of predict fev ( 1 ) , ratio of residual volume to total lung capacity , and peripheral blood eosinophil count ( hazard ratio [ hr ] 2·26 [ 95 % ci 1·05-4·85 ] ; p=0·038 ) , whereas ax ( 2·07 [ 0·91-4·70 ] ; p=0·082 ) and x5 ( 0·86 [ 0·33-2·21 ] ; p=0·75 ) be not associate with exacerbation . for severe small airway disease , both r5-r20 ( hr 2·80 [ 95 % ci 1·26-6·26 ] ; p=0·012 ) and ax ( 2·51 [ 1·04-6·04 ] ; p=0·041 ) become independent predictor of future exacerbation , whereas x5 remain non-significant ( 0·99 [ 0·29-3·32 ] ; p=0·98 ) . we have address an undervalued trait by show that small airway dysfunction be a common , sensitive , early independent risk biomarker for future exacerbation in adult with well control asthma . chiesi pharmaceutical and the dutch ministry of health .

Title: engineer exosomes with kras ( g12d ) specific sirna in pancreatic cancer : a phase i study with immunological correlate .
Authors: Kalluri VS, Smaglo BG, Mahadevan KK, Kirtley ML, McAndrews KM, Mendt M, Yang S, Maldonado AS, Sugimoto H, Salvatierra ME, Solis Soto LM, Haymaker C, Finch R, Gagea M, Fluty AC, Ludtke SJ, Jack Lee J, Jain AK, Varadhachary G, Shroff RT, Maitra A, Shpall E, Pant S, Kalluri R
Abstract: oncogenic kras be amongst the key genetic driver for initiation and maintenance of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma ( pdac ) . here , we show that engineer exosomes with kras ( g12d ) specific sirna ( iexokras ( g12d ) ) reveal a biodistribution in pancreas with negligible toxicity in preclinical study in mouse and rhesus macaque . clinical testing of iexokras ( g12d ) in the iexplore ( iexokras ( g12d ) in pancreatic cancer ) phase i study employ a non-randomized single-arm classical 3 + 3 dose escalation design ( phase ia ) , follow by an accelerated titration design ( phase ib ) ( nct03608631 ) . the primary outcome include safety , tolerability and target engagement , and the secondary outcome aim to assess disease control . patient with advanced metastatic disease be enrol after failure of multiple line of therapy . iexokras ( g12d ) therapy be well-tolerated : the primary outcome be meet with iexokras ( g12d ) show no dose-limiting toxicity . the maximum tolerate dose be not reach even at the high dose . in some case , iexokras ( g12d ) therapy be associate with stable disease response ( secondary outcome ) . downregulation of kras ( g12d ) dna and suppression of phospho-erk be document together with an increase in intratumoral cd8 ( + ) t cell follow treatment . the cd8 ( + ) t cell recruitment priming by iexokras ( g12d ) inform on potential efficacy of immune checkpoint therapy and lead to validation test in preclinical pdac model . combination therapy of iexokras ( g12d ) and anti-ctla-4 antibody , but not anti-pd1 , reveal robust pre-clinical anti-tumor efficacy via fa mediate cd8 ( + ) t cell anti-tumor activity . this first-in-human , precision medicine clinical trial and support preclinical functional study offer new insight into priming of immunotherapy by oncogenic kras inhibitor for future opportunistic combination therapy for pdac patient .

Title: cytokine expression profile in the human brain of old adult .
Authors: Godoy JB, Vialle RA, Dos Santos L, Raittz RT, Wang Y, Menon V, De Jager PL, Schneider JA, Tasaki S, Bennett DA, Guizelini D, de Paiva Lopes K
Abstract: alzheimer 's disease ( ad ) be a complex neurodegenerative condition link to chronic neuroinflammation . this study investigate the cytokine gene expression profile in cortical tissue sample from elderly individual with and without ad to identify potential biomarkers and enhance our understanding of disease pathogenesis . utilizing high-depth rna sequence data , we identify a set of cytokine whose expression significantly associate with different aspect of the ad phenotype , include measure of neurofibrillary tangle , amyloid-β deposition , and a person-specific rate of cognitive decline . single-nucleus transcriptomics data facilitate the identification of specific cell type , such a microglia and astrocyte , that significantly contribute to the inflammatory response in ad . additionally , we observe a correlation between the expression of certain cytokine and genetic risk for the disease . our finding indicate that cytokine-mediated neuroinflammation may play an important role in neurodegeneration and that modulate the immune response may offer a promising strategy for develop new therapy .

Title: trem2+ macrophage alleviate renal tubule lipid accumulation and ferroptosis in diabetic nephropathy by repress il-1β-mediated cd36 expression .
Authors: Wang X, Wan J, Wang C, Tong Y, Chen Y, Wang X, Liu J, Li Q, Dong Z, Hong Q, Sun X, Cai G, Ouyang Q, Chen X
Abstract: the presence of macrophage surround lipotoxic tubular epithelial cell ( tec ) be a hallmark of diabetic nephropathy ( dn ) . nevertheless , the mechanism of communication between these cell here , we explore the characteristic and the function of trem2+ macrophage in the progress of dn . rna-sequencing of macrophage in kidney of trem2 knockout ( ko ) mouse feed a high-fat diet plus streptozotocin ( hfd/stz ) reveal functional enrichment of metabolic process , cytokine production , positive regulation of extracellular signal-regulated kinase ( erk ) cascade , and the regulation of phagocytosis . in vivo study demonstrate that trem2+ macrophage reduce lipid accumulation and mitigate ferroptosis of tec in diabetic mouse . mechanistically , trem2-deficient macrophage amplify the production of interleukin-1β ( il-1β ) through activate the erk signal pathway . furthermore , il-1β trigger cd36 expression via the transcription factor nf-κb . bioinformatics and functional assay show nf-κb bind the cd36 promoter , which directly bound to the promoter of cd36 to facilitate it transcription . inhibition of nf-κb blocked il-1β-induced cd36 production . this mechanism be exacerbate in trem2-deficient macrophage , which release excess il-1β to activate nf-κb in tubular cell , promote cd36-dependent lipid uptake and ferroptosis . additionally , we find trem2 play a role in enhance the phagocytosis and clearance of ferroptotic cell by bone marrow-derived macrophage . altogether , our result suggest trem2+ macrophage maintain homeostasis of the renal microenvironment and exert a protective function in dn . level of trigger receptor express on myeloid cell 2 ( trem2 ) in macrophage be increase in human patient and in mouse with diabetic nephropathy . trem2 suppress the extracellular signal-regulated kinase signal pathway , thereby inhibit il-1β production in macrophage . macrophage trem2 deficiency exacerbate tubular cell lipid deposition and ferroptosis by increase cd36 expression in an il-1β-dependent manner .

Title: a 1.8-mb yac contig span three member of the receptor tyrosine kinase gene family ( pdgfra , kit , and flk1 ) on mouse chromosome 5 .
Authors: Brunkow ME, Nagle DL, Bernstein A, Bucan M
Abstract: we construct a yeast artificial chromosome ( yac ) contig span the gene encode kit ( kit ) , the platelet-derived growth factor alpha receptor ( pdgfra ) , and fetal liver kinase 1 ( flk1 ) , three member of a receptor tyrosine kinase gene family locate in the central portion of mouse chromosome 5. the orientation of yac clone and the extent of their overlap be determine by `` probe content mapping , '' that be , hybridization analysis of yac clone use the available gene probe and yac end sequence . for four yac clone , which constitute a minimal set span 1.8 mb , a detailed restriction map be construct . this map , in conjunction with the previously publish long-range restriction map , indicate the order , the physical distance , and the relative transcriptional orientation of the pdgfra , kit , and flk1 gene . the yac clone and correspond yac end probe present here provide an important resource for the molecular analysis of a cluster of developmental mutation , namely dominant white spotting ( w ) , patch ( ph ) , recessive spotting ( r ) , and rump-white ( rw ) , associate with this chromosomal region .

Title: long covid associate with sars-cov-2 reinfection among child and adolescent in the omicron era ( recover-ehr ) : a retrospective cohort study .
Authors: Zhang B, Wu Q, Jhaveri R, Zhou T, Becich MJ, Bisyuk Y, Blanceró F, Chrischilles EA, Chuang CH, Cowell LG, Fort D, Horowitz CR, Kim S, Ladino N, Liebovitz DM, Liu M, Mosa ASM, Schwenk HT, Suresh S, Taylor BW, Williams DA, Morris JS, Forrest CB, Chen Y
Abstract: post-acute sequela of sars-cov-2 infection ( pasc ) remain a major public health challenge . although previous study have focus on characterise pasc in child and adolescent after an initial health-care utilisation factor use exact and propensity-score matching . we identify 407 300 ( 87·5 % ) of 465 717 eligible child and adolescent with a first infection episode and 58 417 ( 12·5 % ) with a second infection episode from jan 1 , 2022 , to oct 13 , 2023 , in the recover database . 233 842 ( 50·2 % ) patient be male and 231 875 ( 49·8 % ) be female . the mean age be 8·17 year ( sd 6·58 ) . the incident rate of pasc diagnosis ( u09.9 ) per million people per 6 month be 903·7 ( 95 % ci 780·9-1026·5 ) in the first infection group and 1883·7 ( 1565·1-2202·3 ) in the second infection group . reinfection be associate with a significantly increase risk of an overall pasc diagnosis ( u09.9 ) ( rr 2·08 [ 1·68-2·59 ] ) and a range of symptom and condition potentially relate to pasc ( rr range 1·15-3·60 ) , include myocarditis , change in taste and smell , thrombophlebitis and thromboembolism , heart disease , acute kidney injury , fluid and electrolyte disturbance , generalise pain , arrhythmia , abnormal liver enzyme , chest pain , fatigue and malaise , headache , musculoskeletal pain , abdominal pain , mental ill health , pot or dysautonomia , cognitive impairment , skin condition , fever and chill , respiratory sign and symptom , and cardiovascular sign and symptom . child and adolescent face a significantly high risk of various pasc outcomes after reinfection with sars-cov-2 . these finding add to previous evidence link paediatric long covid to multisystem effect and highlight the need to promote vaccination in young population and support ongoing research to good understand pasc , identify high-risk subgroup , and improve prevention and care strategy . national institute of health .

Abstract: clonal expansion be a hallmark of adaptive immunity and have be challenge to investigate in human in a standardized manner compare with animal model . we study a cohort of 29 healthy individual who receive three mrna vaccination against sars-cov-2 before a breakthrough infection . we characterize the magnitude , phenotype , and clonal composition of cd8 t cell response against 16 epitope specificity by elispot ; flow cytometry ; and single-cell rna , protein , and t cell receptor ( tcr ) sequencing . one hundred six tcrs from five epitope-specific repertoire be reexpressed and test for peptide sensitivity . whereas vaccination-recruited t cell repertoire be enrich for high-avidity tcrs , differential clonal expansion be not link to fine avidity difference . instead , maintenance of polyclonality ensure robustness in counteract viral mutational escape through altered epitope . decipher the functionality of human antigen-specific t cell repertoires instruct our understanding of human t cell biology and may guide the development of vaccine and other immunotherapy .

Title: a randomized , placebo-controlled , crossover clinical trial to evaluate the effect of a turmeric formulation on muscle soreness and function recovery in moderately active adult .
Authors: Schönenberger KA, Laval J, Woods T, Truillet R, Naranjo-Modad S, Mettler S, Fança-Berthon P
Abstract: turmeric may alleviate exercise-induced muscle soreness ( delay onset muscle soreness ) and muscular function loss due to the strong anti-inflammatory and antioxidant activity of it active immediately before and 0 , 24 , 48 , and 72 hour post-exercise , muscle soreness during squat on quadriceps ( visual analog scale ) , muscular function ( knee extension dynamometer ) , muscle power ( vertical jump test ) , muscle damage ( serum creatine kinase ) , range of motion ( knee flexion ) , and perceive wellness and wellbeing ( questionnaire ) be assess . during exercise , exhaustion be assess use the borg rating of perceived exertion . the primary trial population consist of the male participant , outcome in female be consider exploratory . adjust least square mean with standard error ( se ) be obtain from mixed model for repeated measure . there be no significant difference between the turmeric formulation and placebo in muscle soreness area under the curve from pre-exercise to 72 hour post-exercise and at all timepoints , except for a trend observe in male 72 hour after exercise ( adjust mean [ se ] for difference from placebo = -4.8 [ 2.7 ] mm , p = 0.0776 ) . muscle soreness recovery ( difference between soreness at 72 hour and maximal post-exercise soreness ) be significantly great with the turmeric formulation compare to placebo ( adjust mean [ se ] for difference from placebo = -10.7 % [ 4.3 % ] , p = 0.0184 for the male participant , and -7.9 % [ 3.6 % ] , p = 0.0346 for the total sample ) . furthermore , in male , the decrease from pre-exercise to 24 hour after exercise in isokinetic peak torque be significantly low with the turmeric formulation ( adjust mean [ se ] for difference from placebo = 11.0 [ 4.9 ] nm , p = 0.0275 ) , a be the decrease in isokinetic max rep work ( adjust mean [ se ] for difference from placebo = 11.6 [ 4.9 ] j , p = 0.0195 ) , while vertical jump peak power at 24 hour after exercise be high ( median [ interquartile range ] with the turmeric formulation vs. placebo = 931.1 [ 825.9 ; 1001.1 ] w vs. 916.5 [ 824.8 ; 989.5 ] w , p = 0.0445 ) . supplementation with the turmeric formulation can accelerate Journal: Journal of the International Society of Sports Nutrition

Title: dcaf12 ubiquitin ligase promote lung cancer metastasis by modulate the tric/cct chaperonin complex .
Authors: Wang Z, Huang H, Huang K, Cui X, Wu L, Lin R, Zhao Z, Chen H, Zheng C, Jin W, Chen S, Chen J, Xu Y, Wei D
Abstract: metastasis be the primary challenge in lung cancer treatment . although proteostasis support tumor growth , the mechanism by which ubiquitin ligases reprogram chaperone network to drive metastasis be poorly understood . in this study , it be reveal that ddb1-cul4-associated factor ( dcaf12 ) , a substrate receptor for cul4-ring ubiquitin ligases , regulate metastatic progression through ubiquitin-mediated proteostatic reprogramming . dcaf12 depletion suppresses tumor cell migration and stemness in vitro and reduces pulmonary/hepatic metastasis in vivo . mechanistically , dcaf12 catalyze the non-degradative ubiquitination of tric/cct subunit , enhance chaperonin assembly and folding of cytoskeletal effector ( β-actin/tubulin ) and oncogenic client ( stat3/raptor/mlst8 ) , thereby activate the yap , stat3 , and mtor pathway . both genetic knockdown and pharmacological blockade ( via hsf1a ) of this axis potently inhibit metastasis . clinically , dcaf12 overexpression be correlate with yap/stat3 activation , advanced metastasis , and poor survival . three key insight be reveal : 1 ) ubiquitination-mediated tric/cct regulation a a metastatic switch , 2 ) dcaf12 a an oncogenic proteostasis hub , and 3 ) therapeutic potential validate through multimodal targeting . these finding establish the dcaf12-tric/cct axis a a mechanistically novel target that simultaneously disrupt cytoskeletal dynamic and oncogenic signaling , make it a promising therapeutic strategy for metastatic lung cancer .

Title: budesonide-formoterol versus salbutamol a reliever therapy in child with mild asthma ( care ) : a 52-week , open-label , multicentre , superiority , randomise control trial .
Authors: Hatter L, Holliday M, Oldfield K, Kearns C, Barry T, Black M, Bruce P, Colman A, Dickinson E, Eathorne A, Harwood M, Hills T, Lamb R, Kerse K, Krishnamoorthy S, Martindale J, Semprini A, Shortt N, McNamara D, Byrnes CA, Dalziel SR, Bush A, Weatherall M, Beasley R
Abstract: combination inhale corticosteroid-formoterol reliever monotherapy reduce the rate of asthma attack compare to short-acting β ( 2 ) -agonist ( saba ) reliever monotherapy in adult . it comparative efficacy in child have not be establish . care be a 52-week , open-label , parallel-group , multicentre , superiority , randomise control trial in child age 5-15 year with asthma use saba reliever monotherapy at 15 clinical trial site in new zealand . participant be randomly assign ( 1:1 ) to either budesonide 50 μg-formoterol 3 μg , two actuation a need , or salbutamol 100 μg , two actuation a need . the primary outcome be asthma attack a rate per participant per year . this trial be register with the australian new zealand clinical trial registry , actrn12620001091998 . from jan 28 , 2021 , to june 23 , 2023 , we assess 382 participant for eligibility . we randomly assign 360 ( 94 % ) participant to treatment ( 179 [ 50 % ] to the budesonide-formoterol group and 181 [ 50 % ] to the salbutamol group ) . the annualised rate of asthma attack be lower in the budesonide-formoterol group than in the salbutamol group-cluster-adjusted rate 0·23 versus 0·41 per participant per year ( relative rate 0·55 [ 95 % ci 0·35-0·86 ] ; p=0·012 ) . the number of participant with at least one adverse event be 162 ( 91 % ) in the budesonide-formoterol group and 167 ( 92 % ) in the salbutamol group ( odds ratio 0·79 [ 95 % ci 0·35-1·79 ] ) . in child age 5-15 year with mild asthma , budesonide-formoterol reliever monotherapy be superior to salbutamol for prevent asthma attack , with a similar safety profile . health research council of new zealand , cure kid new zealand , and the barbara basham medical charitable trust ( manage by perpetual guardian ) .

Title: investigate the relationship of plasma micrornas and colorectal cancer risk use genetic evidence .
Authors: Bouras E, Papagiannopoulos CK, Mustafa R, Sobieski D, Schmit SL, Wu AH, Brenner H, Li CI, Chan AT, Pellatt AJ, Zheng W, Keku TO, Moreno V, Um CY, Van Guelpen B, Phipps AI, Pai RK, Lewis SJ, Martin RM, Gunter MJ, Peters U, Dehghan A, Tsilidis KK
Abstract: micrornas ( mirnas ) be short , single-stranded rna that function a post-transcriptional regulator of gene expression . although circulate mirnas have be link to carcinogenesis , they have not yet be systematically investigate in relation to risk of colorectal cancer ( crc ) . we use mendelian randomization ( mr ) and colocalization analysis to investigate the association of genetically predict plasma mirna concentration ( 2083 mirnas in 710 individual ) with risk of crc ( 58,221 case and 67,694 control ) . for mirnas associate with crc risk , we also investigate their association with circulate plasma protein ( 4907 protein in 35,559 participant ) , bidirectionally , use mr. we perform pathway enrichment analysis ( pea ) to explore downstream molecular pathway . association of five mirnas with crc be find in mr and support in colocalization analysis . specifically , mir-146a-5p , mir-21-5p , and mir-4707-3p be positively , and mir-1908-5p and mir-6810-3p be inversely associate with crc risk . several protein association be find for these mirnas ( range of protein with p < 0.05 : 78-796 ; 211 with fdr < 5 % ) , and 11 pathway be identify in pea , include regulation of erb-b2 receptor tyrosine kinase 4 ( mir-6810-3p ) and insulin-like growth factor pathway ( mir-1908-5p ) . our result support a potential implication of mir-146a-5p , mir-21-5p , mir-4707-3p , mir-1908-5p , and mir-6810-3p to crc risk . however , their downstream effect should be elucidate before they can be utilize a preventive target .

Title: single-dose psilocybin rapidly and sustainably relief allodynia and anxiodepressive-like behavior in mouse model of chronic pain .
Authors: Hammo A, Wisser S, Cichon J
Abstract: chronic pain and mood disorder co-occur , exacerbate one another and share neurobiological mechanism , but whether a single intervention could promptly alleviate both condition remain unclear . here , in two chronic pain model , we show that a single dose of psilocybin induces a rapid and sustain reversal of both mechanical allodynia and anxiodepression-like state in adult male and female mouse . use local psilocin injection , the key active metabolite of psilocybin , we show that the engagement of prefrontal cortical circuit be critical for the concurrent alleviation of both condition . two-photon calcium imaging reveals that psilocin rapidly normalizes chronic pain-associated hyperactivity in anterior cingulate cortex layer 2/3 pyramidal neuron . pharmacologic manipulation with full agonist of 5-ht ( 2a ) and 5-ht ( 1a ) receptor replicate some , but not all , of psilocin 's cellular and behavioral effect , suggest that psilocin 's action arise from partial agonism at these receptor within share circuit govern pain and mood processing .

Title: aberrant expression of slamf6 constitute a targetable immune escape mechanism in acute myeloid leukemia .
Authors: Sandén C, Landberg N, Peña-Martínez P, Thorsson H, Daga S, Puente-Moncada N, Rodriguez-Zabala M, von Palffy S, Rissler M, Lazarevic V, Juliusson G, Ohlin M, Hyrenius-Wittsten A, Orsmark-Pietras C, Lilljebjörn H, Ågerstam H, Fioretos T
Abstract: immunotherapy have show limited success in acute myeloid leukemia ( aml ) , indicate an incomplete understanding of the underlying immunoregulatory mechanism . here we identify an immune evasion mechanism present in 60 % of aml case , wherein primitive aml cell aberrantly express the lymphoid surface protein slamf6 ( signal lymphocyte activation molecule family member 6 ) . knockout of slamf6 in aml cell enable t cell activation and highly efficient killing of leukemia cell in coculture system , demonstrate that slamf6 protects aml cell from recognition and elimination by the immune system in a mode analogous to the program cell death protein-ligand ( pdl1/pd1 ) axis . target slamf6 with an antibody against the slamf6 dimerization site inhibit the slamf6-slamf6 interaction and induces t cell activation and killing of aml cell both in vitro and in humanize in vivo model . in conclusion , we show that aberrant expression of slamf6 be a common and targetable immune escape mechanism that could pave the way for immunotherapy in aml .

Title: sfpq-tfe3 reciprocally regulate mtorc1 and induces lineage plasticity in a mouse model of renal tumorigenesis .
Authors: Asrani K, Amaral A, Woo J, Abadchi SN, Vidotto T, Imada E, Skaist A, Feng K, Liu HB, Kasbe M, Satou Y, Baba M, Oike Y, Outeda P, Watnick T, Rosenberg AZ, Schmidt LS, Linehan WM, Argani P, Lotan TL
Abstract: mit/tfe gene fusion like sfpq-tfe3 drive both epithelial ( translocation rcc ) and mesenchymal ( pecomas ) neoplasm . however , no mouse model for sfpq-tfe3-related tumor exist and the underlying mechanism of lineage plasticity remain unclear . here , we demonstrate that constitutive murine renal expression of sfpq-tfe3 disrupts kidney development with early neonatal renal failure and death , while post-natal induction induces infiltrative epithelioid tumor , that morphologically and transcriptionally resemble human pecomas , with strong activation of mtorc1 signal via increase v-atpase expression . remarkably , sfpq-tfe3 expression be sufficient to induce lineage plasticity , with down-regulation of the pax2/pax8 nephric lineage factor and tubular epithelial marker , and up-regulation of pecoma differentiation marker in transgenic mouse , cell line and human trcc . mtor inhibition downregulates sfpq-tfe3 expression and rescue pax8 expression and transcriptional activity in vitro . these data provide evidence of an epithelial cell-of-origin for tfe3-driven pecomas , highlight a reciprocal role for sfpq-tfe3 and mtor in drive lineage plasticity in the kidney .

Title: sfpq-tfe3 reciprocally regulate mtorc1 and induces lineage plasticity in a mouse model of renal tumorigenesis .
Authors: Asrani K, Amaral A, Woo J, Abadchi SN, Vidotto T, Imada E, Skaist A, Feng K, Liu HB, Kasbe M, Satou Y, Baba M, Oike Y, Outeda P, Watnick T, Rosenberg AZ, Schmidt LS, Linehan WM, Argani P, Lotan TL
Abstract: mit/tfe gene fusion like sfpq-tfe3 drive both epithelial ( translocation rcc ) and mesenchymal ( pecomas ) neoplasm . however , no mouse model for sfpq-tfe3-related tumor exist and the underlying mechanism of lineage plasticity remain unclear . here , we demonstrate that constitutive murine renal expression of sfpq-tfe3 disrupts kidney development with early neonatal renal failure and death , while post-natal induction induces infiltrative epithelioid tumor , that morphologically and transcriptionally resemble human pecomas , with strong activation of mtorc1 signal via increase v-atpase expression . remarkably , sfpq-tfe3 expression be sufficient to induce lineage plasticity , with down-regulation of the pax2/pax8 nephric lineage factor and tubular epithelial marker , and up-regulation of pecoma differentiation marker in transgenic mouse , cell line and human trcc . mtor inhibition downregulates sfpq-tfe3 expression and rescue pax8 expression and transcriptional activity in vitro . these data provide evidence of an epithelial cell-of-origin for tfe3-driven pecomas , highlight a reciprocal role for sfpq-tfe3 and mtor in drive lineage plasticity in the kidney .

Title: gpx1-driven selenium nanoplatform reprograms mams-mediated organelle crosstalk to reverse inflammatory adipose expansion in thyroid eye disease .
Authors: Tan Y, Zhang F, Cao J, Feng L, Xie B, Gao L, Chen X, Yan Z, Xiong W
Abstract: background : thyroid eye disease ( ted ) be a multifactorial autoimmune disorder with limited therapeutic option due to the complexity of it oxidative , metabolic , and inflammatory network . this study aim to develop a selenium-based nanoplatform that target mitochondria-er interaction to reverse inflammatory adipose expansion in ted . method : we design a dual-responsive selenium nanoparticle ( se @ lnt ) modify with lentinan , capable of ros/ph-triggered release . human primary orbital fibroblast , bioinformatic analysis of public datasets , and ted mouse model be use to investigate the therapeutic mechanism . result : se @ lnt undergoes intracellular metabolic conversion into selenocysteine , which enhance gpx1 activity and promotes redox balance . it exert triple regulatory effect by stabilize mitochondrial membrane to reduce mtdna leakage , downregulating grp75 to normalize mam contact and calcium flux , and suppress perk-eif2α-atf4 signal to relieve er stress . transcriptomic profiling reveals multi-target modulation of immune-stromal interaction . in vivo , se @ lnt achieves orbital targeting , rapid hepatic-renal clearance , and significant reduction of adipose expansion with immune remodel . conclusion : se @ lnt offer the first mams-targeted nanotherapy for ted by reprogramming organelle crosstalk , restore metabolic-immune homeostasis , and modify disease progression at the subcellular level .

Title: vista express on tumor cell be regulate by m6a and influence immune microenvironment through stat3/ccl22 in nsclc .
Authors: Xu H, Shen K, Jiang B, Xu Q, Li B, Ke Z, Cheng Q, Zhu S, Wang D, Song Y, Lv T
Abstract: immunotherapy be play an increasingly vital role in the treatment of non-small cell lung cancer ( nsclc ) , yet the challenge of immune evasion remain prevalent . therefore , investigate the regulatory mechanism of the tumor immune microenvironment could yield significant benefit . this study utilized differential expression analysis , wgcna , and lasso-cox to analyze the gse126044 dataset , identify n6-methyladenosine ( m6a ) -related molecule that play significant role in immunotherapy . the m6a modification of the molecule be validate through m6a dot blot , merip , rna pull-down and rna stability assay . their impact on the biological behavior of tumor cell ( tc ) be evaluate by cck-8 assay , wound heal assay , transwell assay , co-culture experiment and flow cytometry . furthermore , rna sequencing be conduct to uncover downstream pathway and cytokine , follow by subsequent validation . lastly , validation be carry out in vivo . through bioinformatics analysis , we identify that v-domain immunoglobulin suppressor of t cell activation ( vista ) serve a crucial role in immunotherapy and that it expression be regulate by m6a . it be subsequently confirm that mettl3 enhance the m6a modification level of vista mrna , which be recognize by ythdf1 . this interaction improve the stability of vista mrna , lead to increase expression of vista protein on the surface of tc . the elevated expression of vista boost the cytotoxic response of cd8 + t cell toward tc . rna sequence analysis indicate that the jak/stat pathway significantly contribute to this process . overexpression of vista on tc decrease the phosphorylation of stat3 , which in turn reduce the expression and release of ccl22 . this reduction alleviate immune suppression within the tumor microenvironment , result in increase enrichment and activity of cd8 + t cell and decreased enrichment of regulatory t cell ( tregs ) , ultimately enhance their cytotoxic effect against tc . we conduct a pioneering systematic study on the expression , function , and molecular mechanism of the vista molecule on nsclc tc . we propose that in the tumor immune microenvironment , vista function a both an immune checkpoint and a regulator of cd8 + t cell activation/recruitment and treg recruitment via it expression on tc .

Title: prostate-specific membrane antigen pet-guided intensification of salvage radiotherapy after radical prostatectomy : a phase 2 randomized clinical trial .
Authors: Belliveau C, Saad F, Duplan D, Petit C, Delouya G, Taussky D, Barkati M, Lambert C, Beauchemin MC, Clavel S, Mok G, Igidbashian L, Gauthier-Paré AS, Nguyen TV, McLaughlin PY, Keu KV, DaSilva JN, Juneau D, Ménard C
Abstract: prostate-specific membrane antigen positron emission tomography ( psma-pet ) offer superior accuracy in detect prostate cancer lesion lead to intensify radiotherapy ( rt ) , but it impact on patient outcome be still undefined . to evaluate whether intensification of salvage rt ( srt ) after radical prostatectomy ( rp ) guide by psma-pet ( psmaisrt ) be associate with improved failure-free survival ( ffs ) . design , set , psmaisrt be a stratified cohort within a large psma-guided intensification of radiotherapy ( psmagrt ) trial , a phase 2 , two-center , registry-based randomized clinical trial . patient with biochemical recurrence follow rp who be eligible for standard-of-care ( soc ) srt from may 2018 to february 2021 , be eligible for randomization in the psmaisrt stratum . a total of 130 patient be randomize , with 2 who do not proceed to radiotherapy ( rt ) . the cutoff date for the primary analysis be october 26 , 2023. patient be randomize in a 1:1 ratio to receive either soc srt to the prostate bed , with or without elective pelvic rt , with or without adjuvant hormonal therapy ( ht ) , or psma-pet/ct-guided srt , intensify to detect site of disease . the primary end point be ffs , define a psa progression ( psa nadir > 0.2 ng/ml ) , radiological progression , next-line therapy initiation , or death . among 128 patient ( median [ iqr ] age , 71 [ 64-74 ] year ) , median ( range ) psa at enrollment be 0.3 ( 0.1-3.0 ) ng/ml . in the psmaisrt group , 33 of 64 patient ( 52 % ) receive intensified srt ; with addition of pelvic rt ( n = 16 [ 25 % ] ) , metastasis-directed rt ( n = 2 [ 3 % ] ) , lymph node boost ( n = 19 [ 30 % ] ) , or prostate bed boost ( n = 15 ) . adjuvant hormone therapy be equally prevalent in both arm ( 55 [ 86 % ] control vs 54 [ 84 % ] psmaisrt ) . at a median ( range ) follow-up of 37 ( 7-60 ) month , psmaisrt improve ffs ( hazard ratio [ hr ] , 0.50 ; 95 % ci , 0.27-0.94 ; p = .04 ) and eugonadal ffs ( hr , 0.45 ; 95 % ci , 0.21-0.96 ; p = .03 ) , with it great benefit in the subgroup with psa of 0.3 ng/ml or more ( hr , 0.17 ; 95 % ci , 0.04-0.79 ; p = .01 ) . few next-line treatment event occur in the psmaisrt arm ( 4 vs 12 ; hr , 0.32 ; 95 % ci , 0.11-1.02 ; p = .04 ) . there be no significant difference in toxic effect or quality of life between arm . this phase 2 trial demonstrate an isotoxic improvement in cancer control with psma-pet-guided intensification of srt after rp . confirmatory evidence be await from a subsequently accrue phase 3 trial . clinicaltrials.gov nct03525288 .

Title: esophageal cancer risk by type of alcohol drinking and smoking : a case-control study in spain .
Authors: Vioque J, Barber X, Bolumar F, Porta M, Santibáñez M, de la Hera MG, Moreno-Osset E
Abstract: the effect of tobacco smoking and alcohol drinking on esophageal cancer ( ec ) have never be explore in spain where black tobacco and wine consumption be quite prevalent . we estimate the independent effect of different alcoholic beverage and type of tobacco smoking on the risk of ec and it main histological cell type ( squamous cell carcinoma ) in a hospital-based case-control study in a mediterranean area of spain . we only include incident case with histologically confirm ec ( n = 202 ) . control be frequency-matched to case by age , sex and province ( n = 455 ) . information on risk factor be elicit by trained interviewer use structured questionnaire . multiple logistic regression be use to estimate adjust odds ratio and 95 % confidence interval ( ci ) . alcohol drinking and tobacco smoking be strong and independent risk factor for esophageal cancer . alcohol be a potent risk factor with a clear dose-response relationship , particularly for esophageal squamous-cell cancer . compare to never-drinkers , the risk for heavy drinker ( > or = 75 g/day of pure ethanol ) be 7.65 ( 95 % ci , 3.16-18.49 ) ; and compare with never-smokers , the risk for heavy smoker ( > or = 30 cigarettes/day ) be 5.07 ( 95 % ci , 2.06-12.47 ) . a low consumption of only wine and/or beer ( 1-24 g/d ) do not increase the risk whereas a strong positive trend be observe for all type of alcoholic beverage that include any combination of hard liquor with beer and/or wine ( p-trend < 0.00001 ) . a significant increase in ec risk be only observed for black-tobacco smoking ( 2.5-fold increase ) , not for blond tobacco . the effect for alcohol drinking be much strong when the analysis be limit to the esophageal squamous cell carcinoma ( n = 160 ) , whereas a lack of effect for adenocarcinoma be evidence . smoke cessation show a beneficial effect within ten year whereas drinking cessation do not . our study show that the risk of ec , and particularly the squamous cell type , be strongly associate with alcohol drinking . the consumption of any combination of hard liquor seem to be harmful whereas a low consumption of only wine may not . this may relate to the presence of certain antioxidant compound find in wine but practically lack in liquor . tobacco smoking be also a clear risk factor , black more than blond .

Title: integrate bioinformatics and experimental validation to reveal a novel vrk score a a prognostic and therapeutic biomarker in hepatocellular carcinoma .
Authors: Fu Z, Liu D, Chen M, Zhong G, Zhao Z, Gong J, Dai X, Hu J, Jia D, Cheng L, Cai D, Gong J
Abstract: vaccinia-related kinase ( vrk ) family gene play a multifunctional role in tumor development . however , the role of vrk family gene in hepatocellular carcinoma ( hcc ) require further research . moreover , the clinical potential of the vrk-related model remain unclear . the aim of this study be to construct a vrk-related model to predict hcc prognosis and therapeutic efficacy . the data of hcc patient be extract from the cancer genome atlas ( tcga ) , international cancer genome consortium ( icgc ) , and gene expression omnibus ( geo ) databases . the single-sample gene set enrichment analysis ( ssgsea ) algorithm be use to calculate the vrk score of each sample . tumor immune estimation resource 2.0 ( timer 2.0 ) and tumor immune dysfunction and exclusion ( tide ) be use to evaluate immune cell infiltration and the immune checkpoint response . prrophetic be use for predict drug sensitivity . cck-8 , colony formation , wound healing , transwell and xenograft assay be use to experimentally validate the biofunction of vrk2 in hcc . we find that all vrk family gene be highly express in hcc . compare with patient with low vrk score , patient with high vrk1 or vrk2 expression in the tcga , icgc , and gse14520 cohort have poorer outcomes . moreover , patient with a high vrk score in the tcga , icgc , and gse14520 cohort also have poorer outcomes . importantly , cox analysis reveal that the vrk score be a potential independent risk factor for hcc . notably , timer2.0 and tide suggest that patient with high vrk score have high immune checkpoint response rate . similarly , drug sensitivity analyse suggest that patient with high vrk score be more resistant to sorafenib , paclitaxel , cisplatin , and gemcitabine . finally , experimental validation reveal that vrk2 knockdown inhibit hcc development in vitro and in vivo . the vrk score be find to be a reliable indicator for predict hcc prognosis and therapeutic efficacy . vrk2 be a potential therapeutic target for hcc .

Title: segregate supramammillary-dentate gyrus circuit modulate cognitive and affective function in healthy and alzheimer 's disease model mouse .
Authors: Luo YJ, Li L, Chen ZK, Dong P, Xie L, Farmer WT, Yu QS, Jiang LX, Su WK, Liu HS, Wang HZ, Jiao ZL, Melville DJ, Penel E, Sheehy RN, Landry T, Wang J, Jiang H, Xu XH, Chen X, Xu NJ, Xue T, Xu TL, Li YD, Song J
Abstract: while progressive cognitive decline be the define feature of alzheimer 's disease ( ad ) , many patient also develop prominent neuropsychiatric symptom , include anxiety and depression . the circuit-level mechanism underlie these distinct symptom domain remain poorly understood , and treatment that address both cognitive and noncognitive aspect of ad be limit . here , we identify anatomically , molecularly , and functionally distinct subpopulation of supramammillary ( sum ) neuron that project to either the dorsal or ventral dentate gyrus ( ddg or vdg ) . these distinct sum neuron and their sum-dg subcircuits selectively regulate memory and emotion , respectively . in ad model mouse , sum neuron target ddg or vdg display aberrant activity during memory or emotional processing , and importantly , target optogenetic activation of sum-ddg or sum-vdg pathway selectively restore cognitive or affective function . these finding reveal sum-dg subcircuits a parallel modulators of cognitive and emotional state and highlight their potential a therapeutic target for address the multifaceted symptomatology of ad .

Title: identification of lacrimal gland postganglionic innervation and it regulation of tear secretion .
Authors: Jin K, Imada T, Hisamura R, Ito M, Toriumi H, Tanaka KF, Nakamura S, Tsubota K
Abstract: tear fluid secrete from the exocrine lacrimal gland ( lg ) have an essential role in maintain a homeostatic environment for a healthy ocular surface . tear secretion be regulate by the sympathetic and parasympathetic component of the autonomic nervous system , although the contribution of each component be not fully understood . to investigate lg innervation , we identify sympathetic and parasympathetic postganglionic nerve , specifically innervate the mouse lg , by inject a retrograde neuronal tracer into the lg . interruption of neural stimulus to the lg by the denervation of these postganglionic nerve immediately and chronically decrease tear secretion , lead to lg atrophy along with destruction of the lobular structure . this investigation also find that parasympathetic , but not sympathetic , innervation be involve in these alteration .

Title: chemotherapy-induced ca-repeat dna fragment in breast cancer trigger antitumor immune response .
Authors: Zhang X, Huang P, Chen H, Yang C, Yang X, Liu Y, Wu B, Zeng W, Saw PE, Ye S, Li J, Wang J, Wu Z, Wang J, Li H, Huang JD, Zeng M, Li M, Liu Q, Su S, Song E, Chen J
Abstract: damage-associated molecular pattern generate by cancer treatment can modulate antitumor immunity , but the underlying mechanism of this effect be unclear . here we show that ca-enriched dna fragment result from dna-damaging chemotherapy in msh2-low tumor preferentially bind cgas with strong affinity and form biomolecular condensate by phase separation in the cytoplasm , result in antitumor immunity . however , classical ca-poor dna release from msh2-high tumor cell engage aim2 , result in immunosuppression by upregulating pd-l1 and ido . intratumoral administration of ca-rich dna fragment enhance antitumor immunity in syngrafted pymt tumor . clinically , ca-rich dna abundance in breast cancer follow chemotherapy be associate with increased tumor-antigen-reactive t cell and good chemotherapeutic response . therefore , different tumor dna fragment can trigger oppose immune response depend on their preference for differential sensor . this study highlight another mechanistic link between genome instability and immune modulation and the therapeutic potential of ca-rich dna to enhance antitumor immunity .

Title: ketogenic diet inhibits glioma progression by promote gut microbiota-derived butyrate production .
Authors: Chen ML, He Y, Dong XH, Liu HF, Yan ZX, Lu XL, Miao QQ, Zhao QN, Zhang H, Luo L, Wang S, Li JY, Xiang DF, Lin Y, Li TR, Zhou XY, Zhou YY, Mao M, Zhang X, Wei H, Shi Y, Liu XD, Ping YF, Bian XW
Abstract: the ketogenic diet ( kd ) be a potential therapeutic strategy for glioma ; however , the underlying mechanism remain unclear . herein , we first identify that glioma patient exhibit a distinct gut microbial profile characterize by reduced butyrate-producing bacteria abundance , particularly r. faecis , along with decreased butyrate level . notably , kd reshape the gut microbiota especially enrich a. muciniphila in a mucin-2-dependent manner , elevate butyrate production , and activate caspase-3 in microglia . these change promote an anti-tumor microglial phenotype , ultimately suppress glioma progression in mouse . crucially , kd 's anti-glioma effect be notably abolish by antibiotic treatment ; germ-free condition ; or specific depletion of mucin-2 , microglia , or microglial caspase-3 . furthermore , butyrate , a. muciniphila , r. faecis , or a. muciniphila plus r. faecis restores kd-induced microglial caspase-3 activation and the anti-tumor phenotype of microglia in antibiotics-treated or germ-free mouse . these finding highlight that target the gut microbiota by kd or supplement with butyrate could be an effective strategy for glioma therapy .

Title: amplify research : the potential for podcasts to boost radiology journal article exposure .
Authors: Wang M, Le T, Leswick DA
Abstract: background podcasts have become an increasingly popular method of communicate information in medicine , include in radiology . however , the effect of podcasts on the reach of journal article remain unclear . purpose to evaluate the influence of radiology podcasts on the performance metric , include downloads , citation , and altmetric attention score ( aa ) , of radiology article . material and method this be a retrospective study . all article publish in the print version of radiology from january 2021 to december 2022 be review ; editorial and case report be exclude . article feature on radiology podcasts be include in the podcast group . article publish within the same journal issue and category be the nonpodcast group . downloads , google scholar citation , dimension citation , and aas metric be record . the mann-whitney u test be use to compare median and evaluate difference between old and more recently publish article . result the podcast group , compose of 88 article , exhibit significantly high median value for downloads ( pg , 4521.0 ; nonpodcast group , 2123.0 ; p < .001 ) , google scholar citation ( podcast group , 14.5 ; nonpodcast group , 10.0 ; p = .01 ) , dimension citation ( podcast group , 12.0 ; nonpodcast group , 9.0 ; p = .01 ) , and aa ( podcast group , 43.0 ; nonpodcast group , 10.0 ; p < .001 ) compare with the nonpodcast group of 378 article . within both group , article publish in the early nonpodcast group ( january to june 2021 ) have high downloads ( podcast group , p = .08 ; nonpodcast group , p < .001 ) , google scholar citation ( podcast group and nonpodcast group , p < .001 ) , and dimension citation ( podcast group and nonpodcast group , p < .001 ) than article from the late period ( july to december 2022 ) . aas markedly increase in recent podcast article ( p = .03 ) , but aa for nonpodcast article significantly decrease over time ( p = .01 ) . conclusion radiology article feature on the radiology podcast have great median metric , include downloads , google scholar citation , dimension citation , and aas , compare with nonpodcast article , suggest that podcasts can be an effective method of disseminate and amplify research within the field of radiology . © rsna , 2024 see also the editorial by chu and nicola in this issue .

Title: glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor agonist in arthritis : current insight and future direction .
Authors: Karacabeyli D, Lacaille D
