Abstract: obesity affect nearly one in six adult worldwide . excess adiposity be a pro-inflammatory state associate with increased risk of several type of arthritis , increase arthritis disease activity and/or severity , and poor response to certain treatment . obesity be a major risk factor for cardiovascular disease , the lead cause of death in people with common arthritides such a osteoarthritis ( oa ) , gout , rheumatoid arthritis , psoriatic arthritis and axial spondyloarthritis . glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor agonist ( glp-1ras ) be a promising therapeutic option for people with arthritis and obesity or type 2 diabetes mellitus owe to their pleiotropic effect , include weight loss , improve survival and reduced risk of major cardiovascular and renal event . in vitro and preclinical in vivo experiment in arthritis have uncover weight-loss-independent anti-inflammatory and chondroprotective property of glp-1ras . in knee oa , clinical data suggest that glp-1ras improve pain and function and reduce the risk of surgical intervention ; however , their effect on oa incidence remain incompletely understood . evidence suggest that glp-1ras do not directly prevent gout attack , but be effective in manage cardiometabolic condition commonly associate with gout and other arthritides . more research be need to clarify the effect of glp-1ras on incidence , disease activity , and progression of rheumatoid arthritis , psoriatic arthritis and axial spondyloarthritis .

Title: rapid pan-microbial metagenomics for pathogen detection and personalised therapy in the intensive care unit : a single-centre prospective observational study .
Authors: Alcolea-Medina A, Snell LB, Humayun G, Al-Yaakoubi N, Ward D, Alder C, Patel V, Vivian F, Meadows CIS, Wyncoll D, Paul R, Barratt N, Batra R, Edgeworth J, Nebbia G, Whitehorn J
Abstract: most clinical metagenomic study do not provide rapid result , detect pathogen from all microbial kingdom , or measure clinical impact . we aim to evaluate the feasibility , performance , and clinical impact of a rapid pan-microbial respiratory metagenomic service for patient admit to intensive care unit ( icu ) . this be a single-centre observational study of a rapid metagenomics service that test respiratory sample from icu patient at guy 's and st thomas ' hospital , london , uk , between dec 5 , 2023 , and april 12 , 2024. test use a previously publish pan-microbial metagenomics workflow , which simultaneously detect bacteria , fungi , and dna and rna virus ; provide same-day preliminary result after 2 h ; and provide final result after 24 h. patient be include if they be age 18 year or old , admit to the icu , have confirm respiratory failure require supplemental oxygen or advance airway support , and have at least one of the following : ( 1 ) clinical suspicion of low respiratory tract infection base on clinical , biochemical , or radiological finding , ( 2 ) sepsis of unknown origin , and ( 3 ) concern from an intensive care physician regard inflammatory pathology . patient with a suspected or confirmed containment level three organism be exclude . the outcome be performance characteristic of the metagenomic test compare with routine diagnostic testing , detection of additional pathogen by metagenomics , change in antimicrobial prescribing within 24 h of test , and initiation of immunomodulation . we process 114 sample ( 1-5 per day ) from 74 patient ( 39 [ 53 % ] female and 35 [ 47 % ] male ) . 107 ( 94 % ) of 114 sample pass quality control , of which 101 ( 94 % ) provide same-day preliminary result . bacteria be detect in 45 ( 43 % ) of 104 tested specimen , fungal organism in 17 ( 16 % ) of 104 tested specimen , and virus in 28 ( 34 % ) of 83 tested specimen . sensitivity in low respiratory tract sample after 24 h be 97 % ( 95 % ci 87-100 ) for bacteria , 89 % ( 65-99 ) for fungi , and 89 % ( 71-98 ) for virus , with only one false positive for bacteria . metagenomics identify 42 pathogen not detect by other test in 32 ( 30 % ) of 107 sample . antimicrobial therapy be change after metagenomic result from 30 ( 28 % ) of 107 sample : 22 ( 21 % ) be de-escalated and eight ( 7 % ) be escalate . metagenomics contribute to the initiation of immunomodulation in 15 ( 20 % ) of 74 patient for a range of inflammatory condition . pathogen with clinical significance to local infection control or national public health be find in ten ( 14 % ) of 74 patient , include three invasive group a streptococci , two parvovirus b19 , and one each of hiv-1 , measles virus , mycobacterium tuberculosis , neisseria meningitidis , and mycoplasma pneumoniae . respiratory metagenomics for icu patient show good performance and turnaround time , and diverse clinical and public health benefit . this ability to inform both personalised patient therapy and infectious disease surveillance need evaluation in multicentre study . none .

Title: the relationship between the fibrinogen-to-albumin ratio and short-term mortality in chinese patient with chronic heart failure : a retrospective cohort analysis .
Authors: Guo LL, Liu P, Cai LN, Hu L, Zhou YS
Abstract: background : recent study have identify an association between the fibrinogen-to-albumin ratio ( far ) and the prognosis of coronary heart disease ; however , evidence regard it significance in heart failure patient remain limited . this study aim to examine the relationship between the far and short-term mortality among individual with heart failure . method : in this retrospective cohort study , we conduct an analysis of clinical data from patient with heart failure who be hospitalize at zigong fourth people 's hospital from december 2016 to june 2019. the primary exposure variable be the far , while the outcome of interest be mortality rate at 28 day and 3 month . multivariate logistic regression evaluate far 's independent association with short-term mortality , with predictive accuracy assess via roc curve and subgroup consistency through stratified analysis . furthermore , smooth curve fitting be utilize to investigate the linear relationship , and a series of sensitivity analysis be conduct to validate the robustness of the finding . result : the analysis include 1880 participant , of whom 58.1 % be female and 54.1 % be age 60-80 year . our study show that a one standard deviation rise in the far be link to a 45 % increase in 28-day mortality ( or = 1.45 , 95 % ci = 1.02-2.06 , p=0.04 ) after adjust for potential confounding factor . the 28-day mortality rate be markedly elevate in the high far group ( far > 0.126 ) compare to the low far group ( or = 4.01 , 95 % ci = 1.17-13.82 , p=0.028 ) . comparable finding be note at the 3-month mark . there be no significant interaction find in the subgroup analysis . a linear association be identify between far and short-term mortality . the optimal far cutoff value for predict 28-day mortality be 0.156 ( sensitivity 68.0 % , specificity 59.4 % , auc = 0.654 ) , while for 3-month mortality , it be 0.156 ( sensitivity 68.0 % , specificity 58.3 % , auc = 0.647 ) . sensitivity analyse corroborate the robustness of our finding . conclusion : a positive correlation exist between the far and short-term mortality among chinese patient with heart failure . these finding underscore the necessity for further investigation into the underlying pathophysiological mechanism and potential therapeutic intervention associate with far in the context of heart failure .

Title: takotsubo syndrome : pathophysiological insight and innovation in patient care .
Authors: Omerovic E, Redfors B
Abstract: takotsubo syndrome , also know a broken heart syndrome , be first describe in japan in the 1990s and present a acute heart failure cause by transient contractile dysfunction that mimic acute coronary syndrome but be not cause by acute coronary obstruction . takotsubo syndrome account for as much a 2-3 % of suspected coronary syndrome and be considerably more common in woman than in men . in this review , we discuss the historical background and clinical feature of takotsubo syndrome and our evolve understanding of it pathophysiology . the hallmark feature of takotsubo syndrome be transient left ventricular dysfunction link to emotional or physical stressor . despite advance in our understanding of the clinical presentation and possible pathophysiological mechanism of takotsubo syndrome , this condition continue to challenge our fundamental understanding of human anatomy and physiology , particularly regard how acute emotional and physical stressor can trigger such profound cardiovascular dysfunction . although the definitive mechanism remain elusive , current hypothesis largely centre on catecholamine surge and sympathetic nervous system hyperactivation . diagnostic criterion have be develop by the mayo clinic and european society of cardiology work group but , in the absence of randomize controlled clinical trial , no specific treatment for takotsubo syndrome be available . in this review , we highlight the complex pathophysiology of takotsubo syndrome , with an emphasis on the interplay between emotional stress and cardiac health , and call for the development of evidence-based management protocol .

Title: transcranial temporal interference stimulation for treat bipolar disorder with depressive episode : a feasibility study .
Authors: Zhou H, Wang M, Qi S, Chen Q, Lai J, Wu Z, Liu R, Wang L, Zhou H, Zhang S, Hu S
Abstract: bipolar depression ( bd-d ) be a significant clinical challenge associate with high disease burden . transcranial temporal interference stimulation ( ttis ) , a novel and noninvasive approach for target deep brain structure , be investigate for it efficacy and safety in bd-d patient in this trial . thirty-six patient be recruit for a single-arm , open-label trial , and 25 complete the 5-day intervention consisting of 10 ttis session target the left nucleus accumbens . each session last 20 min , with a maximum current intensity of 2 ma and an envelope stimulation frequency of 40 hz . significant symptom reduction be observe follow treatment , with mean hamd-17 score decrease from 23.36 to 16.16 ( p < 0.0001 ) , madrs score from 39.12 to 31.28 ( p < 0.01 ) , hama score from 19.68 to 15.44 ( p < 0.05 ) , and qids score from 13.52to 9.68 ( p < 0.001 ) . eleven participant ( 44.0 % ) meet improvement criterion and seven ( 28.0 % ) achieve response . cognitive assessment indicate improvement in memory and executive function , and change in reward-related brain activity correlate positively with symptom reduction . adverse event be mild , mainly transient scalp discomfort . these finding provide preliminary evidence support the efficacy and safety of ttis for alleviate depressive symptom and cognitive impairment in bd-d .

Title: association between body composition and cardiometabolic outcome : a prospective cohort study .
Authors: Jung M, Reisert M, Rieder H, Rospleszcz S, Lu MT, Bamberg F, Raghu VK, Weiss J
Abstract: current measure of adiposity have limitation . artificial intelligence ( ai ) model may accurately and efficiently estimate body composition ( bc ) from routine imaging . to assess the association of ai-derived bc compartment from magnetic resonance imaging ( mri ) with cardiometabolic outcome . prospective cohort study . uk biobank ( ukb ) observational cohort study . 33 432 ukb participant with no history of diabetes , myocardial infarction , or ischemic stroke ( mean age , 65.0 year [ sd , 7.8 ] ; mean body mass index [ bmi ] , 25.8 kg/m ( 2 ) [ sd , 4.2 ] ; 52.8 % female ) who underwent whole-body mri . an ai tool be apply to mri to derive 3-dimensional ( 3d ) bc measure , include subcutaneous adipose tissue ( sat ) , visceral adipose tissue ( vat ) , skeletal muscle ( sm ) , and sm fat fraction ( smff ) , and then calculate their relative distribution . sex-stratified association of these relative compartment with incident diabetes mellitus ( dm ) and major adverse cardiovascular event ( mace ) be assess use restrict cubic spline . adipose tissue compartment and smff increase and sm decrease with age . after adjustment for age , smoking , and hypertension , great adiposity and low sm proportion be associate with high incidence of dm and mace after a median follow-up of 4.2 year in sex-stratified analysis ; however , after additional adjustment for bmi and waist circumference ( wc ) , only elevate vat proportion and high smff ( top fifth percentile in the cohort for each ) be associate with increase risk for dm ( respective adjust hazard ratio [ ahrs ] , 2.16 [ 95 % ci , 1.59 to 2.94 ] and 1.27 [ ci , 0.89 to 1.80 ] in female and 1.84 [ ci , 1.48 to 2.27 ] and 1.84 [ ci , 1.43 to 2.37 ] in male ) and mace ( 1.37 [ ci , 1.00 to 1.88 ] and 1.72 [ ci , 1.23 to 2.41 ] in female and 1.22 [ ci , 0.99 to 1.50 ] and 1.25 [ ci , 0.98 to 1.60 ] in male ) . in addition , in male only , those in the bottom fifth percentile of sm proportion have increase risk for dm ( ahr for the bottom fifth percentile of the cohort , 1.96 [ ci , 1.45 to 2.65 ] ) and mace ( ahr , 1.55 [ ci , 1.15 to 2.09 ] ) . result may not be generalizable to non-whites or people outside the united kingdom . artificial intelligence-derived bc proportion be strongly associate with cardiometabolic risk , but after bmi and wc be account for , only vat proportion and smff ( both sex ) and sm proportion ( male only ) add prognostic information . none .

Title: acute sporadic hepatitis e in kuwait .
Authors: Koshy A, Richards AL, al-Mufti S, Grover S, Shabrawy MA, Pacsa A, al-Anezi H, al-Nakib B, Burans J, Carl M, et al.
Abstract: fifty-seven adult patient with acute hepatitis and 34 comparison patient without liver disease be evaluate use a newly develop western blot assay for igm antibody to hepatitis e virus . the mean age of patient with hepatitis be 32 year ( range , 18-55 year ) ; 88 % be male . among patient with acute hepatitis , hepatitis a ( anti-hav igm positive ) be diagnose in two ( 4 % ) , hepatitis b ( anti-hbc igm positive ) in three ( 5 % ) , and hepatitis e ( anti-hev igm positive ) in 34 ( 60 % ) . one hepatitis patient have cmv igm , another have ebv igm , and 16 others ( 28 % ) be negative for all serologic marker of acute viral hepatitis . no patient with acute hepatitis a or b and none of the comparison patient without acute hepatitis have anti-hev igm . all but one case of acute hepatitis e be find among expatriate of asian origin , and acute hepatitis e be associate significantly with recent travel to the indian subcontinent . these data suggest that acute hepatitis e be common among foreign worker in kuwait but that little hev transmission be occur directly in kuwait .

Title: clinical validation of an ai-based blood test device for diagnosis and prognosis of acute infection and sepsis .
Authors: Liesenfeld O, Arora S, Aufderheide TP, Clements CM, DeVos E, Fischer M, Giamarellos-Bourboulis EJ, House S, Humphries RL, Gill JK, Liu E, Mace SE, May L, Michelson E, Osborn TM, Panacek E, Rothman RE, Self WH, Smithline HA, Steingrub J, Van Heukelom P, Weissman A, Wilson M, Wolk DM, Wright DW, Buturovic L, Hasin-Brumshtein Y, Damaraju N, Lu C, Shak JR, Whitfield NN, Khatri P, Sweeney TE, Shapiro NI
Abstract: lack of reliable diagnostics for the presence , type and severity of infection in patient present to emergency department with non-specific symptom pose considerable challenge . we develop triverity , which use isothermal amplification of 29 mrna and machine learn algorithm on the myrna instrument to determine likelihood of bacterial infection , viral infection and need for critical care intervention within 7 day . to validate triverity , the sepsis-shield study enrol 1,222 patient with clinically adjudicate infection status and need for critical care intervention within 7 day a endpoint . the triverity bacterial and viral score have high accuracy than c-reactive protein , procalcitonin or white blood cell count for the diagnosis of bacterial infection with area under the receiver operate characteristic ( auroc ) of 0.83 , and viral infection ( auroc = 0.91 ) . the triverity severity score have an auroc of 0.78 for predict illness severity and allow reclassification of risk for critical care intervention compare to clinical assessment ( quick sequential organ failure assessment ) alone . each of the three score have rule-in specificity > 92 % and rule-out sensitivity > 95 % . comparison of antibiotic administration at presentation with post-follow-up adjudication find that triverity could potentially reduce false positive and false negative for inappropriate antibiotic use by 60-70 % . further clinical testing in an interventional setting be need to prove actionability and clinical benefit of triverity .

Title: large-scale visualization of α-synuclein oligomers in parkinson 's disease brain tissue .
Authors: Andrews R, Fu B, Toomey CE, Breiter JC, Lachica J, Beckwith JS, Tian R, Brock EE, Needham LM, Chant GJ, Loiseau C, Deconfin A, Baspin K, Popovic R, Evans J, Goh Y, Kurt B, Senicar L, Edmonds M, Bartels T, Bengoa-Vergniory N, Magill PJ, Jaunmuktane Z, Freeman OJ, Taylor BJM, Hardy J, Lashley T, Ryten M, Vendruscolo M, Wood NW, Weiss LE, Gandhi S, Lee SF
Abstract: parkinson 's disease ( pd ) be a neurodegenerative condition characterize by the presence of intraneuronal aggregate contain fibrillar ɑ-synuclein know a lewy body . these large end-stage specie be form by small soluble protein nanoscale assembly , often term oligomers , which be propose a early driver of pathogenesis . until now , this hypothesis have remain controversial , at least in part because it have not be possible to directly visualize nanoscale assembly in human brain tissue . here we present advanced sensing of aggregates-parkinson 's disease , an image method to generate large-scale α-synuclein aggregate map in post-mortem human brain tissue . we combine autofluorescence suppression with single-molecule fluorescence microscopy , which together enable the detection of nanoscale α-synuclein aggregate . to demonstrate the use of this platform , we analyse ~1.2 million nanoscale aggregate from the anterior cingulate cortex in human post-mortem brain sample from patient with pd and healthy control . our data reveal a disease-specific shift in a subpopulation of nanoscale assembly that represent an early feature of the proteinopathy that underlie pd . we anticipate that quantitative information about this distribution provide by advanced sensing of aggregates-parkinson 's disease will enable mechanistic study to reveal the pathological process cause by α-synuclein aggregation .

Title: european respiratory society clinical practice guideline for the management of adult bronchiectasis .
Authors: Chalmers JD, Haworth CS, Flume P, Long MB, Burgel PR, Dimakou K, Blasi F, Herrero-Cortina B, Dhar R, Chotirmall SH, Ringshausen FC, Altenburg J, Morgan L, Nigro M, Crichton ML, Van Meel C, Sibila O, Timothy A, Kompatsiari E, Hedberg T, Vandendriessche T, McShane PJ, Tonia T, Winthrop K, Loebinger MR, Lorent N, Goeminne P, Shteinberg M, Polverino E, Aliberti S
Abstract: bronchiectasis be a common lung condition associate with wide range of infectious , immunological , autoimmune , allergic and genetic condition . exacerbation and daily symptom have the large impact on patient and healthcare system , and they be the key focus of treatment . current practice be heterogeneous globally , and bronchiectasis have historically be a neglected disease . here , we present evidence-based international guideline for the management of adult with bronchiectasis . a european respiratory society ( er ) task force , comprise global expert , a methodologist , and patient representative , develop clinical practice guideline in accordance with er methodology and the grade ( grade of recommendation , assessment , development and evaluation ) approach . systematic literature search , data extraction , and meta-analysis be perform to generate evidence table , and recommendation be formulate use the evidence-to-decision framework . a total of 8 pico ( patient , intervention , comparator , outcomes ) question and 3 narrative question be develop . the task force recommendation include strong recommendation in favour of airway clearance technique for most patient with bronchiectasis and pulmonary rehabilitation for those with impaired exercise capacity . we issue a strong recommendation for the use of long-term macrolide treatment for patient at high risk of exacerbation and a strong recommendation in favour of long-term inhaled antibiotic in patient with chronic pseudomonas aeruginosa infection at high risk of exacerbation . conditional recommendation support the use of eradication treatment or mucoactive drug in specific circumstance . we suggest not to routinely use long term oral , non-macrolide antibiotic treatment or inhaled corticosteroid . additional guidance be also provide on test for underlying cause , manage exacerbation , and manage the deteriorating patient . the er bronchiectasis guideline provide an evidence-based framework for optimal management of adult with bronchiectasis and serve a a benchmark for evaluate the quality of care . the european respiratory society ( er ) guideline for the management of bronchiectasis in adult provide evidence-based recommendation for the care of people with clinically significant bronchiectasis , define by the presence of permanent dilatation of the bronchi evident on chest ct scan , along with characteristic clinical symptom . [ 1 ] these guideline be intend for all healthcare professional involve in the care of adult with bronchiectasis , as well a for policymakers , regulatory authority , and pharmaceutical company . bronchiectasis be a complex and heterogeneous disease ; therefore , no guideline can be entirely comprehensive or replace clinical judgement . all guideline recommendation must be interpret within the specific clinical context in which they be apply . separate er guideline for the management of bronchiectasis in child exist [ 2 ] . bronchiectasis due to cystic fibrosis ( cf ) have a distinct evidence base ; therefore , guidance for the management of cf be provide elsewhere . [ 3 ] some bronchiectasis-associated condition also have distinct guideline for investigation and management , such a primary ciliary dyskinesia ( pcd ) [ 4 ] , allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis ( abpa ) [ 5 ] and non-tuberculous mycobacterial ( ntm ) pulmonary disease [ 6 ] . while the present guideline apply for these condition , they should be interpret in conjunction with the relevant syndrome-specific recommendation .

Title: zhenqi fuzheng granule target the scfas-gpr109a axis to enhance pd-1 antibody efficacy via immunometabolic remodel in colorectal cancer .
Authors: Guo L, Yi J, Zhang A, Zheng X, Wang M, Yang F, Kong X, Meng J
Abstract: immune checkpoint inhibitor ( icis ) , particularly pd-1 antibody , represent a breakthrough in colorectal cancer ( crc ) treatment . however , their clinical efficacy remain limited by tumour-induced immunosuppression . traditional chinese medicine ( tcm ) have attract grow interest a a potential adjuvant to immunotherapy . zhenqi fuzheng granule ( zqfz ) be a clinically approve herbal prescription widely use a an adjuvant therapy for crc , yet it mechanistic underpinnings remain elusive . to investigate how zqfz improve the efficacy in crc , with emphasis on gut microbiota modulation , scfas production , and downstream immunometabolic pathway involve gpr109a , and confirm that butyrate play an important role in colorectal cancer inhibition . phytochemical analysis of zqfz be conduct use lc-ms/ms and uplc-ms/ms , identify and quantify seven major compound . in vivo experiment , aom/dss-induced crc mouse model be treat with zqfz , pd-1 antibody , or their combination . tumour progression , body weight , and survival be monitor . gut microbial composition and colonic scfas level be assess via 16 rrna sequence and gas chromatography . rt-qpcr be employ to validate the expression of key gene associate with the gpr109a/akt/mtor/hif-1α signaling pathway . molecular change in the gpr109a/akt/mtor/hif-1α pathway be evaluate through western blotting , transcriptomic , and proteomic analysis . immune cell infiltration and phenotype be analyze by flow cytometry . molecular docking and molecular dynamic simulation be conduct to predict the binding affinity and structural stability between gpr109a and akt1 . the interaction between gpr109a and akt1 , as well a between butyrate and gpr109a , be far validate in vitro use microscale thermophoresis ( mst ) assay . to evaluate the microbial basis of zqfz activity , antibiotic-pretreated mouse receive zqfz-derived fecal microbiota transplantation ( fmt ) . in vitro experiment , to investigate the mechanism by which sodium butyrate ( nab ) , the major gut microbial metabolite of zqfz , inhibit glycolysis in colorectal cancer under hypoxic condition , cck-8 assay , flow cytometry , lactate measurement , and western blotting be perform to assess cell viability , apoptosis , lactate production , and the expression of akt/mtor/hif-1α and glycolysis-related protein . lc-ms/ms profiling identify multiple bioactive constituent in zqfz . target uplc-ms/ms quantification reveal that the formulation contain adenosine ( 0.87mg/g ) , salidroside ( 0.11 mg/g ) , astragaloside iv ( 0.07 mg/g ) , calycosin ( 0.03 mg/g ) , formononetin ( 6.7 μg /g ) , chlorogenic acid ( 1.4 μg/g ) , apigenin ( 0.5 μg/g ) . in vivo study , both zqfz and pd-1 antibody inhibit tumour growth , with the combination treatment exert the most pronounced antitumour effect . zqfz reshape the gut microbiota , increase the level of short-chain fatty acid ( scfas ) , particularly butyrate , and activate the gpr109a pathway , lead to downregulation of the akt/mtor/hif-1α signaling axis , suppression of hk2 expression and lactate production , and consequent inhibition of glycolysis . immune remodeling be also observe , include reduce infiltration of myeloid-derived suppressor cell ( mdscs ) , polarization of macrophage toward the m1 phenotype , restoration of the cd4⁺/cd8⁺ t cell ratio , and modulation of serum cytokine include upregulation of il-2 , il-12 , and ifn-γ , along with downregulation of il-4 and il-10 . zqfz-derived fmt significantly inhibit tumour growth , suppress glycolysis-related marker ( pkm2 , glut1 , hif-1α , ldha ) , and remodel the immune microenvironment by reduce mdscs and enhance m1 macrophage and cd8⁺ t cell infiltration . in hypoxia-mimicking in vitro experiment , sodium butyrate ( nab ) , the principal gut microbial metabolite of zqfz , suppress colorectal cancer cell viability and induced apoptosis . through activation of gpr109a , nab inhibit the akt/mtor/hif-1α pathway and glycolysis-related enzyme , reduced lactate production , and far suppress glycolysis . molecular docking and dynamic simulation suggest a stable interaction between gpr109a and akt1 , which be confirm in vitro by mst show high-affinity binding ( kd=74.5 ± 20.8 nm ) ; mst also verify moderate-affinity binding between gpr109a and sodium butyrate ( kd=43.3 ± 6.5 μm ) , support a dual interaction model wherein butyrate activates gpr109a , which in turn directly bind akt1 to inhibit downstream glycolytic signaling . this study uncover a novel integrate mechanism whereby zqfz enhance pd-1 antibody efficacy via the gut microbiota-scfas-gpr109a axis , and nab-mediated glycolysis inhibition under hypoxia far confirm it immunometabolic mechanism against crc .
Journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology

Title: teneligliptin and empagliflozin attenuate ferroptosis-mediated acute tubular injury .
Authors: Ema C, Iwakura T, Tsuji N, Nakayama Y, Tsuchida M, Kitamura A, Katahashi N, Ishigaki S, Isobe S, Fujikura T, Ohashi N, Kato A, Sugimoto K, Yasuda H
Abstract: ferroptosis be a key mechanism of tubular cell death in acute kidney injury ( aki ) , particularly in folic acid- and glycerol-induced model . dipeptidyl peptidase 4 ( dpp4 ) and sodium-glucose cotransporter 2 ( sglt2 ) inhibitor exhibit renoprotective effect beyond glucose lowering , and emerge evidence suggest both may suppress ferroptosis . we hypothesize that teneligliptin ( tg ) and empagliflozin ( empa ) protect tubular cell from ferroptosis-mediated injury by reduce lipid peroxidation . hk-2 cell be pretreated with inhibitor of apoptosis ( z-vad-fmk ) , necroptosis ( necrostatin-1s ) , or ferroptosis ( ferrostatin-1 ) , and then expose to folic acid or myoglobin . the effect of tg on erastin- , folic acid- , and myoglobin-induced injury , and of empa on erastin- and myoglobin-induced injury , be evaluate use cell viability and lipid peroxidation assay . in vivo , tg be test in folic acid- and glycerol-induced aki model , and empa in the glycerol-induced aki model . renal function , tubular injury , inflammation , and glutathione peroxidase 4 ( gpx4 ) expression be assess . localization of dpp4 , nadph oxidase 1 ( nox1 ) , nox4 , and megalin in the kidney be analyze by immunostaining . ferrostatin-1 , but not z-vad-fmk or necrostatin-1s , prevented folic acid- and myoglobin-induced cell death in vitro . both tg and empa significantly reduce erastin-induced cell death and lipid peroxidation . tg also attenuate cell death and lipid peroxidation in folic acid- and myoglobin-induced injury . empa improved viability and reduced lipid peroxidation in the myoglobin model . in vivo , tg improve renal function , reduce tubular damage and inflammation , and preserve gpx4 expression . empa show similar protective effect in rhabdomyolysis-associated aki . dpp4 co-localized with nox4 , but show no co-localization with nox1 . tg treatment disrupt the co-localization of nox4 with dpp4 . tg and empa attenuate tubular cell death and kidney injury in ferroptosis-mediated aki model , potentially through the reduction of lipid peroxidation . these finding highlight ferroptosis suppression a a potential mechanism underlie their renoprotective effect in aki prevention .
Journal: Nephrology, dialysis, transplantation : official publication of the European

Title: global , regional , and national burden of type 2 diabetes-related diabetic kidney disease attributable to low physical activity from 1990 to 2021 : a systematic analysis of the global burden of disease study 2021 with prediction to 2050 .
Authors: Wang M, Yan R, Xia W, Gao Y, Liu Y, Bao L, Luo H, E J, Wang H, Li B, Zheng Y
Abstract: low physical activity ( lpa ) significantly heighten the susceptibility of both type 2 diabetes mellitus ( t2dm ) and chronic renal disease . nearly half of population diagnose with t2dm globally worsen into diabetic kidney disease ( dkd ) . focus on physically inactive population , we aim to comprehensively evaluate the trend over time and regional change in t2dm-associated dkd attributable to lpa burden . we utilize data of the 2021 global burden of disease ( gbd ) study to initially assess the worldwide effect of t2dm-associated dkd attributable to lpa by compute the number and age-standardized rate ( asrs ) of death , disability-adjusted life year ( dalys ) , year of life lose ( ylls ) , and year live with disability ( ylds ) , categorize by subtypes in 2021. linear regression model be apply to analyze the illness burden from 1990 to 2021. furthermore , cluster analysis be perform to assess the regional difference in disease burden across gbd region . lastly , to forecast the illness burden for the next 25 year , we utilize the autoregressive integrated move average ( arima ) and excess risk ( er ) model . in 2021 , the fatality attribute to t2dm-related dkd attributable to lpa amount to 30835 ( 95 % 12346-51646 ) case , with 698484 ( 95 % 275039-1158032 ) dalys . the asrs of death and dalys be 0.38 ( 95 % 0.15-0.63 ) and 8.19 ( 95 % 3.21-13.6 ) per 100000 individual , respectively . between 1990 and 2021 , there be a notable escalation in death , dalys , ylds , and ylls , as well a their asrs . the high burden be observe among male , old adult ( age 70 year and above ) , and middle socio-demographic index ( sdi ) . significant difference be note in the disease burden among various region and country a define by the gbd study . predictive analysis indicate a continued escalation of this burden by the year 2050. the global impact of dkd attributable to lpa remains considerable , with significant disparity note across different gender , age , and region . to mitigate this burden , it be crucial to implement effective intervention aim at address physical inactivity , specifically design for targeted demographic group .

Title: host-pathogen interaction between the human innate immune system and candida albicans-understanding and modeling defense and evasion strategy .
Authors: Dühring S, Germerodt S, Skerka C, Zipfel PF, Dandekar T, Schuster S
Abstract: the diploid , polymorphic yeast candida albicans be one of the most important human pathogenic fungi . c. albicans can grow , proliferate and coexist a a commensal on or within the human host for a long time . however , alteration in the host environment can render c. albicans virulent . in this review , we describe the immunological cross-talk between c. albicans and the human innate immune system . we give an overview in form of pair of human defense strategy include immunological mechanism as well a general stressor such a nutrient limitation , ph , fever etc . and the corresponding fungal response and evasion mechanism . furthermore , computational system biology approach to model and investigate these complex interaction be highlight with a special focus on game-theoretical method and agent-based model . an outlook on interesting question to be tackle by system biology regard entangle defense and evasion mechanism be give .

Title: molecular hallmark of excitatory and inhibitory neuronal resilience to alzheimer 's disease .
Authors: Castanho I, Naderi Yeganeh P, Boix CA, Morgan SL, Mathys H, Prokopenko D, White B, Soto LM, Pegoraro G, Shah S, Ploumakis A, Kalavros N, Bennett DA, Lange C, Kim DY, Bertram L, Tsai LH, Kellis M, Tanzi RE, Hide W
Abstract: a significant proportion of individual maintain cognition despite extensive alzheimer 's disease ( ad ) pathology , know a cognitive resilience . understand the molecular mechanism that protect these individual could reveal therapeutic target for ad . this study define molecular and cellular signature of cognitive resilience by integrate bulk rna and single-cell transcriptomic data with genetics across multiple brain region . we analyze data from the religious order study and the rush memory and age project ( rosmap ) , include bulk rna sequencing ( n = 631 individual ) and multiregional single-nucleus rna sequencing ( n = 48 individual ) . subject be categorize into ad , resilient , and control base on β-amyloid and tau pathology , and cognitive status . we identify and prioritize protect cell population use whole-genome sequencing-derived genetic variant , transcriptomic profiling , and cellular composition . transcriptomics and polygenic risk analysis position resilience a an intermediate ad state . only gfap and klf4 expression distinguish resilience from control at tissue level , whereas differential expression of gene involve in nucleic acid metabolism and signal differentiate ad and resilient brain . at the cellular level , resilience be characterize by broad downregulation of lingo1 expression and reorganization of chaperone pathway , specifically downregulation of hsp90 and upregulation of hsp40 , hsp70 , and hsp110 family in excitatory neuron . mef2c , atp8b1 , and reln emerge a key marker of resilient neuron . excitatory neuronal subtypes in the entorhinal cortex ( atp8b+ and mef2c ( high ) ) exhibit unique resilience signal through activation of neurotrophin ( bdnf-ntrk2 , modulate by lingo1 ) and angiopoietin ( angpt2-tek ) pathway . mef2c+ inhibitory neuron be over-represented in resilient brain , and the expression of gene associate with rare genetic variant reveal vulnerable somatostatin ( sst ) cortical interneurons that survive in ad resilience . the maintenance of excitatory-inhibitory balance emerge a a key characteristic of resilience . we have define molecular and cellular hallmark of cognitive resilience , an intermediate state in the ad continuum . resilience mechanism include preserve neuronal function , balance network activity , and activation of neurotrophic survival signal . specific excitatory neuronal population appear to play a central role in mediate cognitive resilience , while a subset of vulnerable interneurons likely provide compensation against ad-associated hyperexcitability . this study offer a framework to leverage natural protective mechanism to mitigate neurodegeneration and preserve cognition in ad .

Title: a point mutation in the murine hem1 gene reveals an essential role for hematopoietic protein 1 in lymphopoiesis and innate immunity .
Authors: Park H, Staehling-Hampton K, Appleby MW, Brunkow ME, Habib T, Zhang Y, Ramsdell F, Liggitt HD, Freie B, Tsang M, Carlson G, Friend S, Frevert C, Iritani BM
Abstract: hem1 ( hematopoietic protein 1 ) be a hematopoietic cell-specific member of the hem family of cytoplasmic adaptor protein . orthologues of hem1 in dictyostelium discoideum , drosophila melanogaster , and caenorhabditis elegans be essential for cytoskeletal reorganization , embryonic cell migration , and morphogenesis . however , the in vivo function of mammalian hem1 be not know . use a chemical mutagenesis strategy in mouse to identify novel gene involve in immune cell function , we positionally clone a nonsense mutation in the hem1 gene . hem1 deficiency result in defective f-actin polymerization and actin capping in lymphocyte and neutrophil cause by loss of the rac-controlled actin-regulatory wave protein complex . t cell development be disrupt in hem1-deficient mouse at the cd4 ( - ) cd8 ( - ) ( double negative ) to cd4 ( + ) cd8 ( + ) ( double positive ) cell stage , whereas t cell activation and adhesion be impair . hem1-deficient neutrophil fail to migrate in response to chemotactic agent and be deficient in their ability to phagocytose bacteria . remarkably , some rac-dependent function , such a th1 differentiation and nuclear factor kappab ( nf-kappab ) -dependent transcription of proinflammatory cytokine proceed normally in hem1-deficient mouse , whereas the production of th17 cell be enhance . these result demonstrate that hem1 be essential for hematopoietic cell development , function , and homeostasis by control a distinct pathway lead to cytoskeletal reorganization , whereas nf-kappab-dependent transcription proceeds independently of hem1 and f-actin polymerization .

Title: multicenter phase ii trial of lenvatinib in patient with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma after progression on first-line atezolizumab plus bevacizumab .
Authors: Kim HD, Sym SJ, Chon HJ, Kim M, Kang JH, Ryoo BY, Lee CK, Hong J, Ryu H, Bae WK, Kim H, Kim H, Kim JW, Kim TY, Yoo C
Abstract: background & atezolizumab plus bevacizumab ( atezo-bev ) be the global standard first-line therapy for unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma ( uhcc ) . however , most patient eventually experience disease progression and optimal second-line strategy after atezo-bev failure remain unclear . prospective evidence support multikinase inhibitor in this context be limit . this investigator-initiated , multicenter , single-arm study ( kcsg hb23-04 ) enrol 50 patient with uhcc who progress after first-line atezo-bev across 13 site between august 2023 and may 2024. patient receive second-line lenvatinib at 12 mg or 8 mg daily , depend on body weight , until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity . the primary endpoint be progression-free survival . secondary endpoint be overall survival , objective response rate , disease control rate , duration of response , and safety . of the 50 patient enrol , the median age be 66 year , and 72 % have a viral etiology . the median time to progression with atezo-bev be 6.5 month . during a median follow-up of 12.6 month , the median progression-free survival be 5.4 month ( 95 % ci 4.2-7.1 ) ( > 4.5 month ) , meet the prespecified primary endpoint . median overall survival be 9.8 month ( 95 % ci 8.1-nr ) . the objective response rate be 14.0 % , and the disease control rate be 82.0 % . the median duration of response be 9.4 month . survival outcome be different accord to the objective response with lenvatinib , but not by time to progression on atezo-bev or hcc etiology . the most common adverse event be diarrhea ( 42.0 % ) , hypothyroidism ( 32.0 % ) , and anorexia ( 30.0 % ) . grade ≥3 adverse event occur in 46.0 % of patient . lenvatinib demonstrate promising efficacy and a manageable safety profile a a second-line treatment for patient with hcc progress on atezo-bev . these finding offer prospective evidence support lenvatinib a a viable treatment option in the post-atezo-bev context . this study provide the first prospective evidence for the use of lenvatinib a a second-line therapy for patient with unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma who have progress after first-line atezo-bev treatment . the finding highlight the potential of lenvatinib a a viable therapeutic option in a clinical setting where few alternative be available . the result be particularly important for healthcare professional manage unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma , a they provide a robust framework for consider lenvatinib in second-line treatment protocol . give the manageable safety profile , these finding could be translate into practical recommendation for clinical practice , offer physician a treatment strategy to improve patient outcomes follow atezo-bev failure while guide future research into combination therapy and broad patient population . nct06138769 .

Title: systematic review and meta-analysis of antioxidant with or without exercise training improve muscle condition in old adult .
Authors: Wang Y, He Z, Long C, Li Y, Yuan Y, Huang T
Abstract: oxidative stress and physical inactivity be regard a important mechanism contribute to muscle loss . however , the efficacy of antioxidant and their potential synergy with exercise training remain controversial for old population . the study aim to evaluate the effect of antioxidant , either combine with or without exercise , on improve muscle strength , mass , and physical performance in old adult . we conduct a comprehensive search of the pubmed , medline , and embase database to identify randomize controlled trial ( rcts ) on muscle condition in subject age 55 year or old . the search period cover from the inception of each database until june 10 , 2024. a total of 39 rcts involve 1714 participant be include . the meta-analysis present that antioxidant alone could enhance muscle strength in 1 repetition maximum ( rm ) in leg press and physical function in the old population . exercise alone could increase the walk distance of 6 min walk more than antioxidant alone . the combination of antioxidant and exercise far improve 1rm in leg press , usual walk speed and walk distance of 6 min walk compare to antioxidant alone . additionally , this combination enhance handgrip strength , 1rm in leg press and walk distance of 6 min walk more than exercise alone . this meta-analysis demonstrate that antioxidant alone have positive effect on muscle condition in old individual . however , the combination of antioxidant and exercise be more effective than either intervention alone in improve muscle strength and physical function among the old adult .

Title: comprehensive identification of immune-related biomarkers and therapeutic target in preeclampsia : integrative bioinformatics and experimental validation .
Authors: Wu X, Li X, Wu Y, Yang H, Wu J, He L
Abstract: preeclampsia ( pe ) be a serious hypertensive complication during pregnancy characterize by immune dysregulation and vascular dysfunction , however , the precise molecular mechanism and effective therapeutic strategy remain unclear . this study focus on identify immune-related differentially express gene ( irdegs ) in pe , investigate their biological significance and regulatory network , and establish robust diagnostic model through integrated bioinformatics and experimental analysis . gene expression data from the gse75010 dataset be analyze utilize the r-based `` limma '' package to determine differentially express gene ( degs ) , which be intersect with immune-related gene ( irgs ) to obtain irdegs . functional enrichment be assess use gene ontology ( go ) , kyoto encyclopedia of gene and genome ( kegg ) , and disease ontology ( do ) analyse . hub gene be identify via random forest ( rf ) and lasso regression algorithm , and their diagnostic performance be assess via receiver operate characteristic ( roc ) curve evaluation in both training ( gse75010 ) and validation ( gse44711 ) cohort . immune cell composition and it association with hub gene be explore use cibersort . regulatory network , include protein-protein interaction ( ppi ) , mrna-mirna and mrna-tf interaction , be construct use encori and chipbase database . analysis of potential pharmaceutical-gene interaction be perform via dgidb platform interrogation , follow by experimental validation in placental tissue and trophoblast cell . we identify 354 degs , include 49 irdegs ( 25 upregulated and 24 downregulated ) . enrichment evaluation demonstrate that irdegs be associate with pi3k-akt signaling , chemokine signaling , and cytokine-cytokine receptor interaction . do analysis link irdegs to pe , cardiovascular disease , and reproductive disorder . four hub gene ( flt1 , pik3cb , klrd1 , and apln ) be identify a pe biomarkers base on their connectivity in the ppi network and performance in machine learning model . the rf-based diagnostic model demonstrate excellent discrimination ability with auc of 0.9468 ( train cohort ) and 0.9844 ( validation cohort ) . immune infiltration analysis reveal high level of eosinophil , plasma cell , and cd8 + t cell in pe , while monocyte and m2 macrophage be reduce . notably , hub gene show distinct correlation with immune cell subtypes , such a the positive association observe between flt1 and plasma cell , contrast with the inverse relationship document between apln and cd8 + t cell . network analysis identify 128 mrna-mirna and 31 mrna-tf interaction pair . drug-gene interaction analysis show cyclooxygenase inhibitor , such a aspirin , target apln , while tnf-α inhibitor , such a etanercept , target klrd1 . experimental validation confirm consistent expression trend across clinical specimen and in vitro model : flt1 and pik3cb be significantly upregulated while klrd1 and apln be significantly downregulated in both preeclamptic placental tissue and hypoxia-exposed trophoblast cell . our study identify four hub irdegs that may serve a potential diagnostic indicator and therapeutic target for pe . these finding suggest an important role of immune dysregulation in pe pathogenesis and offer new perspective for treatment strategy . by integrate computational prediction with experimental evidence , our work contribute to the foundation for future clinical application , though further research include early-stage pe be need to validate these observation .

Title: discovery of a potent and selective tead degrader with durable degradation activity .
Authors: Cao L, Yang J, Liu Y, Chen X, Shi Y, Zhao Y, Zhang Y, Chen J, Li B, Wen W, Chen L, Peng B, Huang L, Sun Y, Zhou L, Rees MG, Ronan MM, Roth JA, Guo Z, Xing J, Zhu G, Wang Y, Jiang B, Lu J, Zhao K, Lu W
Abstract: the tea/atss ( tead ) family of transcription factor be key effector of the hippo pathway , exert their function through interaction with the coactivators yap and taz . over the past five year , the development of yap-tead disruptors have emerge a a central focus of both academic and industrial effort aim at target the hippo pathway for cancer therapy . in this study , the discovery and comprehensive characterization of kg-fp-003 , a potent , selective , and durable tead degrader be report . kg-fp-003 exhibit superior activity compare to the lipid-binding pocket ( lbp ) inhibitor myf-03-176 and the tead-yap protein-protein interaction ( ppi ) inhibitor iag933 , efficiently degrade all tead isoforms at low nanomolar concentration in a ubiquitin-proteasome system ( ups ) -dependent manner . this degradation translate into more robust and sustain therapeutic response both in vitro and in vivo . furthermore , barcoded cell line screen reveal elevated sensitivity in several cancer type , include endometrial carcinoma , glioblastoma , ovarian epithelial tumor , and osteosarcoma . these finding position kg-fp-003 a a compelling lead candidate for tead isoform-selective therapy and underscore it potential utility beyond hippo-dysregulated mesothelioma .

Title: inflammation and cardiovascular disease : 2025 acc scientific statement : a report of the american college of cardiology .
Authors: Mensah GA, Arnold N, Prabhu SD, Ridker PM, Welty FK
Abstract: the crucial role of inflammation in the pathogenesis and clinical outcome of cardiovascular disease ( cvd ) have recently gain increased attention . in particular , residual inflammation , measure with high-sensitivity c-reactive protein ( hscrp ) remain strongly predictive of recurrent event , even in statin-treated patient . similarly , elevate hscrp in apparently healthy individual identify a higher-risk group in whom statin therapy significantly reduce the risk of first major cvd event even if ldl-cholesterol be normal . this report provide an updated understanding of the role of chronic , low-grade inflammation in cvd and highlight new seminal research finding , especially in atherosclerosis , myocardial infarction , heart failure , and pericarditis . consensus recommendation be summarize for screening , evaluation , and cvd risk assessment ; inflammatory biomarkers in cardiovascular imaging ; inflammation inhibition in behavioral and lifestyle risk ; and anti-inflammatory approach in primary and secondary prevention as well a in heart failure and other cvds . this report also address current challenge and future opportunity . for example , it caution that not all trial of anti-inflammatory therapy in secondary prevention have be successful and such trial evidence be need before broad recommendation for other agent can be make . additionally , in successful trial , the interplay between inflammation and key physiological system often remain incompletely examine . another promising area of research be the role that novel special pro-resolving bioactive lipid molecule play in promote the resolution of inflammation and cvd risk reduction . in aggregate , the evidence link inflammation with atherosclerotic cvd be no longer exploratory but be compelling and clinically actionable . the time for take action have now arrive .
Journal: Journal of the American College of Cardiology

Title: determine the efficacy and safety of acupuncture for the treatment of menstrual migraine : an updated systematic review and meta-analysis .
Authors: Wu Q, Fan L, Wu D, Gao H, Han D, Hu H, Qian L
Abstract: menstrual migraine ( mm ) be a common type of headache link to hormonal fluctuation during the menstrual cycle , remain challenge to treat due to the limited efficacy of current therapy . while acupuncture show potential a a therapeutic option for mm , the exist evidence do not clearly support it routine clinical use . this protocol for a systematic review ( sr ) and meta-analysis seek to gather and evaluate recent clinical evidence regard the effectiveness and safety of acupuncture in treat mm . a comprehensive search be conduct across multiple database from their inception to april 2025 , include pubmed , medline , ovid , embase , sciencedirect , the chinese national knowledge infrastructure ( cnki ) , wanfang , the chinese biomedical literature ( cbm ) database , and the vip database . this be complement by regular update from trial registry such a the cochrane central register of controlled trial ( central ) and the who international clinical trial registry platform ( ictrp ) , which target unpublished and ongoing randomize control trial ( rcts ) . eligible study be rcts compare acupuncture with western medicine , herbal remedy , sham acupuncture , or no intervention for the management of mm . primary outcome include the pain intensity [ visual analog scale ( va ) ] , the frequency of migraine attack ( fm ) , and duration of migraine ( dm ) . secondary outcome encompass response rate , headache impact test-6 ( hit-6 ) , the menstrual headache index ( mhi ) , the serum level of 5-hydroxytryptamine ( 5-ht ) , and adverse event . analysis involve meta-analysis , subgroup comparison , publication bias detection , sensitivity testing , risk-of-bias evaluation , and profiling of adverse event . the quality of evidence be judge accord to the grading of recommendation assessment , development , and evaluation ( grade ) criterion . a total of 39 rcts comprise 2,584 participant be include . compare with control intervention , acupuncture significantly reduce va score , decrease the frequency and duration of migraine attack , and improved response rate , as well a hit-6 and mhi score . additionally , acupuncture be associate with increased serum 5-ht level . meta-analytic finding indicate that acupuncture demonstrate a favorable safety profile in the treatment of mm . finding suggest that acupuncture for mm produce the most notable reduction in migraine severity . nevertheless , the grade assessment indicate low overall certainty of the evidence , with considerable heterogeneity present in multiple pooled analysis . therefore , well-designed , large-scale rcts be urgently require to strengthen the evidence base . http : //www.crd.york.ac.uk/prospero/view/crd42022367446 .

Title: rsl3 promote parp1 apoptotic function by distinct mechanism during ferroptosis .
Authors: Chen D, Xie F, Mo Y, Qin D, Zheng B, Chen L
Abstract: the classical ferroptosis activator rsl3 target enzymes with nucleophilic active site , primarily act on glutathione peroxidase 4 ( gpx4 ) to trigger ferroptosis . recent study identify rsl3 a a potential pro-apoptotic agent . however , the mechanism by which rsl3 induces apoptosis during ferroptosis remain elusive . poly ( adp-ribose ) polymerase ( parp1 ) determine cell fate in response to dna damage , where it loss or cleavage by activated caspase-3 induces apoptosis to attenuate tumor progression . we elucidate a novel mechanism underlie parp1 regulation , encompass both it caspase-dependent cleavage and full-length depletion during rsl3-mediated ferroptosis-apoptosis crosstalk . to investigate the role of rsl3 during ferroptosis , we treat several cancer cell of different histological type with vary dos of rsl3 to induce apoptosis . the regulatory protein of parp1 be analyze use real-time quantitative polymerase chain reaction ( rt-qpcr ) and western blot analysis . the n ( 6 ) -methyladenosine ( m ( 6 ) a ) modification level of parp1 be determine by m ( 6 ) a rna immunoprecipitation ( merip ) -qpcr analysis . additionally , an rna immunoprecipitation ( rip ) -qpcr assay be perform to identify the target protein of the m ( 6 ) a site of parp1 . furthermore , we establish a mouse xenograft model of parp inhibitor ( parpi ) -resistant cell to analyze the effect of rsl3 on parpi-resistant tumor growth . rsl3 trigger two parallel apoptotic pathway via increase reactive oxygen specie ( ro ) production during ferroptosis : ( 1 ) caspase-dependent parp1 cleavage and ( 2 ) dna damage-dependent apoptosis result from reduce full-length parp1 . the latter occurs through inhibition of mettl3-mediated m ( 6 ) a modification and subsequent suppression of parp1 translation . moreover , we find that rsl3 retain pro-apoptotic function in parpi-resistant cell and effectively inhibit parpi-resistant xenograft tumor growth in vivo . rsl3 orchestrate ferroptosis-apoptosis crosstalk via parp1 , demonstrate therapeutic potential against tumorigenesis , particularly in parpi-resistant malignancy .

Title: aggression against nursing personnel during the first wave of covid-19 pandemic : an internet-based survey .
Authors: Cruz JPS, Genis-Mendoza AD, López-Narváez ML, González-Castro TB, Juárez-Rojop IE, Tovilla-Zárate CA, Nicolini H
Abstract: ( 1 ) background : health care worker , particularly nurse , have be regularly assault during the covid-19 pandemic . purpose : to evaluate the prevalence and location of assault against nursing personnel in latin america , and to determine predictor factor for aggression against nurse . ( 2 ) method : a cross-sectional online survey be answer by 374 nurse work in health care during the covid-19 pandemic . the aggression against nurse be estimate use the victimization scale . ( 3 ) result : a total of 288 nurse be include in this study . the victimization scale show that 52.1 % of nurse have suffer aggression by the general population during the covid-19 pandemic . male be more likely to be attack than female ( p < 0.05 ) . additionally , male be attack more frequently on public transport ( x ( 2 ) = 6.72 , p = 0.01 ) . the home neighborhood and market be other location with a high risk of be assault ( 3.39 , 1.53-7.50 ) . ( 4 ) conclusion : our result indicate that nurse in latin america who work during the covid-19 pandemic and social isolation have be frequently assault by the general public . male be more frequently attack than female and the main place of aggression be public transportation , their home neighborhood and supermarket . implication for nursing practice : it be necessary to create and implement protocol and guideline to support nursing personnel during the covid-19 pandemic . this study be retrospectively register at the juarez autonomous university of tabasco ( 103/cipdacs/2020 ) on the ( 08/2020 ) .

Title: clostridioides difficile pathogenesis and control .
Authors: Chilton CH, Viprey V, Normington C, Moura IB, Buckley AM, Freeman J, Davies K, Wilcox MH
Abstract: clostridioides difficile infection ( cdi ) continue to be a notable burden worldwide , both in term of patient mortality and morbidity , and the economic cost associate with treatment , diagnosis and management . the epidemiology of c. difficile have change markedly over the decade , with high cdi rate drive by clinical pressure exacerbate by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 pandemic , antibiotic resistance and selective pressure cause by antimicrobial use . c. difficile be challenge to diagnose and treat a it form spore and can persist asymptomatically within the gut . some strain express multiple virulence factor , include adhesins and toxin . the gut microbiota be crucially important in cdi , a a healthy microbiota be resistant to colonization with c. difficile . dysbiosis , often cause by antimicrobial exposure , enable c. difficile spore to germinate and produce toxin , cause symptom that can range from mild diarrhoea to fulminant colitis and death . this review describe change in epidemiology and effect on diagnosis , discuss recent breakthrough in the understanding of pathogenesis and antibiotic resistance and explore the role of microbiota dysbiosis in cdi and novel microbiota therapy in cdi treatment .

Title: listeriosis .
Authors: Disson O, Charlier C, Pérot P, Leclercq A, Paz RN, Kathariou S, Tsai YH, Lecuit M
Abstract: listeriosis be a serious food-borne bacterial infection cause by listeria monocytogenes . l. monocytogenes be a facultative intracellular bacterial specie that can replicate inside human cell , as well a thrive in a variety of environment , include soil , decay vegetation , animal intestine and food such a unpasteurized dairy product , soft cheese , raw meat , fish , seafood , vegetable and fruit . clinically , l. monocytogenes can cause gastroenteritis in healthy individual or serious invasive infection in at-risk population . for example , maternal-fetal infection during pregnancy can lead to adverse pregnancy outcome . in the elderly and immunosuppressed , listeriosis can cause septicaemia and central nervous system infection ( also know a neurolisteriosis ) with high mortality and risk of long-term sequela . genomic study have identify four lineage of l. monocytogenes , with lineage i comprise the most virulent strain . the pathogenicity of l. monocytogenes reflect it ability to resist gastric and bile acid , colonize the intestinal lumen , cross the intestinal barrier , survive intracellularly in the bloodstream , evade immune response , and cross the placental and blood-brain barrier . diagnosis of listeriosis ( septicaemia , neurolisteriosis , maternal-neonatal listeriosis or focal listeriosis ) involve clinical observation and microbiological testing base on bacterial culture or dna detection in individual with prior antimicrobial therapy . treatment typically involve aminopenicillins and aminoglycosides , with no evidence of clinically meaningful acquire antimicrobial resistance . although listeriosis be a well-studied infection , a clear picture of it global burden , it pathophysiology , the dynamic of the l. monocytogenes population and transmission route be need . on the host side , new risk factor , include genetics , and new treatment regimens to improve patient outcome need to be identify .

Title: endometriosis and comorbidities : molecular mechanism and clinical implication .
Authors: Petraglia F, Vannuccini S, Donati C, Jeljeli M, Bourdon M, Chapron C
Abstract: endometriosis , traditionally view a a gynecological condition , be increasingly recognize a a systemic disease due to it frequent association with inflammatory and autoimmune comorbidities . recent molecular and genetic insight reveal dysregulated hormone receptor signaling , heighten inflammatory response , and immune dysfunction a central driver of disease progression . these discovery offer compelling explanation for extra-pelvic symptom and open up avenue for targeted diagnostics and therapy . this review integrate emerge evidence to highlight endometriosis a a multisystem disorder , underscore the need for multidisciplinary care . by redefine endometriosis beyond reproductive health , this perspective encourage a broad , systemic view of woman 's health and foster innovation in precision medicine .

Title: inflammation in atherosclerosis : lesson and therapeutic implication .
Authors: Libby P, Soehnlein O
Abstract: inflammatory pathway operate at all stage of atherosclerosis . these process be drive by risk factor and other stimulus that can spark inflammation by elicit misdirected response of intrinsic vascular cell and leukocyte , culminate in lesion initiation , progression , and complication . continue dissection of the key underlying inflammatory mechanism with increasingly sophisticated tool have inspire successful clinical trial and enabled translation to the clinic . here , we review the mechanistic understanding of the etiology and progression of atherosclerosis . we discuss how cardiovascular risk factor converge at the level of the bone marrow to perturb hematopoiesis , yield output with a pro-inflammatory slant . we further consider how circulating myeloid cell enter , propagate , and persist in atherosclerotic lesion and how intimal macrophage take center stage in regulate the inflammatory milieu . in this context , we delineate emerge therapeutic strategy aim at mitigate inflammation in atherosclerosis and how these add to exist measure toward reduce the global cardiovascular disease burden .

Title: classification of major depressive disorder use vertex-wise brain sulcal depth , curvature , and thickness with a deep and a shallow learning model .
Authors: Goya-Maldonado R, Erwin-Grabner T, Zeng LL, Ching CRK, Aleman A, Amod AR, Basgoze Z, Benedetti F, Besteher B, Brosch K, Bülow R, Colle R, Connolly CG, Corruble E, Couvy-Duchesne B, Cullen K, Dannlowski U, Davey CG, Dols A, Ernsting J, Evans JW, Fisch L, Fuentes-Claramonte P, Gonul AS, Gotlib IH, Grabe HJ, Groenewold NA, Grotegerd D, Hahn T, Hamilton JP, Han LKM, Harrison BJ, Ho TC, Jahanshad N, Jamieson AJ, Karuk A, Kircher T, Klimes-Dougan B, Koopowitz SM, Lancaster T, Leenings R, Li M, Linden DEJ, MacMaster FP, Mehler DMA, Meinert S, Melloni E, Mueller BA, Mwangi B, Nenadić I, Ojha A, Okamoto Y, Oudega ML, Penninx BWJH, Poletti S, Pomarol-Clotet E, Portella MJ, Radua J, Rodríguez-Cano E, Sacchet MD, Salvador R, Schrantee A, Sim K, Soares JC, Solanes A, Stein DJ, Stein F, Stolicyn A, Thomopoulos SI, Toenders YJ, Uyar-Demir A, Vieta E, Vives-Gilabert Y, Völzke H, Walter M, Whalley HC, Whittle S, Winter N, Wittfeld K, Wright MJ, Wu MJ, Yang TT, Zarate C, Veltman DJ, Schmaal L, Thompson PM
Abstract: major depressive disorder ( mdd ) be a complex psychiatric disorder that affect the life of hundred of million of individual around the globe . even today , researcher debate if morphological alteration in the brain be link to mdd , likely due to the heterogeneity of this disorder . the application of deep learning tool to neuroimaging data , capable of capture complex non-linear pattern , have the potential to provide diagnostic and predictive biomarkers for mdd . however , previous attempt to demarcate mdd patient and healthy control ( hc ) base on segmented cortical feature via linear machine learn approach have report low accuracy . in this study , we use globally representative data from the enigma-mdd work group contain 7012 participant from 31 site ( n = 2772 mdd and n = 4240 hc ) , which allow a comprehensive analysis with generalizable result . base on the hypothesis that integration of vertex-wise cortical feature can improve classification performance , we evaluate the classification of a densenet and a support vector machine ( svm ) , with the expectation that the former would outperform the latter . a we analyze a multi-site sample , we additionally apply the combat harmonization tool to remove potential nuisance effect of site . we find that both classifier exhibit close to chance performance ( balance accuracy densenet : 51 % ; 53 % ) , when estimate on unseen site . slightly high classification performance ( balance accuracy densenet : 58 % ; 55 % ) be find when the cross-validation fold contain subject from all site , indicate site effect . in conclusion , the integration of vertex-wise morphometric feature and the use of the non-linear classifier do not lead to the differentiability between mdd and hc . our result support the notion that mdd classification on this combination of feature and classifier be unfeasible . future study be need to determine whether more sophisticated integration of information from other mri modality such a fmri and dwi will lead to a high performance in this diagnostic task .

Title: mitochondrial dynamic and pore formation in regulated cell death pathway .
Authors: Hohorst L, Ros U, Garcia-Saez AJ
Abstract: mitochondrion act a central hub for cell death signal . during apoptosis and regulate necrosis ( pyroptosis , necroptosis , and ferroptosis ) , mitochondrion undergo drastic change include membrane permeabilization , fragmentation , and loss of membrane potential . however , dissection of the mechanism underlie these process be challenge because they involve remodel of mitochondrial membrane couple to the assembly of protein complex whose dynamic be difficult to capture . we discuss progress in our understanding of mitochondrial alteration in cell death and highlight state-of-the-art experimental approach to study them . we focus on advanced single-molecule and correlative microscopy method which have recently provide unprecedented detail about the dynamic and structure of protein complex in mitochondrion and their impact on membrane organization .

Title: postmarketing analysis of sotatercept : identifying serious unlabelled event .
Authors: Cao Z, Xiao Q, Li X, Zhang H, Zhang M
Abstract: sotatercept , an activin signal inhibitor approve in march 2024 for pulmonary arterial hypertension ( pah ) , demonstrate efficacy in clinical trial . this pharmacovigilance study evaluate it real-world safety profile use the u food and drug administration ( fda ) adverse event reporting system ( faers ) to identify postmarketing risk . faers report from 2024 be analyse , focus on case where sotatercept be designate a the primary suspect . duplicate entry be remove use standardised fda protocol . adverse event ( aes ) be categorise use the medical dictionary for regulatory activity ( meddra v.28.0 ) . disproportionality signal be assess via report or ( rors ; 95 % ci low limit > 1 with ≥3 case ) . severity be classify use the eudravigilance important medical event ( imes ) list . among 1 484 350 deduplicated report , 613 sotatercept-associated aes ( 1717 occurrence , 395 meddra term ) be identify . disproportionality analysis reveal 48 safety signal : 30 align with labelled risk ( eg , haemoglobin elevation ( ror=272.2 ) , telangiectasia ( ror=334.1 ) ) and 18 novel signal . the most frequent aes include headache ( n=78 ) , epistaxis ( n=57 ) and diarrhoea ( n=53 ) . two unlabelled events-cerebral haemorrhage and ascites-met criterion for critical imes . most report originate from the usa ( 98.5 % ) and involve female ( 73.6 % ) . this study confirm sotatercept 's labelled risk ( haematological and vascular effect ) and identifies novel safety concern , include cerebral haemorrhage and ascites , highlight the need for vigilant monitoring in pah management . real-world data underscore the value of postmarketing surveillance for detect rare or unanticipated aes . clinician should prioritise monitoring for haematological abnormality and bleed risk . longitudinal study be warrant to clarify long-term safety outcome .

Title: electroacupuncture in patient with early urinary incontinence after radical prostatectomy : a randomized clinical trial .
Authors: Niu J, Wang Y, Wang Y, Shi J, Liang J, Zhao X, Xu T, Guo H, Qiu X
Abstract: postprostatectomy urinary incontinence ( ui ) impair quality of life , yet effective noninvasive therapy remain limited . to investigate the efficacy and safety of electroacupuncture in patient with early ui after radical prostatectomy ( rp ) . design , set , this prospective , single-center , randomize , single-blinded clinical trial be conduct at nanjing drum tower hospital , affiliate hospital of medical school , nanjing university , from july 23 , 2021 , to november 1 , 2024 , with 20-week follow-up complete march 24 , 2025. men with localized prostate cancer who undergo robot-assisted rp and experienced ui ( define a use of ≥2 pad per day ) 4 to 6 week postoperatively be consecutively enrol and randomly assign 1:1 to the electroacupuncture or sham stimulation group . patient with any prior neoadjuvant hormonal therapy , any prior prostatic surgery , any history of pelvic surgery , and history of ui before rp be exclude . three participant withdraw before the intervention , and 101 ( 91.8 % ) complete follow-up . intention-to-treat analysis be use . patient in the electroacupuncture group receive electroacupuncture administer at bilateral ciliao , zhongliao , and xialiao acupoints , with sparse-dense wave electrostimulation ( alternate between 2 and 15 hz ) for 30 minute per session , 3 time per week for 6 week . the sham stimulation group underwent identical procedure with nonpuncturing flat-tip needle at offset point . the primary outcome be urinary continence ( uc ) , define a the use of 0 to 1 pad per day 6 week after the first electroacupuncture session . a total of 110 men ( median age , 69 [ iqr , 67-72 ] year ) be randomize . at week 6 , the intention-to-treat analysis show that the electroacupuncture group achieve a significantly high uc rate than the sham stimulation group ( 24 of 55 [ 43.6 % ] vs 12 of 55 [ 21.8 % ] ; relative risk , 2.00 ; 95 % ci , 1.12-3.59 ; p = .02 ) . the finding of this randomized clinical trial show that electroacupuncture significantly accelerate postprostatectomy uc recovery and may serve a a safe adjunct to standard care . these finding support integrate electroacupuncture into multimodal rehabilitation protocol to reduce early ui burden . clinicaltrials.gov identifier : nct04972669 .

Title: contribution of leukocyte telomere length to cardiovascular disease onset from genome-wide cross-trait analysis .
Authors: Qiao J, Wang Q, Zhao Y, Chang M, Sun S, Zhang P, Yao K, Chen M, Zheng L, Xing X, Cai L, Jegga AG, Jiang L, Pauklin S, Zou R, Yang Y, Feng Y
Abstract: telomere shorten be a well-established marker of cellular aging and genomic instability . while the relationship between leukocyte telomere length and cardiovascular disease have long be of interest , their genetic interplay remain incompletely understood . in this study , we observe substantial genetic overlap beyond genome-wide correlation and identify a potential causal relationship between leukocyte telomere length and coronary artery disease . specifically , we discover 248 pleiotropic locus , 22 of which show strong evidence of colocalization . some share loci implicate multiple pleiotropic gene across different trait pair , include aldh2 , acad10 , tmem116 , sh2b3 ( all at 12q24.12 ) , tmed6 ( 16q22.1 ) , serpinf1 ( 17p13.3 ) , and xpo7 ( 8p21.3 ) . functional analysis highlight key pathway involve in dna biosynthesis and telomere maintenance . notably , sh2b3 be validate through proteome-wide mendelian randomization analysis , suggest it potential a a therapeutic target . here we report the share genetic basis between leukocyte telomere length and cardiovascular disease , provide valuable insight into future therapeutic development .

Title: a novel cystic fibrosis mutation `` dels1255 '' in a male diagnose at birth .
Authors: Gerges M, Sutherland S, Chiasson M
Abstract: cystic fibrosis ( cf ) be an autosomal recessive disorder cause by pathogenic variant in the cftr gene . over 2000 cftr variant have be identify , and ongoing genetic characterization remain critical for guide eligibility for cftr modulator therapy and contribute to variant database that support diagnosis and research . we describe a 20-year-old caucasian male who be a compound heterozygous for the common f508del mutation and a novel variant , p.ser1255del ( c.3763_3765deltca ; dels1255 ) . he be diagnose with cf in the neonatal period follow meconium ileus , confirm by elevated sweat chloride test . his clinical course include pancreatic insufficiency , chronic staphylococcus aureus colonization , and sinus disease with nasal polyp , but no evidence of cf-related diabetes or liver disease . molecular diagnostic testing conduct at stanford clinical laboratory use pcr and bidirectional sanger sequence confirm the f508del mutation and identify the previously unreported dels1255 variant , an in-frame deletion of a serine residue at position 1255. this variant be absent from population database and a missense mutation at the same codon have previously be associate with severe cf phenotype , support it likely pathogenicity . the patient be initiate on elexacaftor-tezacaftor-ivacaftor ( eti ) therapy in 2021 , base on the presence of the f508del allele . since start eti , he have experience substantial clinical improvement , include improved spirometry , radiology , and a marked reduction in sweat chloride concentration . the response be presume to be drive by the f508del variant , while the effect of dels1255 on modulator responsiveness remain unknown . this case add to the grow spectrum of cftr variant with clinical relevance .

Title: engineer apoptotic extracellular vesicle for programmable regulation of neutrophil-macrophage-ros pathogenic axis to reconstruct rheumatoid arthritis microenvironment .
Authors: Kang Y, Han X, Zhou S, Wang X, Wang Y, Song P, Su X, Qin M, Qian D, Meng H, Yan J, Pu F, Zhang H
Abstract: rheumatoid arthritis microenvironment ( ram ) contain complex pathogenic mediator that interact dynamically to drive the progression of rheumatoid arthritis ( ra ) . however , most current ra treatment be single-target intervention , exert limited impact on ram . herein , apoptotic extracellular vesicle ( apoev ) be construct for programmable regulation of the neutrophil-macrophage-ros pathogenic axis , aim to reconstruct ram and improve ra therapy . mesenchymal stem cell ( msc ) be pretreated with dexamethasone ( dex ) and induced apoptosis to produce dex-loaded and fasl-overexpressing apoev ( d @ apoev ( fasl ) ) , which be far modify with low-molecular-weight heparin ( lmwh ) through a ros-responsive cleavage linker to form d @ apoev ( fasl ) ∩l . after intravenous injection into ra mouse , d @ apoev ( fasl ) ∩l target the inflamed joint base on their msc-derived feature and block neutrophil recruitment through bind to p-selectin on vascular endothelial cell . in response to high ro , d @ apoev ( fasl ) ∩l shed lmwh and expose fasl , induce neutrophil apoptosis through the fas/fasl signal pathway . subsequently , the apoptotic neutrophil trigger macrophage reprogramming from m1 to m2 phenotype , and the release dex significantly reduce the oxidative damage . various in vitro and in vivo assessment have confirm that d @ apoev ( fasl ) ∩l can effectively regulate neutrophil , macrophage , and ro , trigger an immune cascade , and restore intra-articular immune homeostasis , exhibit an effective ram reconstruction ability and a promising therapeutic effect for ra .

Title: effect of ketogenic diet on muscle mass , strength , aerobic metabolic capacity , and endurance in adult : a systematic review and meta-analysis .
Authors: Wang Y, Xiao Q, Zhang Z, Yang Y
Abstract: the ketogenic diet ( kd ) have gain popularity a an efficient approach to weight loss and body fat loss . concern about reduce muscle mass and performance have be rise during weight loss , a muscle mass and functionality be crucial for health . however , the effect of the kd on muscle not only for athlete or trainer but also for adult with less physical exercise be still controversial . we conduct a thorough search of database include embase , pubmed , cochrane library , and web of science up to july 19 , 2025. three aspect of muscle assessment be conduct , include muscle mass , power and strength , aerobic metabolic capacity , and endurance . we include randomize and non-randomized controlled study that compare the kd with other dietary intervention . study without control group be exclude . a random-effects model would be utilize when significant difference in population and intervention across study be of concern . the grade system be employ to assess evidence quality , while evidence reliability be gauge via sensitivity analysis . a total of 33 study be analyze , reveal no significant difference between the kd and other diet in muscle mass ( 0.06 , 95 % -1.97 to 2.09 , p = 0.95 ) , muscle power ( countermovement jump : -0.06 , 95 % -0.49 to 0.38 , p = 0.80 ) and strength ( squat : -0.19 , 95 % -0.53 to 0.15 , p = 0.27 ;
