bench press : -0.15 , 95 % -0.49 to 0.18 , p = 0.37 ) . however , a significant decrease in fat-free mass ( -0.48 , 95 % -0.73 to -0.23 , p < 0.001 ) and fat mass ( -1.31 , 95 % -2.06 to -0.57 , p < 0.001 ) be observe in the kd group compare with the control group . the kd also improve fat oxidation ( 0.13 , 95 % 0.08 to 0.17 , p < 0.001 ) and reduced respiratory exchange ratio ( -0.07 , 95 % -0.11 to -0.03 , p < 0.001 ) during an exercise test . the vo ( 2max ) and vo ( 2max ) relative to body weight , treadmill time to exhaustion , and rating of perceived exertion be not significantly affect by kd . among adult population , kd can increase fat oxidation to modify muscle metabolism , while no significant reduction in muscle mass or strength be observe . additional well-designed randomize control trial be warrant to definitively determine the effect of ketogenic diet on muscle parameter .
Journal: Journal of health, population, and nutrition

Title: the primary cilium a a multifunctional organelle : emerging role and unanswered question .
Authors: Corbeil D, Thamm K, Karbanová J, Fargeas CA, Jászai J
Abstract: the primary cilium , a solitary membrane-bound , microtubule-based cellular organelle , have be consider an evolutionary relict for almost a century . over the past three decade , interest in this protruding , non-motile structure of the plasma membrane have be boost by the identification of ciliary dysfunction a the underlie cause of developmental abnormality and inherited disorder , commonly call ciliopathies . the primary cilium respond to environmental stimulus , such a mechanical , chemical , or light ( in the case of the modified cilium of photoreceptors ) signal . the membrane of primary cilium host specific sensory complex and/or receptor associate with various pathway , predispose them to transmit ( or convert ) spatiotemporal environmental information into cellular response . these dual mechanochemical aspect lead to the recognition that primary cilium be multifunctional sensory organelle that act a `` cellular antenna '' . beyond their establish role in signal transduction , primary cilium be newly recognize a important hub for short- and long-distance intercellular communication due to their ability to release and , perhaps , selectively take up extracellular vesicle , which be biological carrier exchange between cell . in addition , the physical contact of the primary cilium with other cilium , cytonemes or with nerve cell axon add another layer of complexity to the mechanism of sensory and/or intercellular communication between neighbor cell that need to be far explore . in this review , we focus on these new and less-explored ciliary property and process , which can affect cell communication and signaling and thus have a direct impact on development , tissue homeostasis , and pathological condition .

Title: integrative genomics and functional immunology reveal clostridia specie a modulators of neuroinflammation in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis .
Authors: Wang S, Jiang H, Yao T
Abstract: this multiomics study investigate causal relationship between the gut microbiota ( gm ) , immune dysregulation , and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis ( al ) pathogenesis use mendelian randomization ( mr ) with experimental validation . analysis incorporate genome-wide data from 87,347 participant ( n = 7738 ; 20,806 patient , 59,804 control ; immune phenotype : n = 3757 ) , transcriptomic data from 71 subject ( 56 al patient , 15 control ) , and experimental validation in matched cohort ( n = 6 subject per group ) . two-sample bidirectional mr and mediation analysis be use to evaluate association . experimental validation employ flow cytometry for myeloid-derived suppressor cell quantification , enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay for cytokine , and real-time polymerase chain reaction for bacterial validation . statistical analysis include inverse variance weight method with cohen 's d calculation . sixteen bacterial taxon , include p_firmicutes.c_clostridia , display protective association with the risk of al , whereas sixteen show harmful association . mediation analysis suggest that p_firmicutes.c_clostridia may confer protection through cd33+hla-dr-myeloid-derived suppressor cell upregulation ( 23.8 % mediation effect ) . experimental validation confirm few myeloid-derived suppressor cell in al patient ( 4.0 ± 0.8 % vs. 7.5 ± 1.0 % , p < 0.001 , cohen 's d = 1.4 ) and low level of anti-inflammatory cytokine ( tgf-β1 : cohen 's d = 1.8 , p < 0.001 ) . these finding support causal association between gut microbial taxon and the al risk , which be mediate through immunoregulatory mechanism , highlight therapeutic target within the gut‒immune‒brain axis .
Journal: Inflammation research : official journal of the European Histamine Research

Title: update efficacy and predictive biomarkers of ql1706 , a bifunctional pd-1/ctla-4 dual blocker in advanced solid tumors-a phase 1/1b study .
Authors: Ma Y, Lin S, Chen Q, Xue J, Yang Y, Zang A, Cheng Y, Zhang Y, Wang X, Chen Z, Qu S, He J, Chen C, Jin C, Zhu D, Li Q, Liu X, Su W, Ba Y, Li W, Li Q, Zhu C, Huang Z, Kang X, Xue S, Li H, Wang C, Luo F, Huang Y, Zhang L, Zhao H
Abstract: ql1706 have show promise efficacy in solid tumor in a phase 1/1b study . here , we report updated long-term survival outcome and biomarker analysis . among 468 patient treat with ql1706 ( 5 mg/kg ) , median progression-free survival ( mpfs ) and overall survival ( mo ) be 1.5 and 14.2 month for non-small cell lung cancer ( nsclc ) , 1.9 and 20.2 month for nasopharyngeal carcinoma ( npc ) , and 4.2 and 18.6 month for cervical cancer ( cc ) , respectively . liver metastasis be correlate with poor progression-free survival ( pfs ) and overall survival ( o ) in nsclc and poor o in cc , while elevate lactate dehydrogenase be link to short pfs and o in npc . cdk4/11q13 diploid or the expression of gzmk ( high ) & myc ( low ) distinguish npcs with the most favorable pfs . in nsclc , pd-l1 ( + ) /til ( + ) or a low cxcl13 ratio indicate well outcome . ql1706 offer long-term survival benefit in solid tumor , with identified molecular marker aid in select suitable candidate . this study have be register on clinicaltrials.gov ( nct04296994 and nct05171790 ) .

Title: reversal of aclf and alf use whole blood extracorporeal system combine hla-depleted liver organoids with granulocyte-monocyte apheresis .
Authors: Yamaguchi H, Yoneyama Y, Ichimura K, Ohtsu K, Soen M, Moriya C, Kumagai M, Myers RP, Subramanian GM, Takebe T
Abstract: background & acute-on-chronic liver failure ( aclf ) be characterize by catastrophic loss of liver function in patient with advanced chronic liver disease , with 28-day mortality rate reach up to 80 % . despite advance in intensive care , the high mortality primarily stem from the absence of a therapeutic modality that simultaneously address both the profound systemic inflammatory response and severe hepatic synthetic dysfunction . we design an integrate extracorporeal circuit , term the utopia system , which combine granulocyte and monocyte apheresis ( gma ) with human induce pluripotent stem cell-derived hepatocyte-like cell ( ihlc ) organoids engineer with hla-a , hla-b , and ciita triple knockout . the efficacy of utopia be test after direct whole blood exposure through venous flow in rat model of aclf and acute liver failure ( alf ) . utopia treatment significantly improve survival in both aclf and alf rat model , outperform gma or ihlc monotherapy and hepg2 cell-based device . improved survival be associate with reduced coma severity , improve liver biochemistry , and reduce hyperammonaemia , hyperbilirubinemia , and systemic inflammation . transcriptomic and histological analysis reveal restoration of hepatic metabolic gene expression and hepatocyte regeneration . mechanistically , ihlc-secreted α-fetoprotein suppress hepatocyte cell cycle arrest via p21 downregulation and enhanced regeneration , while utopia restore hnf4α activity and dampen pro-inflammatory cytokine , include il-6 and tnf-α . the tandem utopia circuit confers a significant survival benefit in preclinical rodent model of aclf and alf by provide anti-inflammatory , synthetic , and metabolic support . elucidate the regenerative signal that promote recovery of the injured liver may far expand the potential of this whole blood extracorporeal system a a novel , off-the-shelf liver support therapy . restore hepatic metabolism while control inflammation in acutely decompensated cirrhosis remain a major unmet clinical need . by combine hla-modified human induce pluripotent stem cell-derived liver organoids with granulocyte and monocyte apheresis , we develop a bioartificial liver system that manage inflammation , restore liver function , and promote regeneration in two rat model of severe liver failure . this therapy could offer an off-the-shelf treatment option for patient with life-threatening liver failure .

Title: reframing remission in severe asthma : a conceptual framework for distinguish disease activity versus damage .
Authors: Porsbjerg C, Rupani H, Brannan JD, Ueki S, Nawijn MC, Erjefält JS, Chanez P, Anderson GP, Pavord ID
Abstract: remission be emerge a a feasible treatment goal in moderate-to-severe asthma , drive by the success of biologic therapy in control inflammation and reduce exacerbation . yet current definition of remission-focused on symptom control , lung function , and corticosteroid reduction-lack precision , can only be ascertain retrospectively , and do not reflect the underlying mechanism and pathology that drive disease progression . this gap limit the clinical applicability of these definition and might obscure opportunity for early , disease-modifying intervention . in this series paper , we propose a refined framework for understand and reach remission , centre on distinguish modifiable disease activity from irreversible remodelling and comorbidity-related factor that contribute to disease burden . we introduce the concept of at-risk asthma a a crucial phase characterise by high disease activity and immune dysregulation , in which timely intervention might prevent irreversible airway and extrapulmonary damage and support long-term disease modification . we examine how symptom , lung function impairment , and exacerbation can arise from distinct and overlap mechanism , underscore the need for careful attribution in clinical assessment . we also outline four key pathophysiological domains-airway hyper-responsiveness , immune hyper-responsiveness , immune remodelling , and structural remodelling-and describe their temporal evolution and implication for treatment responsiveness . finally , we present a domain-based strategy for assessment and intervention , link target therapy to underlie mechanism . this approach support more personalised treatment decision and redefines remission , not simply a the absence of symptom , but a stabilisation of disease biology . a the field advance towards early intervention and more tailored application of biologics in at-risk asthma , such a framework could be essential to improve long-term outcome and prevent overtreatment of irreversible disease .

Title: tumor immune dynamic and long-term clinical outcome of stage iiia nsclc patient treat with neoadjuvant chemoimmunotherapy .
Authors: Schmid D, Sobottka B, Manzo M, Trüb M, Leonards K, Herzig P, Oyewole OR, Jermann P, Hayoz S, Savic Prince S, Tochtermann G, Natoli M, Pless M, Bettini A, Früh M, Mauti LA, Britschgi C, Peters S, Mark M, Ochsenbein AF, Janthur WD, Waibel C, Mach N, Froesch P, Buess M, Bohanes P, Gonzalez M, Alborelli I, Rothschild SI, Koelzer VH, Zippelius A
Abstract: neoadjuvant chemoimmunotherapy offer promise to improve outcome for patient with resectable non-small cell lung cancer ( nsclc ) . yet not all patient derive treatment benefit , and reliable biomarkers of response be still lack . we here assess the long-term clinical outcome of neoadjuvant chemotherapy and perioperative anti-pd-l1 inhibition in resectable stage iiia nsclc in the sakk 16/14 trial and provide a comprehensive characterization of anti-tumor immune response for biomarker-based treatment personalization . we report secondary outcome of median event-free survival ( efs ) of 4.0 year and median overall survival not be reach after a median follow-up of 5.4 year . computer-aided spatial image analysis emphasize the importance of cd8 ( + ) t cell position in tumor , and large tertiary lymphoid structure in pre-treatment biopsy correlate with improved efs . genomic technique reveal the association of intratumoral tcr diversity with response . finally , circulate proliferate cd39 ( + ) pd-1 ( + ) cd8 ( + ) t cell and elevated level of ccl15 post-treatment be see in patient with sustained therapeutic benefit . nct02572843 .

Title: serine-arginine protein kinase 1 ( srpk1 ) be under-expressed in mucinous colorectal cancer , and may mediate resistance to oxaliplatin .
Authors: Duggan WP, Azimi M, Flanagan L, Sullivan GP, Reynolds IS, Fay J, Dussmann H, Ní Chonghaile T, Sheehan KM, Jirström K, Prehn JHM, Burke JP
Abstract: 5-15 % of all colorectal cancer ( crcs ) be mucinous . mucinous crcs be associate with an inhibited response to standard adjuvant and neoadjuvant therapy . serine-arginine protein kinase 1 ( srpk1 ) be an enzyme , which modulate the activity of multiple splice factor . srpk1 under-expression be associate with resistance to platinum-based chemotherapeutic agent in multiple tumor type . the objective of this study be to evaluate srpk1 expression in mucinous crc and to explore the potential relationship between differential srpk1 expression and oxaliplatin resistance in mucinous crc . rectal cancer and crc tissue microarrays ( tma ) be stain with srpk1 to compare expression between mucinous and non-mucinous tumor . srpk1 expression be analyze in mucinous and non-mucinous crc cell line . cell be treat with oxaliplatin to explore difference in treatment response . mucinous cell be transfected with an srpk1 crispr/cas9 lentiviral activation plasmid to investigate the relationship between srpk1 expression and oxaliplatin resistance . the tma cohort include 117 patient with mucinous and 441 patient with non-mucinous crc . srpk1 be find to be under-expressed in both the mucinous rectal cancer ( p < 0.001 ) and crc cohort ( p = 0.003 ) . on univariate analysis , srpk1 under-expression be find to be associate with bad 5-year o ( p = 0.001 ) . treatment of mucinous crc cell with oxaliplatin do not result in a significant increase in cell death ( p = 0.149 ) . however overexpression of srpk1 follow transfection with a crispr/cas9 activation plasmid result in a significant increase in sensitivity of these cell to oxaliplatin treatment ( p = 0.029 ) . srpk1 be under-expressed in mucinous crc , and under-expression be associate with bad o . this may be due to the positive effect of srpk1 on oxaliplatin sensitivity .

Title: a new paradigm for outer membrane protein biogenesis in the bacteroidota .
Authors: Liu X, Orenday Tapia L, Deme JC, Lea SM, Berks BC
Abstract: in gram-negative bacteria , the outer membrane be the first line of defence against antimicrobial agent and immunological attack ( 1 ) . a key part of outer membrane biogenesis be the insertion of outer membrane protein by the β-barrel-assembly machinery ( bam ) ( 2-4 ) . here we report the cryo-electron microscopy structure of a bam complex isolate from flavobacterium johnsoniae , a member of the bacteroidota , a phylum that include key human commensal and major anaerobic pathogen . this bam complex be extensively modify from the canonical escherichia coli system and include an extracellular canopy that overhang the substrate folding site and a subunit that insert into the bam pore . the novel bamg and bamh subunit that be involve in form the extracellular canopy be require for bam function and be conserve across the bacteroidota , suggest that they form an essential extension to the canonical bam core in this phylum . for bamh , isolation of a suppressor mutation enable the separation of it essential and non-essential function . the need for a highly remodelled and enhance bam complex reflect the unusually complex membrane protein find in the outer membrane of the bacteroidota .

Title: tdp-43 in alzheimer 's disease : pathophysiology and therapeutic strategy .
Authors: Zhou X, Lin X, He Y, Huang N, Luo Y
Abstract: alzheimer 's disease ( ad ) be a complex neurodegenerative disorder characterize by the dysregulation of multiple molecular mechanism . in recent year , transactive response dna-binding protein 43 kda ( tdp-43 ) have increasingly be recognize a a critical pathological protein and have become a prominent focus in ad research . tdp-43 be involve not only in physiological process such a rna metabolism , protein quality control , and mitochondrial regulation but also in ad pathology through abnormal aggregation , dysregulated nucleocytoplasmic transport , and aberrant posttranslational modification , lead to neurotoxicity , mitochondrial dysfunction , and disrupt protein homeostasis . study have show that tdp-43 closely interact with two core pathological hallmark of ad , β-amyloid ( aβ ) and tau . by promote aβ oligomerization and tau hyperphosphorylation , tdp-43 accelerate the pathological progression of this disease . give the multifaceted role of tdp-43 in ad , therapeutic strategy target tdp-43 have show great potential . approach such a modulate it rna splicing activity , inhibit pathological aggregation , restore the balance of nucleocytoplasmic transport , and prevent it mitochondrial localization offer new avenue for ad treatment . this review systematically summarize the pathological mechanism of tdp-43 in ad and it interaction with aβ and tau and discuss the feasibility of target tdp-43 a a therapeutic strategy . future study should far elucidate the role of tdp-43 in the early stage of ad and develop specific therapeutic agent that target tdp-43 , with the aim of provide new insight for precision treatment of ad .

Title: c-reactive protein-triglyceride glucose index predict mortality in cardiovascular-kidney-metabolic syndrome stage 0-3 : a prospective cohort study .
Authors: Ying Q, He F, Wu L, Wei Q, Xu J
Abstract: cardiovascular-kidney-metabolic ( ckm ) syndrome be define by the interplay of metabolic risk factor , chronic kidney disease , and cardiovascular disease . the c-reactive protein-triglyceride glucose index ( cti ) be a composite biomarker that reflect both inflammation and insulin resistance , but whether it be associate with mortality in person with early-stage ckm syndrome be unknown . we analyze data from the national health and nutrition examination survey from 1999 to 2010. we use multivariable cox proportional-hazards model to assess the association between the cti score and the risk of all-cause mortality and cardiovascular disease ( cvd ) mortality , with vital status ascertain through linkage to the national death index through december 31 , 2019. among 10,718 participant , a total of 1783 death ( 491 from cvd ) occur during a mean follow-up of 14.0 year . in fully adjust model , a high cti score be associate with a great risk of all-cause mortality ( hr per unit increase , 1.56 ; 95 % ci , 1.36 to 1.78 ) and of cvd mortality ( hr per unit increase , 2.03 ; 95 % ci , 1.49 to 2.77 ) . the association with all-cause mortality be strong among participant under the age of 60 than among those over 60 year old ( p < 0.001 for interaction ) . our study find that in patient with early-stage ckm syndrome , a high cti be independently associate with an increase risk of all-cause mortality and cvd mortality . this association be more significant in young participant .

Title: the significance of urine extracellular vesicle dna methylation detection in the diagnosis and classification of prostate cancer .
Authors: Ding T, Diao Y, Fu R, Gong C, He Q, He W, Zhang L, Yang X, Zeng X, Yu L, Liu J, Shi W, Zhang K, Hao X
Abstract: a one of the most common malignant tumor in men , prostate cancer ( pca ) still lack convenient , non-invasive and highly specific diagnostic marker . the advantage of extracellular vesicle ( ev ) dna in tumor diagnosis have gradually attract the attention of researcher . however , methylation detection , which be more advantageous than mutation detection in tumor diagnosis , have not be widely practice in ev dna , and it value in pca diagnosis also remain underexplored . this study aim to establish and optimize an ev dna methylation detection system and evaluate it diagnostic and classification potential for pca . we characterize ev dna biological property , optimize pretreatment strategy , validate it correlation with genomic dna methylation , and explore urine ev dna methylation target in 86 benign prostatic hyperplasia ( bph ) and 109 pca patient across three cohort ( screen : 30 bph/33 pca ; training : 27 bph/30 pca ; validation : 29 bph/46 pca ) . heterogeneous biological characteristic be observe among dna from different subtypes of ev , but methylation profile remain consistent across subtypes and post-dnase i treatment . ev dna accurately reflect the methylation state of source cell genomic dna . by combine our screen result with data from the tcga database and previously report , we develop a panel consisting of 667 pca-specific methylation target for detection . among these , six methylation site ( macf1、linc01359-1、linc01359-2、adcy4、gaplinc、c19orf25 ) demonstrate high diagnostic value for pca , enable construction of pca and aggressive pca differential diagnosis model with auc up to 0.74 and 0.91 respectively . the diagnostic value of these six marker be far confirm use methylight pcr in the validation cohort which also display promising performance a a tool for diagnose pca . this study highlight the potential of urine ev dna methylation a a novel diagnostic marker for pca and lay a foundation for future ev dna research .

Title: active and passive physical therapy in patient with chronic low-back pain : a level i bayesian network meta-analysis .
Authors: Baroncini A, Maffulli N, Manocchio N, Bossa M, Foti C, Schäfer L, Klimuch A, Migliorini F
Abstract: chronic low back pain ( clbp ) be common . physiotherapy be frequently indicate a a non-pharmacological management of these patient . this bayesian network meta-analysis compare active versus passive physiotherapy versus their combination in term of pain and disability in patient with mechanical and/or aspecific clbp . in june 2025 , the following database be access : pubmed , web of science , google scholar and embase . all the randomise control trial ( rcts ) which evaluate the efficacy of a physiotherapy program in patient with lbp be access . data regard pain score , the roland-morris disability questionnaire ( rmq ) and the oswestry disability index ( odi ) be collect . the network meta-analyses be perform use the stata ( version 14 ; statacorp , college station , tx , usa ) routine for bayesian hierarchical random-effects model analysis , employ the inverse variance method . the standardised mean difference ( std ) be use for continuous data . data from 2768 patient ( mean age 46.9 ± 10.9 year , mean bmi 25.8 ± 2.9 kg/m ( 2 ) ) be collect . the mean length of follow-up be 6.2 ± 6.1 month . between group , comparability be find at baseline in term of mean age , proportion of woman , mean bmi , symptom duration and patient-reported outcome measure ( prom ) . by the end of the follow-up period , the active group evidence the low pain score ( smd 1.00 ; 95 % ci -3.28 to 5.28 ) . the active group evidence the low rmq score ( smd 0.94 ; 95 % ci -4.96 to 3.09 ) . the active group evidence the low odi score ( smd -1.23 ; 95 % ci -9.83 to 7.36 ) . active physiotherapy show good result than passive physiotherapy and a combination of both for the management of mechanical and/or non-specific clbp . level i , bayesian network meta-analysis of rcts .
Journal: Journal of orthopaedics and traumatology : official journal of the Italian

Title: alternate hemiplegia of childhood : retrospective genetic study and genotype-phenotype correlation in 187 subject from the u ahcf registry .
Authors: Viollet L, Glusman G, Murphy KJ, Newcomb TM, Reyna SP, Sweney M, Nelson B, Andermann F, Andermann E, Acsadi G, Barbano RL, Brown C, Brunkow ME, Chugani HT, Cheyette SR, Collins A, DeBrosse SD, Galas D, Friedman J, Hood L, Huff C, Jorde LB, King MD, LaSalle B, Leventer RJ, Lewelt AJ, Massart MB, Mérida MR 2nd, Ptáček LJ, Roach JC, Rust RS, Renault F, Sanger TD, Sotero de Menezes MA, Tennyson R, Uldall P, Zhang Y, Zupanc M, Xin W, Silver K, Swoboda KJ
Abstract: mutation in atp1a3 cause alternate hemiplegia of childhood ( ahc ) by disrupt function of the neuronal na+/k+ atpase . publish study to date indicate 2 recurrent mutation , d801n and e815k , and a more severe phenotype in the e815k cohort . we perform mutation analysis and retrospective genotype-phenotype correlation in all eligible patient with ahc enrol in the u ahc foundation registry from 1997-2012. clinical data be abstract from standardized caregiver ' questionnaire and medical record and confirm by expert clinician . we identify atp1a3 mutation by sanger and whole genome sequencing , and compare phenotype within and between 4 group of subject , those with d801n , e815k , other atp1a3 or no atp1a3 mutation . we identify heterozygous atp1a3 mutation in 154 of 187 ( 82 % ) ahc patient . of 34 unique mutation , 31 ( 91 % ) be missense , and 16 ( 47 % ) have not be previously report . concordant with prior study , more than 2/3 of all mutation be clusteredin exon 17 and 18. of 143 simplex occurrence , 58 have d801n ( 40 % ) , 38 have e815k ( 26 % ) and 11 have g947r ( 8 % ) mutation [ correct ] .patients with an e815k mutation demonstrate an early age of onset , more severe motor impairment and a high prevalence of status epilepticus . this study far expand the number and spectrum of atp1a3 mutation associate with ahc and confirm a more deleterious effect of the e815k mutation on select neurologic outcome . however , the complexity of the disorder and the extensive phenotypic variability among subgroups merit caution and emphasize the need for further study .

Title: the effect of vasopressor choice on renal outcome in septic shock : a systematic review of randomised trial a a guide for future research .
Authors: McDonald R, Burns M, Wong A, Smith C, Ostermann M, Hutchings S
Abstract: patient with septic shock be high risk for develop acute kidney injury ( aki ) , with it associated morbidity . this systematic review assess the evidence for an effect on renal outcome from choice of vasopressor . search be conduct on medline , embase , cochrane central , congress abstract and trial registry . the search strategy include septic shock , vasopressor agent and renal impairment . inclusion criterion be non-crossover randomise control trial of adult septic shock compare individual or combination of vasopressor and placebo control trial . primary outcome be the incidence of aki in study participant . secondary outcome be aki duration , renal replacement therapy ( rrt ) rate , rrt duration , renal failure free day , requirement for long term rrt and major adverse kidney event ( make ) at 30 and 90 day . a total of 4259 patient , from 17 study , be include . vasopressin and terlipressin study predominate . in 8 study report aki rate , no effect be see relate to vasopressor choice . rrt rate be the most reported secondary outcome . of five study that investigate the role of vasopressin , only one show significant benefit . alongside limited reporting , no conclusive benefit be demonstrate in other secondary outcome . no study report requirement for long term rrt , make 30 or 90. this be the first systematic review focussed on renal outcome with differential vasopressor therapy in septic shock . it illustrate the paucity of evidence support a particular vasopressor . also highlight be problem of population and study heterogeneity , as well a the focus on rrt a a proxy for renal outcome . standardise renal outcome reporting , large and appropriately powered trial and focussed sub-population study be require to far inform renal focussed vasopressor research and practice . this systematic review be prospectively register on prospero ( crd42023481778 ) .

Title: clinical characteristic , treatment response and outcome of light chain multiple myeloma .
Authors: Bolarinwa A, Zanwar S, Abdallah N, Buadi FK, Hayman SR, Gertz MA, Dispenzieri A, Muchtar E, Kapoor P, Gonsalves W, Kourelis T, Dingli D, Warsame R, Leung N, Cook J, Binder M, Lin Y, Hwa Y, Rogers MG, Hobbs M, Fonder A, Jevremovic D, Rajkumar SV, Kumar SK
Abstract: light chain multiple myeloma ( lcmm ) be a subtype of multiple myeloma ( mm ) characterize by the exclusive production of immunoglobulin light chain and account for 15 % -20 % of newly diagnose mm . a comprehensive comparison of lcmm with mm produce intact immunoglobulin ( non-lcmm ) remain limited . in this retrospective study , we describe distinct clinical and cytogenetic feature and assess long-term outcome in 852 lcmm patient diagnose between 01/01/2004 and 12/31/2022 , compare with non-lcmm control match for age , sex , and year of diagnosis . on univariable analysis , lcmm patient be more likely to present with elevated creatinine ( > 2 mg/dl ) , beta-2-microglobulin ≥ 5.5 mg/l , elevate ldh , hypercalcemia , t ( 11 ; 14 ) , del ( 13q ) , and t ( 6 ; 14 ) . conversely , ims-imwg high-risk disease , hyperdiploidy , t ( 4 ; 14 ) , and serum albumin < 3.5 g/dl be less common . on multivariable analysis , elevate creatinine ( 5.1 , 95 % 1.2-27 , p = 0.04 ) , t ( 11 ; 14 ) ( 2.6 , 95 % 1.3-5.2 , p = 0.006 ) , and del ( 13q ) ( 4.1 , 95 % 2.1-8.2 , p < 0.001 ) be independently associate with lcmm , while ims-imwg high-risk disease ( 0.3 , 95 % 0.1-0.8 , p = 0.02 ) and hyperdiploidy ( 0.3 , 95 % 0.1-0.7 , p = 0.002 ) be less frequent . despite these difference , progression-free survival with frontline treatment ( 0.97 , 95 % 0.84-1.11 , p = 0.63 ) and overall survival ( 0.99 , 95 % 0.87-1.13 , p = 0.94 ) be similar between lcmm and non-lcmm patient . this study highlight the distinct clinical and cytogenetic feature of lcmm , mark by high rate of renal failure , t ( 11 ; 14 ) , and del ( 13q ) , low prevalence of ims-imwg high-risk disease , and comparable survival outcome .

Title: metabolic reprogramming represent a targetable mechanism to overcome acquire resistance to venetoclax in acute myeloid leukemia .
Authors: de Queiroz GN, Lima K, Cipelli M, Tomaz V, Cortez LGF, de Franca Basto Silva M, Guedes RLM, Campregher PV, Rego EM, Câmara NOS, Costa-Lotufo LV, Machado-Neto JA
Abstract: acute myeloid leukemia ( aml ) often develop resistance to the bcl2 inhibitor venetoclax through metabolic reprogramming . this study establish acquire venetoclax-resistant aml model ( mv4-11vr and molm-13vr ) to explore resistance mechanism and therapeutic strategy . cell viability and apoptosis assay reveal robust acquire resistance to venetoclax upon intermittent drug exposure . metabolic profile revealed distinct adaptation : mv4-11vr cell favor glycolysis , while molm-13vr cell increase oxidative phosphorylation . proteomic analysis support these finding , show pathway enrichment for carbohydrate metabolism in mv4-11vr and aerobic energy production in molm-13vr . despite these difference , both model share hyperactivation of the pi3k/akt/mtor pathway , a show by rps6 hyperphosphorylation . apoptotic regulation also diverge between the cellular model in relation to modulate bcl2-related gene and activation of the mapk signal pathway . target these metabolic change with metformin ( a mitochondrial complex i inhibitor ) or kpt-9274 ( a nampt inhibitor ) re-sensitized resistant cell to venetoclax . combination treatment show strong synergy and near-complete cell elimination . these result highlight metabolic reprogramming a a heterogeneous but targetable resistance mechanism and support combine metabolic inhibitor with bcl2 blockade to treat refractory aml .
Journal: Biochimica et biophysica acta. Molecular basis of disease

Title: application of machine learning in migraine classification : a call for study design standardization and global collaboration .
Authors: Petrušić I, Messina R, Pellesi L, Azorin DG, Chiang CC, Pietra AD, Ha WS, Labastida-Ramirez A, Onan D, Ornello R, Raffaelli B, Rubio-Beltran E, Ruscheweyh R, Tana C, Vuralli D, Waliszewska-Prosół M, Wang W, Wells-Gatnik WD, Martelletti P, Raggi A
Abstract: migraine be a complex neurological disorder with diverse clinical phenotype and a multifaceted pathophysiology , which pose substantial challenge for accurate diagnosis , subtype differentiation , and biomarker discovery . machine learning ( ml ) technique have emerge a promising tool for classify migraine patient and uncover the underlying neurobiological mechanism that differentiate migraine type and subtypes . this systematic review identifies current ml classification model for migraine type and subtypes , evaluate the quality , reproducibility , and clinical utility of publish study . the finding demonstrate that current ml model , particularly support vector machine and linear discriminant analysis , can accurately classify migraine patient base on structural and functional neuroimaging feature with accuracy range from 75 to 98 % . however , quality assessment reveal significant methodological heterogeneity across study , include inconsistent reporting of model performance , insufficient patient phenotyping , small and imbalanced datasets , and limit external validation . these limitation hinder the global generalizability and reproducibility of these study . we propose a roadmap for future research emphasize well-characterized clinical subgrouping , standardize data acquisition and feature engineering protocol , transparency in model development and reporting , and collaborative multicentric design to enable large-scale validation . furthermore , this review stress the importance of incorporate real-world phenotypic data , such a treatment response , comorbidities , and digital phenotyping metric , to enrich ml model and support the transition toward precision medicine in migraine care . ultimately , this review highlight the urgent need for methodological rigor in migraine ml classification study to bridge the gap between experimental success and clinical applicability .
Journal: The journal of headache and pain

Title: cyclin-dependent kinase 4/6 inhibitor beyond progression in hormone receptor-positive , her2-negative advance breast cancer : a systematic review and meta-analysis ( reignite study ) .
Authors: de Almeida LFC, Leite LF, Filho VOC, Noronha MM, Cappellaro AP, Gouveia M, da Silva JL, Ernst B, de Melo AC, Tarantino P, Batalini F
Abstract: add cyclin-dependent kinase 4/6 inhibitor ( cdk4/6i ) to endocrine therapy ( et ) be consider the first-line treatment of advanced hr-positive/her2-negative breast cancer . however , with the recent approval of several additional target agent , the optimal treatment sequencing remain uncertain , and it be unclear whether the benefit of cdk4/6i extend beyond progression on first-line therapy . we conduct a systematic review and meta-analysis to evaluate the efficacy of cdk4/6i in the second-line setting after progression on cdk4/6i in the first line , with a particular focus on patient who have either pik3ca or esr1 mutation . we include randomized clinical trial ( rcts ) compare cdk4/6i combine with et to et alone in patient who experience tumor progression on cdk4/6i treatment in the first-line setting . the result be pool use a random-effects model with 95 % confidence interval ( ci ) . five rcts encompass 1184 patient be include . overall , cdk4/6i plus et significantly improve progression-free survival ( pfs ) versus et alone , yield a hazard ratio of 0.73 ( 95 % ci 0.56-0.94 , p < 0.05 ) , with a more prominent benefit in patient who switch the cdk4/6i ( hazard ratio 0.61 , 95 % ci 0.48-0.77 , p < 0.05 ) . the benefit be consistent in patient with somatic pik3ca mutation ( hazard ratio 0.71 , 95 % ci 0.52-0.98 , p < 0.05 ) , and esr1 mutation ( hazard ratio 0.66 , 95 % ci 0.49-0.89 , p < 0.05 ) . the toxicity profile be compatible with the known side effect from cdk4/6i . our result support the strategy of switch the cdk4/6i in the second-line setting and demonstrate persistent benefit even in patient with pik3ca or esr1 mutation .

Title: dual membrane receptor degradation via folate receptor target chimera .
Authors: Wang Z, Li Z, Högström J, Inuzuka H, Jing R, Yan P, Hou T, Qi Y, Huang D, Wang J, Wu T, Shi X, Liu B, Muranen T, Zhang D, Wei W
Abstract: cancer drug resistance pose a significant challenge in oncology , often drive by intricate cross-talk among membrane-bound receptor that compromise mono-targeted therapy . we develop a dual membrane receptor degradation strategy leverage folate receptor α ( frα ) to address this issue . folate receptor α target chimeras-dual ( foltac-dual ) be engineer degrader design to selectively and simultaneously degrade distinct receptor pair : ( 1 ) egfr/her2 and ( 2 ) pd-l1/vista . through modular optimization of modality configuration and geometry , we identify the `` string '' format a the most effective construct . mechanistic study demonstrate an ~85 % increase in egfr-binding affinity compare to the conventional knob-into-hole design , likely contribute to the improved efficiency of dual-target degradation . proof-of-concept study reveal that egfr and her2 foltac-dual effectively counteract resistance in trastuzumab/lapatinib-resistant her2-positive breast cancer model , while pd-l1 and vista foltac-dual rejuvenates immune response in pd-l1 antibody-resistant syngeneic mouse model . these finding establish foltac-dual a a promising dual-degradation platform for clinical translation .

Title: prevention of type 2 diabetes through prediabetes remission without weight loss .
Authors: Sandforth A, Arreola EV, Hanson RL, Wewer Albrechtsen NJ, Holst JJ, Ahrends R, Coman C, Gerst F, Lorza-Gil E, Cheng Y, Sandforth L, Katzenstein S, Ganslmeier M, Seissler J, Hauner H, Perakakis N, Wagner R, Machann J, Schick F, Peter A, Lehmann R, Weigert C, Maurer J, Preissl H, Heni M, Szendrödi J, Kopf S, Solimena M, Schwarz P, Blüher M, Häring HU, Hrabé de Angelis M, Schürmann A, Kabisch S, Mai K, Pfeiffer AFH, Bornstein S, Stumvoll M, Roden M, Stefan N, Fritsche A, Birkenfeld AL, Jumpertz von Schwartzenberg R
Abstract: clinical practice guideline recommend defined weight loss goal for the prevention of type 2 diabetes ( t2d ) in those individual with increase risk , such a prediabetes . however , achieve prediabetes remission , that be , reach normal glucose regulation accord to american diabetes association criterion , be more efficient in prevent t2d than solely reach weight loss goal . here we present a post hoc analysis of the large , multicenter , randomize , control prediabetes lifestyle intervention study ( plis ) , demonstrate that prediabetes remission be achievable without weight loss or even weight gain , and that it also protect against incident t2d . the underlying mechanism include improved insulin sensitivity , β-cell function and increment in β-cell-glp-1 sensitivity . weight gain be similar in those achieve prediabetes remission ( responder ) compare with nonresponders ; however , adipose tissue be differentially redistribute in responder and nonresponders when compare against each other-while nonresponders increase visceral adipose tissue mass , responder increase adipose tissue in subcutaneous depot . the finding be reproduce in the u diabetes prevention program . these data uncover essential pathway for prediabetes remission without weight loss and emphasize the need to include glycemic target in current clinical practice guideline to improve t2d prevention .

Title: explore causal relationship between epigenetic age acceleration and alzheimer 's disease : a bidirectional mendelian randomization study .
Authors: Liu H, Yin Z, Chen X, Wang Z
Abstract: alzheimer 's disease ( ad ) be identify by a distinct progression of aging-associated cognitive and functional impairment . recent advance recognize the dna methylation-based epigenetic clock a a precise predictor of age process and their related health outcome . however , observational study explore this link be often compromise by confound factor and reverse causality bias . to address the question , our study employ a bidirectional mendelian randomization ( mr ) analysis to explore the causal relationship between epigenetic age acceleration ( eaa ) and ad . genome-wide association study ( gwas ) statistic for epigenetic clock ( grimage , phenoage , horvathage , and hannumage ) be source from edinburgh datashare and the alzheimer disease genetics consortium ( adgc ) . the dataset comprise 63,926 participant , and among them , 21,982 case be ad patient and 41,944 be control . the primary analytical method for the mr be the inverse variance weight ( ivw ) . the potential pleiotropy and heterogeneity among the instrumental variable be evaluate by additional sensitivity analysis . employ the random-effects ivw approach , we find that , a indicate by grimage , eaa be associate with an increase risk of ad ( odds ratio [ or ] = 1.025 , 95 % confidence interval [ ci ] : 1.006-1.044 , p = 0.009 ) . quality control assessment confirm the reliability and robustness of our finding . however , the evidence do not support a causal relationship between ad and epigenetic aging in the reverse direction . our mr study indicate a positive causal relationship between eaa and ad . further research be necessary to explore the underlying physiological mechanism .

Title: gardasil vaccination for recurrent laryngeal papillomatosis in adult men : first report : change in hpv antibody titer .
Authors: Makiyama K, Hirai R, Matsuzaki H
Abstract: patient with human papillomavirus ( hpv ) dna-positive recurrent laryngeal papillomatosis commonly have repeat recurrence follow surgery . the reason be suspect to be a mechanism by which latent hpv infection in the surround healthy mucosa reinfects the surgical site . it may be that production of hpv antibody in the laryngeal mucosa with gardasil injection could inhibit postoperative recurrence . this be a case series study . the purpose of this study be to examine whether gardasil injection effectively inhibit recurrence . however , a a first report , we describe the antibody titer before and after vaccination . gardasil be inject in 12 men ( age 32-74 year ; mean age 47.9 year ) with hpv-positive laryngeal papillomatosis . serum antibody titer of hpv-6 , -11 , -16 , and -18 be measure by a competitive luminex-based immunoassay before the vaccination and 7 month after the start of the vaccination . each of the antibody titer be very low before vaccination , and they rise in all patient after the vaccination . this finding demonstrate that antibody titer increase with gardasil injection in post-adolescent male .
Journal: Journal of voice : official journal of the Voice Foundation

Title: comparative evaluation of antimicrobial effectiveness of 2 % chlorhexidine , 25 % aqueous extract of propolis , and 2.4 % curcuma longa a intracanal irrigants : an ex vivo study .
Authors: Sengupta U, Sogi HPS, Shah SG, Bala R, Saini R, Garg N, Jain M
Abstract: the primary teeth 's unique histological property and interaction with the oral cavity pose a challenge in treatment , unlike the permanent teeth . a repaired natural tooth maintain space well than an artificial one . these factor lead to a great emphasis on save the tooth by pulpectomy involve effective chemical cleaning and disinfection of canal than on meticulous mechanical canal shaping . a chemically available irrigants show cytotoxic effect , hence herbal-based irrigants be be consider viable option . the present study be undertake to compare and assess the antimicrobial effect of 2.4 % curcuma longa extract , 25 % aqueous propolis , and 2 % chlorhexidine in deciduous teeth . forty eight subject in age range of 4-7 year be allocate equally into four group - group i : saline ( negative control ) , group 2 % chlorhexidine ( positive control ) , group 2.4 % curcuma longa , and group 25 % aqueous propolis base on inclusion and exclusion criterion . isolation be achieve use a rubber dam . pre and postirrigation sample be collect use sterile absorbent paper point and transfer to a test tube contain brain heart infusion . the pre and postirrigation sample be send for microbial assay . streptococcus mutans and enterococcus faecalis be isolate use standard microbiological method , and serial dilution method be do to determine the pre and post irrigation colony count . the plate be duplicate and incubate at 37°c for 24 h. the preirrigation and post irrigation colony count sample with different irrigants be count and compare . for the saline pair t-test be use to compare the pre- and postirrigation value , and for 2 % chlorhexidine , 2.4 % curcuma longa , and 25 % aqueous extract of propolis group . the wilcoxon match sign rank test be use to compare pre- and post-irrigation bacterial count . to compare the mean change in bacterial colony count anova test be do . s. mutans and e. faecalis be the most commonly isolated microorganism . there be no statistical significant difference between saline , 2 % chlorhexidine , 2.4 % curcuma longa , and 25 % aqueous extract of propolis . the micro-organisms prevalent in primary teeth with necrosis include s. mutans and e. faecalis . antimicrobial sensitivity test do with the serial dilution method show that herbal irrigants such a 2.4 % curcuma longa extract and propolis be equally effective a 2 % chlorhexidine .
Journal: Journal of the Indian Society of Pedodontics and Preventive Dentistry

Title: a consensus immune dysregulation framework for sepsis and critical illness .
Authors: Moore AR, Zheng H, Ganesan A, Hasin-Brumshtein Y, Maddali MV, Levitt JE, van der Poll T, Lu J, Bouma HR, Scicluna BP, Giamarellos-Bourboulis EJ, Kotsaki A, Martin-Loeches I, Garduno A, Rothman RE, Sevransky J, Wright DW, Atreya MR, Moldawer LL, Efron PA, Kralovcova M, Karvunidis T, Giannini HM, Meyer NJ, Sweeney TE, Rogers AJ, Khatri P
Abstract: critical care syndrome such a sepsis , acute respiratory distress syndrome ( ards ) and trauma continue to have unacceptably high morbidity and mortality , with progress limit by the inherent heterogeneity within syndromic illness . although numerous immune endotypes have be propose for sepsis and critical care , the similarity and difference between these endotypes remain unclear , hinder clinical translation . the subspace consortium be an international consortium that aim to advance precision medicine in critical care through the sharing of transcriptomic data . here , evaluate the overlap of exist immune endotypes in sepsis across > 7,074 sample from 37 independent cohort , we develop cell-type-specific gene expression signature to quantify dysregulation within immune compartment . myeloid and lymphoid dysregulation be associate with disease severity and mortality across all cohort . importantly , this dysregulation be also observe in patient with ards , trauma and burn , suggest a conserved mechanism across various critical illness syndrome . moreover , analysis of randomize control trial data reveal that myeloid and lymphoid dysregulation be associate with differential mortality in patient treat with anakinra in the save-more trial ( n = 452 ) and corticosteroid in the victas ( n = 89 ) and vanish ( n = 117 ) trial , underscore their prognostic and therapeutic implication . in conclusion , our propose immunology-based framework for quantify cellular compartment dysregulation offer a potentially valuable tool for understand immune dysregulation in critical illness with prognostic and therapeutic significance .

Title: proteomic analysis of brain and spinal cord tissue reveals distinct immune and mitochondrial process between human and mouse al model .
Authors: Spiteri AG, Steele JR, Lee HC, Zhang H, Sun J, Schittenhelm RB, Yu CH, McLean C, Masters CL, Goudey B, Jin L, Pan Y
Abstract: amyotrophic lateral sclerosis ( al ) be a fatal neurodegenerative disease result in the progressive loss of motor neuron in the brain and spine . more than 95 % of case be pathologically characterize by the cytoplasmic accumulation of hyperphosphorylated and ubiquitinated transactive response dna-binding protein 43 ( tdp-43 ) . multiple mouse model with tdp-43 accumulation have be develop , however , whether they recapitulate molecular feature of al pathology be unclear . give the lack of curative treatment for al , there be an urgent need to identify the precise biological process contribute to disease pathogenesis for the development of effective therapeutic treatment . thus , in this study we employ label-based untargeted proteomics to characterize the al proteome and related biological process in the spinal cord and brain of tdp-43 ( q331k ) mouse , a transgenic mouse model of al and the motor cortex and the cervical , thoracic , and lumbar spinal cord region from human . in human , we observe highly overlap response across the four tissue examine , primarily relate to the upregulation of immune process and the downregulation of mitochondrial function . in contrast , tdp-43 ( q331k ) mouse demonstrate a lack of enrichment for immune activation and the opposite regulation of mitochondrial process . a meta-analysis of previously publish mouse datasets identify the ubqln2 knock-out mouse model a show strong parallel with our late-stage human al . overall , this study provide in-depth analysis of the site-specific dysregulated proteome and their associated functional process across specie . thereby , identify potential therapeutic target while emphasize the limitation of specific mouse model at certain timepoints in recapitulate als-related process for future model development .

Title: drug-induced agranulocytosis : a disproportionality analysis and umbrella review .
Authors: Lu Y, Wu B, Li K, Liu Z, Chen Y, Xu T
Abstract: drug-induced agranulocytosis ( dia ) be a rare but life-threatening hematologic disorder that demand increased clinical and research attention . this study aim to provide the current overview of dia for clinical guidance . use real-world data from fda adverse event reporting system ( faers ) , we perform a disproportionality analysis to identify the drug associate with agranulocytosis , employ the information component and reporting odds ratio algorithms . logistic analysis be conduct to explore the confound factor of dia . time-to-onset analysis be implement to compare the adverse event onset time among different drug . to comprehensively supplement and corroborate our disproportionality finding , we far conduct an umbrella review of systematic review ( sr ) . five electronic database be search with srs address dia a an included adverse event . two independent reviewer perform literature screening , data extraction , and quality assessment accord to the preferred reporting item for systematic review and meta-analysis statement . the result of the included sr be synthesize use qualitative analysis . the disproportionality analysis reveal that most identified dia signal be for anticancer drug . the top-five drug with dia signal by case number be methotrexate ( 6,462 case ) , lenalidomide ( 5,722 case ) , rituximab ( 5,691 case ) , doxorubicin ( 4,391 case ) , and carboplatin ( 4,371 case ) . high-risk drug ( e.g. , deferiprone ) , old age , and abnormal weight be strongly associate with dia base on multivariate logistic regression . time-to-onset analysis show that clozapine have the long median of onset time ( 1,121.3 day ) , while azithromycin have the short time ( 8.1 day ) . the umbrella review include seven systematic review , with five focus on anticancer therapy . their finding on dia-associated drug , include protein kinase inhibitor and immune checkpoint inhibitor , be consistent with those from the disproportionality analysis . antibiotic , antithyroid drug , and psychotropic drug be also identify a causative drug of dia . this study systematically review the faers database and exist literature on dia to identify a spectrum of associated drug . anticancer drug be predominant , with targeted therapy comprise a large proportion , while non-chemotherapy drug be also identify a suspect drug . these finding underscore the need for heightened clinical vigilance toward suspect drug and highlight the importance of future effort to validate high-risk mechanism and explore dia monitoring strategy .

Title: symptomatic treatment by a bbb-permeable aav engineer to restore tdp-43 function slow motor neuron disease and prevents paralysis .
Authors: Peethambaran Mallika A, Yu JG, Sitzman O, Baghel MS, Renganathan S, Sinha IR, Melnikova T, Ling JP, Wong PC
Abstract: tar dna-binding protein 43kda ( tdp-43 ) dysfunction be an early pathogenic mechanism that underlie amyotrophic lateral sclerosis ( al ) , a devastate neurodegenerative disorder that lack disease modify therapy . we previously develop a mouse model in which tdp-43 be selectively delete from motor neuron ( chat-cre ; tardbp ( f/f ) ) that mimic the early stage of al . here , we demonstrate that intravenous delivery of a blood-brain-barrier ( bbb ) permeable aav capsid express our rationally design splice repressor ctr ( aav-php.eb-ctr ) in symptomatic chat-cre ; tardbp ( f/f ) mouse markedly slow disease progression and prevented paralysis . systemic delivery of aav-php.eb-ctr lead to transduction of ∼80 % of spinal motor neuron , repression of tdp-43-associated cryptic exon within motor neuron express ctr , and attenuation of motor neuron loss . notably , the addition of the tardbp 3'utr autoregulatory element to ctr maintain it expression within a physiological range . in control littermates that receive aav-php.eb-ctr and be monitor for > 20 month , grip strength and body weight remain normal , and no histopathological abnormality be observe , underscore a favorable safety profile for this gene therapy . these result provide preclinical proof-of-concept that bbb-crossing aav delivery of ctr can rescue motor neuron disease through the restoration of tdp-43 function , offer a promising mechanism-based therapeutic strategy for al .
Journal: bioRxiv : the preprint server for biology

Title: association of six insulin resistance-related index with the risk and progression of cardio-renal-metabolic multimorbidity : evidence from the uk biobank .
Authors: Liu L, Yu G, Ji X, Wang Y, He H
Abstract: insulin resistance ( ir ) -related index be increasingly recognize a important contributor to cardio-renal-metabolic ( crm ) diseases . however , most prior study have focus on isolated outcome or cross-sectional disease status , lack dynamic insight into disease progression . this study aim to evaluate the predictive value of six ir-related index for crm onset and multistage progression use multistate modeling , and to explore potential biological mechanism through mediation analysis . we include 327,692 crm-free participant from the uk biobank in this prospective cohort study . six ir-related index include triglyceride-glucose ( tyg ) index , tyg-body mass index ( tyg-bmi ) , tyg-waist circumference ( tyg-wc ) , tyg-waist-to-height ratio ( tyg-whtr ) , triglyceride/high-density lipoprotein cholesterol ( tg/hdl-c ) ratio , and metabolic score for insulin resistance ( mets-ir ) , be calculate use establish formula . cox proportional hazard and multistate model be use to assess association with crm incidence and progression . predictive performance be evaluate use area under the curve ( auc ) , net reclassification improvement ( nri ) , and integrated discrimination improvement ( idi ) . mediation analysis be conduct for inflammatory , hepatic , and renal biomarkers . over a mean follow-up of 13.6 year , 17.3 % ( n = 58,563 ) of participant develop at least one crm disease . all six ir-related index be significantly associate with crm multimorbidity , both in term of incidence and progression . in predict the incidence of crm disease , tyg-wc , tyg-whtr , and mets-ir demonstrate superior performance . for each 1-standard deviation ( sd ) increase in tyg-wc , the risk of develop first , double , and triple crm disease increase by 51.4 % , 88.6 % , and 128.7 % , respectively ( all p < 0.001 ) , with similar gradient observe for tyg-whtr and mets-ir . multistate cox model far confirm consistent association between ir-related index and crm progression , particularly for tyg-whtr and tyg . specifically , a 1-sd increase in tyg-whtr be associate with a 65.3 % increase risk of transition from healthy to first crm disease , 34.6 % from first to double , and 26.7 % from double to triple crm disease ( all p < 0.001 ) . in predictive performance evaluation , tyg-wc , tyg-whtr , and mets-ir achieve the high auc , nri , and idi value . mediation analysis indicate that systemic inflammation , organ function , and especially kidney function partially mediate the observed association . in summary , ir-related index , particularly tyg-wc , tyg-whtr , and mets-ir , be observe to be associate with the presence and progression of crm disease . their potential incorporation into risk assessment and prevention strategy , together with consideration of inflammatory and organ function pathway , might help reduce the burden of crm multimorbidity ; however , far prospective study be need to confirm these finding and clarify their clinical relevance .

Title: association of potential biomarkers with clinical outcome in metastatic triple-negative breast cancer treat with pembrolizumab or chemotherapy .
Authors: Cortes J, Lipatov O, Im SA, Goncalves A, Lee KS, Schmid P, Tamura K, Testa L, Ohtani S, Harbeck N, Loi S, Salgado R, Karantza V, Mejia J, Cristescu R, Loboda A, Nebozhyn M, Jelinic P, Huang L, Winer EP
Abstract: in the randomized , phase 3 keynote-119 study , overall survival ( o ) be not significantly improve with pembrolizumab 200 mg q3w versus investigator 's choice of chemotherapy in participant with previously treat metastatic tnbc . in this exploratory analysis , we evaluate association of tumor-infiltrating lymphocyte ( tils ) , t-cell‒inflamed gene expression profile ( tcell ( inf ) gep ) , brca1/brca2 mutation ( brcam ) status , homologous recombination deficiency ( hrd ) status , and tumor mutational burden ( tmb ) with clinical outcome . til level be associate with improved objective response rate ( orr ) , progression-free survival ( pfs ) , and o with pembrolizumab but not with chemotherapy or after adjust for tcell ( inf ) gep . association be also identify between tcell ( inf ) gep and improved orr , pfs , and o with pembrolizumab . participant with tmb ≥ 10 mut/mb show a trend toward increase benefit with pembrolizumab versus chemotherapy . no association be see between brcam/hrd status and treatment response . these finding suggest a positive association between tils , tcell ( inf ) gep , and tmb with clinical outcome in patient with metastatic tnbc receive pembrolizumab . clinicaltrials.gov identifier : nct02555657 ( date of registration : september 18 , 2015 ) .

Title: multicentric matched-pair analysis of long-term hematotoxicity of peptide receptor radionuclide therapy in patient postsplenectomy .
Authors: Steinhelfer L, Jungmann F, Endroes L, Lanzafame H, Hermann K, Pfob CH, Lapa C, Hartrampf PE, Dörrler AL, Buck AK, Götze K, Wenzel P, Geisler F, Walter R, Haneder E, Lohöfer F, Haller B, Braren R, Eiber M
Abstract: peptide receptor radionuclide therapy ( prrt ) with ( 177 ) lu-dotatate be an approved treatment for metastatic neuroendocrine tumor ( net ) . although the therapy be effective , hematologic toxicity , particularly leukopenia , remain a significant concern . the spleen , which accumulate radiolabeled somatostatin analog , may play a critical role in modulate this toxicity . this study investigate whether patient undergo prrt after splenectomy exhibit lower hematologic toxicity . method : this multicenter retrospective study include 68 patient with metastatic net treat with prrt between 2009 and 2022. splenectomized patient ( n = 34 ) be match to nonsplenectomized patient on the basis of age , sex , tumor location , grading , metastatic pattern , and treatment cycle . hematologic parameter ( leukocyte , lymphocyte , neutrophil , hemoglobin , and platelet ) be assess at baseline and 12 and 24 mo after prrt . hematotoxicity be grade use common terminology criterion for adverse event . statistical analysis include t test , mann-whitney u test , and fisher exact test , with an α of 0.05 and bonferroni adjustment apply . result : splenectomized patient have significantly low rate of leukopenia , with a mean decline of 12.8 % in leukocyte count at 24 mo versus 47.2 % in nonsplenectomized patient ( p < 0.001 ) , and a high median absolute leukocyte count ( 7.2 vs. 4.2 × 10³/mm³ , p < 0.001 ) . leukopenia occur in 2 splenectomized patient compare with 20 in the control group ( p < 0.001 ) . lymphocyte decline be also less pronounced , with high absolute count at 24 mo . platelet count be consistently high postsplenectomy , although relative change over time be not significant . neutrophil count and hemoglobin level remain comparable between group . conclusion : splenectomy appear to reduce leukopenia and improve hematologic tolerability in net patient undergo prrt , highlight the spleen 's role in leukocyte regulation . these patient may better tolerate intensified prrt regimen , include additional cycle or reinduction , with minimal toxicity . this be particularly relevant for patient with pancreatic net , who frequently undergo splenectomy and face a poor prognosis . prospective study be need to far clarify the spleen 's impact on prrt-related hematotoxicity and guide treatment optimization .
Journal: Journal of nuclear medicine : official publication, Society of Nuclear Medicine

Title: elucidate the risk factor and oncogene driver of acute myeloid leukemia .
Authors: Sanya DRA, Onésime D
Abstract: the hematopoietic system be critical for maintain physiological homeostasis but be also implicate in various pathology . the magnitude of hematopoietic response to perturbation or diseases exhibit significant inter-individual variability , underscore the need to identify predictor and determinant of blood responsiveness in human . these reaction be shape not only by genetic factor but also by epigenetic modification and environmental effect . elucidate baseline predictor of hematopoietic response and their molecular underpinnings be of particular interest in acute myeloid leukemia ( aml ) , give their potential to inform malignancy immunotherapy . due to limited understanding of the cellular and molecular mechanism drive diverse aml subtypes in pediatric and adult patient , couple with an increase prevalence of refractory or relapsed hematological malignancy , this review highlight underexplored prognostic biomarkers , their molecular mechanism , and their potential clinical utility in optimize therapeutic strategy for improved patient survival . it examine recent advance in aml research and vaccine development , focus on effort to address highly aggressive and rare aml subtypes drive by aberrantly activate transcription factor . the review also address clinical implication for overall survival and treatment response , as well a promising vaccine candidate . additionally , it highlight newly identify mutation and high-risk molecular marker that could enhance risk stratification for early disease progression , identify patient who may benefit from allogeneic stem cell transplantation or enrollment in clinical trial .

Title: remodeling of senescent macrophage in synovium alleviates trauma- and aging-induced osteoarthritis .
Authors: Liu Y, Duan J, Dang Y, Hao R, Wang H, Tan E, Wang R, Li Y, Zhang S, Wang Y, Lv J, Qi Y, Zhang X, Cheng Y
Abstract: osteoarthritis ( oa ) be one of the most concerned aging-related disease in the worldwide , yet the investigation of immune senescence in joint and related therapy be still poorly identify . single-cell sequencing analysis and immunofluorescence of oa synovium reveal increase senescent macrophage in trauma-induced oa compare to control . importantly , senescent macrophage in oa synovium show enhanced m1 polarization , mitochondrial damage and impaired efferocytosis , which could lead to increase senescence-associated secretory phenotype ( sasps ) in the joint and further exacerbate oa . hence , a novel senotherapeutic nanoparticle be develop use chloroquine ( cq ) -bearing polymer ( pcq ) for targeted delivery of superoxide dismutase ( sod ) to synovial macrophage , term a pcq/sod . the nanoparticle achieve efficient intracellular delivery of sod to synovial macrophage . rna-seq result reveal that pcq/sod nanoparticle inhibit macrophage senescence via p53 and cellular senescence signal pathway , further reprograms m1-to-m2 repolarization . furthermore , the deliver sod inhibit bax-dependent mitochondrial outer membrane permeabilization ( momp ) which further reduces mitochondrial dna ( mtdna ) release and sasp secretion , while pcq promotes macrophage efferocytosis against apoptotic cell via stat3/adam17/mertk signal . a a result , intraarticular injection of pcq/sod nanoparticles in mouse successfully alleviate not only trauma-induced oa , but aging-induced oa a well . the developed senotherapeutic nanoparticle in this study offer an effective approach for remodel of senescent macrophage in synovium and a promising therapeutic strategy for oa treatment .

Title: comparison of single-unit umbilical cord blood transplantation and haploidentical transplantation use posttransplant cyclophosphamide during first complete remission of acute myeloid leukemia .
Authors: Yanada M, Yamasaki S, Mizuno S, Sugita J, Fujino T, Misaki Y, Tanaka M, Uchida N, Onizuka M, Doki N, Ota S, Sawa M, Kawakita T, Hasegawa Y, Nakamae H, Ishiwata K, Hiramoto N, Ishimaru F, Kanda J, Ohbiki M, Atsuta Y, Nakasone H, Konuma T
Abstract: choose an optimal alternative donor be an important clinical concern in allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplantation ( hct ) . in japan , single-unit umbilical cord blood transplantation ( ucbt ) have be widely use in the last two decade , whereas hct from hla-haploidentical related donor ( haplo-hct ) have be increasingly use follow the advent of posttransplant cyclophosphamide ( ptcy ) for graft-versus-host disease ( gvhd ) prophylaxis . this registry-based study aim to compare outcome between single-unit ucbt ( n = 848 ) and ptcy-based haplo-hct ( n = 241 ) perform during first complete remission in patient with acute myeloid leukemia . ucbt be associate with a low likelihood of engraftment ( p < 0.001 ) , a high risk of grade 2-4 and grade 3-4 acute gvhd ( p = 0.003 each ) , and a low risk of extensive chronic gvhd ( p = 0.048 ) . the ucbt and haplo-hct group do not significantly differ in 3-year probability of overall survival ( 68 % versus 69 % , p = 0.686 ) , gvhd/relapse-free survival ( 55 % versus 54 % , p = 0.866 ) , relapse ( 14 % versus 16 % , p = 0.463 ) , and non-relapse mortality ( 21 % versus 19 % , p = 0.403 ) , respectively , which be confirm with multivariate analysis . these result indicate that both procedure should be consider viable option for patient lack a match donor .

Title: cgas inhibits aldh2 to suppress lipid droplet function and regulate masld progression .
Authors: Wang Y, Deng Y, Chen J, Hahn Q, Umbaugh DS, Zhang Z, Zhang Y, Rowe SE, Li L, Herring LE, Conlon BP, Miao EA, Damania B, Diehl AM, Liu P
Abstract: cyclic gmp-amp synthase ( cgas ) be a cytosolic dna sensor essential for host defense against microbial infection , but it role beyond innate immunity remain unclear . here , a non-canonical function of cgas in regulate aldehyde metabolism and lipid homeostasis be identify . this be demonstrate that cgas directly bind to and suppresses aldh2 ( aldehyde dehydrogenase 2 ) , a key enzyme in ethanol metabolism and lipid peroxidation . loss of cgas activates aldh2 , thereby enhance ethanol tolerance in mouse . elevate aldh2 activity upon cgas loss increase aldehyde conversion into acetyl-coa , promote histone acetylation and transcription of lipid synthesis gene , which drive lipid droplet accumulation in cell and in cgas ( -/- ) mouse liver . these lipid droplet confer resistance to ferroptosis but simultaneously induce er stress , impair sting ( stimulator of interferon gene ) activation . functionally , cgas ( -/- ) mouse feed with a modified high-fat diet develop exacerbate metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease ( masld ) , characterize by excessive lipid droplet accumulation in liver compare to wild-type control . in human masld patient cohort , increase cgas but reduced aldh2 mrna expression be observe relative to healthy individual . together , this finding uncover a previously unrecognized role of cgas in metabolic regulation , independent of it innate immune function . by suppress aldh2 , cgas control lipid droplet biogenesis and stress response , with direct implication for masld pathogenesis .

Title: reevaluate nonoperative management for pediatric uncomplicated acute appendicitis : a systematic review and meta-analysis .
Authors: Faria I, Cintra ACG, de Oliveira LGAM, Squizzato F, Maia AS, Cunha AG, Radhakrishnan RS
Abstract: nonoperative management ( nom ) have emerge a a potential alternative to surgery for acute uncomplicated appendicitis in child ; however , while short-term outcome be often favorable , concern remain about treatment durability , complication rate , and long-term failure . an updated meta-analysis of randomized clinical trial ( rcts ) may help clarify the comparative safety and effectiveness of nom vs appendectomy . to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of nom compare with appendectomy for uncomplicated appendicitis in child use the high level of available evidence . a systematic review of pubmed , embase , scopus , cochrane , and web of science be conduct from inception through march 2025 to identify randomized clinical trial compare nom with surgical management in pediatric patient . rcts compare nom vs surgical management in pediatric patient young than 18 year be include . nonrandomized and quasi-randomized study be exclude . data be extract follow preferred report item for systematic review and meta-analyses guideline . meta-analyses be conduct use random-effects model . risk of bias be assess independently by multiple reviewer . trial sequential analysis be perform to determine whether the evidence be sufficiently robust and conclusive . the primary outcome be treatment failure and treatment success in 1 year and major complication ( clavien-dindo grade ≥iiib ) . secondary outcome include time to return to school and time to return to normal activity . of 1246 study screen , 7 rcts , include 1480 pediatric patient , meet inclusion criterion . treatment failure be significantly high in the nom group than in the appendectomy group at 1 year ( risk ratio [ rr ] , 4.97 ; 95 % ci , 3.57-6.91 ; i2 = 0.0 % ) . treatment success be significantly low in the nom group at 1 year ( rr , 0.67 ; 95 % ci , 0.60-0.75 ; i2 = 31.1 % ) . major complication classify a clavien-dindo grade iiib or bad be more frequent in the nom group ( rr , 33.37 ; 95 % ci , 7.89-141.05 ; i2 = 9.5 % ) . appendicitis recur at a rate of 18.47 events/100 observation ( 95 % ci , 12.62-25.07 events/100 observation ; i2 = 48.5 % ) among patient who receive nom . nom , compare with appendectomy , be associate with a modestly faster return to school ( mean difference , -1.36 day ; 95 % ci , -2.64 to -0.08 day ; p = .04 ; i2 = 57.7 % ) and return to normal activity ( -4.93 day ; 95 % ci , -8.68 to -1.19 day ; p = .01 ; i2 = 87.2 % ) , although this may be offset by subsequent readmission or reintervention . trial sequential analysis demonstrate the robustness and conclusiveness of primary outcome . in contrast to early study , this meta-analysis find significantly high treatment failure and major complication rate within a year with nom among child and adolescent . the meta-analysis provide pediatrician and pediatric surgeon with up-to-date data to inform share decision-making with family and encourage individualize , patient-centered treatment .

Title: distinct t cell function enable efficient immunoediting and prevent tumor emergence of develop sarcoma .
Authors: Cheung JF, Hunt BG, Wahed S, Cheng E, Connolly KA, Venkatesan S, Loza JL, Bansal I, Fagerberg E, Kessler EA, Riffard C, Buck J, Attanasio J, Borr ER, Wei W, William I, Fitzgerald B, Joshi NS
Abstract: t cell edit tumor by eliminate neoantigen-expressing tumor cell . yet , how and when this be achieve remains uncertain . use a murine sarcoma model with fluorescent neoantigens , we find that tumor develop later and in few t cell-sufficient mouse ( ∼53 % penetrance ) than t cell-deficient mouse ( ∼100 % ) . with t cell , all emergent tumor cell have silence neoantigens , but neoantigen-negative tumor cell be also present in every t cell-deficient mouse . this suggest silencing be necessary but not sufficient for outgrowth . genetic removal of neoantigens restore tumor penetrance if implement on day 5 post-tumor initiation , but not day 10 , because cd8 ( + ) and cd4 ( + ) t cell infiltrate the tissue and eliminate most neoantigen-positive and -negative tumor cell within 8 day . single-cell analysis on day-7 tumor show oncogenic change include increased proliferation and t cell-dependent upregulation of the ifnγ-response gene cd274 ( pd-l1 ) . t cell-depletion rescue both neoantigen-positive and -negative cell , while ifnγ blockade rescue only negative cell . this show that t cell efficiently edit sarcoma of neoantigens and prevent early tumor via ifnγ-independent and ifnγ-dependent ( bystander ) mechanism .

Title: chemical ecology of antibiotic production by actinomycete .
Authors: van der Meij A, Worsley SF, Hutchings MI, van Wezel GP
Abstract: actinomycete be a diverse family of filamentous bacteria that produce a plethora of natural product relevant for agriculture , biotechnology and medicine , include the majority of the antibiotic we use in the clinic . rather than a free-living bacteria , many actinomycete have evolve to live in symbiosis with among others plant , fungi , insect and sponge . a a common theme , these organism profit from the natural product and enzyme produce by the actinomycete , for example , for protection against pathogenic microbe , for growth promotion or for the degradation of complex natural polymer such a lignocellulose . at the same time , the actinomycete benefit from the resource of the host they interact with . evidence be accumulate that these interaction control the expression of biosynthetic gene cluster and have play a major role in the evolution of the high chemical diversity of actinomycete-produced secondary metabolite . many of the biosynthetic gene cluster for antibiotic be poorly express under laboratory condition , but they be likely express in response to host-specific demand . here , we review the environmental trigger and cue that control natural product formation by actinomycete and provide pointer a to how these insight may be harness for drug discovery .

Title: transarterial chemoembolization plus atezolizumab and bevacizumab in patient with intermediate hepatocellular carcinoma : a single-arm , phase 2 trial .
Authors: Wang K, Feng J, Yu H, Cheng Y, Xiang Y, Liu Z, Qin Y, Liu E, Shan Y, Fan C, Zhai J, He D, Zhou H, Tang Y, Shi J, Guo W, Yan M, Yu L, Kudo M, Cheng S
Abstract: transarterial chemoembolization ( tace ) be the standard treatment for intermediate-stage hepatocellular carcinoma ( hcc ) , yet it efficacy a a standalone therapy remain suboptimal . this phase 2 trial ( chictr2100049829 ) evaluate the feasibility and safety of tace combine with atezolizumab and bevacizumab in patient with intermediate-stage hcc . participant receive tace follow by atezolizumab and bevacizumab until disease progression , unacceptable toxicity , or death . the primary endpoint be objective response rate ( orr ) assess per response evaluation criterion in solid tumor ( recist ) v1.1 . secondary endpoint include progression-free survival ( pfs ) , overall survival ( o ) , orr by modified recist ( mrecist ) , disease control rate ( dcr ) , time to response ( ttr ) , duration of response ( dor ) , and adverse event ( aes ) . between august 21 , 2021 and april 10 , 2023 , 45 patient be enrol . a of the data cutoff on september 30 , 2024 , the median follow-up be 26.7 month . the orr be 47 % per recist v1.1 and 67 % per mrecist . median pfs be 17.9 month , and median o be 33.0 month . the dcr be 87 % ( recist v1.1 ) and 91 % ( mrecist ) . median ttr be 11.9 week ( recist v1.1 ) and 4.9 week ( mrecist ) , with median dor of 36.6 week ( recist v1.1 ) and 44.4 week ( mrecist ) . of the 45 patient , 44 experience aes of any grade , with 20 report grade 3-4 aes ; no grade 5 aes be observe . tace combine with atezolizumab and bevacizumab appear safe and feasible for intermediate-stage hcc , support further investigation in large study .

Title: genomic architecture of inflammatory bowel disease in five family with multiple affected individual .
Authors: Stittrich AB, Ashworth J, Shi M, Robinson M, Mauldin D, Brunkow ME, Biswas S, Kim JM, Kwon KS, Jung JU, Galas D, Serikawa K, Duerr RH, Guthery SL, Peschon J, Hood L, Roach JC, Glusman G
Abstract: currently , the best clinical predictor for inflammatory bowel disease ( ibd ) be family history . over 163 sequence variant have be associate with ibd in genome-wide association study , but they have weak effect and explain only a fraction of the observed heritability . it be expect that additional variant contribute to the genomic architecture of ibd , possibly include rare variant with effect size large than the identified common variant . here we apply a family study design and sequence 38 individual from five family , under the hypothesis that family with multiple ibd-affected individual harbor one or more risk variant that ( i ) be share among affected family member , ( ii ) be rare and ( iii ) have substantial effect on disease development . our analysis reveal not only novel candidate risk variant but also high polygenic risk score for common know risk variant in four out of the five family . functional analysis of our top novel variant in the remain family , a rare missense mutation in the ubiquitin ligase trim11 , suggest that it lead to increase nuclear factor of kappa light chain enhancer in b-cells ( nf-κb ) signal . we conclude that an accumulation of common weak-effect variant account for the high incidence of ibd in most , but not all family we analyze and that a family study design can identify novel rare variant confer risk for ibd with potentially large effect size , such a the trim11 p.h414y mutation .

Title: inflammatory mechanism contribute to long-term cognitive deficit induce by perinatal asphyxia via interleukin-1 .
Authors: Kelemen H, Balla GY, Demeter K, Sipos E, Buzás-Kaizler A, Biró L, Aliczki M, Orsolits B, Kerényi Á, Balogh Z, Pászthy-Szabó B, Pejtsik D, Hegyi L, Szigeti K, Máthé D, Padmanabhan P, Bödör C, Fekete A, Szabó M, Kaila K, Dénes Á, Mikics É
