Abstract: perinatal asphyxia remain a lead cause of neonatal mortality and a major contributor to permanent neurological deficit . even mild case can result in long-term neurodevelopmental , cognitive , behavioural and psychiatric disorder . however , the mechanism underlie asphyxia-induced hypoxic-ischaemic brain injury remain poorly understood , limit the development of targeted intervention during the critical early plastic period . to explore the behavioural and molecular outcome of perinatal asphyxia that may model important aspect of neuropsychiatric disorder observe in human , we utilise a translationally relevant , non-invasive oxygen deprivation model of asphyxia in postnatal day 7 rat . we conduct a comprehensive assessment of asphyxia-induced change , integrate neurobehavioural profiling ( evaluate cognitive , emotional , social and neuromotor function ) , microglial morphology analysis , neuroimaging , stress hormone measurement and whole-transcriptome sequencing technique to elucidate the acute and long-term functional consequence . consistent with clinical observation , the extensive functional assessment reveal distinct sex-dependent effect , include increase anxiety and impulsivity , attention deficit and impaired inhibitory control , which be observe exclusively in male , with no apparent sensorimotor deficit . this phenotype resemble attention deficit hyperactivity disorder ( adhd ) in adult rat be associate with a lasting increase in inhibitory bouton density in the medial prefrontal cortex . the development of an acute inflammatory response after perinatal asphyxia mark by phenotypic transformation of microglia , parallel brain perfusion and stress hormone change . notably , microglial change be mitigate by the blockade of proinflammatory interleukin-1 signalling via systemic il-1 receptor antagonist ( il-1ra ) administration in a therapeutically relevant time window . importantly , early blockade of proinflammatory response be able to prevent cognitive deficit in adulthood and normalise inhibitory bouton density . rna sequence analysis reveal asphyxia-induced dysregulation of molecular pathway target gabaergic signalling , potentially contribute to subsequent morphological and neuropsychiatric alteration . il-1ra treatment appear to engage distinct epigenetic regulatory mechanism , rather than merely reverse these disruption in the acute post-asphyxia period . collectively , these finding demonstrate that perinatal asphyxia induces mark behavioural deficit in attention and inhibitory control , parallel by last inhibitory and epigenetic dysregulation , precede by acute induction of microglia-driven inflammatory process in the medial prefrontal cortex . systemic il-1ra administration may represent a promising therapeutic opportunity to prevent long-term cognitive impairment cause by perinatal asphyxia .
Journal: Neuropsychopharmacology : official publication of the American College of

Title: cancer-associated transporter : molecular driver and drug delivery gateway .
Authors: Khan A, Biswas S, Garg M, Sengupta S
Abstract: membrane transporter be critical regulator of cellular homeostasis , mediate the uptake and efflux of nutrient , ion , and drug . in cancer , their expression be frequently reprogrammed to support enhanced growth , survival , metabolic rewiring , invasiveness , and therapy resistance . among these several solute carrier ( slc ) transporter such a glucose transporter ( glut ) , monocarboxylate transporter ( mcts ) , and the sodium/iodine symporter ( ni ) also facilitate selective delivery of radiopharmaceutical , make them attractive therapeutic target . the tumor suppressor p53 know for it central role in genome stability and apoptosis , also regulate a broad spectrum of membrane transporter . however , oncogenic mutation or structural conversion into amyloid can disrupt this regulatory network , lead to alter transporter expression and multidrug resistance . despite grow interest , the transcriptional and post-transcriptional control of transporter by wt , mutant , and amyloid form of p53 remains underexplored . in this review , we systematically characterize the p53-mediated regulation of diverse transporter class involve in the transport of sugar , amino acid , metal ion , lipid along with abc transporter function and multidrug resistance . we highlight how cancer cell exploit transporter such a p-glycoprotein ( p-gp ) , lat1 , glut1 , mcts , and ni for metabolic advantage and survival . we also examine therapeutic strategy aim at modulate transporter function use crispr/cas9 , small-molecule inhibitor , sirna , and nanoparticle-based co-delivery system . in particular , lat1 inhibition demonstrate potential to starve tumor of essential nutrient . ultimately , we propose that dual targeting of p53 aberration and membrane transporter through synthetic biology and precision delivery approach could restore chemosensitivity and suppress tumor progression , offer promise avenue for personalized cancer therapy .

Title: antxr1 blockade enhances cardiac function in preclinical model of heart failure .
Authors: Boccella N, Yu G, Seaman S, Feng Y, Lee J, Tomassoni-Ardori F, Yang L, Hsu KS, Dunleavey JM, Becker J, Hilton MB, Morris K, Borchin N, So D, Bajgain P, Yanpallewar S, Gross RT, Dewan KC, Bowles DE, Yuen DA, Tessarollo L, St Croix B
Abstract: heart disease , a lead cause of mortality worldwide , be in urgent need of improved therapy . fibrosis , an accumulation of collagen-rich extracellular matrix in response to injury , be a hallmark of heart disease , but clinical agent that can interfere with the fibrotic pathway do not yet exist . here we show that antxr1/tem8 , a pathology-induced transmembrane protein require for collagen removal , exacerbate injury in multiple model of heart failure . genetic disruption of antxr1 and treatment with human neutralize antibody prevent heart deterioration follow acute myocardial infarction . antxr1 pharmacological blockade also improve heart function in model of pressure overload and obesity-induced heart disease with preserved ejection fraction . improved heart function be accompany by enhanced exercise tolerance . mechanistic study reveal an antxr1-antibody-driven improvement in post-infarct scar formation follow by attenuation of late-stage , chronic tgfβ-mediated extracellular matrix remodel . thus , antxr1-mediated collagen turnover during heart failure be both maladaptive and druggable , provide avenue for therapeutic intervention .

Title: the transcriptional repressor blimp1 enforce tcf-1-dependent and -independent restriction of the memory fate of cd8 ( + ) t cell .
Authors: Murphy MK, McCullen M, Deffenbaugh JL, Chen AY, Pai J, Daniel B, Yousif A, Raju S, Hsiung S, Wang Z, Ghoneim HE, Satpathy AT, Colonna M, Oltz EM, Egawa T
Abstract: during differentiation of cd8 ( + ) t cell , the transcription factor tcf-1 and blimp1 control progenitor and terminally differentiate state , respectively . here , we examine the hierarchy and functional consequence of cross-regulation between these factor . we identify two blimp1-bound cis-regulatory element , tcf7 ( +22kb ) and tcf7 ( +17kb ) , that enforce tcf7 silence in a context-specific manner during both acute and chronic response . deletion of these element decouple tcf7 repression from effector differentiation but do not rewire effector t cell to a memory state or prevent the acquisition of phenotypic hallmark of exhaustion . however , combine ablation of prdm1 and tcf7 preserve a memory surface phenotype despite defect in secondary expansion . thus , the anti-proliferative and pro-differentiative effect of blimp1 in effector or exhaust cd8 ( + ) t cell represent mechanistically distinct module , wherein repression of tcf7 limit proliferative capacity but not memory or progenitor specification .

Title: rethink post-sepsis syndrome : link cellular dysfunction to the clinical picture .
Authors: Gorecki GP, Bodor A, Novac MB, Costea DG, Costea DO, Costea AC, Grasa CN, Tomescu DR
Abstract: post-sepsis syndrome ( ps ) encompass a range of long-term complication , include immune dysregulation , chronic inflammation , and neuromuscular impairment , that persist beyond the resolution of the acute septic episode . while these clinical phenotype be increasingly recognize , the underlie molecular mechanism remain incompletely define . mitochondrial dysfunction , particularly in the form of persistent mitochondrial senescence , be emerge a a potential unifying factor drive multiple ps trajectory . accumulate evidence suggest that damage mitochondrion not only lose their bioenergetic capacity but also actively contribute to chronic immune and inflammatory signalling . base on this , we propose a dual-intervention strategy ( `` mitochondrial flush '' ) which involve the coordinated elimination of senescent mitochondrion and stimulation of mitochondrial biogenesis . the regenerative component , support by establish preclinical research on peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor gamma coactivator 1-alpha ( pgc-1α ) activation , represent a partially develop therapeutic arm , while the selective clearance of dysfunctional mitochondrion remain an area of active investigation . this concept raise important question regard regenerative capacity , therapeutic timing , and cellular resilience follow critical illness . we further propose a working definition of ps a a state of persistent mitochondrial dysfunction , possibly drive by ongoing oxidative stress , which may underlie a broad range of clinical phenotype than currently recognize . a deep understanding of mitochondrial quality control may offer a new therapeutic framework for reverse the chronic physiological decline observe in sepsis survivor .

Title: effect of the obese gene product on body weight regulation in ob/ob mouse .
Authors: Pelleymounter MA, Cullen MJ, Baker MB, Hecht R, Winters D, Boone T, Collins F
Abstract: c57bl/6j mouse with a mutation in the obese ( ob ) gene be obese , diabetic , and exhibit reduced activity , metabolism , and body temperature . daily intraperitoneal injection of these mouse with recombinant ob protein lower their body weight , percent body fat , food intake , and serum concentration of glucose and insulin . in addition , metabolic rate , body temperature , and activity level be increase by this treatment . none of these parameter be alter beyond the level observe in lean control , suggest that the ob protein normalize the metabolic status of the ob/ob mouse . lean animal inject with ob protein maintain a small weight loss throughout the 28-day study and show no change in any of the metabolic parameter . these data suggest that the ob protein regulate body weight and fat deposition through effect on metabolism and appetite .

Title: antimicrobial drug development -- the past , the present , and the future .
Authors: Powers JH
Abstract: antimicrobial resistance have be an issue since the introduction into clinical use of the first agent in the 1940s . although the discovery and development of new class of antimicrobial through the 1960s present an array of treatment option , these option for some serious and life-threatening infectious disease may now be more limited . this paper examine the history of antimicrobial development , show how the challenge in discover new class of drug have be with u for the last 40 year . the present state of antimicrobial discovery and development be shape by these challenge as well a by the economic reality of the pharmaceutical industry . this paper also discuss some of the regulatory consideration in antimicrobial drug development , and present some potential solution to the challenge inherent in antimicrobial drug development , include step take by the u food and drug administration to streamline the drug review process for antimicrobial agent while maintain the standard necessary to protect and promote the health of the public .
Journal: Clinical microbiology and infection : the official publication of the European

Title: the role of the tuft cell-interleukin-25 axis in the pathogenesis of inflammatory bowel disease .
Authors: Tao Z, Li L, Zhang Y, Tang Y, Zhang S, Yang H, Jiang G, Zhang R, Wu Z, He M
Abstract: emerge evidence highlight the tuft cell-interleukin-25 ( il-25 ) axis ( tuft/il-25 axis ) a a critical orchestrator bridge luminal stimulus and intestinal immunity in inflammatory bowel disease ( ibd ) , which encompass crohn 's disease ( cd ) and ulcerative colitis ( uc ) . this review synergises current understanding of how dysregulation within this axis contribute to ibd pathogenesis , arise from disrupt immune homeostasis involve aberrant microbiota response , genetic susceptibility , and immune pathway dysregulation . central to this axis , intestinal tuft cell act a chemosensory epithelial sentinel , differentiate in response to microbial and metabolic cue to become the primary source of il-25 . il-25 , signal via il-17rb , engage innate and adaptive immune cell , particularly group 2 innate lymphoid cell ( ilc2s ) . while il-33-responsive homeostatic ilc2s ( nilc2s ) promote mucosal repair , il-25-driven inflammatory ilc2s ( iilc2s ) amplify inflammation , position them a pivotal effector . critically , il-25 exhibit a context-dependent `` double-edged '' role : engagement with il-25r ( + ) t cell and modulation of downstream signaling can exert anti-inflammatory effect and enhance barrier integrity , yet dysregulation drive pro-inflammatory injury . the axis be dynamically regulate by diverse luminal factor : helminth infection activate the tuft-ilc2 circuit , induce protective type 2 immunity ; specific microbial metabolite ( e.g. , succinate , scfas ) modulate it activity ; and viral infection can disrupt homeostasis by remodel tuft cell function . dysregulation of the tuft/il-25 axis , drive by infection , microbial metabolite fluctuation , or environmental factor ( include regional variation in helminth exposure link to the hygiene hypothesis ) , be increasingly recognize a a significant contributor to ibd pathogenesis . consequently , precisely regulate this axis to harness it beneficial effect while mitigate it detrimental potential represent a promising therapeutic frontier . future strategy should integrate microbiota remodeling , target metabolite intervention , and potentially virus-directed therapy . furthermore , deep investigation into the impact of geographical environmental factor on this axis and ibd risk be warrant . ultimately , multi-pathway approach aim at restore the `` immune-microbiota-epithelial '' triad via reprogramming the tuft/il-25 axis hold significant promise for novel ibd management .

Title: ezh2-mediated h3k27me3 link microbial inosine loss to depression : a gut-brain epigenetic switch .
Authors: Zhu S, Li X, Yu Y, Han X, Yang F, Lu M, Dai G, Guo L, Xu D
Abstract: background : depression , the second most prevalent neurological disorder globally , affect over 300 million people and present an urgent public health challenge . while gut microbiota dysbiosis be increasingly recognize a a key contributor to depression , the molecular mechanism link microbial imbalance to brain dysfunction remain poorly define . method : we investigate the role of ezh2 in gut microbiota-induced depressive behavior in mouse use the chronic unpredictable mild stress ( cum ) , fecal microbiota transplantation , and conditional knockout of ezh2 . cut & tag sequencing be employ to analyze ezh2-mediated h3k27me3 epigenetic reprogramming . untargeted metabolomics and luciferase reporter assay be use to identify metabolite that upregulate ezh2 expression . 16 rrna sequence combine with metabolic tracing be conduct to trace the microbial origin of inosine . additionally , natural compound screen identify coumaric acid ( ca ) a a novel ezh2-targeting degrader . result : conditional knockout of neuronal ezh2 abolishes microbiota-induced depressive behavior and neuronal apoptosis . mechanistically , reduce abundance of specific microbiota ( f_lachnospiraceae , f_oscillospiraceae , and f_erysipelotricaceae ) lead to inosine depletion . this depletion subsequently elevate ezh2 transcriptional activity by increase h3k9ac modification at it locus , mediate through attenuation of the a2ar-camp-pka-creb-hdac3 signaling axis . subsequently , ezh2 silence serotonergic synapse-related gene ( e.g. , tph2 , htr2a , htr6 ) via h3k27me3 reprogramming , ultimately drive depressive behavior and neuronal apoptosis in mouse . importantly , ca be identify a a first-in-class ezh2 degrader that bind lysine residue k623/k646 and recruit ube3a for proteasomal degradation . ca treatment restores synaptic integrity and revers depressive behavior with minimal toxicity . conclusion : collectively , these finding define a novel `` microbiota-inosine-ezh2 '' axis in depression pathogenesis and highlight ezh2 degradation a a promising therapeutic strategy for microbiota-associated neuropsychiatric disorder .

Title: clinical and molecular characterization of slc31a1-related developmental and epileptic encephalopathy : insight from 13 new case .
Authors: Juliá-Palacios N, Muñoz-Pujol G, Maroofian R, Bertoli-Avella AM, Gómez-Chiari M, Muchart-López J, Paredes-Fuentes AJ, O'Callaghan M, Machado-Casas IS, Cristian I, Morrison J, Garcia-Cazorla A, Codina A, Miryounesi M, Zonic E, Bauer P, Cheema H, Anjum MN, Al-Sannaa N, Abd Elmaksoud M, Ababneh F, Alijanpour S, Tonekaboni SH, Fayazi A, Urbaniak M, Barba U, Hoenicka J, Palau F, Houlden H, Ortigoza-Escobar JD, Ribes A, Santos-Ocaña C, Tyler M, Gaffney P, Carroll CJ, Tort F, Wierenga KJ, Webb BD, Artuch R, Baide-Mairena H, Urreizti R
Abstract: copper be indispensable for various metabolic process , notably mitochondrial respiration . in human , copper homeostasis hinge on transporter such a copper transporter 1 ( ctr1 ) , encode by the slc31a1 gene . recently , bi-allelic mutation in slc31a1 have be associate with a new neurodevelopmental disorder . this study present clinical , genetic , and biochemical finding from 13 new case across 10 family worldwide . rna sequence evaluated gene expression , and western blotting assess copper transporter 1 protein level . additionally , mitochondrial respiratory capacity be measure via high-resolution respirometry . affected individual exhibit a distinct clinical phenotype characterize by early-onset epileptic encephalopathy , severe neurodevelopmental delay and hypotonia , with high mortality . neuroimaging reveal significant brain atrophy and white matter abnormality . genetic analysis identify bi-allelic slc31a1 variant , predominantly p.his120gln in six case and p. ( arg102cys/his ) in three case . functional study in patient fibroblast demonstrate impaired mitochondrial respiration . this study significantly broaden the clinical spectrum of this recently describe syndrome , present a a severe developmental encephalopathy with high mortality risk , and suggest mitochondrial dysfunction a a potential pathomechanism . these finding contribute to the mount evidence link copper transporter 1 dysfunction to neurodegeneration , underscore the urgency for further therapeutic investigation .

Title: define heterogeneity in core regulatory circuitry reveals hoxb3 condensation a a potential target in glioblastoma .
Authors: Zhang C, He Y, Zhan X, Yu J, Xu S, Zhang Q, Qiu R, Wang X, Gao Z, Huang M, Long W, Liu Q, Zhao W
Abstract: glioblastoma ( gbm ) exhibit mark heterogeneity , yet therapeutic strategy effectively target this variability remain inadequately develop . here we employ single-cell cut & tag analysis to investigate h3k27ac modification , uncover pronounced heterogeneity within the core regulatory circuitry ( crc ) of gbm . notably , we observe heterogeneous condensation state of crc factor , particularly hoxb3 , which be shape by it intrinsically disorder region and interaction with runx1 , drive the phenotypic manifestation . leverage these finding , we synthesize the peptide p621-r9 , which effectively disrupt hoxb3 condensation , alter chromatin structure and reduced transcription at super-enhancer-associated oncogenic site in gbm cell exhibit hoxb3 condensation . treatment with p621-r9 selectively diminish tumourigenic potential in gbm patient-derived xenograft model characterize by hoxb3 condensate , but show no efficacy in the model lack these condensate . these result highlight the critical role of crc condensation in gbm heterogeneity and suggest that peptide-based targeting of distinct gbm subpopulation could represent an avenue for therapeutic exploration .

Title: effectiveness of sars-cov-2 test strategy inreducing covid-19 case , hospitalisation , and death .
Authors: Saif-Ur-Rahman KM, Nurdin N, Movsisyan A, Kothari K, Gleeson C, Conway T, Tierney M, Taneri E, Mulholland D, Tricco AC, Dinnes J, Devane D
Abstract: severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 ( sars-cov-2 ) have substantially affect daily life . sustainable testing practice be essential to balance the resource demand of widespread test with the need to reduce the health impact of covid-19 . however , the effectiveness of specific test strategy for symptomatic and asymptomatic individual in reduce covid-19 case , hospitalisation , and death remain uncertain . to evaluate the effectiveness of different sars-cov-2 testing strategy in reduce covid-19 case , hospitalisation , and death amongst suspect case and asymptomatic individual . we search central , medline ( ovid ) , embase ( elsevier ) , europe pmc , clinicaltrials.gov , and the world health organization ( who ) international clinical trial registry platform . we also conduct reference check , citation search , and contact study author to identify eligible study . the most recent search be conduct on 07 october 2024. we include randomise control trial ( rcts ) , non-randomised study of intervention ( nrsis ) , control before-and-after study ( cba ) , match cohort study , and observational study with a comparison group involve suspect or asymptomatic individual . eligible study compare test strategy versus no testing or standard care or usual practice ; one test strategy with another , such a antigen-detecting rapid diagnostic test ( rdts ) versus nucleic acid amplification test ( naat ) , include reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction ( rt-pcr ) ; home-based versus provider-administered testing ; one-time test versus repeat test at different frequency ; and target test versus widespread testing . combination of these component be also consider . in this review , we define 'sars-cov-2 test strategy ' a a complex intervention comprise multiple varying component , include test type ( e.g . naat , antigen-detecting rdt ) , sample type ( e.g . nasopharyngeal swab , saliva ) , target population ( e.g . symptomatic , contact ) , set ( e.g . home , clinic , congregate ) , frequency of test ( e.g . one-time , weekly , daily ) , and response protocol ( e.g . isolation , confirmatory testing , treatment ) . we exclude single-arm study , review , thesis , editorial , letter , commentary , study report solely in abstract form , laboratory or animal study , mathematical modelling study , and diagnostic test accuracy study . our critical outcome be : covid-19 case avoid ( reduction in new case ) ; covid-19-related hospitalisation avoid ( reduction in hospital admission ) ; covid-19-related death avoid ( reduction in mortality ) ; and serious adverse event relate to test , include unnecessary intervention , employment impact , isolation effect , and psychological harm . we use the risk of bias 2 ( rob 2 ) tool to assess the risk of bias in rcts and the robins-i tool to assess the risk of bias in nrsis , cba study , and match cohort study . a a meta-analysis be not feasible due to the nature of the data , we apply synthesis without meta-analysis ( swim ) method . we assess the certainty of the evidence for each outcome use the grade approach . we include 21 study ( 10 rcts and 11 nrsis ) with 13,312,327 participant . among these , 13 studies-comprising eight rcts and five nrsis-either report one or more prespecified outcome ( four study ) , provide relevant information through proxy measurement ( five study ) , or supply information follow author correspondence ( four study ) . we present the prioritised comparison and critical outcome . for the comparison test strategy versus no testing or standard care or usual practice , one include study measure two critical outcome . the study do not measure the other critical outcome : covid-19 case avoid , and serious adverse event relate to test . no study measure any critical outcome for the other prioritised comparison : antigen-detecting rdt versus naat testing . benefit and harm of test strategy versus no testing or standard care or usual practice one observational study with a comparison group , conduct in a long-term care facility in israel , compare weekly sars-cov-2 rt-pcr test with no testing and measure two of our critical outcome . base on the analysis , the evidence be very uncertain about the effect of sars-cov-2 rt-pcr testing on reduce hospitalisation ( decrease in the hospitalisation rate from 13.59 % to 11.41 % ; 1 study , 162,205 participant , very low-certainty evidence ) and mortality ( 33.8 % decrease in expect mortality ; 1 study , 162,205 participant , very low-certainty evidence ) compare to no test . we downgrade the certainty of the evidence because of methodological limitation , indirectness , and imprecision . author ' the available data be of very low-certainty . only one of the 21 included study report hospitalisation or death ; therefore , we can not draw conclusion about the effect of test strategy versus no test on reduce hospitalisation and mortality . no study evaluate other critical outcome i.e . covid-19 case avoid , and serious adverse event relate to test . future research should aim for consistency and relevance by use clearly define outcome , preferably base on a standardise core outcome set . a qualitative evidence synthesis ( qes ) would help identify barrier and facilitator to routine sars-cov-2 testing in healthcare setting , which could help inform intervention development . the qes would explore factor affect the implementation of routine testing , draw on the perspective of healthcare provider , patient , and other interest holder . this cochrane review be partially fund by the world health organization ( who ) and the health research board of ireland . protocol ( 2025 ) 10.1002/14651858.cd016192 .
Journal: The Cochrane database of systematic reviews

Title: novel therapy for lower low-density lipoprotein level for atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease prevention : reach the target where others have fail .
Authors: Dziewierz A, Bobrowska B, Streb W, Pelliccia F, Bartuś S, Rajtar-Salwa R
Abstract: atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease ( ascvd ) remain a lead cause of global morbidity and mortality , with elevate low-density lipoprotein cholesterol ( ldl-c ) establish a a primary causal factor . despite foundational therapy , many high-risk patient fail to achieve optimal ldl-c target . this review examine establish ldl-c lowering agent ( statin and ezetimibe ) , detail their mechanism and limitation , include statin intolerance and residual cardiovascular risk . we provide a comprehensive analysis of novel therapeutic option , include proprotein convertase subtilisin/kexin type 9 ( pcsk9 ) modulators ( monoclonal antibody , small interfering rna , and emerge oral agent ) , atp-citrate lyase inhibitor ( bempedoic acid ) , angiopoietin-like protein 3 ( angptl3 ) inhibitor , and pioneer gene-editing technology . we discuss mechanism of action , pivotal efficacy data ( ldl-c reduction and plaque modification ) , safety profile , and key finding from major cardiovascular outcome trial . novel ldl-c lowering therapy represent a paradigm shift , offer unprecedented efficacy in reduce ldl-c and mitigate ascvd risk . however , significant challenge remain , include cost-effectiveness concern , the need for long-term safety data , profound global disparity in access , and persistent clinical inertia that impede real-world implementation even in well-resourced healthcare system . future research should prioritize personalized lipid management , combination strategy , and development of durable , cost-effective solution to reduce the residual ascvd burden .

Title: taladegib for the treatment of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis ( env-ipf-101 ) : a multicentre , randomise , double-blind , placebo-controlled , phase 2a trial .
Authors: Maher TM, Goldin JG, Hood J, Pitman J, de Los Rios M, Hobbs BP, Yu-Lin AB, Buendia-Roldan I, Thien F, Song JW, Perea PC, Ramírez-Rivera A, DiFrancesco A
Abstract: the hedgehog ( hh ) signal pathway promotes fibrosis in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis ( ipf ) , an interstitial lung disease with a high mortality rate . currently , there be no cure for ipf , and available anti-fibrotics only slow the rate of decline in lung function in ipf . we aim to assess the safety and efficacy of taladegib ( env-101 ) , an hh pathway inhibitor , in ipf in a phase 2a , proof-of-concept clinical trial . env-ipf-101 be a randomised , double-blind , placebo-controlled , phase 2a trial conduct at 16 clinical site in australia , canada , malaysia , mexico , and south korea for patient with ipf old than 40 year who be not treat with concurrent ipf therapy . patient be randomly assign to taladegib 200 mg or placebo equivalent once daily , orally for 12 week , with a 6-week follow-up . the primary outcome be safety in the intention-to-treat population and change from baseline in forced vital capacity ( fvc ) in the efficacy-evaluable population . exploratory outcome be measure of fibrosis on high-resolution ct ( hrct ) in the efficacy-evaluable population . this study be register with clinicaltrials.gov , nct04968574 . between aug 12 , 2021 , and july 28 , 2023 , 41 patient be randomly assign to the taladegib group ( n=21 ; three [ 14 % ] female and 18 [ 86 % ] male ) or the placebo group ( n=20 ; four [ 20 % ] female and 16 [ 80 % ] male ) . all treatment-emergent adverse event possibly or probably relate to the study drug be grade 1 or 2 , all except one be mild or moderate in severity , and none be serious adverse event . the most common treatment-emergent adverse event in the taladegib group be dysgeusia ( 12 [ 57 % ] of 21 ) , muscle spasm ( 12 [ 57 % ] of 21 ) , and alopecia ( 11 [ 52 % ] of 21 ) ; none of these event be report in the placebo group , for which the most common adverse event report be diarrhoea ( four [ 20 % ] of 20 ) , headache ( three [ 15 % ] of 20 ) , and dizziness ( one [ 5 % ] of 20 ) . patient treat with taladegib have an improvement from baseline in fvc and across multiple hrct-based measure of disease . between-group difference in change from baseline to week 12 favour taladegib for the efficacy measure of percent predict fvc ( 3·95 % [ 95 % ci 0·31-7·60 ] ; p=0·035 ; mean change from baseline of 1·9 % in the taladegib group vs -1·3 % for placebo ) , total lung capacity by hrct ( 257·0 ml [ 95 % ci 86·8-427·2 ] ; p=0·0040 ; mean change from baseline of 206·67 ml in the taladegib group vs -55·58 ml in the placebo group ) , and percent quantitative interstitial lung disease ( p=0·047 ; mean change from baseline of -9·4 % in the taladegib group vs 1·1 % in the placebo group ) . no death occur during the trial . the acceptable safety profile and efficacy analysis of taladegib support further investigation in a phase 2b trial in patient with ipf ( whistle-pf ) . endeavor biomedicine .

Title: tumor treat field ( ttfields ) therapy after stereotactic radiosurgery for brain metastasis from non-small cell lung cancer : final result of the phase 3 metis study .
Authors: Mehta MP, Gondi V, Ahluwalia MS, Roberge D, Sio TTW, Trifiletti DM, Muanza T, Krpan AM, Zhu Z, Ramakrishna NR, Fiveash JB, Metellus P, Yu J, Wang CJ, Jacob J, Freyschlag CF, Csőszi T, Salmaggi A, Taliansky A, Lucas A, Debus J, Brown PD, Harat M
Abstract: improved treatment for brain metastasis from non-small cell lung cancer ( nsclc bm ) be need to prolong time to intracranial progression without increase neurotoxicity . ttfields , be electric field deliver via skin-based array that disrupt cancer cell division , have demonstrate efficacy and safety in glioblastoma , nsclc , and pancreatic cancer . in the phase 3 metis trial ( nct02831959 ) adult with 1-10 newly-diagnosed nsclc bm suitable for sr receive optimal therapy for extracranial disease be randomize 1:1 to srs follow by ttfields ( 150 khz ) or srs alone . radiologic progression be assess by an independent radiology review committee . primary endpoint be time to intracranial progression ( ttip ; rano-bm ) . secondary endpoint include overall survival , neurocognitive function , quality of life ( qol ) , and safety . patient ( n=298 ) be follow for a median of 8.6 ( 0.07-85.2 ) month . ttfields significantly delay ttip ( hr 0.72 [ 95 % ci 0.53-0.98 ] ; fine-gray p=0.044 ) . intracranial progression rate at month 2 , 6 , 12 , and 24 be 13.6 % vs 22.1 % ( p=0.034 ) , 33.7 % vs 46.4 % ( p=0.018 ) , 46.9 % vs 59.4 % ( p=0.023 ) , and 53.6 % vs 65.2 % ( p=0.031 ; post hoc ) . time to distant intracranial progression ( ttdp ) favor ttfields therapy , although not statistically significantly ( hr 0.76 [ 0.51-1.12 ] ; log-rank p=0.165 ; post-hoc ) . in patient receive immune checkpoint inhibitor ( ici ; n=118 ) , the delay in both ttip ( hr 0.63 [ 0.39-1.0 ] ; cox p=0.049 ; fine-gray p=0.055 ) and ttdp ( hr 0.41 [ 0.21-0.81 ] ; log-rank p=0.0087 , post-hoc ) be more pronounced . device-related aes be mainly grade ≤2 skin event . ttfields do not cause qol deterioration , and improvement in deterioration-free survival and time to deterioration of the global health status , physical functioning and fatigue domain be observe ( post-hoc ) . by significantly prolong ttip , without worsen qol or cognitive function , ttfields after sr be a new treatment option for patient with nsclc bm , include those receive ici .
Journal: International journal of radiation oncology, biology, physics

Title: non-coding rna in gastric cancer : mechanism and therapeutic prospect .
Authors: Han Z, Liu W, Zhu Y, Sun Y, Sun D, Jia R, Yang Y, Qi H, Zhang L, Huo Y, Zhang N, Chai J, Yang M
Abstract: gastric cancer be the fifth most common cancer and the third leading cause of cancer-related death worldwide . it be associate with high molecular and phenotypic heterogeneity . early-stage gastric cancer can be treat with endoscopic resection and surgery , whereas at it advanced stage , sequential chemotherapy present the only treatment option , which start with first-line platinum and fluoropyrimidine-based dual drug , support a median survival period of less than one year . target monoclonal antibody approve for the treatment of gastric cancer be effective for a limited subset of patient . furthermore , painless and precise marker for the early detection of gastric cancer and new target for it treatment be unavailable . interestingly , many non-coding rna ( ncrnas ) , such a micrornas ( mirnas ) , long non-coding rna ( lncrnas ) , and circular rna ( circrnas ) , play key role in the development of gastric cancer . multiple piece of evidence suggest that ncrnas play a crucial role in the treatment of gastric cancer use chemotherapy and targeted therapy drug . in this article , we systematically review the important role of ncrnas in chemotherapy resistance , immune escape , metabolism , and angiogenesis of gastric cancer , and systematically elucidate the relevant molecular mechanism . in addition , we also propose the potential clinical significance of ncrna a a new therapeutic target and prognostic biomarker for gastric cancer .

Title: meiotic cohesin rad21l shape 3d genome structure and transcription in the male germline .
Authors: Marín-Gual L, Vara C, Sainz-Urruela R, Cuartero Y, Álvarez-González L, Felipe-Medina N, Garcia F, Llano E, Marti-Renom MA, Pendás AM, Ruiz-Herrera A
Abstract: the distinctive three-dimensional ( 3d ) chromatin architecture adopt by chromosome during meiosis be essential for fertility , yet the functional implication of the fine-scale spatial organization remain poorly understood . here , we investigate the impact of rad21l deletion , a meiosis-specific cohesin subunit , on the 3d genome architecture and gene expression in the male germ line . use fluorescence-activated cell sorting , high-throughput chromosome conformation capture , and single-cell rna sequencing , we demonstrate that rad21l deficiency impair meiotic chromatin organization and inter/intrachromosomal interaction . this conspicuous 3d genome reorganization also disrupt bouquet formation , result in increase telomeric interaction between heterologous chromosome in primary spermatocyte . genome reorganization be accompany by detectable transcriptional dysregulation in spermatogonia and primary spermatocyte , mainly affect sex chromosome . collectively , our finding establish the cohesin rad21l a a germline-specific critical regulator of genome-wide 3d genome reorganization during spermatogenesis and a modulator of the male germline transcriptional landscape .

Title: initial multicenter experience with [ ( 161 ) tb ] tb-psma in [ ( 177 ) lu ] lu-psma-refractory metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer : preliminary result .
Authors: Kucuk NO, Coskun N, Araz M, Alan Selcuk N, Berberoglu K, Ozdemir EC, Gumuser FG, Kuyumcu S, Sezgin C, Sanli O, Sanli Y, Sendur MAN, Urun Y
Abstract: ( 161 ) tb be a theranostic radionuclide that emit both β ( - ) particle and auger electron with high linear energy transfer , potentially enhance cytotoxicity in micrometastatic disease . we report the first multicenter clinical experience of [ ( 161 ) tb ] tb-psma in patient with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer ( mcrpc ) refractory to [ ( 177 ) lu ] lu-psma therapy . method : this prospective , multicenter study include 7 patient with mcrpc who have progress despite prior androgen receptor pathway inhibitor , taxane-based chemotherapy , and at least 2 cycle of [ ( 177 ) lu ] lu-psma . all patient have psma-positive disease without any [ ( 18 ) f ] fdg-discordant lesion . each receive 2 cycle of [ ( 161 ) tb ] tb-psma ( 7.4 gbq per cycle , 6-wk interval ) . response be assess with [ ( 68 ) ga ] ga-psma pet/ct per recip 1.0 and prostate-specific antigen kinetics . posttherapy dosimetry be perform use spect/ct imaging at 4 time point . result : of the 7 patient , 4 ( 57 % ) demonstrate objective imaging response and 4 ( 57 % ) show at least a 50 % decline in prostate-specific antigen level . treatment be well tolerate , with only mild adverse event ( grade 1-2 ) and no toxicity great than grade 3. organ dosimetry confirm favorable absorbed dose distribution . conclusion : [ ( 161 ) tb ] tb-psma demonstrate promising molecular and biochemical activity with a favorable safety profile in patient who have progress after [ ( 177 ) lu ] lu-psma therapy . these preliminary finding support further investigation of ( 161 ) tb-based radiopharmaceutical a next-generation therapeutic option for mcrpc .
Journal: Journal of nuclear medicine : official publication, Society of Nuclear Medicine

Title: the immunotherapy landscape in aml : defining knowledge gap toward rational combinatorial strategy .
Authors: Subklewe M, Rutella S, Curti A
Abstract: immunotherapy have dramatically improve outcome in lymphoid malignancy . in b cell cancer , cd19-directed car t cell and t-cell engagers have produce high remission rate and durable response , now form the cornerstone of treatment in many relapse or refractory setting . in contrast , acute myeloid leukemia ( aml ) have not experience a comparable breakthrough . to date , only antibody-drug conjugate have reach regulatory approval , with gemtuzumab ozogamicin approve in combination with intensive induction and consolidation therapy for newly diagnose cd33-positive aml . this divergence be root in the biological and immunologic complexity of aml . unlike b-cell malignancy with lineage-restricted surface marker such a cd19 , aml lack leukemia-specific antigen . most target be share with normal hematopoietic progenitor , lead to on-target/off-leukemia toxicity . moreover , aml exerts local and systemic immunosuppression through both tumor-intrinsic and microenvironmental mechanism , limit t-cell persistence and function . this review will introduce the current immunotherapy platform under investigation in aml , start with antibody-based approach , follow by t-cell redirecting therapy , and culminate in an overview of immune resistance , the bone marrow microenvironment , and strategy toward personalize combinatorial immunotherapy . by synthesize recent clinical data and mechanistic insight , include those from early car and t-cell engager trial , we aim to provide a translational framework for how immunotherapy might still reshape aml care-through integration of immune contexture of the bone marrow environment aim for rational combinatorial approach .

Title: effective neutralizing antibody produce in mouse directly immunize with integrated pichia pastoris express hpv16l1 protein .
Authors: Xv Z, Lv J, Jiang J, Wang W, Feng F, Zhang L, Xue X, Li W
Abstract: the human papillomavirus ( hpv ) vaccine have not be widely use in develop country because of it high cost and multiple subtype restriction . the present study aim to develop an economical , convenient , and effective vaccine to produce neutralizing antibody . use late protein 1 ( l1 ) from the hpv16 subtype a the target antigen ( hpv16l1 ) and pichia pastoris a the antigen release system , integrate p. pastoris express hpv16l1 ( name yeast-hpv16l1 ) be prepare and vaccinate directly into mouse by subcutaneous multipoint injection . after immunization be perform thrice , high titer ( great than 1:40,960 ) of specific anti-hpv16l1 antibody be obtain in immune serum and be observe to continuously rise over time . the indirect hemagglutination test and indirect hemagglutination inhibition test be use to detect neutralize antibody activity in vitro , and the result demonstrate the hemagglutination ability of the immune serum and the reduction in or loss of the hemagglutination ability if preneutralized antigen be add to the immune serum . the protection confer by immune serum to tumor-bearing mouse at the early stage be confirm , but the neutralizing activity disappear when the tumor reach a size of 1 mm ( 3 ) . the neutralization activity of the immune serum be confirm both in vitro and in vivo .

Title: transthyretin amyloid cardiomyopathy : from cause to novel treatment .
Authors: Fontana M, Aimo A, Emdin M, Porcari A, Solomon SD, Hawkins PN, Gillmore JD
Abstract: transthyretin amyloid cardiomyopathy ( attr-cm ) be a progressive disorder mark by amyloid deposition in the heart , ultimately impair cardiac function . recent treatment advance have parallel an evolve understanding of attr-cm pathophysiology . one emerge hypothesis suggest that an imbalance between in vivo amyloid production and natural clearance may drive disease progression , a conceptual framework that still require validation . transthyretin ( ttr ) stabilizer , such a tafamidis and acoramidis , mitigate amyloid formation by promote the native tetrameric conformation of circulate ttr , thereby slow functional decline and prolong survival . similarly , ttr gene silencer inhibit hepatic ttr synthesis , and gene-editing therapy with nexiguran ziclumeran offer an additional strategy to reduce amyloid production . however , these approach do not enhance the body 's limited capacity to clear exist amyloid deposit , underscore the need for novel agent that accelerate amyloid removal . promisingly , monoclonal antibody target ttr amyloid be under development , with early clinical trial suggest that this passive immunotherapy may reverse disease progression and improve heart function . ultimately , optimal management of attr-cm will require further elucidation of the complex interplay between amyloid formation , it structural and functional impact , it clearance mechanism , and the potential for myocardial reverse remodelling .

Title: biological therapy in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease : new direction in personalised respiratory medicine .
Authors: Mappin-Kasirer B, Pavord ID
Abstract: chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( copd ) , a lead cause of global morbidity and mortality , be a complex and heterogeneous respiratory condition characterise by incompletely reversible airflow obstruction on spirometry . the aetiology and pathological pattern of copd be vary , which have long be view a a hindrance to target treatment . yet inflammation be central to the diverse mechanism of copd pathogenesis , and type 2 inflammation have emerge a a measurable , modifiable and clinically meaningful therapeutic target in those patient in whom it be identify . the approval of first biological therapy against type 2 inflammation in copd build on our understanding of immunological mechanism in airways disease , be inform by a decade of randomised trial and make possible a fundamental shift in our approach to this common condition . this review will ( 1 ) assess aspect of pathological inflammation in copd , namely type 1 , 2 and 3 inflammation , and the role of epithelial alarmins ; ( 2 ) examine data from randomise trial on the efficacy and safety of monoclonal antibody against inflammatory mediator in copd ; and ( 3 ) discus future direction for biological therapy in copd , include new patient population , new agent and new approach that focus on high-risk disease and open the door to prevention .
Journal: BioDrugs : clinical immunotherapeutics, biopharmaceuticals and gene therapy

Title: dynamic of detergent-resistant membrane of plasmodium falciparum during blood stage development .
Authors: Sferra G, Fratini F, Birago C, Megliorini L, Mochi S, Lalle M, Paone S, Olivieri A, Ferreri C, Sansone A, Ponzi M, Currà C, Pizzi E
Abstract: membrane microdomains , also know a detergent-resistant membrane ( drms ) , be tightly pack assembly enrich in cholesterol and sphingolipids , where various membrane-associated process occur . many intracellular pathogen , include plasmodium , exploit these raft-like structure to recognize and invade host cell . in particular , plasmodium depend on host cholesterol to build it own membrane , a it be unable to perform sterol synthesis . use quantitative proteomics , lipid analysis , and bioinformatics , this study define the composition and dynamic of plasmodium falciparum drms from key developmental stage : schizonts , which give rise to invasive merozoite , and gametocyte , which be responsible for transmission to the mosquito vector . comparative analysis of the flotation property of drm-associated protein and lipid reveals both conserve and stage-specific feature in the structural organization of membrane microdomains . follow parasite invasion , host drms be also remodel with the internalization of component of the erythrocyte junctional complex and their repositioning in the newly generate parasitophorous vacuole membrane . prediction and analysis of the drm interactomes reveal a core of protein involve in fundamental biological process maintain between the schizont and gametocyte stage . this common core form a highly interconnected subnetwork that occupy a central position in the interactomes , while stage-specific function occupy a peripheral position in the network .

Title: memantine to treat social impairment in youth with autism spectrum disorder : a randomized clinical trial .
Authors: Joshi G, Gönenc A, DiSalvo M, Faraone SV, Ceranoglu TA, Yule AM, Uchida M, McDougle CJ, Wozniak J
Abstract: pharmacologic intervention for address social impairment in autism spectrum disorder ( asd ) be lack . proton magnetic resonance spectroscopy ( 1h-mrs ) study in individual with asd have document altered glutamate level in the pregenual anterior cingulate cortex ( pgacc ) . to evaluate the safety and efficacy of memantine for treat social impairment in youth with asd and to explore pgacc glutamate level a a potential biomarker for treatment response . design , set , this 12-week , placebo-controlled , double-blind , parallel-design randomized clinical trial be conduct between january 20 , 2015 , and july 11 , 2018. the study population comprise youth age 8 to 17 year with asd without intellectual disability ( iq≥85 ) recruit from ambulatory psychiatry clinic at an academic institution . age- and sex-matched healthy control participant provide reference data for pgacc glutamate level . data analysis be conduct between january 7 , 2020 , and december 19 , 2024. participant with asd be randomize to memantine or placebo , with dose titration up to 20 mg/d . 1h-mrs scan be acquire to assess pgacc glutamate level . response be define a priori a ( 1 ) a 25 % or great reduction in informant-rated social responsiveness scale-second edition total score and ( 2 ) a clinician-rated clinical global impression-improvement subscale ( anchor for asd ) score of 2 or less . the association between pgacc glutamate level and treatment response be explore use receiver operate characteristic ( roc ) curve analysis . this study include 42 youth with asd who initiate treatment ( mean [ sd ] age , 13.2 [ 2.6 ] year ; 32 male [ 76.2 % ] ) . of these youth , 35 be include in the intention-to-treat efficacy analysis ( n = 16 treat with memantine and 19 with placebo ) , and 33 complete the trial ( n = 16 treat with memantine and 17 with placebo ) . significantly more memantine-treated participant meet the response criterion compare with placebo-treated participant ( 9 of 16 [ 56.2 % ] vs 4 of 19 [ 21.0 % ] ; odds ratio , 4.8 [ 95 % ci , 1.1-21.2 ] ; p = .03 ) . memantine be well tolerate and do not have significantly more adverse event compare with placebo . mean ( sd ) pgacc glutamate level be significantly high in youth with asd v healthy control participant ( 95.5 [ 14.6 ] iu v 76.6 [ 17.7 ] iu ; standardize mean difference , -1.2 [ 95 % ci , -1.8 to -0.6 ] ; p < .001 ) . abnormally elevated pgacc glutamate level ( ≥1 sd above that of healthy control participant ) be observe in 20 of 37 participant ( 54.0 % ) with asd and be associate with more treatment responder to memantine than placebo ( 8 of 10 [ 80.0 % ] vs 2 of 10 [ 20.0 % ] ; odds ratio , 16.0 [ 95 % ci , 1.8-143.2 ] ; p = .007 ) . roc curve analysis indicate that pgacc glutamate level be highly efficient at identify treatment responder . in this trial , memantine be well tolerate and significantly improve social impairment in youth with asd . elevate pgacc glutamate level be associate with a favorable treatment response , support their potential a a biomarker for assess memantine efficacy in individual with asd . clinicaltrials.gov identifier : nct01972074 .

Title: cbp/p300 , a promising therapeutic target for prostate cancer .
Authors: Xu H, Hou Y, Zhao Z, Zhang J, Li P, Cao Y, Nie X, Hou J
Abstract: prostate cancer ( pca ) remain the most prevalent malignancy among men , with the inevitable emergence of castration-resistant prostate cancer ( crpc ) present the great challenge . accumulate evidence have confirm that the overexpression of camp response element-binding protein ( creb ) -binding protein ( cbp ) and e1a-binding protein ( p300 ) , two highly homologous transcriptional coactivators , play a crucial role in the development of pca and it progression to crpc , thereby make them prominent therapeutic target for all type of pca . in this review , we systematically discuss the structure and function of cbp/p300 and elucidate the detailed mechanism by which cbp/p300 promote prostate carcinogenesis and development . specifically , cbp/p300 facilitate prostate carcinogenesis by acetylate specific lysine residue on essential transcription factor involve in androgen receptor ( ar ) signaling , canonical wnt signaling , p53 signaling , as well a other pathway such a pi3k/akt and mapk signaling . additionally , they contribute to tumor immunosuppression and adaptive resistance to program death ligand 1 ( pd-l1 ) blockade treatment by induce the expression and secretion of the pd-l1 protein . furthermore , we explore the late advance in the use of various inhibitor target different domain of cbp/p300 and proteolysis-targeting chimera ( protac ) degrader in pca . we propose that comb cbp/p300 inhibitor or degrader with current anti-pca therapy , include androgen deprivation therapy ( adt ) , chemotherapy , and immunotherapy , hold potential to overcome the challenge in treat advanced pca and improve clinical outcome for all pca patient .

Title: papillomavirus l1 major capsid protein self-assembles into virus-like particle that be highly immunogenic .
Authors: Kirnbauer R, Booy F, Cheng N, Lowy DR, Schiller JT
Abstract: infection by certain human papillomavirus type be regard a the major risk factor in the development of cervical cancer , one of the most common cancer of woman worldwide . analysis of the immunogenic and structural feature of papillomavirus virion have be hamper by the inability to efficiently propagate the virus in cultured cell . for instance , it have not be establish whether the major capsid protein l1 alone be sufficient for virus particle assembly . in addition , it be not know whether l1 , l2 ( the minor capsid protein ) , or both present the immunodominant epitope require for induction of high-titer neutralizing antibody . we have express the l1 major capsid protein of bovine papillomavirus type 1 and human papillomavirus type 16 in insect cell via a baculovirus vector and analyze their conformation and immunogenicity . the l1 protein be express at high level and assemble into structure that closely resemble papillomavirus virion . the self-assembled bovine papillomavirus l1 , in contrast to l1 extract from recombinant bacteria or denatured virion , also mimic intact bovine papillomavirus virion in be able to induce high-titer neutralizing rabbit antiserum . these result indicate that l1 protein have the intrinsic capacity to assemble into empty capsid-like structure whose immunogenicity be similar to infectious virion . this type of l1 preparation might be consider a a candidate for a serological test to measure antibody to conformational virion epitope and for a vaccine to prevent papillomavirus infection .
Journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America

Title: the association between the tyg index and the risk of cancer-a systematic review and meta-analysis .
Authors: Li H, Chen Z, Jiang G, Yu W, Luo J, Li S, Xie L, Bai X, Xu Y, Jiang Y, He M, Mao M, Wang X
Abstract: the triglyceride glucose ( tyg ) index , a simple and reliable surrogate marker of insulin resistance ( ir ) , have garner increase attention in metabolic research . although ir be mechanistically link to carcinogenesis through multiple pathway , include chronic inflammation , hyperinsulinemia-driven pro-mitogenic signaling , and alter adipokine secretion , the specific utility of the tyg index for cancer risk assessment remain unclear . this systematic review examine whether the tyg index show consistent association across cancer type and hold value a an independent risk predictor beyond establish metabolic syndrome component . we systematically search pubmed , embase , and web of science database from 2008 ( the year the tyg index be establish a an ir marker ) to december 31 , 2024 , for study on the tyg index-cancer association . cohort , cross-sectional , and case-control study be include . use meta-analysis , we pool effect size and conduct subgroup analysis by gender , region , population source , and study design . trial sequential analysis ( tsa ) evaluate evidence reliability . this meta-analysis incorporate a total of 20 eligible study . our finding demonstrate that elevate tyg index level be significantly associate with increased risk of various malignancy , include digestive system cancer ( 1.22 , 95 % ci 1.13-1.31 ) , urogenital system cancer ( 2.04 , 95 % ci 1.53-2.71 ) , and breast cancer ( 1.64 , 95 % ci 1.49-1.80 ) when compare to low tyg index level . these association remain consistent across all pre-specified subgroup analysis stratify by study characteristic . furthermore , tsa confirm sufficient statistical power for definitive conclusion . the consistent observe association between elevate tyg index and increase cancer risk highlight it potential a a candidate biomarker for further investigation . while these finding support the biological plausibility of insulin resistance in oncogenesis , current evidence-partially derive from observational studies- can not establish causality or direct clinical utility . future research should prioritize : ( 1 ) prospective validation of tyg index threshold for cancer risk prediction , ( 2 ) mechanistic study elucidate it role in tumor biology , and ( 3 ) assessment of it incremental value to exist risk stratification tool .

Title: ivosidenib or venetoclax combine with hypomethylating agent in idh1-mutated acute myeloid leukemia : a real-world study .
Authors: Lachowiez CA, Smith BD, Ambinder AJ, Binder G, Angiolillo A, Potluri R, Papademetriou E, LeBlanc TW
Abstract: approximately 10 % of patient with newly diagnose acute myeloid leukemia ( nd-aml ) harbor the isocitrate dehydrogenase 1 gene mutation ( midh1 ) . in this real-world study evaluate ivosidenib ( ivo ) + hypomethylating agent ( hmas ; n = 181 ) v venetoclax ( ven ) + hmas ( n = 99 ) in patient with midh1 nd-aml , those treat with ivo+hma have high rate of complete remission ( cr ; 42.5 % vs 26.3 % ; p = .007 ) , high rate of composite cr + cr with incomplete platelet count recovery ( 63.0 % vs 48.5 % ; p = .019 ) , short median time to best response ( 3.3 vs 4.1 month ; p = .006 ) , and improve 6-month event-free survival ( 55.8 % vs 38.4 % ; p = .006 ) . most patient treat with ven receive well under 28 day of ven per cycle , likely due to anticipation of toxicity ; outcomes with this short-schedule ven be proportionately bad with few day of exposure per cycle . the between-group rate of grade ≥3 adverse event be similar within 30 day of treatment initiation , except for high rate of febrile neutropenia for ven+hma v ivo+hma ( 8.1 % vs 1.7 % ; p = .008 ) . these finding support result from the phase 3 agile trial demonstrate ivo+hma 's efficacy and favorable toxicity profile in patient with midh1 nd-aml . ivo + azacitidine should be consider a the preferred standard of care treatment regimen in this patient subgroup .

Title: long-term outcome in flt3-mutated acute myeloid leukemia after frontline hypomethylating agent , venetoclax and a flt3 inhibitor .
Authors: Short NJ, Loghavi S, Yilmaz M, Karrar O, Kim K, Dinardo CD, Kadia TM, Maroun M, Borthakur G, Issa GC, Jabbour J, Oran B, Shpall EJ, Popat U, Patel KP, Routbort M, Konopleva M, Ravandi F, Kantarjian H, Daver N
Abstract: triplet regimens with a hypomethylating agent , venetoclax and a flt3 inhibitor yield high rate of response in newly diagnose flt3-mutated aml . however , the long-term outcome and pattern of relapse with these triplet regimen be not well-established . in this retrospective analysis , 73 patient with newly diagnose flt3-mutated aml receive a frontline flt3 inhibitor-containing triplet regimen . the composite complete remission ( cr ) and cr with incomplete hematologic recovery ( cri ) rate be 93 % . next-generation sequence flt3-itd mrd negativity ( sensitivity : 0.005 % ) be achieve in 60 % of patient after cycle 2 and 90 % after cycle 4. the estimate 3-year relapse-free survival ( rf ) for flt3-itd-mutated and flt3 tkd-mutated aml be 38 % and 76 % , respectively , and the 3-year overall survival ( o ) be 45 % and 76 % , respectively . neither age , npm1 co-mutation , eln 2022 risk , nor allogeneic stem cell transplantation in first remission significantly impact o . baseline ras pathway mutation be associate with poor long-term survival ( 3-year os 22 % versus 63 % without ras pathway mutation ) . flt3 wild type relapse account for 65 % of relapse , and new ra pathway mutation be observe in 24 % of relapse . outcome be poor after relapse ( median o of 6.1 month ) , particularly for those with persistently detectable flt3 mutation . triplet combination of an hma , venetoclax and a flt3 inhibitor result in durable remission and encouraging long-term o in old adult with newly diagnose flt3-mutated aml . however , good strategy to prevent flt3 wild type relapse and to overcome ras pathway-mediated resistance be still need .

Title: relative efficacy of minoxidil in combination with other treatment for androgenic alopecia : a network meta-analysis base on randomized control trial .
Authors: Xia Y, Chen H, Chen Y, Chen Z
Abstract: androgenetic alopecia be the most prevalent form of progressive hair loss . minoxidil be widely regard a a standard treatment for this condition . consequently , we assess the effectiveness of minoxidil in combination with other pharmacological agent for the treatment of androgenetic alopecia . a comprehensive search be conduct across four databases-pubmed , embase , web of science , and cochrane library-on december 10 , 2024. eligible study be select base on the picos framework . data extraction and synthesis be carry out use a bayesian network meta-analysis , focus on mean difference and sample size data . league table and surface under the cumulative ranking ( sucra ) value be employ to evaluate the relative efficacy of the intervention . among the 20 study group analyze , the combination of platelet-rich plasma and basic fibroblast growth factor with minoxidil demonstrate the high overall efficacy ( sucra = 93.06 % ) . this combination result in a mean increase in hair density of 35.12 hairs/cm ( 2 ) compare to the group treat with minoxidil alone . in male subgroup , finasteride combine with minoxidil be the most effective treatment ( sucra = 80.18 % ) . among seven combination therapy for female , microneedle with minoxidil prove most effective ( sucra = 87.18 % ) . this study establish a clinically actionable hierarchy of minoxidil-based combination therapy , provide evidence-based guidance for dermatologist to optimize androgenetic alopecia management . http : //www.crd.york.ac.uk/prospero/view/crd42024623164 , identifier crd42024623164 .

Title: traumatic brain injury and risk of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis .
Authors: Zhu X, Russell ER, Lyall DM, Ho F, Mackay DF, Pell JP, Stewart W
Abstract: history of traumatic brain injury ( tbi ) or repetitive head impact be associate with an increase risk of neurodegenerative disease . this association have attract attention in recent year through the relationship between contact sport participation and the increase risk of a number of neurodegenerative disease , include motor neuron disease or amyotrophic lateral sclerosis ( al ) . however , to date , the association between tbi in the community and al risk remain uncertain . to leverage population-level health record to explore the association between a history of tbi and subsequent al risk . design , set , this retrospective cohort study access uk-wide electronic health record ( ehr ) data from individual 18 year or old with tbi history and age- , sex- , and area deprivation-matched general population comparators . ehr data be available from january 1 , 2005 , to december 31 , 2020 , with database interrogation perform on february 11 , 2021 , and data analysis conduct between june 1 , 2023 , and october 3 , 2024. document history of tbi . outcome be obtain by individual-level linkage to ehr data available via clinical practice research datalink . risk of al be evaluate use cox proportional hazard regression model to investigate it association with tbi . overall , 85 690 adult with a history of tbi and 257 070 match adult with no history of tbi be include , for a total of 342 760 participant ( 50.1 % male ; mean [ sd ] age , 50.7 [ 17.6 ] year ) . during a median 5.72 ( iqr , 3.07-8.82 ) year of follow-up , provide 2.13 million person-years of follow-up , 150 incident al case be record , result in 7.05 case per 100 000 person-years . risk of al be high among individual with a history of tbi compare with individual without a tbi history ( hazard ratio [ hr ] , 2.61 ; 95 % ci , 1.88-3.63 ) . however , this association be time dependent , with risk confine to the 2 year follow tbi ( hr , 6.18 ; 95 % ci , 3.47-11.00 ) , but not thereafter . in this retrospective cohort study of 342 760 adult , an association between tbi and subsequent risk of al be identify . however , this association be confine to the 2 year immediately follow injury . a such , the association between tbi and high al risk may indicate reverse causality , with tbi in some individual perhaps reflect a consequence of early , subclinical al .

Title: association between sleep duration , depression and cognitive decline trajectory : finding from a prospective cohort study in china .
Authors: Li C, Wu X, Li Y, Zhang M, Zhang L, Zhou C, Ma F
Abstract: this study investigate the relationship between sleep duration and cognitive decline trajectory among chinese adult with age ≥ 45. additionally , it examine whether baseline depression symptom mediate the association between sleep duration and cognitive decline trajectory . data come from the china health and retirement longitudinal study ( charls ) , a nationally survey of chinese adult . total sleep duration be group into shorter ( ≤ 6 h ) , normal ( 6-9 h ) , and long ( > 9 h ) . nighttime sleep duration be categorize a shorter ( ≤ 6 h ) , normal ( 6-8 h ) , and long ( > 8 h ) . daytime nap duration be classify into no nap , shorter ( ≤ 0.5 h ) , normal ( 0.5-1.5 h ) , and long ( > 1.5 h ) . cognitive decline trajectory be identify use a group-based trajectory model ( gbtm ) . depression symptom , measure by baseline depression score , be include a a potential mediating variable . multinomial logistic regression model be apply to analyze the association between sleep duration and cognitive trajectory . a total of 4,094 respondent be include . participant be classify into three trajectory group : high-level stable ( n = 1,278 , 31.2 % ) , moderate-level slow-decline ( n = 2,089 , 51.0 % ) , and low-level rapid-decline ( n = 727 , 17.8 % ) . compare to the stable group , short total sleep duration be associate with both rapid-decline ( 1.510 ; 95 % 1.079,2.114 ) and slow-decline ( 1.466 ; 95 % 1.145,1.877 ) cognitive trajectory . similarly , short nighttime sleep duration be associate with both rapid-decline ( 1.572 ; 95 % 1.089,2.271 ) and slow-decline ( 1.480 ; 95 % 1.129,1.939 ) cognitive trajectory compare to the stable group . baseline depression symptom do not mediate these relationship ( p > 0.05 ) . short total sleep duration ( ≤ 6 h ) and short nighttime sleep duration ( ≤ 6 h ) be significantly associate with cognitive decline trajectory . however , baseline depression symptom do not mediate these relationship .

Title: hsa_circ_0058495-mediated igf2bp2 ubiquitination and m6a modification of mekk1 promote the progression of pdac .
Authors: Lv S, Zhang J, Peng X, Liu H, Chu T, Liu Z, Duan K, Guo J, Wang J, Liu Y, Wei F
Abstract: background : pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma ( pdac ) be a highly aggressive malignancy with dismal clinical outcome . we identify hsa_circ_0058495 a significantly upregulated in pdac tissue and pdac cell-derived exosomes , where it contribute to tumor proliferation and invasion . the molecular mechanism underlie it oncogenic function , however , remain incompletely understood . method : differential circrna expression be profile by rna sequencing . the functional role of hsa_circ_0058495 and it molecular interaction be interrogate through western blotting , rt-qpcr , co-immunoprecipitation , rna pull-down , and rna immunoprecipitation assay . confocal microscopy and pet/ct imaging be employ to delineate it biological effect in vitro and in vivo . result : hsa_circ_0058495 be enrich in pdac-derived exosomes and stabilize igf2bp2 by prevent trim25-mediated ubiquitination and attenuate autophagy-dependent degradation . stabilize igf2bp2 enhance the stability of mekk1 mrna , lead to sustain erk1/2 phosphorylation and consequent promotion of pdac cell proliferation and invasion . moreover , exosomal hsa_circ_0058495 facilitate m2 macrophage polarization , thereby foster an immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment . conclusion : hsa_circ_0058495 promote pdac progression by stabilize igf2bp2 and activate the mekk1-erk signaling cascade , while exosomal transfer of hsa_circ_0058495 drive m2 macrophage polarization to reinforce tumor-associated immunosuppression . these finding establish hsa_circ_0058495 a a pivotal regulator of pdac progression and underscore it potential utility a both a diagnostic biomarker and a therapeutic target .

Title: real-world management strategy and clinical outcome of metastatic her2-positive breast cancer in greece in the second-line setting and beyond ( the together study ) .
Authors: Korantzis I, Koumarianou A, Rapti V, Timotheadou E, Christodoulou C, Tryfonopoulos D, Karageorgopoulou S, Boukovinas I, Zagouri F, Nikolaidi A, Papazisis K, Razis E, Barbounis V, Christopoulou A, Mavroudis D, Georgoulias V, Kesisis G, Papadopoulos EI, Michalea R, Ardavanis A
Abstract: in the realm of her2-positive ( her2+ ) metastatic breast cancer ( mbc ) , the advent of targeted therapy , notably trastuzumab and pertuzumab , represent a substantial advancement in enhance patient outcome . however , the intricacy of treatment escalate when patient encounter progression or resistance during first-line ( 1l ) therapy . the together study aim to elucidate real-world insight into the profile , management strategy , and outcome for her2+ mbc patient initiate second-line treatment ( 2lt ) in greece , predate recent international guideline change incorporate trastuzumab deruxtecan and tucatinib in the second line and beyond line of treatment . data from adult female patient with her2+ mbc who have initiate 2lt between 01-jan-2015 and 31-dec-2018 in 18 oncology department across greece be retrospectively abstract through medical chart review . the eligible population comprise 122 patient , 68.0 % of whom present with recurrent mbc . among the latter , 26.5 % be test for her2 both in early and metastatic setting with 27.3 % of them change her2 status from negative to positive . retesting of her2 expression follow 2lt initiation be record in 8 case . at 2lt initiation , patient ' median age be 57.0 year and 63.6 % be hormone receptor-positive . the most common metastatic site be bone ( 56.6 % ) , lung ( 44.3 % ) , liver ( 41.0 % ) , and brain ( 29.5 % ) . anti-her2 agent usage in 1l and 2l stood at 91.8 % and 92.6 % , respectively , with rate slightly diminish in third ( 3l ) ( 85.9 % ) and fourth line ( 4l ) ( 82.4 % ) . endocrine therapy administration be generally low across treatment line ( 12.3 % , 9.9 % , and 5.9 % , in 2l , 3l , and 4l respectively ) , while chemotherapy use increase from 30.3 % in 2l to 47.9 % and 47.1 % to 3l and 4l , correspondingly . median progression-free survival ( pfs ) for 2l , 3l , and 4l be 7.7 [ 95 % confidence interval ( ci ) 6.0-14.4 ] , 6.4 ( 95 % ci 5.4-7.1 ) , and 5.6 ( 95 % ci 2.6-9.0 ) month , respectively , while median overall survival be 25.0 ( 95 % ci 20.5-34.4 ) month . although the 2lt pattern in greece generally align with guideline , persistently poor treatment outcome underscore a significant unmet medical need for these patient .

Title: phase ii study of zevorcabtagene autoleucel , a fully human bcma-targeting car t cell therapy , in patient with relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma .
Authors: Chen W, Fu C, Fang B, Liang A, Xia Z, He Y, Lu J, Liu H, Hou M, Cai Z, Yang W, Hao S, Jiang S, Jing H, Liu J, Du X, Fu R, Mei H, Zhu Z, Yang Y, Liu H, Meng X, Rajakumaraswamy N, Yuan D, Wang H, Li Z
Abstract: zevorcabtagene autoleucel ( zevor-cel ) be a fully human autologous car t-cell therapy target b-cell maturation antigen approve in china since 2024 for patient with relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma ( rrmm ) . lummicar study 1 be a phase 2 , single-arm study conduct across 23 center in china . rrmm patient age ≥ 18 to ≤ 75 year with measurable disease who have receive ≥ 3 prior line of therapy , with adequate organ function and bone marrow reserve , with an eastern cooperative oncology group ( ecog ) score of 0-1 , be eligible . patient previously treat with any car t-cell therapy , or any bcma-directed therapy be ineligible . the primary endpoint be objective response rate ( orr ) determine by an independent review committee . the secondary endpoint include orr determine by investigator , additional efficacy outcome include complete response ( cr ) / stringent complete response ( scr ) rate , duration of response ( dor ) , minimal residual disease negativity , safety outcome include incidence and severity of adverse event , and pharmacokinetics of zevor-cel . overall , 125 patient underwent apheresis , 105 patient received lymphodepletion , 102 patient ( median age of 59.5 [ range : 38 , 75 ] year ; 53.9 % male and 46.1 % female ) receive zevor-cel . the orr be 92.2 % ( 95 % ci 85.13-96.55 ) with 70 patient ( 68.6 % ) achieve scr and 3 ( 2.9 % ) achieve cr . at a median follow-up of 20.3 ( interquartile range [ iqr ] 12.5 , 23.8 ) month , 45 ( 44.1 % ) progression-free survival ( pfs ) event and 20 ( 19.6 % ) overall survival ( o ) event be observe , the dor , pfs and o data be not mature . cytokine release syndrome be report in 92 ( 90.2 % ) patient , with grade 3 or 4 event in 7 ( 6.9 % ) patient . immune effector cell associate neurotoxicity syndrome be report in 2 patient at grade 1 ; no zevor-cel-related grade ≥ 3 neurotoxicity occur . zevor-cel induces deep and durable response in heavily pre-treated rrmm patient with a manageable safety profile .

Title: transformer-based ai approach to unravel long-term , time-dependent prognostic complexity in patient with advanced nsclc and pd-l1 ≥50 % : insight from the pembrolizumab 5-year global registry .
Authors: Cortellini A, Santo V, Brunetti L, Garbo E, Pinato DJ, La Cava G, Naidoo J, Katz A, Loza M, Neal JW, Genova C, Gettinger S, Kim SY, Jayakrishnan R, El Zarif T, Russano M, Pecci F, Di Federico A, Alessi JV, Montrone M, Owen DH, Ramella S, Signorelli D, Fidler MJ, Li M, Camerini A, Halmos B, Vincenzi B, Metro G, Passiglia F, Yendamuri S, Guida A, Ghidini M, D'Alessio A, Banna GL, Fulgenzi CAM, Grisanti S, Grossi F, D'Incecco A, Josephides E, Van Hemelrijck M, Russo A, Gelibter A, Spinelli G, Verrico M, Tomasik B, Giusti R, Balachandran K, Bria E, Sebastian M, Rost M, Forster M, Mukherjee U, Landi L, Mazzoni F, Aujayeb A, Dupont M, Curioni-Fontecedro A, Chiari R, Sforza V, Tiseo M, Friedlaender A, Addeo A, Zoratto F, De Tursi M, Cantini L, Roca E, Mountzios G, Rocco D, Della Gravara L, Kalvapudi S, Inno A, Bironzo P, Di Marco Barros R, O'Reilly D, Fitzpatrick O, Karapanagiotou E, Monnet I, Baena J, Macerelli M, Piedra A, Agustoni F, Cortinovis DL, Tonini G, Minuti G, Bennati C, Mezquita L, Gorría T, Servetto A, Beninato T, Lo Russo G, Prelaj A, De Giglio A, Rogado J, Moliner L, Nadal E, Biello F, Nana FA, Dingemans AM, Aerts JGJV, Ferrara R, Abu Hejleh T, Takada K, Naqash AR, Garassino MC, Peters S, Wakelee HA, Nassar AH, Ricciuti B, Soda P, Caruso CM, Guarrasi V
Abstract: with nearly one-third of patient with advanced non-small cell lung cancer ( nsclc ) and pd-l1 tumor proportion score≥50 % survive beyond 5 year follow first-line pembrolizumab , long-term outcome challenge traditional paradigm of cancer prognostication . the emergence of non-cancer-related factor and time-dependent trend underscore the need for advanced analytical framework to unravel their complex interplay . we analyze the pembro-real 5y registry , a global real-world dataset of 1050 patient treat across 61 institution in 14 country with a long-term follow-up and a large panel of baseline variable . two complementary approach be employ : ridge regression , choose for it ability to address multicollinearity while retain interpretability , and not another imputation method ( naim ) , a transformer-based artificial intelligence model design to handle miss data without imputation . endpoint include risk of death at 6 , 12 , 24 , 60 month and 5-year survival . the ridge regression model achieve a c-statistic of 0.66 ( 95 % 0.59 to 0.72 ) for the risk of death and an area under the curve ( auc ) of 0.72 ( 95 % 0.65 to 0.78 ) for 5-year survival , identify eastern cooperative oncology group performance status ( ecog-ps ) ≥2 , increase age , and metastatic burden a primary risk factor . however , wide ci for some predictor highlight statistical instability . naim demonstrate robust handling of miss data , with a c-index of 62.98±2.11 for risk of death and an auc of 60.52±3.71 for 5-year survival . the comprehensive shapley additive explanation analysis reveal dynamic , time-dependent pattern , with early mortality dominate by acute factor ( eg , ecog-ps , steroid ) and long-term outcome increasingly influence by systemic health marker ( eg , absence of hypertension , increase body mass index ) . unexpected insight include the protective role of dyslipidemia ( but not statin ) and the nuanced impact of smoke status , reflect evolve disease dynamic and host-tumor interplay . our integrative framework illuminate the complexity of long-term outcome in patient with nsclc treat with pembrolizumab , uncover dynamic , non-linear prognostication trend . this analysis provide insight into patient trajectory , emphasize the need for holistic , long-term management strategy .

Title: statin activate temperature-gated transient receptor potential ion channel .
Authors: Oprita G, Domocos D, Selescu T, Paduraru A, Tunaru S, Leffler A, Babes A, Babes RM
