Abstract: statin be hmg-coa reductase inhibitor administer to decrease level of ldl cholesterol and to lower the risk of cardiovascular disease . although statin be relatively well tolerate , adverse effect such a myalgia and painful peripheral neuropathy have be report . while the underlie cause have not be fully elucidate , accumulate evidence show that statin have numerous pleiotropic effect include anti-inflammatory and analgesic action in several animal pain model . here we report that some of the most extensively used statin activate member of the temperature-gated transient receptor potential ( trp ) ion channel subfamily express in heterologous system . all test statin ( simvastatin , atorvastatin and rosuvastatin ) activate human trpa1 and , in addition , simvastatin activates human trpv1 and rosuvastatin activates human trpm8 . the activation of trpv1 by simvastatin be abolish in a capsaicin-insensitive mutant . furthermore , the sensitivity of both trpv1 and trpa1 to simvastatin be diminish in triple cysteine mutant know to exhibit a reduced sensitivity to reactive oxygen specie . rosuvastatin-induced activation of trpm8 seem to involve an aspartate residue which be essential for sensitivity to the synthetic trpm8-agonist icilin . in mouse dorsal root ganglion ( drg ) neuron , simvastatin activate a subpopulation of neuron which also respond to the trpv1-agonist capsaicin or the trpa1-agonist allyl isothiocyanate . in addition , trpm8 play an important role for the activation of a small population of drg neuron by rosuvastatin . take together , these result indicate that statin activate thermo-sensitive trp channel express in nociceptive sensory neuron . this property may explain some of the pleiotropic effect of these widely use drug .

Title: decode long covid-associated cardiovascular dysfunction : mechanism , model , and new approach methodology .
Authors: Thomas D, Yang PC, Wu JC, Sayed N
Abstract: the covid-19 pandemic have reveal that the impact of sars-cov-2 infection extend well beyond the acute phase , with long-term sequela affect multiple organ system , most notably , the cardiovascular system . long covid , or post-acute sequela of sars-cov-2 infection ( pasc ) , be characterize by persistent symptom such a fatigue , dyspnea , chest pain , and palpitation , which can last for month or even year after initial recovery . increase evidence implicates immune dysregulation , endothelial dysfunction , persistent viral antigen , and coagulopathy a central driver of cardiovascular complication . mechanistic study demonstrate that direct viral infection of cardiac and vascular cell , along with autoantibody formation and cytokine-mediated injury , contribute to myocardial inflammation , fibrosis , and arrhythmias . sex-based immunological difference and underlie comorbidities far influence individual susceptibility and disease trajectory . large-scale epidemiological study have confirm significantly increased risk of pericarditis , cardiomyopathy , dysrhythmias , and heart failure among covid-19 survivor . in parallel , the emergence of advanced preclinical platform , include patient-derived induced pluripotent stem cell ( ipsc ) -based cardiac organoids , engineer heart tissue , and organ-on-a-chip system have enable mechanistic dissection of long covid pathophysiology . these human-relevant model , when integrate with clinical datasets and artificial intelligence ( ai ) -driven analytics , offer powerful tool for biomarker discovery , risk stratification , and precision therapeutic development . this review synthesize the current understanding of cardiovascular involvement in long covid , highlight key mechanistic insight from both clinical and preclinical study , and outline future direction for diagnostic and therapeutic innovation .
Journal: Journal of molecular and cellular cardiology

Title: investigate the prognostic role of citrullination-related gene in breast cancer by combine transcriptomics , single-cell analysis and verification .
Authors: He W, Fan S, Luo Y, Yi X, Liu Y, He G, Li Z, Li Y
Abstract: citrullination , a process link to autoimmune disease , have be implicate in cancer , but it role in breast cancer ( brca ) remain unclear . this study aim to identify citrullination-related gene ( crgs ) associate with prognosis in brca . we utilized datasets from the cancer genome atlas ( tcga-brca ) and gene expression omnibus ( geo ) , pinpoint candidate gene by intersect differentially express gene ( degs ) from tcga-brca with known crgs . prognostic crgs be select use univariate cox regression and lasso regression analysis , and a predictive nomogram be create base on independent prognostic factor identify through multivariate cox regression . our finding reveal that sez6 , s100b , spib , and tff1 be key crgs use to construct a risk model . high-risk brca patient exhibit immune-suppressive tumor microenvironments ( tmes ) with low cd8 ( + ) t cell mutation and enrichment in c1/c4 immune subtypes . in contrast , low-risk patient display high immune infiltration and enrichment in c2/c3/c6 subtypes . high expression of s100b , spib , and tff1 be associate with increase immune infiltration by nk cell and t cell , while high sez6 expression be link to neutrophil mutation , pd-l1 upregulation , and low cd8 ( + ) t cell infiltration . molecular dock study explore the interaction of these crgs with entinostat . in conclusion , sez6 , s100b , spib , and tff1 be identify a significant prognostic gene in brca , provide insight into brca pathogenesis and potential personalized treatment strategy .

Title: characterize epithelial-mesenchymal transition-linked heterogeneity in breast cancer circulate tumor cell at a single-cell level .
Authors: Topa J, Richert J, Stokowy T, Staśczak A, Szajewski M, Ciesielski M, Grešner PM, Tomasik B, Arcimowicz Ł, Stankiewicz A, Suchodolska G, Senkus E, Kruszewski W, Żaczek AJ, Markiewicz A
Abstract: epithelial-mesenchymal transition ( emt ) generate heterogeneity in circulate tumor cell ( ctc ) , affect their biological property and hamper their detection . this limit our understanding of the mechanism underlie hematogenous dissemination , especially in early breast cancer ( bc ) , where ctc be rare . here , we aim to detect ctc with different emt status from bc patient . ctc in blood sample from 107 bc patient be evaluate use immunomagnetic depletion and multi-marker immunofluorescence ( epcam , e-cadherin , mcam , cell surface vimentin , cd31 , cd45 ) , follow by single-cell transcriptomics . ctc be detect in 51.9 % of therapy-naïve early bc case , with 3.8 % show only epithelial ctc ( ectcs ) , 5.8 % epithelial-mesenchymal ( emctcs ) , 26.0 % mesenchymal ( mctcs ) , and 16.3 % mixed phenotype . ctc heterogeneity be more frequent in triple-negative ( 86 % ) than in luminal bc ( 17 % , p = 0.008 ) . lymph node involvement strongly predict dissemination of all ctc phenotype , while tumor size correlate with mctc abundance . single-cell rna sequence revealed downregulation of ribosomal gene and translation inhibition in ctc with mesenchymal feature , link to mtorc1 signal . finding be also validate in an independent dataset , highlight vulnerability in ctc during dissemination .

Title: microrna signature of cancer risk in kidney transplant patient : insight from the cometa study .
Authors: Simeoni M, Tufano R, Grandinetti V, Cossu AM, Alfieri C, Pollastro R, Calcutta A, Scrima M, Bocchetti M, Zappavigna S, Simeone I, Grandaliano G, Capasso A, Messa P, Castellano G, Mella A, Biancone L, Ceccarelli M, Caraglia M, La Manna G, Capasso G, Citterio F
Abstract: post-transplant malignancy be one of the leading cause of morbidity , mortality and graft failure in kidney transplant recipient ( ktrs ) . while viral infection and immunosuppressive drug have historically be consider primary cause , the mechanism underlie post-transplant cancer occurrence remain incompletely understood . furthermore , predictive cancer biomarkers have yet to be identify in ktrs . cometa study be an observational study involve 138 ktrs , and it aim to elucidate the interplay between the immune system and cancer by integrate comprehensive clinical data with high-throughput small-rna sequencing on the serum of patient with post-kidney transplant malignancy . our result identify three distinct serum mirna profile , respectively , associate with kidney transplantation , pro-oncogenic and onco-protective factor in this unique population . these profile be also use to create mirna classifier , which demonstrate promising predictive performance , especially for tumor-promoting signature . notably , mir-210-3p up-regulation , within the cancer-related profile be first find to be associate with non-melanoma skin cancer . these finding could serve a a basis for future research , pave the way for the development of advanced tool for early cancer diagnosis , precise prognosis formulation , and the creation of targeted therapy for ktrs with neoplastic complication .
